EU Sustainability Analyst
Amazon France Logistique SAS38,551 avis - Paris (75)
date_publication:
Amazon.com - il y a 1 heure

Signaler cette offre d'emploi
description:
At least 8 years of professional experience in quantitative analytics or business intelligence.
Degree in engineering, operations research, mathematics, statistics, or other quantitative areas such as computer science or physics. Master’s level degree or higher preferred.
Knowledge of SQL. Mathematical, analytical, and data-driven decision making skills.
Experience with statistical analysis tools (such as R), root cause analysis, process design and control.
Excellent Microsoft Office skills, including strong working knowledge of Excel and VBA.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Ability to simplify complex topics for broad audiences. The role requires effective communication with colleagues from computer science, operations research and business backgrounds.
Team player with proven ability to work with cross-functional teams in various locations.
A track record of problem solving and creativity in finding/designing new solutions and innovative methods, using software systems and the desire to create and build new processes.
Ability to handle multiple competing priorities and projects in a fast-paced environment.

Amazon seeks a passionate, results-oriented, data and analytic engineer to join our European Global Transportation Services organization and work towards the carbon neutral target that Amazon pledged to reach by 2040. You will be responsible to optimize our complex and expanding European Fulfillment Network in that direction. Do you think you are up to the challenge? Would you like to stretch your skills, learn from other super smart people, and develop your career?

Successful candidates will have the attitude of a data detective combined with strong analysis skills and problem solving mindset. This is a highly visible role that requires partnering with software development, retail, fulfillment centers and transportation teams. You must have the experience and capability to create and present documentation for senior executives. Excellent written and verbal communication, and ability to prioritize well are essential skills.

Your responsibilities include:

Identify the biggest opportunities to transition towards a carbon-neutral supply chain and transportation network
Lead complex analysis, develop models and reports to drive key strategic decisions.
Identify opportunities to deliver step-changes in supply chain performance through configuration, parameter adjustment, or based on innovative mathematical analysis.
Partner with operations, retail and software teams to implement key strategic initiatives.
Analyze and track carbon impacts and prioritize new features based on their relevance, communicate results with Senior leadership.
Research, evaluate and roll-out software, tools or process improvements.

Experience with scripting languages (Python, Perl, or Ruby) and UNIX.
Experience with analyzing big data sets (100M+ rows)
Experience working effectively with software engineering teams. Technical aptitude and familiarity with the design and use of software systems.
Familiarity with supply chain management concepts - forecasting, planning, optimization, logistics - gained through work experience or graduate level education.
Familiarity with statistical concepts and advanced statistical techniques - distributions, confidence intervals, time series analysis, regression models, clustering, machine learning
Familiarity with mathematical modelling & simulation techniques – probability, optimization (linear programming, etc.), graph theory, state models
Familiarity with Big Data concepts and platforms (Hadoop, Mahout, etc.)

description:
Snapshot
Java Software Engineer

Location
Paris 17,
36 Rue Brunel

Overview
This is a great opportunity to be part of the technical leadership that delivers large- scale systems, used by millions of users every day.

The Synchronoss Personal Cloud product set enables mobile operators to deliver converged rich media services that in turn enable their subscribers to create, store, view and share their digital content in an operator branded environment on mobile, desktop and web.
We deliver user content management systems at multi-petabyte scale to 10s of millions of end users. We are looking for software engineers to help us develop the next generation of our platform.
Job Purpose: To design, develop and unit test the next generation of Synchronoss Personal Cloud product suite. To work in an agile development team to produce a, performant, elastic, resilient and extensible n-tier product. The position is based in our Paris Offices

Roles and Responsibilities
Develop architecture and designs based on internal product management requirements
Implement n-tier applications in Java
Communication of designs and other development issues to developers and managers. Design and architecture documentation.
Peer review of design, code and automated tests.
Participate in agile development program
Analyze product computational resource utilizations.
Work with Synchronoss architects and principal engineers on cross cutting design concerns
Design, develop and manage automated unit and integration tests and frameworks, improve build pipeline strategies
Communicate in English with other developers or testers located in other countries
Participate if needed to production issues analysis
Skills and Abilities Required
N-Tier design and development.
Excellent knowledge of Java, Spring framework, Springboot/cloud, REST, Asynchronous messaging (AMQP, JMS)
Good knowledge of one database (MySQL/MAriaDB, Cassandra)
Understanding of design patterns
Troubleshooting application performance bottlenecks
Ability to design for auto-scaling and resilience.
Strong application process flow and problem solving techniques.
Strong focus on refactoring and code quality.
Understanding of software configuration and release management
High levels of software engineering literacy and communication skills
Friendly and professional manner
Experience on large scale deployment of Java applications

Desirable
Docker Containers and Kubernetes cluster deployments
Product development and lifecycle experience
Knowledge of JUnit, Maven, Gradle, Git
Exposure to any of: Java Messaging Service (JMS),
Hands-on experience of NoSQL stores such as Cassandra at scale
Qualifications
Minimum 3 years java development, 2 in n-tier development
Third Level Qualifications in computing, mathematics or science – Bac+5 Ecole d’Ingénieurs

description:
L’Energie et le Digital vous passionnent ? Envie d’être acteur dans cette transition énergétique et de trouver un sens à ce que vous faites ?

Alors welcome chez ENGIE Digital !

# WeareENGIEDigital

ENGIE est un acteur mondial de l’énergie, résolument engagé dans la transition énergétique et expert dans 3 métiers : l’électricité, le gaz naturel et les services à l’énergie. ENGIE compte 155 000 collaborateurs dans plus de 70 pays pour un chiffre d’affaires en 2017 de 65 milliards d’euros.

En pleine transformation digitale ENGIE a décidé de créer en 2016, ENGIE Digital en plein cœur de Paris dans le quartier Saint-Lazare.

Notre mission ? ENGIE Digital conçoit et fournit des produits et services digitaux pour réinventer le monde de l’énergie et accompagner la transformation digitale des entités, dans le monde entier, d’ENGIE et du Groupe.


Pour ce faire, nous recherchons un nouveau talent, pour grandir et nous faire grandir !


Engie Digital- Data Scientist (H/F) au sein de l'équipe Data
Poste basé à Paris (Saint-Lazare)

L’équipe Data accompagne les plateformes digitales et les Business Units d’Engie dans leur création de valeur autour de la donnée en fournissant une expertise technique en Data Science et Data Engineering. Sa vocation est de réaliser les études data science de bout en bout, c’est-à-dire de la phase exploratoire jusqu’à leur industrialisation.

Vos missions au quotidien
Votre mission principale consiste à participer au développement des briques data science de produits digitaux orientés Data. Pour cela vous aurez notamment besoin de :
Réaliser des études exploratoires sur les données mises à disposition, vous serez notamment amené à évaluer la qualité des données et produire des data visualisations
Identifier les problématiques métiers et les traduire en problématiques Data
Utiliser des techniques de machine learning afin de répondre aux problématiques identifiées,
Présenter les résultats et animer les ateliers métiers pour orienter les développements,
Industrialiser les modèles retenus,
Assurer le monitoring des modèles afin de gérer leur cycle de vie et les ré entrainer ou les faire évoluer lorsque la qualité baisse,
Réaliser une amélioration continue des modèles,
Animer des communautés autour de ces sujets
Faire de la veille technologique.
Qualifications
Votre profil
Vous êtes diplômé(e) d’un Bac+5, vous êtes passionné(e) par l’univers de la data science en général et vous justifiez à minima d’une première expérience dans le domaine. Vous avez idéalement déjà travaillé au sein d’une équipe de développement. Votre niveau d’anglais est courant.
Compétences techniques attendues
Langages de programmation : très bonne maitrise de python. R est un plus.
Maitrise des librairies classiques de data science : scikit-learn, numpy, pandas. keras est un plus.
Maitrise des techniques de régressions, classification, clustering, deep learning, …
Connaissance en bases de données : SQL et noSQL
Pratique de la méthode Agile Scrum,
Sensibilité à la culture devops et au software craftmanship
Compétences comportementales recherchées

Vous appréciez le travail dans une équipe pluridisciplinaire orientée produit (product owner, data engineers, software engineers, …)
Vous recherchez le partage de connaissances avec vos homologues sur votre domaine d’expertise.
Vous êtes pédagogue et êtes capable d’expliquer simplement des méthodes complexes tout en les justifiants vis-à-vis de leur contexte.
Vous êtes rigoureux et vous appréciez avoir un impact direct sur le business : le code produit a vocation à être déployé en production et être utilisé au quotidien par plusieurs milliers d’utilisateurs.

Emploi
: Digital et IT
Lieu principal
: Europe-France-Île-de-France-Paris
Organisation
: ENGIE Digital
Horaire
: Temps plein
Nature de responsabilité
: Opérationnel confirmé

description:
Why work for VMware PSO?
The global VMware Professional Services Organization (PSO) drives the adoption of VMware technology and solutions. The Global Account Management (GAM) team owns the business across top enterprise accounts with global operations. We are responsible for driving a significant part of VMWare’s revenue by co-innovating with our customers and partners. Our vision is to lead the digital transformation journey by driving the simplification and acceleration of IT solutions using VMware leading-edge technology and deliver the business outcomes our customers demand.
We are passionate about our Customers: our focus is on professional excellence and quality. We have a rich portfolio of consulting services aimed at bringing to bear the experience, expertise and methodology of our delivery teams around software defined Data Centre (SDDC), cloud automation, multi-cloud, IoT and workspace management.
We are committed to offering a collaborative and supportive working environment with an opportunity to develop in services sales. We promote an inclusive atmosphere where your voice will be heard, and where you will join a fun, dynamic team working in partnership with each other.
The Role:
As a Associate Client Solutions Executive (Associate CSE), South EMEA (SEMEA) Global Accounts (GAM) you will be responsible for supporting services sales across Global Accounts in France, Spain and Italy. You will be part of an exciting team working to drive complex solutions that create disruption, help our customers to innovate their business models and enable them to achieve competitive advantage and differentiation through using VMware’s technologies and services.
Your team is formed by a group of top talent sales individuals across EMEA and with a strong background and experience in selling professional and consulting services for cloud infrastructure, software, workspace mobility, end user computing and IT operational transformation. We are looking for services sellers with vertical industry experience in Telco, Finance and Manufacturing to share their knowledge and approach in a diverse sales team.
You will be working with the extended GAM team to build the commercial proposition to your customers and achieve your business objectives
This is a role which requires passion, dedication and creativity. The GAM team is driving innovation at VMware.
Responsibilities:
You will be responsible for:
Supporting the professional services business across France, Italy and Spain Global Accounts
Supporting services sales activity working closely with the extended GAM CSE team
Working with the GAM CSEs to driving the services sales cycle end-to-end:
Building the statement of work (legal and finance terms)
Obtaining internal deal approvals (Finance, Delivery, Revenue, Operations)
Negotiating & closing the deal with the customer/partner
Supporting the CSE team to:
Driving customer-specific sales campaign to utilise PSO services credits
Establishing direct relationships with the customer and partner representatives
Orchestrate the VMware PSO presales resources required to develop proposals, respond to RFQs/RFPs and Statements of Work (SoWs)
Liaise with the VMware Key Stakeholders to secure deal and pricing approvals
Work with the GAM extended sales team to develop business pipelineDevelop and maintain internal business reporting to support forecasting activities
Working as a team with Sales and Presales Solution Consultants on customer Request for Proposal (RFP)
Required Experience & Skills
Strong sales orientation
Understanding of Software Defined Data Centres & cloud infrastructures and common challenges
Able to organise and manage multiple tasks and activities supporting multiple team members Self-motivated, passionate, dedicated, driven, tenacious, achiever and well presented
Able to communicate effectively at all levels.
Excellent communication, and social skills
Fluent in French and English
Bachelors degree
Desired Experience & Skills:
Good understanding of our portfolio

description:
Job Category
Sales
Job Details
Lead Security Solution Engineer - Public Sector
Paris, France
We’re looking for Security & Compliance Solution Engineers that sell to agencies across the Public Sector.
This sector, as a lot of other industries, have a diverse set of issues around security, compliance, risk as well as emerging technology and trends. This is a highly technical and customer-facing role with most of its impact focused on the success of our customers. There must be a strong desire to leverage both technical and sales skills, including the ability to solicit business requirements, develop a technical sales strategy, and effectively demonstrate the solutions that address these requirements and provide business value, often using configuration or light coding to tailor the demonstration to the audience.
We look for technical professionals who can “own” the conversation on Salesforce's platform security and service delivery, Data confidentiality and Privacy and Security and Compliance posture various cloud offerings flow together.
The role of a Security & Compliance Solution Engineer is to work with our sales teams and customers to:
Understand a customer's risk, security or compliance concerns and communicate how Salesforce's infrastructure, architecture and application features can address these concerns
Apply knowledge of Federal, State, and local cyber and information security regulation and legislation (specifically National Cyber Security Centre (NCSC) - Cyber Essentials Plus, Defence Cyber Protection Partnership (DCPP), Cyber Security Model (CSM), French National Cybersecurity Agency (ANSSI) - SecNumCloud, ANSSI - politique de sécurité des systèmes d'information (PSSI), ANSSI - politique de sécurité des systèmes d’information de l’État (PSSIE)) to address customer concerns around risk, data privacy or Salesforce's compliance posture
Work with a variety of technical organizations within Salesforce - including Technology Compliance, Technology & Product and Engineering teams
Have strong understanding of network security, general engineering principles, cryptography, data in transit, and other technical aspects to assist in in-depth conversations with IT/CIO conversations
Partner with sales teams to remove security as a blocker by speaking to CISOs, CIOs and other key decision makers
Understand current and emerging cyber security risks, and innovative risk management methods and eloquently communicate to customers
Scale the role through external and internal education and enablement efforts
Lead hands-on technical workshops and education sessions
Your Impact :
Having fun and getting out of your comfort zone on a daily basis
Present Salesforce's cloud infrastructure, including demonstrating deep familiarity with Salesforce's hardware, software, networking and security stack
Opportunity to speak at industry conferences
Build and present customized demos
Feedback customer requirements and use cases to Product Managers and Product Marketers to influence product strategy and optimize product-market fit
Build deep relationships and provide thought leadership in our customer base to become a Trusted Advisor
Constantly learning, absorbing new information daily, and having a keen focus on how to best discuss complex, technical problems with customers
Assist customers understand how the cloud and Salesforce can meet their security needs
Part of a highly motivated sales team who are fanatical about our customers’ success
Comfortable working with clients at all levels - it is just as important to work with the front line as the CIO and CTO
Willing to learn how to configure our technology to build demonstrations that will show off the power of Salesforce’s platform
Adding to our broader team's point of view and base of knowledge and understanding
Minimum Qualifications:
B.S. Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Software Engineering or equivalent work experience
A deep passion for working with the latest, cutting-edge technologies
Experience with cloud, SaaS, PaaS, aPaaS and IaaS concepts and technologies
Familiarity with integration, security, and architecture patterns
Knowledge of related applications, relational database, and web technology
Deep understanding with information security and auditing, including experience with internal and external audits, and security and risk frameworks (e.g. ISO 27001, PCI DSS, HIPAA, GDPR or similar standards)
Strong background in security controls, auditing, network and system security
Some domestic travel is required
Fluent French and good English language skills
Preferred Qualifications:
Basic programming experience in Java/.Net/JavaScript and other web based technologies, Salesforce platform development (e.g. Apex code)
Information Security certifications (CISSP, GSEC, SANS etc.)
*LI-Y
Posting Statement
Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this Web site or directly to managers. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesforce.com or Salesforce.org.

description:
Purpose of the job

The role is to carry out all aspects of support for the Workplace infrastructure.

Perimeter :
Technical support
Platform design and management
Process analysis
Patch management

The team is located in Paris, however with company expansion, location of additional team member could occur in other AXA IM sites outside Paris.

The job holder controls the budget of the department including software and hardware procurement for workplace scope.

The activity includes management of initiatives and project activities related to workplace strategy as well as the day-to-day operations needed to maintain the committed high quality of service.

From a governance and organizational point of view, ensure full control of the environment is maintained, covering all aspects including software tool selection (operational, security and administration) to ensure service availability with appropriate procedures, process and infrastructure.

A regular reporting on costs, quality of service and activities is required by IT Management

Key Accountabilities / Responsibilities

• Team management:

Manage the day to day of the workplace management Core technical team activity. Look after the quality of service delivered by the team on a global basis.
Ensure performance and adaptability from the team to the very demanding context of workplace management. Partner with the business streams to ensure the platform meets business requirements
Responsible to define and own the desktop strategy aligned to business needs including O/S and tool upgrade procurement policy

• Support activity:
Desktop build
Desktop management including patch management, package delivery and deployment – covering 2nd and 3rd level support
Desktop model selection, testing and performance accreditation to meet business need
Desktop Asset management
Testing of new desktop image with Technology Teams

• Security
Ensure IT standard security policies are applied on desktops and laptops
Perform the relevant security controls
Working with IT security, responsible to select, test and deploy relevant solutions to maintain security levels.

• Tools
manage the admin platforms related to workplace management including SCCM, ITCM, safeboot , URC, Lan secure & Nexthink

Responsible for the Desktop LOGIN scripts, incl development & deployment of the scripts to ensure they are fully maintained to retain performance & that access is secure.

Manage engagement with key desktop partners, incl Microsoft, CA, Dell Etc..

meet KPI's as defined and agreed with management and the business

• Management
manage a team of technical engineers (perm, external and partners) in support of the Desktop environment
Proactively drive process and solutions to maintain high quality solutions

• Budget
It is the responsibility of all staff to follow the budgeting rules for the company, including
Managing personal expenses
Controlling company budgets (where you have budgetary responsibilities) to meet pre agreed forecasts.
Constantly striving to optimise costs of contracts and services to the benefit of the company.



• Maintain controls (as agreed in a previous AUDIT)

a. Define and implement a process (as part of the workstation refresh project) to review the list of software any user within the company is allowed to / supposed to have installed on their workstations is up to date and in line with a defined IT strategy. And a process to maintain this software compliance will be included as part of the Software Licence management contract (with the 3rd party provider)

b. Ensure a proper monitoring, forecasting (over 3 years) and reporting of the software lifecycle management

c. As workplace Manager, implement a process to periodically review logon scripts and remove unnecessary batches. Implement a process to manage changes to logon scripts (including restricted access to the scripts) and define who is responsible for making all changes to the scripts

d. The responsibility for oversight & implementation of the agreed level 1 security processes and activities e.g. antivirus and security patching, recertification and de-provisioning are undertaken.

e. Define and implement the agreed level 1 security controls and monitoring for the server platforms under Workplace teams scope. To be completed at the start of every quarter and be reported within their monthly team dashboard.

f. Ensure a comprehensive installation of antivirus software on all workstations and windows servers. Change the passwords of the administrators of the antivirus software every 6 months. At the start of a quarter, workstation and server managers within Infrastructure teams will complete full level 1 security checks to ascertain the policy is strictly adhered to & will be report on the results by including an indicator within their team dashboard

g. Support the business continuity and disaster recovery plan actions within scope of desktop. Including maintainance of the BCP image.


Qualifications
Qualifications
Engineering school, University Degree

Experience
Significant experience in financial institutions with a main experience on managing IT technical services.
Understanding of the underlying IT technologies:.
Significant experience on support within a very demanding environment.
Good understanding of change lifecycle and risk assessment within IT.
Asset management knowledge is appreciable.

Personal Competencies
• Very good team Spirit both on managing teams or partnering with other IT teams
Recognized leadership and autonomy
Good communication skills
Client and service orientation
Drive for excellence – maintaining high quality of service
Cross cultural awareness; Fluent in French & English

Technical skills
• IT systems and Infrastructure experience
IT support
Project management understanding
Team management skills
A propos d'AXA
Aimeriez-vous vous lever chaque jour motivé(e) par une mission inspirante et travailler en équipe pour permettre de protéger les personnes et leurs proches? Chez AXA nous avons l’ambition de mener la transformation de notre métier. Nous cherchons des personnes talentueuses ayant une expérience diversifiée, qui pensent différemment, et qui veulent faire partie de cette transformation passionnante en challengeant le statu quo et faire d’AXA – marque globale leader et une des sociétés les plus innovantes dans notre secteur – une entreprise encore plus performante et responsible.
Dans un monde en perpétuelle évolution et avec une présence dans 64 pays, nos 166 000 salariés et distributeurs privilégiés anticipent le changement pour offrir des services et solutions adaptés aux besoins actuels et futurs de nos 103 millions de clients.
Nous sommes un investisseur global multi-actifs, qui privilégie le long terme et la gestion active, pour permettre au plus grand nombre d’atteindre ses objectifs financiers en exploitant tout le potentiel des solutions d’investissement. En associant une connaissance pointue de l’investissement et de l’innovation à une gestion solide des risques, nous sommes devenus l’un des acteurs majeurs de la gestion d’actifs en Europe, avec 746 milliards d’euros d’actifs à fin 2017. Nous employons 2 400 personnes à travers le monde et possédons 29 bureaux répartis dans 21 pays.
Pourquoi nous rejoindre ?
Nous sommes fiers de promouvoir une culture de la performance ce qui veut dire que nous cherchons à recruter des personnes qui sont non seulement compétents techniquement mais également ouverts à l'international, innovants et capable de mettre à contribution leurs uniques perspectives et expériences afin d'accompagner nos succès en tant qu'entreprise. Employer les meilleurs professionnels parmi le plus large vivier de talents possible est au cœur de notre stratégie qui consiste à délivrer une excellente qualité de service à notre clientèle diversifiée.
AXA IM s’engage à développer une culture inclusive, mettant en valeur la diversité et soutenant la progression de carrière de l’ensemble de ses collaborateurs et collaboratrices.

Present and sell Varonis’ products and services to current and potential clients.
Follow up on leads and referrals resulting from field activity, while maintaining and expanding the database of contacts within the targeted organizations.
Uphold sales activities which includes prospecting, cold calling, booking appointments, performing demos, and creating proposals.
Present to C-Level prospective clients as well as to resellers through effective and enticing product demonstrations.
Partner with Sales Managers and Channel Managers to determine a strategic sales approach.
Establish and maintain current customer relationships by responding to customer requests and managing/resolving customer issues.
Support the reseller communication channel throughout the sales process.
Maintain accurate account information and activity detail in Customer Relationship Management system (CRM).
Participate in marketing events such as seminars and trade shows when necessary.
Percent of travel varies by territory.
Requirements

Bachelor’s Degree from a four-year College/University OR 5+ years of business-to-business sales experience/training OR equivalent combination of education and experience.
Technology industry experience preferred.
Microsoft Dynamics and Microsoft Outlook skills preferred.
Prior experience selling security software products through use of channel partners.
Strong communication and presentation skills.
Healthy list of pre-established and prospective contacts in given territory.
Willingness to learn technical aspects of selling the Varonis product.
Competencies

To perform this job successfully, an individual should demonstrate the following competencies:

Achievement Focus: Demonstrates persistence and overcomes obstacles; recognizes and acts on opportunities; sets and achieves challenging goals; takes calculated risks to accomplish goals.
Sales Skills: Achieves sales goals; initiates new contacts; maintains customer satisfaction; maintains records and promptly submits information; overcomes objections with persuasion and persistence.
Sense of Urgency: Displays a matter of utmost urgency; understands the importance of making critical business decision in a timely manner with strong attention to detail; realization that efficiency and prioritization is critical to success.
Customer Service: Manages difficult or emotional customer situations; meets commitments; responds promptly to customer needs; solicits customer feedback to improve service.
Problem Solving: Identifies and resolves problems in a timely manner; gathers and analyzes information skillfully; develops alternative solutions.
Written Communications: Edits work for spelling and grammar; presents numerical data effectively; varies writing style to meet needs; writes clearly and informatively.
Oral Communication: Demonstrates group presentation skills; listens and gets clarification; responds well to questions; speaks clearly and persuasively.
Adaptability: Adapts to changes in the work environment; manages competing demands; changes approach or method to best fit the situation; able to deal with frequent change, delays, or unexpected events.
Planning/Organizing: Prioritizes and plans work activities; uses time efficiently; plans for additional resources; sets goals and objectives; develops realistic action plans.
We invite you to check out our Instagram Page to gain further insight into the Varonis culture!

@VaronisLife

Varonis is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.

Big Data Engineer H/F
Square Sense - Paris (75)
date_publication:
il y a 21 heures
Signaler cette offre d'emploi
description:
Technology domains: Kafka, Spark, Python, Java, Scala, Docker, Kubernetes, AWS, GCP, Azure
Location: Paris, France
Duration: CDI
Square Sense
Square Sense is a fast-growing platform that provides advanced data solutions to global real estate developers, investors and managers. The company builds AI-powered “brains” that improve the operational and financial performance of real estate assets by providing real-time pattern detection and autonomous optimization. They also greatly enhance the overall experience for the tenants.
Square Sense was founded in 2017 in Paris by a multi-cultural team of talented engineers and data scientists.
Software Engineering at Square Sense
In Square Sense's Software Engineering Team we are building a multitude of products in the domains of data collection, analysis, visualization and IoT manipulation. Our systems collect data from IoT devices or third-party data sources, process ingested data in streaming and batch modes, organize processed data, provide the APIs to access it (thus creating a data analytics platform), or use third-party APIs to manipulate the physical world (thus making an automated decision making solution).
Our main programming languages are Python and Scala. From software engineering standpoint, our current technology stack includes Docker and Kubernetes, Kafka, Spark, Beam, Airflow, as well as various related Google Cloud Platform services (GKE, Dataproc, Dataflow, Pub/Sub, BigQuery) and Azure services (e.g.: AKS, HDInsight, etc.).
All team members are responsible for the overall design and architecture, development, quality, production delivery, and monitoring.
Objectives
As a Data Engineer you will be a member of the Software Engineering Team. This position implies close collaboration with members of our Data Science Team, who design and implement various data processing algorithms.
Primary objectives of a Data Engineer are:
Develop various components for data collection (connectors for various IoT devices and third-party services, web hooks, or MQ clients) and ingestion of collected data (using Kafka, for example).
Develop data processing applications (for example, streaming and batch data pipelines with Apache Kafka Streams and Apache Spark).
Automate data processing tasks and their monitoring in production (for example, orchestration of batch processing jobs using Airflow).
Design efficient data models using various storage technologies (cloud file storages, relational DBs and non-relational DBs such as Cassandra for instance).
Implement APIs (GraphQL and REST) to access processed data.
Profile
We are looking for a software engineer with 3+ years of industry experience in back-end software development or data engineering. Candidates for this position are expected to have:
Industry experience and strong programming skills with at least one of the following programming languages: Python, Java, or Scala. We expect a candidate to be fully autonomous in the coding process.
Willingness to learn new programming languages and new technologies.
Industry experience in back-end software development and/or data engineering.
Good knowledge of SQL and relational databases.
A taste for high quality software (clean code, high test coverage, willingness to do thorough PR reviews).
Knowledge in following areas is a plus:
Kafka, Kafka Connect, Kafka Streams, KSQL
Spark
Docker, Kubernetes, Helm
NoSQL databases
Amazon Web Services / Google Cloud Platform / Microsoft Azure
Agile methodology and Scrum in particular
Being passionate about IT ourselves, we are looking for a likewise passionate person with a good team spirit.
Working at Square Sense
Every member of our enthusiastic multi-cultural team is passionate about the technology; team leaders have 10+ years of professional experience in Software Engineering and Data Science. Currently with 8 full-time members we are looking to double the team size in next 12 months. We offer a motivating work environment, competitive salary and participation in the stock option plan. We work in a nice comfortable office in the center of Paris (Métro Strasbourg – Saint-Denis).
Apply
To apply for this position, please send us your CV via indeed.com, or visit https://jobs.square-sense.com/data-engineer/
Job Type: Permanent
Salary: 50,000.00€ to 60,000.00€ /year
Experience:
professional software development: 3 years (Required)

Digital Algorithm Architect
PROPHESEE - Paris (75)
date_publication:
il y a 19 heures
- Continuer pour postuler
Signaler cette offre d'emploi
description:
Founded by the world's leading pioneers in the field of neuromorphic vision, Prophesee develops a breakthrough technology that mimics the human eye and brain and allows machines to see what was previously invisible to them, making human interactions with them more efficient, more reliable and safer than ever.
PROPHESEE is driven by a team of 70 visionary and global engineers, holds more than 20 international patents and has raised $40M funding in just 3 years from leading international investors including 360 Capital Partners, Supernova Invest, iBionext, Intel Capital, Renault Group, and Robert Bosch Venture Capital.
This is a great opportunity to join a fast-growing company and an exciting team and to lead a paradigm shift in computer vision across many industries.
JOB DESCRIPTION
As a Digital Algorithm Architect, you will use your algorithmic and software engineering expertise along with your understanding of hardware implementation constraints to rethink complex algorithms and optimize them into area- and power-efficient ASIC-compliant solutions. You will work closely with Computer Vision, Software and Application engineers as well as RTL designers to find the implementation best fitting the constraints on efficiency, memory usage and robustness.
For this position, we are looking for a passionate individual who takes ownership for project work and demonstrates initiative, attention to details and creativity. The ideal candidate is an experienced software engineer with a background in algorithm design or image processing.
JOB RESPONSIBILITIES
Work in close collaboration with Computer Vision, Software and Application engineers as well as RTL designers to integrate requirements and use-cases
Rethink algorithms typically written for x86/ARM platforms and design, develop and optimize new C/C++ implementations adapted to hardware implementation constraints, in particular the memory usage.
Validate the approximations (fixed point, limited bit range, etc.) done for constructing the hardware-friendly version of the algorithm and support the digital design teams during the hardware implementation.
Work innovatively and creatively within the group with a focus on protecting innovation and IP through patents
QUALIFICATION, EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS
Required
MS degree in computer science, electrical engineering or computer engineering with 2+ years of industry experience.
Proven experience in software engineering and/or algorithmic architecture, with contribution on the design, development and optimization phases.
Preferred
Experience in implementation of C/C++ software models for hardware implementations
Experience in hardware image-processing architecture
Awareness of SOC/IC design architecture and digital design flow (i.e. design, verification, area/timing/power optimization)
Exposure to RTL description languages (e.g. VHDL or Verilog)
Language skills: English is mandatory as it is the working language of the company. French is an asset for living in Paris.

description:
Je recherche pour un de mes clients un Progam Manager R & D, Anglais exigé et courant

Overall Job Description

The R&D Program Manager supports its tribe or more tribes by ensuring that all business and technical aspects of the delivery of functionalities are executed smoothly and that software delivery over our environments is a continuous and aligned process. Each tribe consists of several Squads that deliver software changes for a specific . Program Manager works closely together with the IT Tribe Leads, the Business Tribe leads (/Product Owner) and the delivery teams within the Squads.

Fast removal of impediments, timely preparation of SAFe and SCRUM ceremonies, fruitful collaboration with concerned business and IT departments to manage any dependencies are the key tasks and responsibilities of the R&D Program Manager. He/she also assists the Tribe and Product Owner with idea funneling, as well as with timely prioritization and identification of requirements.

The R&D Program Manager proposes and continuously improves implementation-related processes that drives the technical delivery of his/her tribe and assures proper maintenance by the IT Operations team after delivery. When relevant, the R&D Program Manager assures that delivered functionalities are properly marketed by the concerned stakeholders.

Using his/her technical expertise and superb interpersonal skills, the R&D Program Manager works together with the IT Tribe Lead and the Product Owner to ensure that business and technical initiatives owned by the tribe are prioritized, planned and delivered to Production within time, scope and budget. He/she also provides clear monthly reporting to all stakeholders about the tribe’s delivery roadmap.

KEY RESPONSABIITIES:
Governance: Enables product vision understanding within squads and secure audit-proof requirements
Accountability: Is the accountable person for end to end delivery of the Program building a consolidated plan with all actors of the projects (Development, QA, Architects, Product Owners, Integration, DevOps)
Financial Management: Forecasts annual budget in terms of iterations and service increments of all EPICS within his/her scope on time for V0 and V1 portfolio budget exercises
Planning / Forecasting including non R&D deliveries: Setup and runs the Service/Program Increment planning ceremonies (cross Tribes) to define and plan the scope of the next service increments (10 to 12 weeks cycle
Risk Management Multi-squad level: Identifies and track risk, dependencies and issues and work with Development, Product Owners, Architects, OPS and Customer Program Manager to maximize alignment and value delivery and remove impediments
Infrastructure delivery: Setup release management ceremonies in order to follow up and obtain proper release management visibility and delivery
Service increment demo: Setup service increment demo ceremonies in order to show value delivery and obtain feedback for potential release decision
Best practices: Promotes continuous improvement practices and accounts for sprints retrospectives outcomes; Lead by example with respect to change management; Foster craftsmanship practices, frequent deliveries of value and shorter time to market cycles. Champion I-AM (Agile Methodology) values and guiding principle and provide continuous feedback for its improvement.
Build and Share Reporting: Measures progress of Epics deliveries within his/her scope with respect to delivered value and forecasted budget through his / her updated EPICS roadmap and EPICS burndown / burnup charts; Is accountable for providing transparency on delivery through monthly reporting and stimulate teamwork and team commitment

SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS:
4-6 years of hands on experience in taking a key role in an agile SDLC, for instance as Scrum Master, Senior Developer, Product Manager or IT Project Manager
4-6 years in an international working environment
Demonstrated experience in large organizations in roles which include structuring of activities, estimation of time and costs, execution to plan, delivery of results
Experience in managing technical aspects of software delivery in at least three of the following areas: front end development, back end development, infrastructure, middleware, data warehousing
Ideally Certified from Scrum.org ( Professional Scrum Master’ or Scaled Professional Scrum’) or SAFe
Knowledge of CI/CD concepts
Experience in Financial or Payment industry in senior delivery roles
Experience working with geographically dispersed teams, onshore, offshore and nearshore
Experience in implementation of continuous improvement methodology (Lean, Six Sigma)
Experience with a professional, structured Project Management Methodology is a nice to have (i.e. Prince2, CMMI, PMI)
Ability to work across functional and business unit lines and develop and maintain a culture of partnership with the Group project and product delivery managers and between all parts of the organization

INTERPERSONAL SKILLS:
Demonstrated relationship building, networking and collaboration, decisiveness in negotiation, very strong influencing and persuasion skills
Excellent planning skills, ability to split large deliveries into small epics, features and user stories prioritized by value delivered, in collaboration with the Product Owner
Ability to build consensus in an environment of conflicting interests and ensure execution of agreed initiatives - always focused towards result
Strong ability to analyze complex situations and present solutions in a structured way at Director and C-Level
Assertive and a driver of change and delivery
Strong operational orientation
Strong communication skills
Ability to work cross-culturally and across regions and to travel internationally on occasion
Lean / Agile attitude and mindset

QUAALIFICATIONS
The 3rd party company has to propose candidates with the following skillset / qualifications:
Engineer or University degree, with a least 7 years of experiences
Proficient in Microsoft Excel and Powerpoint, Atlassian JIRA and Confluence
Technical (Development/DBA) background is a plus
Basic knowledge in Monetic
Experience in Linux environment and SAAS development

description:
QUI SOMMES-NOUS ?

Thales propose des systèmes d'information et de communication sécurisés et interopérables pour les forces armées, les forces de sécurité et les opérateurs d'importance vitale. Ces activités, qui regroupent radiocommunications, réseaux, systèmes de protection, systèmes d'information critiques et cybersécurité, répondent aux besoins de marchés où l'utilisation des nouvelles technologies numériques est déterminante. Thales intervient tout au long de la chaîne de valeur, des équipements aux systèmes en passant par le soutien logistique et les services associés.

Le site de Gennevilliers est le c?ur des activités de conception, et de développement et de soutien des produits et solutions de radiocommunications des Armées, des systèmes de réseaux d'infrastructures résilients et de communications par satellite, et ainsi que des solutions de cybersécurité.

La Direction des Produits Air & Naval recherche un Ingénieur Développement Logiciel C / C++ (F/H)
Basé(e) à Gennevilliers (92).

QUI ETES VOUS ?
Profil recherché De formation ingénieur ou équivalent BAC+5, vous avez une première expérience de développement sur des bancs de test, de préférence en environnement Windows ? et des compétences en informatique embarquée ?
Vous maitrisez le langage C++, ainsi que les outils d'ingénierie associés ?
Vous avez une expérience pratique du travail en mode Agile/SCRUM et Méthode Test First.?
Vous appréciez le travail en équipe et êtes friand d'innovation ?

Alors ce qui suit pourrait vous intéresser !

CE QUE NOUS POUVONS ACCOMPLIR ENSEMBLE :
Au sein du centre de compétences Ingénierie du secteur des Produits Aéronautiques et Navals, vous êtes rattaché(e) au département Logiciels Dédiés.
Vous intervenez dans le domaine des Liaisons de Données Tactiques en tant que Software Engineer sur la famille de produit liée à la radio MIDS: logiciel embarqué MIDS TIO, banc EVTT, TMCT.

Dans le cadre de votre mission, vous :
? Participez à la spécification et au design des évolutions de nos logiciels
? Implémentez les fonctionnalités sur les composants de la solution dont vous avez la responsabilité
? Définissez et exécutez les tests d'intégration et de vérification des exigences fonctionnelles implémentées
? Participez à la phase de qualification avec le client interne et l'intégrateur final

description:
Job details
Position
Internship ORENG01 - Junior engineer : Seven Borealis Stinger upgrade study
Vacancy ref
64373
Based in
Paris (Suresnes)
Business area
Surf and Conventional
Contract type
Closing date
31/12/2019
Languages in which you may apply
English, Français
Vacancy information
Pipeline Group is a service provider for the engineering of rigid pipelines and associated structures installation. Multiple projects are on execution and several engineers are mobilized on each of them to execute the work.

One of the methods to lay offshore pipeline is called S-Lay. The name comes from the shape taken by the catenary during installation. This method allows laying pipe at high speed (rate) but in deep-water imposes large top tension capacity to prevent from too high strain in the pipeline. To control pipeline displacement when it leaves the installation vessel, a structure, called stinger, is installed at the vessel stern. The stinger, by supporting the pipeline on a longer distance, allows to reduce the requirement of tensioning of the pipeline, and thus to install pipeline in deeper water depths.
The SEVEN BOREALIS is the SUBSEA SEVEN deep-water enabler, dedicated to rigid pipeline installation in S-lay. However, the development of new fields deeper and deeper with larger and larger pipeline diameters require a stinger upgrade to maximize the competitivity of the asset. The purpose of the internship is to design the required upgrade of the present SEVEN BOREALIS stinger, considering prospects and structural constrains of the vessel. Especially, the present improvements will be looked at:
Modifications to allow “Steep S” initiation: rigid pipeline method allowing to initiate the pipeline with/without a structure without being connected from the vessel to the initiation anchor:
connection to the anchor is performed when pipeline first end gets close to the seabed. This method is already considered for future projects,
Extension of the actual stinger length.
The trainee will be integrated within Analysis Pipeline Group department and within an engineering project team for the upgrade linked to the « Steep S » methodology.The mission implies to communicate with Pipeline Group method engineers and Offshore Resources Engineers, in charge of SUBSEA 7 asset management.
The internship will be split in several stages:
Bibliography study to understand the constrains links to stinger design (length, curvature, number of supports, number of sections…)
Study of different stinger concepts used for rigid pipeline S-laying in ultra-deepwater,
Training to rigid pipeline installation analysis with Orcaflex Software,
Set up the scope of work for the stinger upgrade to initiate in “Steep S”: characteristics of the pipeline to check, water depth, detail of the modifications to perform, validation by installation analysis on actual project cases and prospects. As this method is already considered on future projects, you will be integrated on project to properly define the required modifications to capture properly the projects constrains,
Set up the scope of work for the stinger upgrade to extend its length: characteristics of the pipeline to check, water depth, detail of the modifications to perform (lengths, sections, number of supports, curvature, type of extension, loads on the vessels and supports…). Attention shall be taken to the vessel structural constrains.
Modeling with Orcaflex installation analysis simulation with upgraded stinger,
Writing of pre-design report.
The internship report will be used internally to support decisions for future investment.

Profile:
Engineering Student in third year of engineering school cursus or equivalent with a specialization in civil or marine engineering.
The present skills are expected:
Skills and interest for engineering and Finite Element Analysis,
Beam Theory knowledge,
Flexibility,
Initiative and responsibility,
Good English level (oral and writing)
Good communication skills,
Team work.
Knowledge of Orcaflex software will be appreciated but not mandatory.

During tender and project phases, the Operations team develop an offshore schedule, describing all activities that need to be done by the vessels offshore on field to install all the different piece of equipment (pipelines, Manifold, flexible line, umbilical, …), pre-commission them and made them fully ready for hand-over to our Client.
Today, the process to setup this offshore schedule is mainly “hand driven” and required lot of People (Project Operations Manager) effort to analyse past experience and develop new schedule for new tender and project.
All analysis of variation in duration of offshore works between as-sold, as-planned and as-built are mainly done manualy with no automated tools, and no reliable and standard way of doing.
The offshore schedule is done with Microsoft Project.
The intention of this internship is to develop a tool and processes that maximize the automation process of creating offshore schedule, including understanding the Scope of Work, evaluation tasks to be performed, understanding links inter tasks and evaluate based on previous experience/evaluated time estimates, the required time to perform the tasks.
Candidate, will have access to the softwares and tools that are required to be used. He/she will also have access to previous projects schedules to understand the the work Subsea 7 is performing, how schedules are built as of today, and what type of activities and links need to be considered.
Candidate will need to prepare a standard process, develop an input interface file to summarize scope of work and potential individual activities, develop a tool to maximise offshore schedule automation for initial setup/creation, update throught out life cycle (as a minimum during tender) and variation analysis.
Depending on progress and time available, the candidate will also be required to do analysis of past projects schedule and will be required to create statistics from past projects on individual tasks, that can be used for future offshore schedule.
Profile :
We are looking for an applicant in his third year of Engineering School.
The applicant mut be curious, proactive and have good communication skills.
The applicant must be practical in order to understand quickly the reality of our marine activities, but also have good skills on data analysis / processes analysis / automation of process.
An advanced level in English is required

Following a first internship during which the anchoring system was designed for shallow depths, Subsea 7 now wants to review the anchoring systems for depths up to 6000m deep.
The trainee will be asked to review the various anchoring systems existing to date as well as the design codes allowing their industrialization.
A first selection of the anchoring system but also of the riser system will be carried out based on technical elements but also based on cost comparison between the different solutions.
The trainee will then perform a parametric technical study to assess the displacement of the platform according to the design parameters of the anchoring system (Weight, stiffness, configuration).
He/she will get in touch with the estimating department to evaluate the costs of each of the solutions and will highlight a relationship between the cost of the anchoring system and the offset of the platform.
In the same way as for the anchoring system, the design of the dynamic configuration of the power cable that connects the converter to the seabed will be evaluated for each mooring design to optimize the overall cost (cable + anchor for each configuration).
For these studies the engineer will model the converter in the Orcaflex software for which the loadings due to the winds and currents and to the swell will have been previously calculated. Orcaflex will be the software that will be used for the sizing and analysis of the anchoring system. A large number of load combinations will be studied considering the winds, currents and swells on the site.
A report will be written to present the results obtained and proposals for further studies.

Student in 3rd year of engineering school with specialization in naval hydrodynamics or maritime engineering and interested in numerical simulations.

An advanced level in English is required

meta1:
Internship GPCENG09 - Junior engineer : Torpedo piles, design challenges
Subsea 7118 avis - Paris (75)
titre_poste: Internship GPCENG09 - Junior engineer : Torpedo piles, design challenges
date_publication:

description:
Job details
Position
Internship GPCENG09 - Junior engineer : Torpedo piles, design challenges
Vacancy ref
64372
Based in
Paris (Suresnes)
Business area
Surf and Conventional
Contract type
Closing date
31/12/2019
Languages in which you may apply
English, Français
Vacancy information
Geotechnical Team forms part of the Design and Analyses group, servicing the geotechnical needs of Subsea 7 within the Global Project Centre. Our team has been involved and has extensive experience in the design and installation of foundations for a large collection of offshore developments (Oil & Gas industry and renewable industry) around the globe.
Dynamically penetrating anchors provide an extremely simple and cost-effective method of installation, by free fall from a significant distance above the seabed. In its simplest form, the so-called Torpedo piles are steel, torpedo-shaped objects that are installed as projectiles penetrating the sea floor under velocity. Used widely (more than 2000 units) by Petrobras Offshore Brazil, they are a potentially viable alternative for anchoring both mobile drilling units as well as permanent facilities.
They are designed to reach velocities of 25 to 35 m/s at the seabed, allowing tip penetrations of ~3 times the anchor length, and holding capacities after consolidation that are anticipated in the range 5 to 10 times the weight of the anchor. While such efficiencies are lower than would be obtained with other sorts of anchor, the low cost fabrication and installation compensates.
However, they have not yet been used outside of Brazilian water. There is a lack of documented installation and design methods with verification agencies.
The proposed work consists of:
Review of the design challenges for Torpedo piles on deep-water sediments.
Specific items are:
Penetration behaviour of anchors
Axial pull out capacity over the time
Lateral capacity
Establishment of design procedure
Prediction of pile embedment after free fall
Modelling of the piles with 3D finite element analyses
Validation of the numerical results by mean of published centrifuge data, model tests and field tests
Identify the further work (in terms of additional model tests in the laboratory, full-scale tests in the field and numerical modelling).
Case study: typical offshore development: Torpedo pile vs suction pile. Focus on both technical aspect and cost evaluation
Reporting
The candidate will be integrated to the offshore geotechnical team. He will work under the direct supervision of the team manager. Candidate will collaborate closely with structure department, installation group and supply chain team for other aspects of Torpedo pile viability.

Profile :
Engineer's degree in civil or geotechnical engineering.
Broad interest in engineering software, notably PLAXIS/ABAQUS and Mathcad.
An advanced level in English is required

Vacancy information
The department is specialized in design and calculation of structure and piping elements for offshore structures including the installation and construction requirements. It is part of the following activities: deep water fields, shallow water & hook-up fields, assets and yard support, renewables energy development. The activity consists in concept definition to detailed calculation from tender stage to project execution.
Offshore wind farm development requires the installation of a large quantity of structure that support the wind turbines that generate the electricity. Like the oil and gas jacket type foundations their number is however ranging from 40 to 80 units according to the energy power required for the field. There is a real challenge for the logistic and technical solution to ensure a quick and cost saving delivery to the offshore site.
The internship will consist at first stage to understand and analyze the functionalities of structural foundations of the wind turbine based on project examples or concept studies. Then the intern will determine methods and calculate smart sea fastening on barges or heavy lift vessels. Modular aspects as well as advanced part fabrication and re-use of connecting elements will be part of the study. The intern will have to interact with design and installations teams. The type of wind turbine support could also include the floating structures and their associated transportation means from fabrication site to offshore field.
The main tasks to be achieved by the trainee will be:
Analyze the functionalities of foundations structure for offshore wind farms
Define smart method for fastening of those structures for sea transportation
Do structural calculations of solutions that will combine modularity and pre-fabrication
Assess the global budget savings (engineering, purchase, fabrication and installation) of this solution
Integrate this study in a process of standardization,
Write an engineering document to present the works performed during the internship.
Profile:
This internship position is targeted at students in their last year of engineering school.
The candidate will have been trained in mechanics and structural calculations. The applicant shall master at least one structural software and be able to read and understand mechanical/structural drawings for this internship position.
The trainee shall be autonomous, dynamic and rigorous and show creativity in order to propose cost saving solutions.
An advanced level in English is required

POSTE

Afin d'accompagner sa forte croissance et dans un souci permanent d'améliorer la qualité de ses logiciels, NeoXam recherche un testeur responsable de l'assurance qualité pour son équipe de R&D.

Elaborer les plans de tests en coordination avec les équipes de recherche et développement et consultants

Suivre des solutions automatiques d'amélioration de la qualité logicielle
Vous travaillerez de manière rapprochée avec les autres acteurs QA de l'entreprise, ainsi que les business analyst et développeurs.

Suivant les besoins, vos compétences et vos affinités, des opportunités de mobilité interne vers des postes de consultant, de business analyst offrant d'autres tâches liées à l'activité d'un éditeur sont envisageables : analyse de besoin, spécifications techniques, développement, documentation, support de niveau 2.

NOUS PROPOSONS

Un poste en CDI
Des bureaux agréables dans le quartier central de Bourse/Grands Boulevards à Paris 2e
Une ambiance de travail conviviale où l'esprit d'équipe est clé
Un environnement international et multiculturel
Un package compétitif composé d'un fixe, bonus individuel, participation & intéressement, tickets restaurant, mutuelle & prévoyance, RTT, congés d'ancienneté
Et bien plus…
Profil recherché PROFIL

Bac+2 minimum
Au moins une première expérience pertinente dans la mise en place de méthodes/outils/test plan pour l'Assurance Qualité
Bonne connaissance du domaine de la gestion de portefeuille
C'est encore mieux si :
Une certification ISTQB
Connaissances sur l'outil JIRA et/ ou Quality Center
Un niveau d'angalis opérationnel
Chez NeoXam, nous aimons les personnes curieuses, impliquées et autonomes, qui aiment proposer de nouvelles solutions et pour lesquelles il est essentiel de continuer à apprendre et à se développer au quotidien.

Le poste nécessite une grande rigueur et ténacité, une capacité à travailler en équipe.
Entreprise POURQUOI NOUS REJOINDRE ?

Nous rejoindre, c'est rejoindre un éditeur de progiciels financiers reconnu qui conçoit et intègre des solutions logicielles pour le secteur de la banque, de la finance et de l'assurance. Nos clients sont des sociétés de gestion d'actifs (buy-side) et de marchés de capitaux (sell-side).

NeoXam assure la couverture complète de la chaîne de valeur financière, front to back : gestion de portefeuille, comptabilité d'investissement, ainsi que gestion de données. Grâce à la performance de nos logiciels et notre « Digital Lab », nous gérons plus de 15 milliards de dollars d'actifs.

C'est aussi intégrer un groupe international avec des bureaux à Paris (notre siège social), mais aussi à Francfort, Luxembourg, Zurich, Genève, Milan, New York, Boston, Hong Kong, Shanghai, Pékin, Singapour, Tunis et au Cap.

Nous mettons tout en œuvre pour permettre à nos 500 collaborateurs d'exprimer leur potentiel et leur expérience.

Nous nous engageons à respecter nos valeurs d'adaptabilité, de fiabilité et de transparence aussi bien en interne qu'en externe.

Enfin, en rejoignant l'aventure NeoXam, vous participerez à un véritable projet d'entreprise en pleine croissance. L'esprit proactif et agile, l'expertise, la convivialité et l'environnement multiculturel de NeoXam et de ses collaborateurs font notre force.

description:
The Company
We are engineers. We provide an open-source content management platform for architects and developers, using the latest technologies and working with agile methodologies.
We are focused on creating an extensible platform for our customers, allowing them to build applications to organise, search and transform their data according to their business needs.
That is why we are leaders and visionaries in our sector.
People are our secret weapon, and that is why Nuxeo is an award-winning place to work.
The Team
Our Engineering team of 30 developers is committed to designing, building and delivering features, and continuously improving the performance and reliability of our products as we rapidly scale our organisation.
The team is divided into sub-teams that work with agile methodologies.
We are mainly based in Paris, France but also in Lisbon, Portugal as well as in the US.
Technical Stack
Frontend: JavaScript (ES6), Polymer 3, CSS3, npm, webpack.
CI/CD: Jenkins X, Kubernetes, Docker, AWS, GCP.
The Role
As a Frontend Software Engineer for the Engineering team, you will create visually engaging interfaces for complex applications. You will implement designs for Nuxeo's products and services, taking technical possibilities and limitations into account: we are looking for a developer with a strong sense of design and UX.
We are not looking for freelance workers: this is a permanent position (CDI).
A Typical Week
You will brainstorm with Software Architects, Product Managers and Designers to deliver quality applications with experience focused on user needs.
You will implement interactive client-side web applications on both desktop and mobile browsers, using HTML, CSS and JavaScript to accommodate the ever-growing list of viewports and browsers in play.
You will help our support team fix bugs and make customers happy. This is important as we sell support and maintenance.
You will mentor other engineers and review code.
Requirements
You love coding!
You have 3+ years of relevant experience in the Frontend development: expert skills in JavaScript, HTML5, CSS3, RWD techniques and methods, cross-browser compatibility including mobile and tablet experience and accessibility.
You are familiar with frontend development frameworks.
You write understandable and testable code keeping in mind maintainability.
You bring an in-depth understanding of fundamental visual and interactive user-centred design principles.
You're a quick learner, team player and are adaptable to new technologies.
You speak English and French fluently.
Bonus Points
You've mastered developing with Polymer.
You have experience developing PWA and web components.
You are comfortable with visual tools such as Photoshop, Sketch and wireframing software.
You are familiar with other programming languages e.g. Typescript, Dart, Java or other frameworks like React, React Native, Vue.js...
You have a passion for building beautiful user interfaces.

Full-stack & Dataviz Software Engineer
TINYCLUES - Paris (75)
date_publication:
ISAI Group - il y a 4 jours

Signaler cette offre d'emploi
description:
Tinyclues is an AI solution that enables B2C marketers to drive revenue and engagement from their existing customers. By contrast with traditional data-science approaches that rely on capturing explicit customer intent, Tinyclues' Deep AI approach leverages the full complexity of our clients' anonymized first-party datasets and picks up implicit signals (“tiny clues”), making it possible to reach unparalleled relevance & campaign performance.
Job Description
Tinyclues’ AI-first marketing platform is built with the latest technology including Akka, Spark, Mesos, elasticsearch, Docker, scikit-learn, Python ML frameworks, React.js, etc. Our software stack is a mix between Scala and Python, natively designed for cloud and deployed on AWS and other cloud providers. We focus on using those ecosystems for what they do best.
The solution processes and analyzes hundreds of terabytes of data every day from our 100+ enterprise clients across 13 countries. It runs dozens of powerful and carefully designed machine & deep learning algorithms to find the “tiny clues” in our clients’ first-party dabases. The technology currently relies on proven NoSQL datastores and distributed backends to process data. Our data pipelines are implemented over Spark and Mesos and orchestrated with an intelligent event-driven architecture using Akka and RabbitMQ.
What we do
We build a bleeding-edge predictive marketing platform on top of open-source technologies such as React, Play/Scala, Spark, elasticsearch, Docker, python, numpy, scikit-learn... Our software stack is natively designed for cloud and deployed on AWS and other cloud providers. We focus on using all those ecosystems for what they do best.
We ingest petabytes of data, and run dozens of powerful and carefully designed Machine Learning algorithms to bring value to our customers. It relies on an industrialized, automated and highly configurable platform, using advanced visualizations to help its operation.
As we believe methodology excellence helps to build a better product for our clients in a sustainable way, we currently work using agile methods, kanban boards, and recurrent internal tech events to share knowledge.
What you will do
Embedded in the Data Science Tools team:
You will help us build the platform that runs and operates all the ML algorithms in production
You will work hand in hand with data-scientists, ML engineers, data-ops to improve our platform and deliver rich insights from the data we manipulate
You will play with some of the sexiest piece of technologies available (react, d3, play/scala, machine learning...), and help going even one step further
You will participate in our initiatives of knowledge sharing and continuous quality improvement
You will be at the heart of a fast-paced, forward-thinking company building word-class technology
Preferred Experience
You are currently a full-stack & dataviz software engineer or wish to become one.
These assertions should not frighten you :
You have practical knowledge, experience or strong interest in building a solid, beautiful, useful and easily refactorable front end applications. Since our product and tools use browser side technologies, you should have knowledge in the corresponding idioms.
You like manipulating data, and find a way to visualize it in a meaningful way for the users, even when you have to deal with abstract matrices and mathematical metrics.
You have practical knowledge, experience or strong interest in manipulating data structures, algorithms, and backends to build data-centric applications while being easily refactorable, easily deployable, monitorable and resilient
You work easily with agile concepts (user stories, sprints) and best practices (peer review, pair programming…)
You have a passion for shipping quality/tested/performant code : all around testing, TDD, continuous integration, continuous deployment, devops…
You have great communication skills and fit well within a team
You have no fear to challenge benevolently others' work or to be challenged on your own
Additional Information
Contract Type: Full-Time
Location: Paris, France (75001)
Education Level: Master's Degree
Experience: > 1 year

MISSIONS

La majeure partie de l’activité de l’équipe R&D est de programmer et maintenir des fonctions financières dans notre progiciel : support de nouveaux instruments, indicateurs et analyses de risque, suivi réglementaire, méthodes de pricing, adaptation à de nouveaux types de clients ou marchés géographiques.

Dans cette équipe, l’essentiel de votre temps sera consacré à :

Elaborer les plans de tests en coordination avec les équipes de recherche et développement et consultants
Déterminer les outils et méthode à appliquer pour assurer la qualité du logiciel
Tester et valider l'application jusqu'au "Quality Sign-off"
Former vos collègues aux nouveaux outils et processus que vous aurez mis en place
Suivre des solutions automatiques d'amélioration de la qualité logicielle

NOUS PROPOSONS

Un poste en CDI
Des bureaux agréables dans le quartier central de Bourse/Grands Boulevards à Paris 2e
Une ambiance de travail conviviale où l'esprit d'équipe est clé
Un environnement international et multiculturel
Un package compétitif composé d’un fixe, bonus individuel, participation & intéressement, tickets restaurant, mutuelle & prévoyance, RTT, congés d’ancienneté
Et bien plus…

Au moins une première expérience pertinente dans la mise en place de méthodes/outils/test plan pour l'Assurance Qualité
Bonne connaissance du domaine de la gestion de portefeuille

Une certification ISTQB
Connaissances sur l’outil JIRA et/ ou Quality Center
Un niveau d’angalis opérationnel

Le poste nécessite une grande rigueur et ténacité, une capacité à travailler en équipe.

The Company
We are engineers. We provide an open-source content management platform for architects and developers, using the latest technologies and working with agile methodologies.
We are focused on creating an extensible platform for our customers, allowing them to build applications to organise, search and transform their data according to their business needs. That is why we are leaders and visionaries in our sector.
People are our secret weapon, and that is why Nuxeo is an award-winning place to work.
The Team
Our Engineering team of 30 developers is committed to designing, building and delivering features, and continuously improving the performance and reliability of our products as we rapidly scale our organisation.
The team is divided into sub-teams that work with agile methodologies. You will be integrated in one of the teams working on the platform.
We are mainly based in Paris, France but also in Lisbon, Portugal as well as in the US.
Technical Stack
Java, Python, Groovy, JavaScript
Git, GitHub, Jira, Slack, Nexus
AWS, Docker, Kubernetes (GKE or OpenShift), Ansible, Terraform
Jenkins X, SonarQube, etc.
GNU/Linux, Mac, Windows, Android, iOS
The Role
This Engineering team commits to the full development lifecycle (design + coding + testing + packaging + delivery) and faces daily challenges inherent to the build of maintainable software that need to evolve very quickly.
We need (wo)manpower to improve the whole chain in order to efficiently deliver a high quality product.
A lot of technologies are at stake (front-end, back-end core services, build & packaging) and the expected technical level is ambitious.
A Typical Week
You will:
participate in the Platform team’s scrum activity.
anticipate and find solutions to their needs.
manage short term and long term plans for chosen technical solutions.
answer the whole team’s needs by building generic solutions (as much as possible/relevant).
collaborate with the DevTools and Cloud teams when elaborating these solutions.
handle communication with these teams as a referee for the Engineering team.
Requirements
You have +3 years of relevant experience in the DevOps world, CI and CD oriented.
You like helping getting things done by achieving pragmatic short term solutions and planning long term solutions at the same time.
You are a quick learner, open minded and curious.
You are organised.
You care for a quality product delivery.
You like communicating about what you do.
You speak English and French fluently.
Bonus Points
You know continuous integration tools such as Jenkins and its Pipeline plugin inside and out.
You have experience with build/dependency tools like Maven and Gradle.
You are familiar with Go.
You have heard of Jenkins X.
You know Tekton is not a type of dance from 10 years ago.

Manage industrialization of Filter & Navigate for Cloud and On Premise deployments. Perform automation activties within ENOVIA organization.
Perform Best-in-class Quality Assessment of DS products and ensure that products quality meets DS criteria.

This position is related to test Navigation & Filter functionalities on preGA (release not yet marketed) and post GA (FP/FD).
Activities will be performed on Cloud and On Premise environment with priority on Cloud.
Automation will also be key part of the activity.
Those topics are all critical for ENOVIA and highly exposed.
Global activity includes (non exhaustive):
Industrialization (Define, Tests…) of functions on GA and FD levels with full agreement of R&D development team on scope covered (or not).
Specific testing activity on topics which need to be performed in DSHQ exclusively
Communication with our extended enterprise team (3DP) of all needed information for collaboration
Automation activity with definition of scenarios to be automated, script creation, analysis, and reporting

General details on the industrialization activity:
Validate PES: review PES (Product Enhancement Specifications) written by Product Development teams and ensure they are complete and compliant with DS standards (via DSX Dev)
Define functional testing scenarios: describe all use cases (customer scenarios) corresponding the functionalities to be tested. If it is a new functionality, the target is to validated all the items described in the PES. Document and share these scenarios (with the Product Development R&D teams in particular)
Manage and publish the Test results and provide an appropriate communication on a regular basis: communicate quality statuses, define with the Product Development teams recovery plans, escalate issues and priority arbitration to stakeholders & to management in order to provide a decision support information. Participate to the Go/No Go decision.
Monitor and control the testing process: steer in details the QA activities, the quality improvement, follow up the execution of the Industrialization plan according to the defined gates. Capitalize on the feedback from incidents reported by customers to continuously improve the testing process (content and efficiency).
Execute testing: run the defined scenarios (acceptance, convergence & non regression) on several environments, find and qualify the bugs and the non-convergence areas with PES. Document them carefully in Incident Reports (IRs) for the Product Development teams for them to correct. Provide a quality status and prioritize the required corrections
Plan convergence & non regression tests according to the targeted GA (final delivery) date and define Industrialization plan: the compilation and the arbitration between all the scenarios, the necessary time & resources for testing, the organization of the activities between all the Development cycle gates and the optimization of the QA costs.
