description:
About Datadog:
We're on a mission to build the best platform in the world for engineers to understand and scale their systems, applications, and teams. We operate at high scale—trillions of data points per day—providing always-on alerting, metrics visualization, logs, and application tracing for tens of thousands of companies. Our engineering culture values pragmatism, honesty, and simplicity to solve hard problems the right way.

The team:
The data science team focuses on improving the observability of dynamic distributed systems by creating practical user-facing features in the Datadog app. We research, develop, and maintain features such as automated alerting, forecasting, anomaly detection, directed root cause analysis, and much more.

The opportunity:
This role sits at the intersection of software engineering, data engineering, and data science. You will be working on large-scale distributed systems, horizontally-scalable datastores and a variety of data-processing frameworks to build our next-generation platform and capabilities for data science at Datadog. You will be contributing to our core products in a way that significantly and directly impacts our customers’ experiences.

You will:
Build common services and components encapsulating data science capabilities for other products and teams to leverage
Enable new capabilities for our core products by integrating and preprocessing data from tens of sources and preparing it for incorporation into data science models
Ensure that our data science-driven features continue to scale well as Datadog adds more customers and ingests more data per customer
Leverage modern tools and frameworks to improve the performance and cost-efficiency of data science services
Join an amazing team of data scientists and software engineers building a product that our customers love to use

Requirements:
You can write performant Python code
You have experience building data processing systems
You can design architecture to solve problems at high scale
You want to work on a data science team that ships products
You value simplicity and getting the right things done
You want to work in a fast-moving, high-growth environment that respects engineers and customers

Bonus points:
You are an expert in Go or Scala
You have built systems that process terabytes of data every day
You have more than a passing interest in statistics or data science

Le poste
Notre client est la start-up la plus primée au monde pour ses inventions d’excellence dans le domaine du son. À l’origine de l’épopée, une invention brevetée qui a révolutionné le monde de l’amplification. Cette innovation, qui confine à l’impossible, leur a permis de croiser les technologies analogique et numérique pour restituer un son d’une qualité jamais atteinte jusqu’alors. Chaque jour, notre client conduit la plus belle des aventures et réinvente des façons de travailler pour donner accès au plus grand nombre à un son d’une qualité et d’une émotion incomparable. Dans ce cadre notre client recherche un ingénieur logiciel C++ pour intégrer leur équipe R&D et les aider à repousser les limites du possible. Au sein de l’équipe R&D, vous serez en charge de poursuivre le développement des logiciels embarqués sur les produits présents ainsi que les produits à venir. Vous travaillerez en interaction forte avec les équipes applications mobile, produit (expérience utilisateur) et hardware
Les responsabilités
Développement de nouvelles technologies (audio multi-canal, capture sonore basse latence, etc…)
Extension de framework distribué C++ multi-plateforme (Linux/iOS/Android/…)
Vous serez responsable du développement et de la certification des sources de contenu et des services, tels que AirPlay 2, Roon RAAT, Bluetooth, Spotify Connect, Amazon Alexa, nouveaux services de streaming. Vous serez en contact direct avec les équipes techniques des fournisseurs de ces services
Profiling et optimisation des performances réseau. Adaptation aux nouvelles topologies de réseau (réseau hybride ou mesh, agrégation des liens, reconfiguration dynamique)
Développement spécifique aux usages TV, gaming et professionnel (faible latence, configurations spécifiques)
Pourquoi venir chez nous?
Dans l’univers du son, il existe un paradoxe frappant : la musique n’a jamais été aussi accessible en volume, mais la qualité sonore restituée par les technologies peine à nous toucher. La pureté et les milliers de détails qui composent la musique nous échappent. L'objectif de notre client: permettre au plus grand nombre d’écouter un son parfait, grâce aux objets sonores du quotidien. Cela peut paraître simple dit comme ça ! Chaque jour, toutes leurs équipes oeuvrent pour rendre cette folle ambition plus concrète. Etape par étape, c’est une véritable révolution technologique du monde de l’audio qui s’est mise en marche avec des innovations radicales. Depuis leur création, plus de 160 brevets ont été déposés.

Lead Software Engineer - Medical Devices

SentinHealth is a MedTech startup established in 2017, focused on the development of integrated
monitoring solutions to prevent heart failures and manage other chronic diseases in ageing patients.

We are developing an implantable medical device which communicates the patient’s condition in order
to detect symptoms as early as 30 days before heart failure, which allows doctors to administer a light
and effective treatment and thus prevent hospitalization and potential adverse effects.

Our patented technology determines a composite index from multi-sensor physio-pathological signals
and uses state-of-the-art algorithms to predict the evolution of the patient’s condition.

SentinHealth currently conducts pre-clinical trial and will bring its first product to the market in 2023.

Who we are
At Criteo, we connect 1.5 billion active shoppers with the things they need and love. Our technology takes an algorithmic approach to predict what user we show an ad to, when, and for what products. Our dataset is about 50 petabytes in Hadoop (more than 120 TB extra per day) and we take less than 10ms to respond to an ad request. This is truly big data and machine learning without the buzzwords. If scale and complexity excite you, join us.

Most of all, we are creators. From designing ground-breaking products to finding unique ways to solve technical challenges at an exceptional scale, our tech teams work with state of the art methodologies to shape the future of advertising.

The Site Reliability teams keep one of the largest computing platforms in the AdTech world functioning like clockwork. They are processing, storing and monitoring through large scale data compute & storage services (Hadoop, SQL & NoSQL), streaming (Kafka), platform as a service (Chef, Mesos), identity management (Kerberos) and analytics (Hive, Druid, Vertica).

The Data Engineer will be part of our Data Group. This group is in charge of hosting and producing the data for operations, reporting and machine learning purposes. We deliver can't-fail systems and services distributed across 9 data centers, spanning 3 continents and serving billions of Internet users. This includes the systems that host the data, the pipelines responsible of producing the core data and the tools to monitor and understand the data life cycle.
Challenges of this role
Build optimal data pipelines that meet business owners needs and requirements
Maintain the most critical data sets with high quality monitoring
Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery
Participate in building the long term vision on data governance problematic
What we're looking for
You are comfortable with Java or Scala or a similar language
Practical experience on data modelling and ETL
Analytical mind - You like to question the information you have and understand the big picture and the real problems that should be solved
Scalability - You like working with problems involving huge amounts of data, provide data insights, with good reliability practices
Accountable - you have a real sense of ownership and feel responsible for the service your team provides to multiple clients
Passionate - You are a problem solver, a fixer, and a creative technologist. We believe coding is a talent and a passion, not just a skill.
Team Oriented - You need to be a great team worker and a good communicator.
Bonus skills
Practical experience in writting Map/Reduce, Spark or Hive/Presto jobs
Practical experience in writting SQL queries
Experience performing root cause analysis to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement
Experience on Data Governance questions

Research and identify automation solutions which bring value to the existing software system

Driving automation practices into the software development life-cycle
Mentoring both current (and future) testers and developers in using the new system effectively

Strong automation experience
Experience using test automation tools (for example, Selenium or SpecFlow/Cucumber)
Experience writing code in one of the following languages (Python, C#, Java)
Good practice of SQL databases and REST API services, including the ability to programmatically interact with data formats that may include XML and JSON
Working knowledge of distributed version control (i.e. git)
Broad understanding of Agile development practices & several years working in an agile environment
Experience working collaboratively in multi-disciplinary teams to deliver software development projects

Experience in and knowledge of developing and testing transactional websites, data-driven web publishing, content management systems
Experience of product tracking tools, e.g. Jira
Solid verbal and written communication skills in English & French
Why would you join us?
Passionate team
Foosball, and nice office configuration to interact with the teams
Summer socials
End of year party
After work socials

Nokia is a global leader in the technologies that connect people and things. The candidate will manage a research department in networking systems for augmented machine interactions. The role entails leading several researchers in the design, implementation, and analysis of new network architectures, protocols, and systems for software-defined networking, network virtualization, cloud automation, artificial intelligence and Internet of Things. The candidate must be fluent in the current state-of-the-art and scientific literature of these areas, in which she/he should have published impactful research work. The responsibilities will encompass leading the development of innovative ideas, their evaluation, measurement, and analysis, and their implementation as prototype systems to further Bell Labs’ long history of discoveries and technological contributions. The candidate’s vision and leadership will drive the development of concepts and architectures for the next generation of network systems and software.

PhD in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or related field with deep understanding of IP networking and expertise in areas such as software-defined networking, network virtualization, cloud automation, artificial intelligence and Internet of Things
Established research vision and leadership in the field of networking and related disciplines

Strong background in networking with hands-on and practical system building experience

description:
C3.ai répond à une demande urgente et à croissance rapide d'applications Big Data, IA et IoT à l'échelle de l'entreprise pour permettre la Transformation Digitale. La plateforme C3.ai utilise le monitoring de performances en temps réel et l'analyse prédictive pour optimiser les processus métier, différencier les produits et services et créer de nouvelles sources de revenus. Grâce à l'innovant système du C3.ai Type System et à sa plateforme ouverte et extensible, C3.ai est devenu le leader mondial des initiatives de Transformation Digitale.

Notre plateforme et les applications développées sur celle-ci sont majoritairement écrites en Java, JavaScript et Python. Nous développons et utilisons des technologies modernes (Spark, Cassandra, PostGres, Kafka, GraphX, Torch, etc.). Au cœur de cette architecture réside notre type system : une couche d'abstraction objet d'une grande expressivité qui permet aux développeurs et data scientists de décrire leurs données, d'utiliser des fonctionnalités existantes ou d'en définir de nouvelles sans se soucier de l'infrastructure ou des services sous-jacents. Cette technologie permet à nos utilisateurs de développer et de déployer en production des applications à grande échelle en à peine quelques semaines.

Le rôle

En tant que Software Engineer - Professional Services, vous travaillez directement avec les clients pour concevoir, développer et déployer des applications d'entreprise basées sur l'intelligence artificielle sur la plateforme C3.ai ; en particulier :

Vous êtes est en charge du développement des modèles de données, des APIs (utilisant le C3.ai Type System), et de la logique applicative, notamment des algorithmes d'analyse de données en JavaScript et Python.
Vous travaillez à l'intégration d'algorithmes d'apprentissage et de prédiction en collaboration avec les équipes Machine Learning et Data Science.
Vous effectuez les améliorations, les revues de code, les tests et le débogage des applications avec et pour le compte des clients.
Vous rédigez les spécifications, la documentation, et les guides utilisateur.
Vous identifiez les risques et les lacunes techniques; vous élaborez des stratégies d'atténuation en prévision des besoins des clients
Un candidat idéal possède une véritable capacité d'analyse, une bonne compréhension des enjeux stratégiques, une expertise forte en développement logiciel, et d'excellentes compétences interpersonnelles.

Votre profil

Le(a) candidat(e) sélectionné(e) sera un membre clé de l'équipe, contribuera à notre croissance rapide et sera à l'origine de solutions innovantes pour des problématiques uniques.

Expérience avec JavaScript et Java (ou autre langage de programmation orientée objet).
Connaissance et compréhension solide de :
Programmation orientée objets
Algorithmes et Structure de données
Fonctionnement des types de base de données (RDBMS, NoSQL, etc.)
Systèmes distribués et paradigmes associés (MapReduce, Event Processing, etc.)
Expérience avec git (ou autre VCS), la rédaction de tests efficaces, et la méthodologie agile
Une bonne connaissance des services AWS est un plus
Capacité démontrable d'adaptation (nouveaux domaines, nouvelles technologies) et volonté de partager son expérience en interne ou avec nos clients
Excellent niveau de communication orale et écrite en français et en anglais
Désir de résoudre des problèmes difficiles en équipe et de contribuer à développer un environnement inclusif, intellectuellement stimulant et fun (Glassdoor Best place to Work 2017)
Les +

Our patented technology determines a composite index from multi-sensor physio-pathological signals
and uses state-of-the-art algorithms to predict the evolution of the patient’s condition.

SentinHealth currently conducts pre-clinical trial and will bring its first product to the market in 2023.

description:
WHO WE ARE:
DataDome is a global company that offers the most advanced technology designed to block OWASP automated threats: credential stuffing, layer 7 DDoS attacks, SQL injection & intensive scraping. DataDome's Artificial Intelligence protects all vulnerability points (web, mobile apps & APIs) with a cutting-edge technology providing real-time automated blocking decisions.

Thanks to our state-of-the-art dashboard, users get real-time intuitive notifications about blocked attacks, feedback loops, insights, business KPIs and attack details.

Our technical stack is mainly composed of real time detection layer in Java, a low latency Stream Engine running on Flink in Scala, ElasticSearch for the storage, Kafka for communication between layers, HAProxy for load balancing, Symfony 4 & Angular 7 for our dashboards.

Our infrastructure is deployed on AWS and Azure, using Docker, Ansible and Terraform, and monitored with Grafana and Prometheus.

This stack is currently handling 100k requests per second and manages more than 100 TB of data.

DataDome was founded by seasoned entrepreneurs and is backed by ISAI (tier 1 VC)

ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

DataDome is growing fast and we're looking for an experienced Solution Engineer to join our growing team.

You'll be responsible for helping our customers (major e-commerce and classified all over the world) to become experts of DataDome in order to improve their security.
Facing our clients, you'll be demonstrating the capacity of our solution to software engineers, architects and C-level executives with our objective to establish technical credibility.
You'll work closely with our engineering team and our customer success team. You'll participate in the development of our solution in translating customers feedback into product features
You'll work actively in improving issues solving process
REQUIREMENTS

Background:
3+ years of experience in a customer-facing role in tech environment
Strong experience with technical B2B products
Experience in managing web servers like Apache, Nginx, Varnish, IIS (is a plus)
Key skills include:
You have excellent communication skills both in English and in French
You are Customer centric and a solving problems person
You are a team player and like to interact with other teams in the company
You are passionate about the products you are in charge of.
You are convinced that serving the best we can your clients is the key success factor of the growth.
***REMOTE CANDIDATES ARE WELCOME***

WHY JOINING US

A stimulating work environment with passionate individuals and a first class R&D team creating a top-quality and innovative solution, making DataDome one of the strongest performers in the bot management industry
A multicultural and diverse team with individuals from diverse backgrounds (Asia, America, Europe, Africa)
A joyful workplace with many events throughout the year : annual offsite, summer and Christmas parties; one thematic aperitivo per month, breakfast every Friday morning
Offices being at the heart of Paris and the tech ecosystem
An attractive remuneration scheme and rewards policy
Interested in joining us? Send your application now!

description:
QUI SOMMES-NOUS ?
L’activité Systèmes terrestres et aériens conçoit des systèmes, des équipements, des capteurs et des services pour le contrôle du trafic aérien civil et militaire, la défense aérienne ainsi que le combat naval et terrestre.
Le site de Rungis est idéalement situé à proximité de l’aéroport d’Orly. Site à l’architecture moderne, il compte aujourd’hui plus de 1000 collaborateurs travaillant pour nos trois domaines d’activité : les radars, le contrôle du trafic aérien et les systèmes d’armes avancés.
Leader mondial de la gestion du Trafic Aérien, Thales ATM équipe plus de 170 pays de solutions radars et logicielles permettant chaque jour à des millions de passagers d’arriver à leur destination en toute sécurité et sans retard. La densification sans précédent du trafic aérien, l’occupation des espaces de basse altitude par des engins sans pilote (drones) et l’optimisation de la consommation d’énergie requierent des solutions digitales plus écologiques et plus efficaces. Pour relever ces défis nos équipes conçoivent des systèmes et développent des algorithmes d’IA visant à aider à la prise de décision en temps réel tout en respectant les contraintes de sécurité liées au monde de l’aéronautique.
Votre rôle
Au sein d'une squad qui développe le produit UTM (Drone Traffic Management), vous êtes développeur confirmé. Dans un contexte Agile/Scrum vous contribuer fortement à la création du produit par votre expertise, votre expérience et votre leadership.
Responsabilités
Porter la vision technique FE/BE et système du produit en tant qu’expert technique au sein de la squad
Supporter et éclairer le PO sur les technologies requises pour l’implémentation des fonctionnalités du produits
Proposer des choix technologiques et participer aux choix d’architecture en collaboration avec le Tech Lead et le Chapter Leader Architecture
Accompagner l’équipe dans ses pratiques de qualité logicielle : TDD, revues de code, pair programming, etc.
Assurer des codes reviews
Coder la majorité de son temps tant par plaisir que pour donner l’exemple et enseigner les bonnes pratiques
Contribuer activement à la mise en place, au suivi et à l’amélioration continue des pratiques de développement de l’équipe
Collaborer avec l’équipe d’assurance qualité afin d’élaborer les scénarios de tests et de les accompagner dans l’automatisation des cas de tests
S’assurer que les principes de sécurité sont compris en appliqués par l'équipes
Être à l’écoute des difficultés techniques rencontrées par l’équipe, co-construire les solutions
Faire grandir et transmission de son savoir à l'équipe

Votre profil
Une formation Bac+4/5 en école d'ingénieur, formation universitaire ou tout domaine connexe
Une expérience de 3 ans minimum au sein d’équipes de développement ou des réalisations / contributions significatives
Bonnes connaissances des langages BE (Java / SpringBoot) et FE (Angular)
Maîtrise du SQL et des bases NoSQL
Connaissance des API REST et leurs best-practices ainsi que les suites de tools associés (Postman, Swagger …)
Une expérience significative sur un projet Kafka ou sur des infrastructures distribuées temps réel à forte volumétrie de données
Pratique de la containerisation (Docker…) et du déploiement en environnement orchestré (Swarm, K8s…)
Connaissance des pratiques de développement collaboratifs (Git et Git-flow, CI/CD & pipeline DevOps, tests, revues de code, intégration continue, gestion de versions, etc.)
Connaissance et pratique des principes de Test Driven Development ainsi que des framework courants de testing et d’évaluation de la qualité
Connaissance et pratique du développement en mode agile
Anglais correct à l’écrit et à l’oral
Bonus
Connaissance en développement et framework de cartographie et de géométrie 2D/3D
Travaux personnels ou contribution(s) à des projets open source
Participation à des projets d’envergure dans le contexte de l’industrie aéronautique ou connaissances dans le domaine
Connaissances en sécurité/sûreté logicielle
Innovation, passion, ambition : rejoignez Thales et créez le monde de demain, dès aujourd’hui.

Responsibilities:
Collaborating closely with Program Management, QA, Development and Documentation teams throughout the development and release cycle.
Creating engineering based use cases, workflows and end-to-end processes for the purposes of new feature specification and product validation.
Help tracking, testing and managing the progress of beta version of the products
Provide high level technical support internally to developers and application engineers worldwide
Preparation of materials for technical pre-sale and proofs of concept presentations
Perform demos and seminars to promote new product capabilities
Performing benchmark and help migrating customers to Altair products
Visiting customer to communicate technical functionality and gather new requirements
Actively participating in internal meetings and contribute to the decision-making process.
Interaction among Altair products to help specification and implementation of new workflows

Sound understanding of Finite Element analysis and Mechanical Engineering principles
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Structural/Mechanical/Civil/Aerospace Engineering

Energetic, enthusiastic and able to work effectively with others

Problem solving capability with out of the box mentality

Experience with HyperView, HyperGraph, Metapost, Animator, Patran, HyperMesh, Ansa, Ansys Workbench or similar products

Altair is a global technology company that provides software and cloud solutions in the areas of product development, high performance computing (HPC) and data intelligence. Altair enables organizations across broad industry segments to compete more effectively in a connected world while creating a more sustainable future. To learn more, please visit www.altair.com.

Profil recherché Titulaire d'un diplôme d'Ingénieur (ou équivalent Bac+5) en électronique et/ou Informatique Industrielle, vous disposez d'un première expérience significative réussie sur un des postes suivants :

Entreprise CHELA+ est une société de conseil en ingénierie industrielle présente dans les métiers de l'industrie de pointe. Nous intervenons dans 3 domaines principaux: la conception de nouveaux produits en recherche et développement, en bureaux d'études et en essais de qualification.

Notre premier engagement est de vous accompagner pour vous permettre d'exprimer vos compétences et de construire ensemble une collaboration durable.

meta1:
Chief of Staff to the VP of Engineering
BLABLACAR - Paris (75)
titre_poste: Chief of Staff to the VP of Engineering
date_publication:
ISAI Group - il y a 20 jours
- Continuer pour postuler
Signaler cette offre d'emploi
description:
À propos
BlaBlaCar’s vision is to bring fairness, freedom and fraternity to the world of travel. BlaBlaCar was created in 2006 with one dream in mind: fill the millions of empty seats on the road to create an efficient, affordable and friendly way to travel. Today, our global, trusted community counts 75 million members in 22 countries, enabling a smarter, large scale and truly sustainable transport network.
Born from a simple idea of people sharing their rides, BlaBlaCar’s ambition is to become the go-to marketplace for shared road mobility. We offer long distance carpooling service, a commuting carpooling service, and since 2018 a marketplace bus service too. A filled bus emits one third of the emissions per passenger kilometer as an average car. So we want to fill those seats too!
In 2018, 84 million travellers used BlaBlaCar globally saving 1.6 million tons of CO2. Meanwhile we enabled human connections, bringing people closer together in more ways than one with 87% of members say that carpooling is an enriching experience.
BlaBlaCar offers a truly and unique international environment with a team counting 35 nationalities, serving a global member-base from 8 offices in Berlin, Kiev, Madrid, Milan, Moscow, Paris (HQ), São Paulo, Warsaw. English is the official spoken language across BlaBlaCar. We are privately-held and founder-led. Our team of 500 employees is entrepreneurial, passionate, and fundamentally mission-driven.
Descriptif du poste
Why join us?
We’re looking for a Chief of Staff to help amplify the VP Engineering and the Engineering Management team (direct reports of the VP Engineering). As the right-hand person of the VP Engineering, you’ll be given authority to drive key cross-cutting programs and processes to continually level-up the engineering organization. You’ll be instrumental in scaling the engineering organization by doubling the number of engineers in a year.
This job is a great opportunity to learn from successful VPs and leaders, to attend high-level meetings and to work on strategic projects with teams in the company.
What you will directly contribute to:
1/ Drive cross-cutting Tech (non-software) Projects
You’ll drive our Tech organization-wide projects, aiming at the engineering organization to scale and operate more efficiently: our Tech Delivery Capacity program and also our (about to start!) HR Tech program as well (better attracting and retaining our Tech talents).
You lead the relevant meetings or steerco, coordinate the relevant stakeholders contributing to your projects and follow-up on action plans and results.
You will have a keen pulse of the engineering team and use this to propose new initiatives that will improve the overall health and happiness as well as belonging feeling of the engineering team.
Your projects will necessarily be non-software projects, software projects being handled by delivery teams you’ll closely work with.
2/ Facilitate Engineering Management team
You will support the Tech Management team governance : you’ll run weekly Engineering Management team meetings, ensure communication of the key decisions and follow-up on actions ;
You lead cross-cutting missions such as tech vision definition, follow-up and updates : you organize work sessions, offsites and any kind of efforts for the Tech management team to improve its skills and the way we work together.
You’ll provide a bridge for smooth communication between the VP Engineering and other executives and organizations (Product, People, Marketing, Finance, Customer Relations and Legal) across BlaBlaCar, enabling effective cross-functional collaboration across the company.
You’ll provide decision support through research, analysis of information, and clear presentation of considerations.
3/ Key contribution to Tech Executive Communications
You’ll prepare memos, presentations, and emails for internal and external audiences. This involves setting the agenda for engineering all-hands meetings, internal keynotes, helping draft presentations to the executive team and board.
You stay up-to-date with the Tech economy and community and leverage your knowledge in a Blablacar context to sustain our Tech ambitions.
In the situations where the VP Engineering has multiple commitments, you’ll provide counsel on how to collaborate to ensure coverage.
Profil recherché
What you will need to be successful:
The right candidate will have interacted with significant engineering teams, set strategy, and experienced technical organizations scaling. 7+ years of overall software development lifecycle experience or product management experience
Significant cross-functional project experience, working with many stakeholders across departments
Having managed engineering teams or geographically distributed projects is a plus
Be comfortable working with executives and senior leaders, be proficient at running executive meetings
Strong program management

Born from a simple idea of people sharing their rides, BlaBlaCar’s ambition is to become the go-to marketplace for shared road mobility. We offer long distance carpooling service, a commuting carpooling service, and since 2018 a marketplace bus service too. A filled bus emits one third of the emissions per passenger kilometer as an average car. So we want to fill those seats too!
In 2018, 84 million travellers used BlaBlaCar globally saving 1.6 million tons of CO2. Meanwhile we enabled human connections, bringing people closer together in more ways than one with 87% of members say that carpooling is an enriching experience.
BlaBlaCar offers a truly and unique international environment with a team counting 35 nationalities, serving a global member-base from 8 offices in Berlin, Kiev, Madrid, Milan, Moscow, Paris (HQ), São Paulo, Warsaw. description:
Au sein de la Direction technique, et en lien avec notre Architecte Data, vous participez à la construction et la mise en œuvre de notre nouvelle plateforme Data d’Alchimie.

Cette plateforme contient l’ensemble des données des services d’Alchimie, de toute nature, de sources multiples, et nécessite une capacité de volumétrie et de rapidité de traitement : depuis l’ingestion jusqu’à la structuration et le traitement de l’ensemble de ces données.

Cette plateforme constitue un projet structurant pour Alchimie puisqu’elle permet un

meilleur traitement des données, des informations fiables en temps réel déterminantes pour le pilotage business et à terme des analyses prédictives.

Votre mission principale consistera à développer et améliorer la plateforme actuelle centrée sur Python et Spark, et gérer le passage vers le Cloud hybride.

En particulier, vous serez en charge de :
l'amélioration de l'ingestion des données provenant aussi bien du bus de donnée de l'entreprise (event sourcing) que de fichiers de logs, ou de sources externes

le développement et intégration d’un framework pour la gestion de la Data Quality pour les données ingérées

la mise en place de la data virtualization pour gérer les sources externes à la plateforme principale

l’automatisation des traitements pour la création de datamarts mis à jour en temps réels

la préparation de l’infrastructure pour le développement des nouveaux modèles prédictifs et la gestion de leur cycle de vie
Profil recherché De formation supérieure, universitaire ou école d’ingénieur, vous avez une première expérience d’au moins un an sur un poste de Data Engineer

ou Software Engineer avec une sensibilité « Data »

.

Vous maîtrisées SQL, Python et Spark.

Vous avez une très bonne culture informatique

(notamments notions de versioning et bonne pratiques de deployment, notions d’Event sourcing, bases d’Administration Linux, notions de modélisation de données)

ainsi que des notions d’architecture de Data Lake et Datawarehouse.

Idéalement, vous connaissez la stack Hadoop, le cloud et le DevOps (ou vous êtes très motivé à l’idée de monter en compétences sur ces technologies les apprendre)

Vous êtes force de proposition, faites preuve d’autonomie et de curiosité, vous avez envie d’apprendre des nouvelles technologies et contribuer activement au succès de l’entreprise

La pratique de l’anglais est nécessaire pour ce poste.
Entreprise Alchimie est une société technologique et marketing de distribution de contenus audiovisuels qui distribue et valorise des jeux, de la musique, de la vidéo.

Elle accompagne les artistes et les créateurs/producteurs de contenus dans la diffusion numérique et la commercialisation de leurs productions, leur permettant de générer de nouveaux revenus et de rencontrer de nouvelles audiences.

Grâce à ses 150 experts du mobile et de la télévision connectée, de la monétisation et de la distribution digitale, elle est présente dans 10 pays et réalise près de 70 millions d'euros de transactions payantes par an. Ses différentes plateformes attirent jusqu'à 20 millions de visiteurs uniques par mois avec le support et la confiance de centaines d’ayant-droits tels qu’Universal, Warner et Sony et d’un vaste réseau de distribution composés de médias, d’opérateurs, de constructeurs et de retailers mondiaux.

QUI SOMMES-NOUS ?
L’activité Systèmes terrestres et aériens conçoit des systèmes, des équipements, des capteurs et des services pour le contrôle du trafic aérien civil et militaire, la défense aérienne ainsi que le combat naval et terrestre.
Le site de Rungis est idéalement situé à proximité de l’aéroport d’Orly. Site à l’architecture moderne, il compte aujourd’hui plus de 1000 collaborateurs travaillant pour nos trois domaines d’activité : les radars, le contrôle du trafic aérien et les systèmes d’armes avancés.
Leader mondial de la gestion du Trafic Aérien,Thales ATM équipe plus de 170 pays de solutions Radar et logicielles permettant chaque jour à des millions de passagers d’arriver à leur destination en toute sécurité et sans retard.
La densification sans précédent du trafic aérien, l’occupation des espaces de basse altitude par des engins sans pilote (drones) et l’optimisation de la consommation d’énergie requierent des solutions digitales plus écologiques et plus efficaces. Pour relever ces défis nos équipes conçoivent des systèmes et développent des algorithmes d’IA visant à aider à la prise de décision en temps réel tout en respectant les contraintes de sécurité liées au monde de l’aéronautique.

Le rôle de Lead Software Engineer - Airspacepilote le développement logiciel sur les données de structuration de l’espace aérien : volume, sectorisation, capacité, données de description (aéroports, pistes, couloirs aériens, volumes spéciauxdrones…).

Piloter l’implémentation des algorithmes de machine learning sur les données d’aviation
Accompagner l'équipe dans les bonnes pratiques de développement logiciel, en collaboration avec l'équipe QA (TDD, revues de code, pair-programming etc.)
Fluidifier la communication tant avec les développeurs de la squad qu’avec les autres Tech lead et collaborer avec notre Lab IA et nos Data Scientists sur le domaine Aviation
Faire de la veille et se former aux technologies les plus pertinentes pour notre plateforme d’aviation afin de continuer à innover
Piloter la mise en place, le suivi et l’amélioration continue des pratiques de développement de l’équipe

Connaissances et pratique du développement en mode Agile (Scrum, TDD)
Anglais correct à l’écrit et à l’oral

Pourquoi nous rejoindre ?
Travailler et évoluer dans des industries de pointes : aéronautique, espace, défense, sécurité & transport
Possibilité d’évolution à l’étranger dans le groupe (Europe, Asie, USA, Australie...)

A l'aide d'algorithmes complexes, nous pouvons même évaluer l'impact d'une modification sur un réseau de transport. Nous souhaitons aider les villes à adapter leurs réseaux de façon à ce que les usagers puissent se déplacer plus facilement et être mieux connectés.
Nous sommes actifs depuis plus d'un an en tant que start-up. Notre équipe compte désormais douze personnes et se développe rapidement.

Vous ferez partie d'une équipe passionnée, composée de Data Scientists et de Data Engineers. Vous travaillerez sur un code source de qualité (écrit, testé, et bien construit).

Vous utiliserez un ensemble d'outils récents (React, Redux, Redux Sagas, ES6+, D3, CrossFilter, Leaflet, Jest, Enzyme, Yarn, Typescript) pour résoudre des défis requérant une bonne performance data et centrés sur l'application web. Vous ferez partie d'une équipe passionnée par l'écriture d'un bon code, qui accorde une importance toute particulière à la qualité, tout en utilisant des techniques modernes de développement software.

QUI SOMMES-NOUS ?

Ces activités, qui regroupent radiocommunications, réseaux, systèmes de protection, systèmes d’information critiques et cybersécurité, répondent aux besoins de marchés où l’utilisation des nouvelles technologies numériques est déterminante. Thales intervient tout au long de la chaîne de valeur, des équipements aux systèmes en passant par le soutien logistique et les services associés.
Le site de Gennevilliers est le cœur des activités de conception, et de développement et de soutien des produits et solutions de radiocommunications des Armées, des systèmes de réseaux d’infrastructures résilients et de communications par satellite, et ainsi que des solutions de cybersécurité.
La Direction des Produits Aéronautiques et Navals (ANP) recherche un.e Ingénieur de développement logiciel embarqué C (F/H)
Basé.e à Gennevilliers (92)
QUI ETES VOUS ?
De formation Ingénieur ou équivalent, vous avez une expérience de développement sur les bancs de test, de préférence en environnement Windows.? Ainsi que des compétences en informatique embarquée ?
Vous maitrisez le langage C, ainsi que les outils d’ingénierie associés ?
Vous avez une expérience pratique du travail en mode Agile/SCRUM ?
Vous appréciez le travail en équipe et êtes friand d’innovation ?
On dit de vous que vous êtes rigoureux, et force de proposition ?

CE QUE NOUS POUVONS ACCOMPLIR ENSEMBLE :
Au sein du centre de compétences de l’ingénierie des Produits Aéronautiques et Navals, vous êtes rattaché(e) au département Logiciels Dédiés.
Vous intervenez dans le domaine des logiciels embarqués sur les radios aéro en tant que Software Engineer.
Dans le cadre de votre mission, intégrée à une équipe AGILE de 6 personnes, vous participez au développement du logiciel d'exploitation des modes de communication ATC (civil) et Militaires embarqué sur la nouvelle radio aéro ERSa.

description:
Nokia is providing Software, IT & Optics equipment and Services at the cutting edge of technology and adaptable to all types of Networks. Nokia is the only one on the market to hold technological promise made possible by the 5G, Cloud and Internet Objects toward service providers, governments and large companies. To meet the needs of customers spread over 100 countries, our scientists and engineers are constantly innovating and developing future technologies that significantly transform the way people and objects interact.
Powered by the innovation of Nokia Bell Labs, the company is at the forefront of creating the technologies that are increasingly at the heart of our connected lives. Nokia Bell Labs mission is to define the future of communications and networking and deliver disruptive innovations that redefine human existence and business realities.
Role description
The open scientist position is in Nokia Bell Labs campus located in Paris-Saclay (France) at the high-speed optical communications lab. Our lab has developed many innovative solutions in fiber optic communications over the years that significantly contributed to product portfolio of Nokia (former Alcatel-Lucent). Our lab is the world-leading research group in fiber optical communications and is home of several recent breakthroughs such as: coherent detection with signal processing for 100 Gb/s transmission, spatial mode multiplexing, ultra-wideband systems etc. The combination of optical system design modeling and optimization, high-speed electronics and innovative signal processing algorithms are required to sustain the ever-increasing demand for capacity growth in high-speed optical communications. Potential candidates are required to master at least two of the following skills:
Optimization techniques
Signal processing
Statistics and machine learning
Communication theory
Information theory
Optical transmission
High-speed optoelectronics

Main activities
Contribution to technical and scientific development of the laboratory by publishing articles and participating in international conferences
Design novel algorithms, develop models and/or methods to conduct proof of concept demonstrations as well as analyzing and interpreting results
Close interactions with various Nokia business teams to transfer the validated technology innovations.
Close collaboration with researchers from other research departments in France or abroad.
Qualifications
Ph.D. degree in Electrical or Computer Engineering
Demonstrated excellent research track on high-speed optical communications
Strong written and spoken communications skills and ability to participate in robust discussions.

meta1:
PhD in Augmented Machine Interaction
NOKIA4,364 avis - Nozay (91)
date_publication:
il y a 17 jours
- Continuer pour postuler
Signaler cette offre d'emploi
description:
Nokia is a global leader in the technologies that connect people and things. With state-of-the-art software, hardware and services for any type of network, Nokia is uniquely positioned to help communication service providers, governments, and large enterprises deliver on the promise of 5G, the Cloud and the Internet of Things.
Serving customers in over 100 countries, our research scientists and engineers continue to invent and accelerate new technologies that will increasingly transform the way people and things communicate and connect.
Nokia is an equal opportunity employer that is commited to diversity and inclusion.
At Nokia, employment decisions are made regardless of race, color, national or ethnic origin, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

Nokia Bell Labs’ AAAID research domain focuses on the blending of intelligence into all aspects of everyday life and processes. As devices and sensors become increasingly connected and several autonomous agents with a physical presence make an appearance in smart homes and factories, the need for intelligent algorithms to support machines within complex physical spaces shared with humans becomes a primary driver of our research. The Future X network will be the platform that dynamically provides the knowledge and the computing power to support machine interactions at scale. Our ambitious objective is to develop systems that collect and blend information from multiple sources, extract and make sense of the things that matter, and act upon and propagate the resulting knowledge. Our research targets the fields of industrial automation and smart cities.

Scope of the Ph.D. Thesis

Future industrial automation scenarios will be defined by the coexistence of heterogenous devices that include sensors, mixed-reality displays, robots, drones, and smart objects. The development of new functionalities involving these mobile devices will face fundamental limitations, imposed by the resource constraints inherent to the devices’ form factor and by the technical possibilities of wireless connectivity. While accelerators for compute-intensive tasks will help empower the devices with local “intelligence” for solving specific tasks, the evolution of ever-smaller goal-driven machine designs will still limit the complexity of generalized problem-solving capabilities and require distributed coordination of sensing and processing among devices and infrastructure. Other constraints - such as battery life, thermal dissipation, interactivity, expected quality and timeliness of the decisions - provide a large spectrum of trade-offs in the design of algorithms that manage real-time, computational-intensive functions that underpin sensor coordination and machine learning in augmented reality and robotics.

Research Topic

The Ph.D. thesis will focus on developing techniques aimed at augmenting autonomous machines capabilities through accelerated processing, by overcoming their inherent computing limitations while still meeting different requirements including scalability, latency, and energy efficiency.

The student will explore challenging use cases that highlight how industrial automation scenarios might benefit from an infrastructure tailored towards integrating sharing of knowledge across different types of machines. In particular, he/she will focus on the mobile devices that will populate the factory ecosystem (e.g. drones, robots). These machines will be required to take over tasks that require dynamic cooperative interaction with the environment. Towards this goal, these machines will need to gather contextual information and act in real time. The end goal of the Ph.D. will be designing and developing algorithms and systems that integrate into the envisioned industrial automation environment.

Two key research questions will be tackled in the context of the Ph.D. program:
The architecture of the computing environment is expected to play a key role in supporting information exchange among machines, as the presence of distributed resources drives down the complexity of these devices and supports their interactions by offloading computing tasks that would have to be otherwise executed on every device. The thesis will explore how systems could use the infrastructure to gather and merge information into exploitable knowledge.
Supporting the generation of contextual awareness through information exchange will require collecting and processing data from a large number of sensors at low latency, without impacting their inherent power restrictions. The advancements in wireless access technologies plays an important role in supporting industrial IoT scenarios, but also requires a fundamental re-thinking of how data will be delivered, processed, and aggregated on the way. More powerful delivery paradigms could be explored exploiting context-based communication and control schemes.

Job Grade/Level: 6

We are looking for a highly-motivated candidate who is enthusiastic about developing breakthrough innovations and participate in cutting-edge research in NOKIA Bell Labs.

A BAC+5 diploma or master's degree in communications, computer science or electrical engineering with focus on embedded systems, as well as a good knowledge in communication networks and programming languages for systems development (e.g. C++, C, python). Most importantly, the applicant should be willing and able to get engaged in novel and disruptive research areas across multiple disciplines, which will require the applicant to readily learn new skills and expand their toolbox.

The applicant should be highly proficient in spoken and written English, and he/she should have the ability to conduct independent research while also collaborating in a multi-cultural team environment.

Documentation

Applications shall include: a cover letter, curriculum vitae, bachelor and master (or diploma) degrees, academic transcript of courses and grades, any other related documents such as certificates and reference letters.

The application process started on July 1st, 2019 and shall conclude as soon as a qualified applicant has been selected.

L’équipe Data Science conçoit, implémente, intègre et optimise des modèles de Machine Learning pour automatiser intelligemment le traitement massif de documents.
Au sein de l’équipe, tes missions en tant que Senior Data Scientist seront les suivantes:

description:
Platform.sh is an idea-to-cloud application platform that simplifies cloud infrastructures.
We give developers the tools they need to experiment, innovate, get rapid feedback and deliver better-quality features with speed and confidence thanks to our unique rapid cloning technology.
Fully distributed, with a small Parisian headquarter, we have people on all continents (excluding Antarctica) from New-Zealand out to the west coast.
Platform.sh serves thousands of customers worldwide including The Financial Times, Gap, Magento Commerce, Orange, Hachette, Ikea, Stanford University, Harvard University, The British Council, and Lufthansa.
We want people who are passionate, open, multicultural, friendly, humble and smart to join us and help this fast-growing, award-winning company to revolutionize the tech industry.
Job Description
Platform.sh is a groundbreaking hosting and development tool for web applications. We’re a European VC-Backed startup with a host of blue-chip Enterprise clients and a string of awards and grants (including €2m from the EU Horizon 2020 program).
To reinforce our technical prowess, we are looking to grow our operations team. If you’re looking for an exciting, high-growth opportunity with an award-winning, cutting-edge company, this could be just the job for you
For its PaaS solution
https://platform.sh
is looking for an Operations and Service Reliability Engineer with a taste for Python and Go, great Linux system understanding, and a real hunger for the challenges of building robust, distributed systems.
Platform.sh is a PaaS shrouded in a lot of black magic (we can consistently clone a whole running cluster, with its state, databases, indexes in a matter of seconds). We want to get this down to the hundreds of milliseconds domain. Interested? There is more...
Our external API is pure Hypermedia REST + oAuth on top of Pyramid. It mechanizes the Git layer and needs more features.
We can consistently generate from the same manifest a Docker container, an LXC one, or VM disk images (AWS, Azure, OpenStack), we want more targets.
We probably have the highest industry container density. We need to get it higher.
We support any Python, Ruby, NodeJS or PHP, Java and .NET, time to roll-out Elixir, of course, Elixir (and Rust. We need Rust).
Directly reporting to one of our Directors for the Operations InfrastructureDepartment and in close interaction with our Engineering and Customer Success teams, you will be responsible for:
cloud operations: configure clusters, deploy stuff, follow-up on alerts, help customer support debug issues.
automating all of the above so they can instead drink margaritas (or non-alcoholic beverages, of course)
creating systems, tools & processes that will enhance our support and operations efficiency
improving service quality, discipline and reliability throughout lifecycle
monitoring operating objectives, streamline and automate intervention
continuous learning from Operations experience, modeled as software
Preferred Experience
The ideal candidate
has proven successful experience in an operations role,
has demonstrated the ability to successfully manage cloud-based infrastructure for a fast growing organization,
has experience with containerization technologies,
has had exposure to cloud services (AWS, Azure, GCP, ...),
understands how an OS works, knows networking, how git works, and the constraints of a distributed system,
Puppet experience,
is proficient in Python (Golang a plus).
Nice to have
knowledge of Magento Ecommerce, Symfony, Drupal, eZ Platform, or Typo3.
Note: we don't like stress, so we build everything to be robust and resilient, but stuff does break. This is a role with on-call duties and fire drills. If this fills you with dread... well, this might not be a fit for you.
Recruitment Process
4 interviews
Background checks
Additional Information
Contract Type: Full-Time
Start Date: 23 September 2019
Location: Paris, France (75002)

R&D Program Manager / Freelance
Uniware - Paris
date_publication:

description:
1. PROJECT PRESENTATION

1.1 CONTEXT
The Retail/ Payment Platforms division is a cross country organization gathering both card present (CP) and card non present (CNP) high-volume and high-availability platforms within . Our common target is to move from a platform to a service organization, leveraging on our global pool of IT resources to enhance our offer and capabilities. You will be joining Group, a company in full transition to a new era of payments, covering both hardware, software and services as tooling for merchants to grow their business. A company, that over the past 7 years has shown, a remarkable and constant appetite for market share.
In this strong transformation context, we are looking for a R&D Program Manager working for the R&D service based in Paris, France. The Research & Development (R&D) department is structured in Tribes made of Squads ( ), each Tribe is responsible for a specific part of our Product Portfolio or Technology Stack. The objective of our department is to develop and manage the software products portfolio. R&D adds value by creating marketable products that help our customers to become more successful and by supporting s internal business processes.

1.2 OVERALL JOB DESCRIPTION
The R&D Program Manager supports its tribe or more tribes by ensuring that all business and technical aspects of the delivery of functionalities are executed smoothly and that software delivery over our environments is a continuous and aligned process. Each tribe consists of several Squads that deliver software changes for a specific product line. To achieve this the R&D Program Manager works closely together with the IT Tribe Leads, the Business Tribe leads (/Product Owner) and the delivery teams within the Squads.

Fast removal of impediments, timely preparation of SAFe and SCRUM ceremonies, fruitful collaboration with concerned business and IT departments to manage any dependencies are the key tasks and responsibilities of the R&D Program Manager. He/she also assists the Tribe and Product Owner with idea funneling, as well as with timely prioritization and identification of requirements.

The R&D Program Manager proposes and continuously improves implementation-related processes that drives the technical delivery of his/her tribe and assures proper maintenance by the IT Operations team after delivery. When relevant, the R&D Program Manager assures that delivered functionalities are properly marketed by the concerned stakeholders.

Using his/her technical expertise and superb interpersonal skills, the R&D Program Manager works together with the IT Tribe Lead and the Product Owner to ensure that business and technical initiatives owned by the tribe are prioritized, planned and delivered to Production within time, scope and budget. He/she also provides clear monthly reporting to all stakeholders about the tribe’s delivery roadmap.

2. REQUIEREMENTS

2.1 KEY RESPONSABIITIES:
Governance: Enables product vision understanding within squads and secure audit-proof requirements
Accountability: Is the accountable person for end to end delivery of the Program building a consolidated plan with all actors of the projects (Development, QA, Architects, Product Owners, Integration, DevOps)
Financial Management: Forecasts annual budget in terms of iterations and service increments of all EPICS within his/her scope on time for V0 and V1 portfolio budget exercises
Planning / Forecasting including non R&D deliveries: Setup and runs the Service/Program Increment planning ceremonies (cross Tribes) to define and plan the scope of the next service increments (10 to 12 weeks cycle)
Risk Management Multi-squad level: Identifies and track risk, dependencies and issues and work with Development, Product Owners, Architects, OPS and Customer Program Manager to maximize alignment and value delivery and remove impediments
Infrastructure delivery: Setup release management ceremonies in order to follow up and obtain proper release management visibility and delivery
Service increment demo: Setup service increment demo ceremonies in order to show value delivery and obtain feedback for potential release decision
Best practices: Promotes continuous improvement practices and accounts for sprints retrospectives outcomes; Lead by example with respect to change management; Foster craftsmanship practices, frequent deliveries of value and shorter time to market cycles. Champion I-AM ( Agile Methodology) values and guiding principle and provide continuous feedback for its improvement.
Build and Share Reporting: Measures progress of Epics deliveries within his/her scope with respect to delivered value and forecasted budget through his / her updated EPICS roadmap and EPICS burndown / burnup charts; Is accountable for providing transparency on delivery through monthly reporting and stimulate teamwork and team commitment

2.2 SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS:
4-6 years of hands on experience in taking a key role in an agile SDLC, for instance as Scrum Master, Senior Developer, Product Manager or IT Project Manager
4-6 years in an international working environment
Demonstrated experience in large organizations in roles which include structuring of activities, estimation of time and costs, execution to plan, delivery of results
Experience in managing technical aspects of software delivery in at least three of the following areas: front end development, back end development, infrastructure, middleware, data warehousing
Ideally Certified from Scrum.org ( Professional Scrum Master’ or Scaled Professional Scrum’) or SAFe
Knowledge of CI/CD concepts
Experience in Financial or Payment industry in senior delivery roles

meta1:
Post-Doctoral Research Visit F/M Distributed memory parallelization of the anisotropic mesh adaptation platform
Inria46 avis - Palaiseau (91)
titre_poste: Post-Doctoral Research Visit F/M Distributed memory parallelization of the anisotropic mesh adaptation platform
date_publication:
il y a 20 jours
- Continuer pour postuler
Signaler cette offre d'emploi
description:
Le descriptif de l’offre ci-dessous est en Anglais
Type de contrat : CDD de la fonction publique
Contrat renouvelable : Oui
Niveau de diplôme exigé : Thèse ou équivalent
Fonction : Post-Doctorant
A propos du centre ou de la direction fonctionnelle
Located at the heart of the main national research and higher education cluster, member of the Université Paris Saclay, a major actor in the French Investments for the Future Programme (Idex, LabEx, IRT, Equipex) and partner of the main establishments present on the plateau, the centre is particularly active in three major areas: data and knowledge; safety, security and reliability; modelling, simulation and optimisation (with priority given to energy).
The 450 researchers and engineers from Inria and its partners who work in the research centre's 28 teams, the 60 research support staff members, the high-level equipment at their disposal (image walls, high-performance computing clusters, sensor networks), and the privileged relationships with prestigious industrial partners, all make Inria Saclay Île-de-France a key research centre in the local landscape and one that is oriented towards Europe and the world.
Contexte et atouts du poste
The postdoc will be held at Inria Saclay - Ile-de-France in the Gamma team-project under the supervision of Frederic Alauzet.

The work will be done in collaboration with Boeing and Safran Tech that are users of the mesh adaptation technology.
Mission confiée
The aim of mesh adaptation is to generate the best mesh to perform a specific numerical simulation. It results in a powerful methodology that reduces significantly the size of the mesh required to reach the desired accuracy. Thus, it impacts favorably the simulation CPU time and memory requirement. Moreover, as the generated adapted mesh is in agreement with the physics of the flow, for some applications, this is the only way to obtain an accurate prediction of the flow.
Nowadays, mesh adaptation is a mature tool which is well-posed mathematically. And, as it is fully automatic, it has started to be used in industrial R&D departments. Indeed, it has already proved, throughout many publications and applications, its superiority with respect to fixed mesh. However, simulating complex physical phenomena on complex 3D geometries (such as high-lift applications or turbomachinery applications), which is more and more required by industry, still remains a challenge. Indeed, high-fidelity prediction for such numerical simulations requires large size meshes (hundreds of million elements) even if anisotropic mesh adaptation is considered.
A quicker response of the adaptative process requires a parallelization of the full platform, i.e., the parallelization of the flow solver, the error estimate, the local remesher and the interpolation stage. This also requires a proper mesh partitioning which is optimal for each stage of the mesh adaptation loop.
A first step in this direction has been done with the shared-memory parallelization of the whole solution-adaptive simulation platform using a shared-memory parallelization library developed in the team: the LPlib. An overall (real time) strong speed-up between 10 and 15 on twenty cores is usually achieved on industrial applications.
A second step has been achieved with the distributed-memory parallelization of the local remesher and the development of an efficient mesh partitioning which takes into account the remesher work load. With this strategy, we were able to generate, for a model problem, a billion elements in 15 minutes on 100 processors. But, this has been done outside of the solution-adaptive platform.
The goal of this Post Doctoral position is to finalize the distributed-memory parallelization of each stage of the mesh adaptation loop and to design optimal transition between each stage as mesh repartitioning will be required to obtain balance work load at each step.

The postdoc will first learn all the concepts related to mesh adaptation. He/she will perform several 3D adaptive simulations of inviscid and viscous flows to become familiar with the Inria solution-adaptive simulation platform involving a flow solver, an adaptive mesh generator, an error estimate code and an interpolation code.
Once familiar with the mesh adaptation platform, the postdoc will work on the parallelization with MPI of the flow solver, the error estimate and the solution interpolation software. For each tool, we will analyze in detail the obtained strong speed-up and will set-up the optimal hybrid parallelization using shared-memory and distributed memory techniques. We will also enhance the mesh partitioning code to obtain an optimal load balancing and to output appropriate partitions (ghost cells, ...) for each tool.
The next step will be to link all the tools involved in the solution-adaptive simulation platform and to analyse deeply the obtained strong speed-up. This may lead to work on the development of parallel IO's in the LibMesh library.

The developed methodology will be validated on several industrial problems in aeronautics and turbomachinery and will be
run on Inria Saclay Ile-de-France cluster composed of 1000 processors. In aeronautics, in collaboration with Boeing, we will focus of drag and high-lift prediction applications. In turbomachinery, in collaboration with Safran, we will focus on compressor and stator simulations.
As one can see, in this work, the postdoc will be confronted to advanced scientific computing issues (numerical schemes, fast and efficient implementation of the numerical methods, parallel computing,...).
Principales activités
Main activities (5 maximum) :

Develop distributed memory parallelization in the flow solver, the error estimate and the interpolation tools
Pursue the development of the mesh partitioning tool
Set-up the full distributed memory solution-adaptive simulation platform
Anaylze the strong scalability of the full distributed memory solution-adaptive simulation platform
Participate to the collaboration with Boeing and Safran
Further information below :
https://zimbra.inria.fr/service/home/~/?auth=co&loc=fr&id=403116&part=2
Compétences
A PhD in scientific computing is required to apply for this position.
Good knowledge in C and shell programming is required.
Knowledge on MPI and finite volume methods is also mandatory.
Avantages
Subsidized meals
Partial reimbursement of public transport costs
Leave: 7 weeks of annual leave + 10 extra days off due to RTT (statutory reduction in working hours) + possibility of exceptional leave (sick children, moving home, etc.)
Possibility of teleworking (after 6 months of employment) and flexible organization of working hours
Professional equipment available (videoconferencing, loan of computer equipment, etc.)
Social, cultural and sports events and activities
Access to vocational training
Social security coverage
Rémunération
Monthly gross salary : 2.653 euros

Sell value.

FSI sector knowledge

Si vous rejoignez Adelean, vous participerez au développement d’une jeune entreprise en pleine croissance dans un milieu qui n’est pas près de s’essouffler.
À propos du poste :
Dans le cadre de votre activité, vous analyserez les besoins business et proposerez des solutions techniques adaptées (choix des technologies, de l’architecture, prise en compte de la scalabilité…), vous mettrez en place les MVP des solutions choisies, vous assurerez la gestion et le suivi technique d’un projet (développer les modules critiques, trouver le bon expert pour déléguer, paralléliser le travail de chacun…). Enfin, vous échangerez avec les partenaires techniques afin d’améliorer les solutions.
Ce que nous recherchons :
Vous êtes incollable sur Java et ses bonnes pratiques (java 8 minimum).
Vous maîtrisez à minima un langage de script (python de préférence).
Vous êtes à l’aise avec les bonnes pratiques de développement en général (SOLID, RAII, 12Factor, etc).
Vous avez une bonne connaissance de l’environnement UNIX et des outils GNU/Linux (sed, cut, etc) et des outils de collaboration (utilisation de git).
Vous vous adaptez facilement au potentiel changement de techno et/ou langage.
Quelques notions sur la stack ELK, Spring (framework java), la programmation réactive (RX Java, Akka, Kafka…) ou les technologies du Big Data (Hadoop, Spark…) sont les bienvenues, mais ne sont pas un prérequis.
À propos d’Adelean :
Adelean est une entreprise de conseil et développement dans les domaines des moteurs de recherche et analyse des données, établie en région parisienne.
Nous accompagnons nos clients et partenaires dans la mise en place de moteurs performants et pertinents pour la recherche, la navigation et l’analyse de données. Adelean intervient dans toutes les phases d’un projet informatique et dans une diversité d’environnements techniques et organisationnels.
Intégrateur, depuis 2011, de logiciels comme Lucene, Solr et la suite Elastic (Elasticsearch, Logstash, Kibana et Beats), nous apportons l’expertise nécessaire pour déployer ces technologies et leurs écosystèmes dans un système d’information déjà existant et souvent complexe.
La force d’Adelean tient dans sa maîtrise des flux de données et des traitements préparatoires à l’indexation et à la recherche. Cette expertise est mise à disposition par sa plateforme A2, plateforme d’intégration de données et pilotage de moteurs de recherche, permettant aux utilisateurs métier de maîtriser le contenu et la qualité des recherches.
Nous délivrons des solutions innovantes pour les domaines de l’e-commerce, de l’assurance, de la distribution ou encore de la gestion électronique des documents.
Notre métier est l’extraction, la transformation et la restitution des données sous toutes leurs formes.
Type d'emploi : Temps plein

Job Description

About the team
Dailymotion is seeking an experienced software engineer to join the Scale team in Paris for a full time position.
The scale team in Dailymotion is a world class back end engineering team responsible for building and maintaining Dailymotion’s metadata API at scale. All dailymotion services use this API to launch a video player or to recommend what to watch next. With more than 3 billion views per month this API has to run smoothly, quickly, be always available and secure!
Our team is at the center of Dailymotion’s engineering organization. We provide architecture, services, tools and guidelines to build a fast, geo-distributed Graph based API’s.
Our Activities include :
Development of scalable and high performance services
Orchestration/Automation (GCP/on-premise Kubernetes environment) CI/CD Jenkins Pipelines definition
Legacy features cleaning/migration (PHP/MySQL)
Defining requirements/technical specifications, and translating them into high performance & scalable services
Working closely with infrastructure operations to construct our footprint and improve our capacity planning.
Writing technical specifications & evangelizing our architecture and services across the engineering organization.
Driving and executing the migration from the relational database to our new column based database
Defining development operations guidelines, standards and tools with a high focus on code quality, testing, documentation, and following SOLID/KISS/TDD principles
About the Role
At Dailymotion, we value dynamic and motivated engineers and give them various opportunities to work on innovative projects and cool bleeding edge technologies. From backend architecture through code optimisation, you will be involved in every aspect of software development. The ideal candidate is excited about fast response times, efficient caching, scalable architecture & performance monitoring. Within the global architecture/core skill group of Dailymotion, you will be in charge of supporting the business growth by defining appropriate systems and architectures, capable to handle Dailymotion data and processing volumes. More specifically, you will be involved in the following projects:
Building and maintaining a versionned column oriented database, optimized for scale.
Integrating and maintaining A kafka based databus to stream data to our worldwide points of presence.
Building and maintiaining a custom made mapping solution (technical and functional) to migrate various data elements from a relational database to a flat column oriented database.

Proven experience working on production running applications

2 or more years of experience working with relational databases (e.g. MySQL, Postgres)

Experience with continuous integration, continuous deployment testing and automation tools (Jenkins etc.)
Experience using modern software versioning systems (e.g. git)

Strong command of written/verbal English

Python - Golang - PHP(legacy stack only)

Contexte et atouts du poste
This engineer position is open at Inria in the context of the Software Heritage project, on the topic of digital preservation, software description and metadata, research software archival, referencing and access, in the framework of the FAIRsFAIR EU project. This position involves travel to collaborate with other teams across the world, travel expenses will be covered within the limit of the current Inria travel policy.

Inria is a national research institute dedicated to digital sciences that promotes scientific excellence and transfer. Inria employs 2,400 collaborators organised in research project teams, usually in collaboration with its academic partners. This agility allows its scientists, from the best universities in the world, to meet the challenges of computer science and mathematics, either through multidisciplinarity or with industrial partners.

Software Heritage is a unique initative to build the universal archive of software source code, catering for the needs of research, industry and society as a whole

Mission confiée
Assignments :
With the help of the Software Heritage team, the recruited person will contribute to establishing best practices for research software archival, referencing and access, and will ensure that the needed functionalities are present and properly deployed in the Software Heritage archive.
Collaboration :
The recruited person will be in connection with Software Heritage partners in France and worldwide, in the framework of the FAIRsFAIR European project.
Responsibilities :
The person recruited is responsible for the Software Heritage actions for research software archival, referencing and access, and will be the main contact point at Software Heritage for RDA, Force11, SPN, and related organizations.
Principales activités
To this end, the recruited person will
maintain regular contact with working groups active in the area of research software preservation, including in particular RDA, Force11, SPN
animate the Software Heritage community interested in research software, in particular by participating in and/or contributing to the organization of workshops and meetings related to the FAIRsFAIR european projects, preparing presentation material and activities
collaborate with the french national archive, HAL, for the deposit of research software into the Software Heritage archive
collaborate with the Software Heritage engineering team for the development of functionalities related to software archival and metadata
contribute to research and documentation for best practices for software identification and description
write articles and documentation

Compétences
This position involves significant interaction within the Software Heritage team and with partners worldwide, hence it is expected that the candidate will have excellent relational skills, and written and oral communication abilities.

ABOUT INSTADEEP
InstaDeep is looking for a new Research Engineer to join our expanding team in Paris.
InstaDeep Ltd is a leading company that develops cutting-edge artificial intelligence solutions for major global and local clients in Europe and Africa. We focus on developing enterprise software solutions that solve existing problems across a range of industries using advanced machine learning, deep learning, and deep reinforcement learning.
Our expertise spans across research, development, visualization, and design, allowing the whole end-to-end solution to be developed in-house across our teams in Paris, London, Lagos, Nairobi, and Tunis.
Our proactive approach to research, combined with a broad spectrum of clients, ensures a challenging and motivating environment to work and thrive in. In our mission to stay ahead of the curve, we are proud to partner with organizations such as Google DeepMind, Nvidia and Intel, and world-class universities such as Oxford.
JOB DESCRIPTION
In the Engineering Team, the mission of Research Engineers (REs) is to solve real-world problems with cutting-edge AI. Solutions developed by Research Engineers typically involve advanced Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Reinforcement Learning and/or a mix of these technologies with more classic Operation Research approaches.
REs' responsibility is to understand the business problems, identify and develop the right AI or cognitive computing technologies to solve them, and take part in the commercial deployment of their solution. REs intervene at every stage of the life of a project. REs provide technical expertise and scope projects during pre-sales, drive research and development for Proof of Concepts (POC), develop Minimum Viable Products (MVPs), and ensure continuous improvement and maintenance for industrialized solutions.
Among the tasks a RE is responsible for, it is important to mention: developing prototype applications, providing software design and programming support, implementing software libraries, supporting the business development, managing projects and project teams.
In this role, at InstaDeep you will report to the Head of Engineering. This role may require overseas travel.

ROLE RESPONSIBILITIES/ACCOUNTABILITIES
Develop highly scalable algorithms based on state-of-the-art machine learning and neural network methodologies.
Apply knowledge of relevant research domains along with expert coding skills to develop industrial solutions (POC, MVP, fully deployed solution) and products (platforms and frameworks).
Adapt machine learning and neural network algorithms and architectures to best exploit modern parallel environments (e.g. distributed clusters, multicore SMP, and GPU).
Report and present development work clearly and efficiently, both internally and externally (clients, different audiences, etc.), both verbally and in writing.
Actively collaborate with BD team in the pres sales activities, including but not limited to presenting the company to new prospective clients, writing decks and proposals, participating in calls and meetings, and representing Instadeep in conferences / events.
Collaborate with Research team to drive high-impact innovation by tackling previously unsolved problems with AI.

Person Specification

REQUIREMENTS:
Postgraduate degree in Computer Science, Mathematics or a related scientific field from Elite University
Experience in developing and debugging production-level Python. Knowledge of C/C++, GoLang and other languages is a strong plus.
Experience using deep learning frameworks such as PyTorch, Tensorflow and/or Keras.
Research and software engineering experience demonstrated via previous work experience, internships, contributions to open source projects, or coding competitions.
Proficiency with Git workflow, development with best coding practices.
Experience in deploying software to production using Docker and Kubernetes.
Experience with storage systems, distributed systems, HPC, compilers, and/or CUDA programming.
Work permit for Europe
BENEFITS:
Competitive salary.
Working in small, diverse teams where you can make an impact.
Varied challenges across industries.
Cooperation across European and African offices
Annual offsite events.
