description:
CGG is a leader in cutting-edge geoscience. We have achieved leadership through a strong focus on innovation and a commitment to delivering the best sustainable solutions to our clients' energy challenges. We bring our clients a unique range of technologies, services and equipment designed to acquire extremely precise data and images of the Earth's subsurface. We also provide state-of-the-art software and services for analyzing that data and developing a deeper understanding of the subsurface for exploration, production and optimization of oil and gas reservoirs.
To meets our clients’ needs in an ever-changing and innovative environment, CGG has a team of dedicated research professionals who strive to continuously improve our operational activities.
Job Description
This position, as part of the Subsurface Imaging CGG research organization in the Massy land processing research team, will be responsible and accountable for developing, implementing, testing, and supporting new algorithms to improve imaging of the subsurface in the context of land seismic.
Using your math skills you will have to abstract geophysical concepts with mathematical languages, whilst developing algorithms to solve geophysical problems.
More precisely you will:
Develop algorithms to solve specified geophysical problem associated to land seismic processing and imaging.
Validate the algorithm on synthetic and real data to assess the strengths and weaknesses of the proposed approach.
Support the porting of those algorithms on SI HPC infrastructure by providing algorithmic and mathematical expertise on them.
Support rollout of new technology through internal presentations and user support.
Promote use of new technology to clients through scientific publications and presentations.
Keep informed of internal requirements by building close relationships with the seismic imaging operations.
Develop knowledge by reading academic publications, attending technical presentations, workshops, conferences, seminars.
Required Education & Experience:
You have a passion for coding and analyzing real data to deliver high-end technical products. More precisely you have:
Strong skills in mathematics and physics in order to apply advanced mathematical tools and understand the underlying geophysical concepts;
Analytical and problem solving abilities with a great attention to detail.
Coding skills, essential for this role, particularly FORTRAN or C/C++;
Effective communication & presentation skills, in order to interface with production and to share knowledge;
High motivation to deal with real data, solve problems and deliver high end technological products;
Solid practice of English - both spoken and written.

Knowledge of seismic processing/imaging, experience in wave propagation, inversion, experience in Machine learning or a strong signal processing background are a plus.

At Criteo, we connect 1.5 billion active shoppers with the things they need and love. Our technology takes an algorithmic approach to predict what user we show an ad to, when, and for what products. Most of all, we are creators. From designing ground-breaking products to finding unique ways to tackle technical challenges at an extraordinary scale, our tech teams work with state of the art methodologies to shape the future of advertising.

Our Infrastructure teams are designing and operating the overall capacity and connectivity supporting the Criteo platform. They are in charge of designing, planning, scaling and operating hardware, system, network and datacenter layers.

What you'll do :

Network teams provides connectivity services allowing the company to serve advertising business, develop new products and improve existing ones.

We build our own Network automation framework to support constant scaling needs
We constantly improve our reachability over the internet, managing transit, peering, and routing optimization solutions
We develop our own reverse proxy solution, leveraging service discovery with the goal of speeding up product delivery and securing their exposition to the Internet
We are engaged in a global vendor unlocking effort by leveraging open source software and commodity hardware

The company is exposed to all possible threats of the Internet, and for sure as a Network team, we have a role to play

Who you are :

You know your network basics and have a relevant experience on significant infrastructures
OR as a seasoned developer, you want to bring your expertise to our team
You know your coding basics and understand that the future of network engineering is software defined
Adaptability to work in a DevOps culture
You are an accomplished team player
As a DevOps, you understand why you are responsible for projects AND for operations
At Criteo, we dare to be different. We believe that diversity fuels innovation and creates an energy that can be seen and felt all over Criteo. We champion different perspectives and are committed to creating a workplace where all Criteos are heard, feel a sense of belonging, and are treated with respect and dignity.

About Datadog:
We're on a mission to build the best platform in the world for engineers to understand and scale their systems, applications, and teams. We operate at high scale—trillions of data points per day—providing always-on alerting, metrics visualization, logs, and application tracing for tens of thousands of companies. Our engineering culture values pragmatism, honesty, and simplicity to solve hard problems the right way.

The opportunity:
We’re looking for an Engineering Manager to lead and grow the teams building our log management platform. Working very closely with product management, they build the log application but also the log collection agent and integration endpoints. They own all the services from ingestion to processing as well as near-real time systems like live-tail or alerting.
The platform runs in the cloud, it's always on, low latency and high throughput. It's built on top of high-scale open source frameworks and languages: Kafka, Go, Java, MongoDB, Akka, Kubernetes.
You’ll join at an ideal time to make a big impact, the product is seeing very high growth, with many new features to build as well as a need for scaling up dramatically. You’ll be involved in every step of the process—defining product, designing architecture, managing the team, recruiting excellent engineers.

You will:
Manage and grow teams of talented engineers, ensuring they deliver high quality, timely work and that they’re happy, motivated, and growing
Work with the product team to flesh out the future of the product
Work with other managers in Europe and in the US to deliver cross-cutting projects (e.g. running in multiple regions and clouds)
Scale the systems to accommodate hyper growth
Contribute to shaping the future of the engineering organisation

You have significant backend programming experience
You have managed a team of software engineers
You have architected, built, and operated distributed systems to solve problems at high scale

description:
Dataiku’s mission is big: to enable all people throughout companies around the world to use data by removing friction surrounding data access, cleaning, modeling, deployment, and more. But it’s not just about technology and processes; at Dataiku, we also believe that people (including our people!) are a critical piece of the equation.

We're looking to fill an opening for Vice President, Sales Engineering at Dataiku.

The VP of Sales Engineering oversees Dataiku’s global team of Sales Engineers and Sales Engineering managers. With more than 25 team members today, the team will likely grow to 40+ in the coming 12 months.

The Sales Engineering function at Dataiku is the primary technical function within the Sales organization, providing pre-sales support to the Account Executives and directly contributing to Dataiku’s revenue objectives. As the “trusted advisors” in the sales process, the Sales Engineers help to build interest in Dataiku, build the solution to the prospect’s needs, and then build the evaluation to provide the prospect with the proof that they need to make their purchasing decision.

The Vice President role is a key, senior management role at Dataiku, reporting directly into the Chief Revenue Officer. The VP of Sales Engineering will own objectives related to our ability to deliver compelling, highly technical customer engagements in the field. Key responsibilities in the coming months will be the enablement of the existing team, hiring for 2020, and ensuring excellence in our execution.

Given the cross-cutting nature of the function, this role will have direct interaction with top management and the executive team.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Monitor key metrics relevant to the efficiency and efficacy of our sales delivery
Establish and oversee technical enablement for the Sales Engineering team
Directly manage the Regional Sales Engineering Managers
Contribute to the development of the 2020 hiring plan, and then execute on that plan, directly overseeing the hiring of 15+ sales engineers
Oversee onboarding and enablement efforts
Coordinate closely with the post-sales Customer team to ensure smooth handovers of new clients
Coordinate closely with the Product, Engineering, and R&D teams to ensure that the needs of the field are appropriately communicated back to those who can address them in the product
REQUIRMENTS
10+ years of professional experience, including significant team management experience
Enterprise sales experience in the B2B software sector, ideally in the big data, analytics, ML, and/or AI spaces
Strong technical knowledge related to data science, analytics, distributed computing (on-premise and cloud), ML and their applications and constraints in the enterprise
Experience rapidly hiring highly technical profiles
Analytic, data-driven mindset for setting up and measuring team staffing and other key delivery metrics
A bridge-building communication style, with excellent written and verbal skills, to collaborate proactively with the many teams at Dataiku on which the success of the role dependsExperience working in a target driven environment, and the ability to work towards deadlines and in a fast-paced environment
Strong ambition and an appreciation for “reach” objectives, where the goal is to make a maximum impact with minimum resources
Ideally located in (or willing to relocate to) New York, Denver, Paris, or London. However, remote is a possibility for the right candidate
BENEFITS
Opportunity to have significant responsibility at Dataiku early on and help scale the company in a meaningful and measurable way
Competitive compensation package, equity, health benefits, and paid vacation
Opportunity to work with a smart, passionate and driven team
Dataiku has a strong culture based on key values: Ownership, Passion, Autonomy and Friendliness
Dataiku is an end-to-end collaboration platform that is revolutionizing how data science teams from 5 to 5,000 people work together to create and share insights from big data. Our software is designed to be the one place where everyone in the data science process works together: it’s as powerful for PhD data scientists as it is for Business Analysts as it is for Dev Ops engineers as it is for IT professionals. Our customers include companies like GE, Unilever, Fox, Comcast, Capgemini, and many more. We raised our $101 million Series C in December 2018 with Iconiq Ventures, a preeminent VC fund known for their highly selective investment strategy. We’re growing really quickly (more than doubling every year), and we’re building out our global presence with amazing team members in France, the US, the UK, the Netherlands, and Singapore (with more locations on the way). We’re looking for really talented, smart, kind, and genuinely curious individuals to work alongside us.

To fulfill its mission, Dataiku is growing fast (having just closed a $101 million Series C round in December 2018 and looking to double in 2019), but still maintains a startup spirit. Dataiku serves its global customer base from its headquarters in New York City as well as offices in Paris, London, Munich, Singapore, and Sydney. Each of our offices has a unique culture, but underpinning local nuances, we always value curiosity, collaboration, and can-do attitudes.

description:
Think about the billions of purchases that consumers make every single day around the world. Imagine trying to make sense of the trillions of data points that represent these purchases. From a family doing online shopping for household essentials to a quick run to the supermarket, Nielsen is measuring the entire consumer path to purchase.
Nielsen is a multinational company working with the world’s largest brands across the world to inform them on where and how their best customers are shopping. The challenge is that this is a moving target and a complex problem. The commerce landscape is shifting today from brick and mortar to online shopping - and only Nielsen has the span of data to make sense of what drives a consumer to make their purchases.

FULL STACK WEB DEVELOPER

So where do you fit here? In Nielsen Technology, we process over 250 terabytes of data every single day, manage it in the latest cloud technology, and build best-in-class analytical tools to add transparency and efficiency to the consumer goods market at a scale that no other company is able to achieve.
We’re looking for Engineers with experience in Angular and Java Full Stack. If you have a passion for building top-notch, scalable products and have Angular and Java experience, we’re looking for you to join us in our Paris Technology Hub!

What would you do:
Write complex code to develop scalable, flexible and user-friendly mobile applications
Analyse and develop intuitive UI components, Web pages & Reporting using Angular
Develop User interfaces for Modern Rich Internet Applications with the latest Front End Technologies
Perform analysis and development tasks of increasingly complex nature which may require extensive research and analysis
Analysing and developing corresponding web services on server side (including database layer).
Creating self-contained, reusable, and testable modules and components
Develop application code and unit test using tools like Jasmine & Karma
Ensure ongoing Angular upgrades in a complex environment
Experience of configuration management tools (GIT), configuration concepts and continuous integration tools (Jenkins / Bamboo)

We are looking for people with:
A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science or related field
3 + years of software development experience
Strong Experience in Angular 7 & above, Java, HTML5, JavaScript, CSS3
Able to write automated unit test cases in Jasmine & Karma
Experience in Web Services, Database Oracle 12c
Working experience in a Scrum/Agile environment
Working knowledge of tools like Bitbucket & JIRA
Manage Pull Request (PR) and code review process

#LI-PL

ABOUT NIELSEN

We’re in tune with what the world is watching, buying, and everything in between. If you can think of it, we’re measuring it. We sift through the small stuff and piece together big pictures to provide a comprehensive understanding of what’s happening now and what’s coming next for our clients. Today’s data is tomorrow’s marketplace revelation.

We like to be in the middle of the action. That’s why you can find us at work in over 100 countries. From global industry leaders to small businesses, consumer goods to media companies, we work with them all. We’re bringing in data 24/7 and the possibilities are endless. See what’s next with us at Nielsen: careers.nielsen.com

Senior UX Designer (19000BRE)
PRIMARY LOCATION : FRANCE-75-PARIS-PARIS
ORGANIZATION : Group IT
CONTRACT TYPE : Regular
SCHEDULE : Full-time
DESCRIPTION
Key responsibilities
You we’ll join of group of passionate software engineers, data scientists, actuaries and designers on a mission to design and build the next generation insurance technology solutions. We operate globally from San Francisco, Paris and Lausanne.
What will you do?
Create designs and artefacts throughout the entire product development lifecycle such as user research, design thinking, wireframes, prototypes, specifications and production.
Collaborate closely with project leads on project vision, strategy and roadmaps. Understand the value behind product decisions and advocate for solutions that bring both end user benefit and business value
Lead brainstorming workshops and co-design activities with internal groups and with end users
Create and maintain coherent design systems for the REV products
Occasionally produce visual contents to promote our assets and communicate on our products internally and/or externally.
Facilitate education and training of developers, product owners and junior designers on the principles of design thinking
Evangelize AXA executives and top managers on the business value of Design

QUALIFICATIONS
Skills and Experience
BA or Master Degree
5+ years of UI/UX design experience in a product role at a startup, innovation lab, digital agency, or design consultancy
Mastering the design and prototyping such as tools Sketch, Adobe CC, Invision, Principle, Zeplin, Abstract…
First experience with an insurance or financial company is a plus
You like observing and understanding the world around you in order to provide simple, impactful solutions to complex issues.
You are a Design Generalist with an interdisciplinary, open-minded approach to problem-solving and a talent for uniting and motivating teams. Collaborating with different areas of expertise and in a multicultural environment is a second nature
Like Thomas Edison you think that “vision without execution is hallucination”
You've been responsible for the UX/UI design of apps/software solutions at every stage of the process, from concepting through delivery with proven experience in user research, wireframe, prototyping, interface design
Demonstrable understanding of visual and user experience design disciplines and principles
Critical eye for details
The ability to lead multiple projects and tasks at a time
Ability to be a hands-on designer while being a team manager
The ability to operate independently, to thrive in ambiguity and to adjust for the unexpected
Your written and verbal communication skills are excellent and you have the ability to confidently present your work and convince senior managers
English fluent, French is a plus
HOW TO APPLY
CV
Book mandatory


ABOUT AXA
Would you like to wake up every day driven and inspired by our noble mission and to work together as one global team to empower people to live a better life? Here at AXA we strive to lead the transformation of our industry. We are looking for talented individuals who come from varied backgrounds, think differently and want to be part of this exciting transformation by challenging the status quo so we can push AXA - a leading global brand and one of the most innovative companies in our industry - onto even greater things.
In a fast-evolving world and with a presence in 64 countries, our 166,000 employees and exclusive distributors anticipate change to offer services and solutions tailored to the current and future needs of our 103 million customers.

About REV:
The position will be part of REV (Research, Engineering and Vision) having locations in Paris 17th (France), on the EPFL campus in Lausanne (Switzerland) and in San Francisco (USA). This new unit was created in 2018 to contribute to a global strategic program of digital transformation and innovation to drive AXA towards becoming a tech-led company. It is not only an innovation unit but also, and above all, an engineering team helping AXA entities to “test and learn” their ideas leveraging emerging technologies and scale them across the group. We strongly believe in learning by doing and acknowledge we have the right to fail if we learn along the way. Our projects span from IT related topics, to computer vision, cognitive services, bots, drones and many other web/mobile initiatives. Our mission is to transform an idea into a first stage of execution. Once the feasibility and the value for users is confirmed, we scale it with the help of industrialization teams.
We are the Tech Innovation team of AXA Group. We are a group of passionate software engineers, data scientists, actuaries, product managers and designers on a mission to identify or invent the technologies that will support the transformation of insurance.

WHAT WE OFFER
At AXA, we lead a an HR policy that encourages diversity, maintains your professional and private life balance and accelerates the skills and career development : promotion of diversity, remuneration policy, training device, ... Discover everything that makes AXA an employer of choice.
Whatever your job is, we strive to offer you career opportunities. Our goal is to develop your skills to support the transformation of our changing business.

description:
Ready to tackle the challenges of the vehicle of the future? Join us and take part in the autonomous and connected car revolution at Valeo!

The Créteil Europarc site is part of the Comfort and Driving Assistance Systems (CDA) division. Focused on the user experience, the site develops intelligent controls and commands, innovative functions and technologies for connected cars (remote access, on-board telematics, hands-free access and start systems), driving assistance technologies and systems for autonomous cars.

Join the "Product & System Engineering Department" team composed of 8 systems engineers, and define the architectures of Telematics products and systems (on-board and off-board) in order to respond to calls for tenders and platform projects in advance of the phase.

Your Challenges?

Reporting to the head of the Telematics product line:

Answers to calls for tenders: You contribute to the realization of the Telematics product architecture to best meet customer requirements by using solutions from proven product platforms and standard blocks. To do this, you participate in the functional analysis of the need integrating the dimension of cybersecurity, remote software updating and telecommunication/network/server architecture. Finally, you determine the optimal connectivity choices for the product/embedded/unembedded system/product (performance/costs).
Standardization of electronic blocks and software: As architectures are based on electronic blocks and an open software platform, you will be required to develop the repository of product platforms and standard blocks according to technological developments, component roadmaps and product benchmarks carried out by competitors, with the objective of integrating security concepts into architectures from their design stage.
Planning: You participate in the planning of Platform Projects and manage the planning of activities with partners on the landed system.
Benchmark: You participate in our competitors' product and system benchmarks to evaluate and compare our technologies and new solutions.
Patents: You contribute to the identification, analysis, and filing process of new patents in the field of telematics, and check whether the innovative solutions proposed by our competitors are protected.
Roadmap: You contribute, with the Business Team Leader and specialists, to the development of roadmaps (embedded/unembarked system, products, components, software, production resources, etc.).
Telecom Architecture and Security business line: You participate in the technological monitoring of the product line, and participate in the capitalization of knowledge by reporting the advantages of new techniques and technologies of our products, and by designing modules with a view to reuse (platform approach and standard blocks).
System business: You contribute, with the Technical Project Managers, to the drafting of the system validation plan and system specifications.
Let's talk about you....

You have more than 5 years of experience in system engineering and embedded software development and a knowledge of Linux tools, DOORS and software development languages.
You have graduated from a Master Degree or equivalent Engineering
You are reactive and have good communication skills and a spirit of synthesis.
You have a good level of fluent English

Moreover...

Do you speak German well? That's even better!

Join Us !

Thanks to its strategy focused on innovation, Valeo is at the heart of the three revolutions which are disrupting the automotive sector: electrification, autonomous and connected cars, and digital mobility.
These are revolutions that Valeo has been able to anticipate and which today provide amazing career opportunities, including internationally!
At Valeo, innovation is driven by the diversity, authenticity and energy of its talent. Are you looking for new technological and human adventures ? Join Valeo and its 113 600 employees across 33 countries!
More information on Valeo : https://www.valeo.com

date_publication:

description:
Vous souhaitez intégrer une entreprise française, innovante et agile ?

Rejoignez Faurecia Clarion Electronics, alliant un esprit start-up à un équipementier automobile de 1er rang, pour développer le cockpit du futur !

L’activité automobile de Parrot a été racheté à 100% par Faurecia en 2018 et a donné naissance à Faurecia Clarion Electronics Europe : 4ème Business Group de Faurecia.

Au cœur de Paris, nos équipes conçoivent des technologies innovantes en développant des interfaces homme-machine sous Android auto pour offrir au client final une expérience connectique intuitive.
Nos solutions électroniques embarquées sont dotées de processeurs graphiques multi-cœur puissants afin de répondre plus rapidement à diverses instructions simultanées.

Relevez avec nous l'un des plus grands challenges de l'industrie automobile !

Nous recherchons un ALTERNANT(E) Analyste Marketing & Benchmark Automobile

CONTEXTE

Nous recherchons un(e) étudiant(e) en dernière année de Master (ingénieur, marketing ou commerce) pour le compte de notre département Business Development et Marketing.
L’objectif est de benchmarker les technologies et les produits infotainment, audio et d’assistance à la conduite des concurrents de Faurecia Clarion Electronics.

Ces renseignements marché alimenteront :
Notre approche client (pricing, positionnement)
La feuille de route produits & innovation

Le benchmark continu de véhicules connectés et autonomes par l’analyste nourrira la définition du plan produit et les équipes ventes, marketing et innovation.

MISSIONS

Vos missions seront :

Identifier les véhicules, systèmes d’infotainment et d’assistance à la conduite pertinents à benchmarker :
Analyse et étude du marché
Synchronisation avec l’équipe vente, ajustement des cibles d’acquisition

Identifier les innovations et les nouvelles technologies clefs :
Contribuer à la définition de la feuille de route produit
Benchmark continu des innovations en électronique et logiciel embarqué :
Véhicules et services connectés, mobilité intelligente, cockpit du futur, etc.
Veille concurrentielle
Visite de salons automobiles (quelques déplacements professionnels à l’étranger à prévoir) et rédaction de rapports visuels exhaustifs
Tests de véhicules
Analyses “make or buy” en collaboration avec les équipes innovations et R&D
“Data crunching” à l’aide de bases de données (analyses de volumes, dimensionnement de marchés, etc.)
Contribution aux ateliers innovation

PROFIL

Vous êtes en dernière année de master (études d’ingénieur ou de marketing) et vous recherchez une alternance d’un an (contrat de professionnalisation ou contrat d’apprentissage).

Le monde de l’électronique, du logiciel et de l’IoT vous intéresse.

Curieux et proactif, vous êtes doté de capacités d’analyse, de communication et d’organisation.
Vous disposez également de compétences de présentation et de rédaction et vous maîtrisez le Pack Office.
Vous souhaitez travailler dans un environnement international et votre anglais est courant à l’écrit comme à l’oral.
La compréhension de l’automobile, des technologies de connectivités et d’Android serait un plus.

Des compétences en benchmark, conseil, innovation seraient également un plus.

EN - Would you like to be part of a French company known for its innovation and agility?

Join Faurecia Clarion Electronics, combining a start-up spirit with a first-class automotive equipment manufacturer, to develop the cockpit of the future!
Parrot's automotive business was acquired 100% by Faurecia in 2018 and gave rise to Faurecia Clarion Electronics Europe, Faurecia's 4th Business Group.

In the heart of Paris, our teams design innovative technologies by developing man-machine interfaces under Android auto to offer the end customer an intuitive connectivity experience.
Our embedded electronics solutions are equipped with powerful multi-core graphics processors to respond more quickly to various simultaneous instructions.

Take up with us one of the greatest challenges in the automotive industry!

We are looking for an APPRENTICE Benchmarking Engineer/Analyst – Automotive Infotainment

CONTEXT

We are looking for a student in the final year of a Master's degree (engineer, marketing or commerce) for our Business Development and Marketing department.
The objective is to benchmark the infotainment, audio and driver assistance technologies and products of Faurecia Clarion Electronics' competitors.

This market information will feed:
Our customer approach (pricing, positioning)
The product & innovation roadmap

The continuous benchmark of vehicles connected and autonomous by the analyst will feed the definition of the product plan and the sales, marketing and innovation teams.

MISSIONS

Your missions will be:
Identify relevant vehicles, infotainment and driver assistance systems to benchmark:
Market analysis and study
Synchronization with the sales team, adjustment of acquisition targets

Identify innovations and key new technologies:

Contribute to the definition of the product roadmap
Continuous benchmarking of innovations in electronics and embedded software:
Connected vehicles and services, intelligent mobility, cockpit of the future, etc.
Competitive intelligence
Visit to car shows (some business trips abroad to be planned) and writing of exhaustive visual reports
Vehicle tests
"Make or buy" analyses in collaboration with the innovation and R&D teams
Data crunching" using databases (volume analysis, market sizing, etc.)
Contribution to innovation workshops

PROFILE

You are in the final year of your master's degree (engineering or marketing studies) and you are looking for a one-year work-study program (professionalization contract or apprenticeship contract).

The world of electronics, software and IoT interests you.

Curious and proactive, you have analytical, communication and organizational skills.
You also have presentation and writing skills and you are familiar with the Office Pack.
You want to work in an international environment and your English is fluent in both written and spoken English.
An understanding of the automobile, connectivity technologies and Android would be a plus.

Skills in benchmarking, consulting, innovation would also be a plus.

DXC2,447 avis - Paris (75)
date_publication:
il y a 23 jours

description:
Job Description:
DXC Technology (NYSE: DXC) is the world’s leading independent, end-to-end IT services company, helping clients harness the power of innovation to thrive on change. Created by the merger of CSC and the Enterprise Services business of Hewlett Packard Enterprise, DXC Technology serves nearly 6,000 private and public sector clients across 70 countries. The company’s technology independence, global talent and extensive partner alliance combine to deliver powerful next-generation IT services and solutions. DXC Technology is recognized among the best corporate citizens globally.
Hybrid Cloud Solution Architect Summary:
Drives large, multiple and/or highly complex business solutions and strategy for targeted customers focused on Microsoft Azure and hybrid cloud solutions. Serves as company and customer subject matter expert/trusted advisor for assigned solution area(s). Provides in-depth industry, market and technical expertise to develop and execute sale of high-level technical operating strategies, solutions and benefits to meet client's needs and requirements. Supports full sales lifecycle from initial customer contact and qualification through contract signature to delivery success.
Essential Job Functions:
Engages with assigned or targeted customer organizations. Understands customer business and establishes technical and business credibility with clients providing the ability to cultivate relationships and envision creative sales and solution strategies that generate additional revenue. Creates and cultivates key trusted-advisor relationships with senior level IT executives demonstrating an understanding of key business challenges within customer markets and how company technology-enabled business solutions can address those needs.
As industry and market expert in cloud-enabled solutions, develops and drives large, multiple and/or highly complex business solutions for targeted/assigned customers. Provides in-depth solutions architecture capability based on specific customer's business needs. Oversees holistic solutions from both business and technical perspective, taking into account all realities and constraints such as costs, contract terms, business conditions and the technical environment of the client.
Provides leadership and strategic guidance with pursuit teams during the solution development process to ensure alignment with overall company sales and client business strategy and effective use of public cloud services and DXC offerings. Develops high-level technical operating strategies and solutions, and benefits. Analyzes stakeholders, identifies and recognizes prospect traits and determines how to effectively influence their decision.
Delivers and sells the technical solution strategy and vision to senior client executives ensuring the solution embodies company win themes and key differentiators while meeting client expectations and requirements thereby providing company the best chance to compete and win.
Maintains current and applicable knowledge of industry, market and IT (information technology) services best practices and trends as well as maintaining the highest levels of certification on public cloud (Microsoft Azure preferably) to evaluate and ensure company solutions and services are meeting the needs of clients.
Provides leadership to help customers understand best practices around advanced cloud-based solutions, and how to migrate existing workloads to the cloud including modernization and transformation of applications. Have a strong understanding of large scale computing solutions and delivery excellence. The ideal candidate will have past experience working as a systems or support engineer, and pre-sales experience.
Leverages Public Cloud technologies to continuously find ways to solve customer needs. Provides recommendations to offering organization on new offerings, upgrades/augmentation to enhance corporate competency in meeting the needs of customers.
Helps to develop and then translate the corporate technology strategy into the wider business at the same time as mentoring and providing technical expertise to less experienced Sales Solutions personnel.
Key Attributes
Ability to interface with senior stakeholders – boardroom credentials
Experience in application modernization, workload migrations, private cloud solutions (e.g. VMware, Openstack), public cloud architecture (Azure, AWS, GCP), application architecture, devops, containers and personal interest/close contact with any other new and emerging technologies.
Stewarding, shaping and expanding technology in DXC offering.
Basic Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in business, computer science, information technology or related field preferred
Five or more years of business solutions, technical consulting, or sales solutions experience
Experience working with the technology industry, specifically handling significantly sized accounts
Experience working with solution/product portfolios
Experience developing winning sales solutions and proposals
Significant implementation experience with hybrid clouds
Experience with Cloud Management Platforms (CMP’s) and automation tools
Experience working with enterprise management systems, ITIL service delivery, and service desk integration
Experience working with business environment, business industry and competitor products and services
Other Qualifications
Experience migrating or transforming legacy customer solutions to the cloud
Strong interpersonal and presentation skills for interacting with team members and prospective clients up to the Board level
Strong skills as trusted advisor and technical subject matter expert for assigned products and solutions
Strong verbal and written communication skills to persuade others through presentations, demonstration and written communication
Strong communication skills to listen to client and articulate back for solutioning
Strong selling and negotiation skills
Ability to articulate and present the business value of company solutions with a firm understanding of company strategies and products relative to company's major competitors
Ability to present ideas, goals, problems, outcomes and processes to be understood by a diverse audience
Ability to publicly represent company with internal and external clients
Ability to work and lead in a team environment
Ability to create and maintain formal and informal networks
Ability to use own judgment and initiative in problem resolution
Public Cloud Certifications;
ITIL, CISSP or other relevant certifications are desirable
Experience working within software development or Internet-related industries
Strong understanding of CloudOps, DevOps and the their value proposition
Familiarity with common enterprise services (Directory Services, Information Assurance, Virtual Desktop, etc.), products (i.e., Oracle, SAP) and frameworks (ITIL, Zachman, TOGAF, etc.)
Professional experience architecting/operating solutions built on Microsoft Azure and/or AWS/GCP.

description:
Quel poste ?

Pour notre entité CAPFI Technology, nous recrutons un Software Engineer Python. Vous intégrerez une équipe agile, en relation avec des experts et des architectes techniques. Nos clients (banque de financement et d’investissement ou asset manager) sont situés à Paris.

Quel contexte ?

Vous interviendrez sur :
La conception et le développement d’applications Python. Ces applications, parfois développées en couplage avec d’autres technologies (C# ou C++) sont très sensibles et nécessitent une rigueur et l’application de bonnes pratiques logicielles

Le respect de l’usage de ces bonnes pratiques (TDD, Clean Code, DDD …)

Le design de l’architecture et le développement des fonctionnalités des outils utilisés par les opérationnels (traders, sales …)

L’automatisation des tests (non régression, tests unitaires …)

La gestion des versions (Git)

L’intégration continue (Maven, Jenkins …)
Profil recherché Grâce à votre force de proposition et à la veille technique sur laquelle nous vous accompagnerons, vous pourrez également conseiller nos clients sur le choix des technologies, méthodologies ou architectures à mettre en place.

La connaissance de l’environnement fonctionnel en finance (automates de trading, risques, PnL …) sera un plus, mais pas un impératif car nous vous formerons aussi sur ces sujets.

Vous interviendrez sur des missions évolutives (technos, méthodos, complexité …) de 2 ans minimum, dans l'optique de votre projet de carrière.

Ces missions vous permettront de consolider vos compétences techniques, d’appliquer les bonnes pratiques de qualité logicielle et d’apprendre à connaître la finance de marché.
Entreprise Qui sommes-nous ?

Fondée en 2005, CAPFI est une ESN implantée à Paris et à Londres.

CAPFI regroupe 330 passionnés intervenant pour le compte de 70 clients aux secteurs d’activités variés : Finance, Assurance, Media, Luxe, Banque, Industrie, Cosmétique, Aéronautique, Énergie, etc …

Les acteurs du groupe CAPFI accompagnent leurs clients sur des projets de transformation digitale, de Data Science, d’Infrastructure IT et de Cybersécurité, ainsi que sur des projets métier.

Les membres de notre communauté sont placés au cœur de la stratégie d’innovation collective de l’entreprise avec notamment :

L’offre Fluid 2.0 qui permet de se challenger au travers du Lab d’idéation et de la Fabrique Digitale

10 Tribus qui favorisent le partage d’expérience et stimulent la créativité de tous autour de sujets d’experts comme : Software Craftsmanship, UX Design Thinking, DevOps, IA, Blockchain, Fintech, Architecture 4.0, Projet et Management 4.0, VR/AR…

Junior Finance Manager
PRIVATEASER - Paris (75)
date_publication:
ISAI Group - il y a 25 jours

description:
À propos
Privateaser est une marketplace qui permet aux professionnels et aux particuliers d’organiser en quelques clics tous les évènements importants de leur vie : anniversaires, afterworks, séminaires, journées d'étude, soirées d’entreprise.
En quatre ans, nous avons :
construit une équipe de plus de 100 talents ;
développé une culture forte autour de 4 valeurs (Ambition, Enthousiasme, Transparence et Pragmatisme) ;
déployé notre service en Europe (10 villes en France et en Espagne pour le moment) ;
levé 14M€ auprès d’investisseurs de premier plan : Kerala Ventures (Doctolib, Malt...), ISAI (BlaBlaCar, Malt, ...) et Serena Capital (La Fourchette, Evaneos...) Et ce n’est que le début !
Notre vision est d'apporter la réservation instantanée sur le marché de l’évènementiel : une opportunité à plus de 100 milliards d’euros en Europe, ne demandant qu’à être digitalisée. L'éxécution de cette vision passera par le développement de l'usage de notre produit sur le marché Corporate.
Demain, nous permettrons à nos utilisateurs de réserver en un temps record le lieu idéal pour leurs évènements, aussi simplement qu'ils réservent un hôtel ou un billet de train aujourd'hui.
Descriptif du poste
As Junior Finance Manager at Privateaser, you structure and pilot the operational execution of the financial and administrative department.
Under the responsibility of our Finance Manager, you will :
ensure the excellent execution of invoicing, cash collection, accounting, and oversee administrative management of Human Resources,
handle projects to scale and adapt these operations to sustain the growth and fast moves of our company
Your Missions :
Sales administration:
Manage day-to-day operations: clients' contracts, direct-debit authorization set-up, dunnings, bank reconciliation, etc
Pilot invoicing and cash collection workflows
Build metrics to monitor our efficiency and implement internal and external processes.
Accounting and management control:
Support monthly accounting with our French & Spanish external accountants
Ensure the excellence of execution
Administrative management of HR:
Manage administrative and general services related to on and off-boarding
Oversee monthly payroll edition
Financial structuration
Structure our financial flows with our Product Managers and Software Engineers to support our international scaling
Roll-out our new offer for Large Accounts, consisting on monthly billing
Improve productivity of all our sales administration and accounting processes.
Profil recherché
Strong appetance for financial topics (billing, accounting, VAT) and fast learner.
Looking for the highest standards for your work. You ensure flawless and excellent execution.
Autonomous and hard worker.
Willing to process and automate operations
Interest for legal & HR topic is a plus
Informations complémentaires
Type de contrat : CDI
Date de début : 29 septembre 2019
Lieu : Paris, France (75009)
Niveau d'études : Bac +5 / Master
Postuler
Voir toutes les autres offres de Privateaser

Create designs and artefacts throughout the entire product development lifecycle such as user research, design thinking, wireframes, prototypes, specifications and production.

Like Thomas Edison you think that “vision without execution is hallucination”

HOW TO APPLY
CV
Book mandatory

About AXA
Would you like to wake up every day driven and inspired by our noble mission and to work together as one global team to empower people to live a better life? Here at AXA we strive to lead the transformation of our industry. We are looking for talented individuals who come from varied backgrounds, think differently and want to be part of this exciting transformation by challenging the status quo so we can push AXA - a leading global brand and one of the most innovative companies in our industry - onto even greater things.
In a fast-evolving world and with a presence in 64 countries, our 166,000 employees and exclusive distributors anticipate change to offer services and solutions tailored to the current and future needs of our 103 million customers.
About REV:
The position will be part of REV (Research, Engineering and Vision) having locations in Paris 17 th (France), on the EPFL campus in Lausanne (Switzerland) and in San Francisco (USA). This new unit was created in 2018 to contribute to a global strategic program of digital transformation and innovation to drive AXA towards becoming a tech-led company. It is not only an innovation unit but also, and above all, an engineering team helping AXA entities to “test and learn” their ideas leveraging emerging technologies and scale them across the group. We strongly believe in learning by doing and acknowledge we have the right to fail if we learn along the way. Our projects span from IT related topics, to computer vision, cognitive services, bots, drones and many other web/mobile initiatives. Our mission is to transform an idea into a first stage of execution. Once the feasibility and the value for users is confirmed, we scale it with the help of industrialization teams.
We are the Tech Innovation team of AXA Group. We are a group of passionate software engineers, data scientists, actuaries, product managers and designers on a mission to identify or invent the technologies that will support the transformation of insurance.

What We Offer
At AXA, we lead a an HR policy that encourages diversity, maintains your professional and private life balance and accelerates the skills and career development : promotion of diversity, remuneration policy, training device, ... Discover everything that makes AXA an employer of choice.
Whatever your job is, we strive to offer you career opportunities. Our goal is to develop your skills to support the transformation of our changing business.

description:
Who is Onfido?
Onfido is the new identity standard for the internet. Founded in 2012, our vision is to create a more open world where identity is the key to access. In a nutshell, we use groundbreaking machine learning - facial biometrics and document verification - to help you prove that you’re you. In doing so we can connect you to the services you need and love more easily, speedily and safely than ever before, whether it’s sharing a car or opening a bank account.
That’s how we give companies like Revolut, BlaBlaCar and Bitstamp the assurance they need to onboard customers remotely and securely across 195 countries. We’ve also received over $100 million in funding from world-class tech investors including Microsoft and Salesforce… and we’re just getting started.
About the role
We’re looking for a brilliant and dynamic Senior Account Executive to win new business for Onfido in France and beyond. Part of our Paris office and reporting to our VP Sales (Southern Europe), you’ll identify and cultivate relationships with large enterprise clients across France, Italy, Spain and Portugal.
Owning the end-to-end sales cycle, you’ll lead on all aspects of deal execution including prioritisation of deals, strategic and financial assessment, transaction structuring and negotiation. In this way, you’ll become an Onfido subject matter expert in multiple sectors.
Delivering strong growth against agreed targets will also require you to collaborate widely with Onfido colleagues both local and global - Sales Development Representatives (SDRs), Solutions Engineers, Client Service Managers, Product, Marketing and Partnerships. In doing so, you’ll helping us smash our goal of 1 billion verifications by 2025.
Requirements
Who are we looking for?
In a business like ours that is changing fast and pushing boundaries, a growth mindset is a must. Someone with a curious and analytical mind will help us ask the right questions and use data smartly. Creating customer buzz is also a big deal for us, so we want to know that you’re customer driven, able to give voice to internal stakeholders and champion external clients and end-users alike. And to be a great fit at Onfido, we look for individuals who share our values:
succeed together
take pride
learn things, share them
find a better way
creating customer buzz
You can learn more about our team and the work we do on our Onfido blog.
On our wish list is a combination of...
A SaaS sales expert with deep knowledge of the French market
Additional SaaS sales experience in one or more of Italy, Spain and Portugal preferred
Significant experience of complex sales to enterprise clients
A consistent revenue generator capable of routinely exceeding revenue targets (€100.000+)
Evidence of strong revenue generation in a scale-up/high growth environment
Full strategic and tactical ownership of end-to-end sales cycle
Passionate about technology trends and interested in continual learning
Fluency in written and conversational French and English (+ Spanish and/or Italian desirable)
Formal sales training experience ie. MEDDIC approach
Technical product understanding to support on trials and tenders
Benefits
We're committed to making Onfido a fantastic place to work, so we go to great lengths to give you what you need to succeed. You will receive:
Share options in Onfido Ltd, through our equity schemes - options have a one year cliff and vest over four years, starting after probation.
50% health insurance rebate for Mutuelle Collective
50% commute reimbursement for Paris metro up to €40
25 days holiday, plus bank holidays
Sanctus mental health coaching
Subsidised gym membership, home cleaning or mentoring, 50% up to €50 per month
Flexible working
An unlimited budget for any software or books you need
Open and transparent culture—we come together on a weekly basis for a global forum (OnFriday) where we share updates and strategic plans, and engage with each other informally over food and drink
What next?
Apply! We’ll then assess your application against the role and other applicants. If successful we’ll then begin a two-way conversation where we both can find out a bit more about each other. Typically, a do-at-home problem solving task or scenario will follow, before closing out with onsite technical and behavioural conversations with the team.
The process from application to completion should take four weeks, depending on diaries.
We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity at Onfido. We don't discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

date_publication:

description:
Vous souhaitez intégrer une entreprise française, innovante et agile ?

Rejoignez Faurecia Clarion Electronics, alliant un esprit start-up à un équipementier automobile de 1er rang, pour développer le cockpit du futur !

L’activité automobile de Parrot a été racheté à 100% par Faurecia en 2018 et a donné naissance à Faurecia Clarion Electronics Europe : 4ème Business Group de Faurecia.

Au cœur de Paris, nos équipes conçoivent des technologies innovantes en développant des interfaces homme-machine sous Android auto pour offrir au client final une expérience connectique intuitive.
Nos solutions électroniques embarquées sont dotées de processeurs graphiques multi-cœur puissants afin de répondre plus rapidement à diverses instructions simultanées.

Relevez avec nous l'un des plus grands challenges de l'industrie automobile !

Nous recherchons un ALTERNANT(E) Analyste Marketing & Benchmark Automobile

CONTEXTE

Nous recherchons un(e) étudiant(e) en dernière année de Master (ingénieur, marketing ou commerce) pour le compte de notre département Business Development et Marketing.
L’objectif est de benchmarker les technologies et les produits infotainment, audio et d’assistance à la conduite des concurrents de Faurecia Clarion Electronics.

Ces renseignements marché alimenteront :
Notre approche client (pricing, positionnement)
La feuille de route produits & innovation

Le benchmark continu de véhicules connectés et autonomes par l’analyste nourrira la définition du plan produit et les équipes ventes, marketing et innovation.

MISSIONS

Vos missions seront :

Identifier les véhicules, systèmes d’infotainment et d’assistance à la conduite pertinents à benchmarker :
Analyse et étude du marché
Synchronisation avec l’équipe vente, ajustement des cibles d’acquisition

Identifier les innovations et les nouvelles technologies clefs :
Contribuer à la définition de la feuille de route produit
Benchmark continu des innovations en électronique et logiciel embarqué :
Véhicules et services connectés, mobilité intelligente, cockpit du futur, etc.
Veille concurrentielle
Visite de salons automobiles (quelques déplacements professionnels à l’étranger à prévoir) et rédaction de rapports visuels exhaustifs
Tests de véhicules
Analyses “make or buy” en collaboration avec les équipes innovations et R&D
“Data crunching” à l’aide de bases de données (analyses de volumes, dimensionnement de marchés, etc.)
Contribution aux ateliers innovation

PROFIL

Vous êtes en dernière année de master (études d’ingénieur ou de marketing) et vous recherchez une alternance d’un an (contrat de professionnalisation ou contrat d’apprentissage).

Le monde de l’électronique, du logiciel et de l’IoT vous intéresse.

Curieux et proactif, vous êtes doté de capacités d’analyse, de communication et d’organisation.
Vous disposez également de compétences de présentation et de rédaction et vous maîtrisez le Pack Office.
Vous souhaitez travailler dans un environnement international et votre anglais est courant à l’écrit comme à l’oral.
La compréhension de l’automobile, des technologies de connectivités et d’Android serait un plus.

Des compétences en benchmark, conseil, innovation seraient également un plus.

EN - Would you like to be part of a French company known for its innovation and agility?

Join Faurecia Clarion Electronics, combining a start-up spirit with a first-class automotive equipment manufacturer, to develop the cockpit of the future!
Parrot's automotive business was acquired 100% by Faurecia in 2018 and gave rise to Faurecia Clarion Electronics Europe, Faurecia's 4th Business Group.

In the heart of Paris, our teams design innovative technologies by developing man-machine interfaces under Android auto to offer the end customer an intuitive connectivity experience.
Our embedded electronics solutions are equipped with powerful multi-core graphics processors to respond more quickly to various simultaneous instructions.

Take up with us one of the greatest challenges in the automotive industry!

We are looking for an APPRENTICE Benchmarking Engineer/Analyst – Automotive Infotainment

CONTEXT

We are looking for a student in the final year of a Master's degree (engineer, marketing or commerce) for our Business Development and Marketing department.
The objective is to benchmark the infotainment, audio and driver assistance technologies and products of Faurecia Clarion Electronics' competitors.

This market information will feed:
Our customer approach (pricing, positioning)
The product & innovation roadmap

The continuous benchmark of vehicles connected and autonomous by the analyst will feed the definition of the product plan and the sales, marketing and innovation teams.

MISSIONS

Your missions will be:
Identify relevant vehicles, infotainment and driver assistance systems to benchmark:
Market analysis and study
Synchronization with the sales team, adjustment of acquisition targets

Identify innovations and key new technologies:

Contribute to the definition of the product roadmap
Continuous benchmarking of innovations in electronics and embedded software:
Connected vehicles and services, intelligent mobility, cockpit of the future, etc.
Competitive intelligence
Visit to car shows (some business trips abroad to be planned) and writing of exhaustive visual reports
Vehicle tests
"Make or buy" analyses in collaboration with the innovation and R&D teams
Data crunching" using databases (volume analysis, market sizing, etc.)

SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.
SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.
PURPOSE AND OBJECTIVES
SAP Customer Experience helps build trusted relationships between brands and their customers to unlock a new world of digital innovation, customer value, and sustainable growth. We seek talent who want to innovate, be disruptive, and who support mutually agreed upon goals and ambitions. As a fast-paced growth business, there are no limits to how our teams will shape the future of SAP and our industry.

Arm the field with ready-to-use Customer Reference assets for sales meetings with customers
Coordinate the field communication on content available (stories, competitive deck, logo deck, solution overview...) for the Sales, Presales, Partners.

EXPECTATIONS AND TASKS
As an intern as External/Internal Customer Stories Creation intern, you will work with the team to produce Customer Stories, you will help the identification of customers for Analysts requests, and identify good stories to be included in global marketing brochure,. You might also build Logo Slides for the Sales Teams. These stories will help the sales and partners to have the right arguments along win stories based on their competitive situation. You will also support (ad-hoc ) Field References Enablement .
The success of your mission is to work closely with experts in that domain, therefore, you will learn and be exposed to amazing rich customer insights and experience from the team.

Support the Team to identify Customers for Analyst Requests, Events, and Marketing Brochures such ( SAP Customer Experience Gold Guide or Path to SAP C/4HANA).

Bring a passion for technology and how it changes businesses,
Have a strong customer focus and be an innovative thinker,
Good communication skills and curious to learn more about communications,
Ready to contribute to very visible projects,
And for sure Good sense of humor.

WORK EXPERIENCE
Ideally first Business experience and work experience (internship) in a B2B environment.
Ideally experience with (SAP) CRM tools and first writing experience (in English).

Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own. A career at SAP can open many doors for you. Summary
Posted: Oct 4, 2019
Weekly Hours: 35
Role Number: 200089658
Come help us build the next generation cloud platform to support internet services across Apple. Our software provides storage at massive scale and with the highest reliability to product teams inside Apple. We are looking for a world-class Software Engineer with experience in developing large scale services and infrastructure.
Key Qualifications
A successful track-record and proven experience as a backend internet services software developer.
Proven aptitude for building, launching and operating very large-scale production internet services.
Deep knowledge of Java, Java libraries, non-blocking and thread safe programming.
Understanding of C++ libraries and JNI integration a plus.
Some exposure to structured or unstructured storage and caching.
Understanding of file system handling on Linux.
Experience Web UI, including modern JS frameworks (e.g. React) a plus.
Knowledge of continuous integration, testing methodologies, TDD and agile development methodologies.
Open to pair programming.
Description
We are building, and supporting new, critical infrastructural systems and frameworks which provide and support services like structured and unstructured storage, caching, queueing, searching, and much more. These form the platform upon which many iCloud and other backend systems at Apple are built. The team is responsible for the next generation platform that will power Apple’s infrastructural services. These services have huge scale and store hundreds of petabytes of data. The platform will support a variety of services based on open-source software, such as Apache Cassandra, SOLR, Zookeeper, Kafka, Redis, etc. We are looking for a strong, hardworking developer to join as a member of this group. This person will have a tremendous amount of individual responsibility and influence over the direction the backend of many critical Apple internet services take for years to come. You are someone with ideas and real passion for software delivered as a service to improve reuse, efficiency, and simplicity. This engineer’s work will impact hundreds of millions of users and be essential to the success of some of the most transparent current and future Apple features.
Education & Experience
Technical BS/MS degree or equivalent work experience.
Additional Requirements
Design, build and maintain software & services to improve the feature set, availability, scalability and security of Apple's internal cloud infrastructure.
Use proven testing methodology to assure system stability and performance.
Some international travel will be required in this role.

Our brands recognize the power of travel to break down barriers and make people's lives better – that responsibility inspires us to be the place where exceptional people want to do their best work, and to provide them the tools to do so.
Whether you're applying to work in engineering or customer support, marketing or lodging supply, at Expedia Group we act as one team, working towards a common goal; to bring the world within reach. We relentlessly strive for better, but not at the cost of the customer. We act with humility and optimism, respecting ideas big and small. We value diversity and voices of all volumes. We are a global organization but keep our feet on the ground so we can act fast and stay simple. Our teams also have the chance to give back on a local level and make a difference through our corporate social responsibility program, Expedia Cares.
If you have a hunger to make a difference with one of the most loved consumer brands in the world and to work in the dynamic travel industry, this is the job for you.
Our family of travel brands includes: Brand Expedia®, Hotels.com®, Expedia® Partner Solutions, Egencia®, trivago®, HomeAway®, Orbitz®, Travelocity®, Wotif®, lastminute.com.au®, ebookers®, CheapTickets®, Hotwire®, Classic Vacations®, Expedia® Media Solutions, CarRentals.com™, Expedia Local Expert®, Expedia® CruiseShipCenters®, SilverRail Technologies, Inc., ALICE and Traveldoo®.
Expedia Group is committed to creating an inclusive work environment with a diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, disability or age.
*****
Traveldoo se positionne comme « le » fournisseur de plateformes Web et mobiles en Europe pour la gestion des voyages d'affaires et des frais professionnels. Avec plus de 4 500 clients dans plus de 65 pays, nos solutions combinent technologie de pointe et service clients de qualité supérieure pour fournir des services à valeur ajoutée aux entreprises. Traveldoo fait partie d’Expedia Group.
Nous créons et apportons de la valeur en utilisant les méthodologies agiles (Scrum et Kanban) pour travailler sur des projets à court et long terme, à l'échelle mondiale. Notre équipe Recherche & Développement en pleine croissance se trouve à Levallois-Perret et se compose de plus de 30 ingénieurs hautement qualifiés et expérimentés.
Nous recrutons des développeurs mobiles avec des compétences de back-end et front-end
Votre mission
L'équipe mobile travaille sur les applications natives iOS et Android pour la gestion des voyages professionnels et des frais de voyage.
Nous recherchons des experts Android investis, qui sont à même de guider des développeurs juniors et de leur transmettre leurs connaissances techniques approfondies, des personnes véritablement passionnées par la réflexion créative et qui seront à même de permettre à Traveldoo de demeurer leader dans le secteur des dépenses et du voyage d'affaires.
Votre expérience et vos compétences contribueront au développement et à la création de produits logiciels novateurs et ambitieux. Vous aurez l'opportunité de travailler avec les dernières technologies iOS et Android.
Votre profil
En tant que développeur avec 5 ans d'expérience professionnelle au minimum dans le développement mobile, nous attendons de vous une maîtrise professionnelle des technologies suivantes (ou similaires) :
Expertise logicielle (méthodologies agiles, TDD, DDD, BDD/ATDD, MVVM, VIP, Clean Code)
Connaissance de l'architecture : architecture propre, stratégie de tests, API Rest
Kotlin, Java Android, Java JEE, Swift, RxSwift
Outils : XCode, Android Studio, Cocoapods, IntelliJ IDEA, Gitlab, Maven, Jenkins, Fastlane, Bitrise
Techniques de codage sécurisé
En outre, vous parlez anglais couramment, vous êtes sociable et vous vous épanouissez dans un environnement de travail flexible et international.
Vous avez l'esprit d'initiative et savez adopter des moyens innovants et contribuer utilement grâce à votre réflexion créative. Vous avez une connaissance approfondie de l'architecture logicielle et de l'écosystème mobile.
Pourquoi nous rejoindre ?
Au sein d'Expedia Group, nous sommes persuadés que notre succès dépend de celui de nos employés. Nous sommes la plateforme de voyages par excellence dans le monde, composée de personnes parmi les plus capables, les plus passionnées et les plus créatives du secteur. Nos marques s’appuient sur une conviction commune, à savoir que les voyages ont le pouvoir de faire tomber les barrières et de rendre nos vies meilleures à travers le monde. Cette responsabilité qui est la nôtre nous inspire à faire de nos environnements de travail des endroits uniques, où des personnes aux qualités exceptionnelles sont motivées à donner le meilleur d’elles-mêmes, en ayant à disposition les outils pour le faire.
Que vous soyez tenté par un poste d’ingénieur ou d’agent clientèle, une carrière dans le marketing ou dans le service hébergement, Expedia Group est une seule et même grande équipe dont tous les efforts sont dirigés vers la réalisation d’un objectif commun : mettre le monde à la portée de tous. Nous visons l'excellence, mais jamais au détriment de nos clients. Nous agissons avec humilité et optimisme, en respectant toutes les idées, des plus simples aux plus ambitieuses. Nous apprécions la diversité et les opinions de chacun. Nous sommes une compagnie internationale, mais nous gardons les pieds sur terre pour pouvoir agir rapidement et de la manière la plus simple possible. Nos équipes ont également la chance de pouvoir rendre la pareille aux communautés locales et d'apporter leur pierre à l'édifice pour un monde meilleur en participant à Expedia Care, notre programme interne d'initiatives solidaires.
Si vous rêvez de faire la différence en travaillant dans un secteur très dynamique, pour l'une des marques grand public les plus appréciées au monde, ce poste est pour vous.
Notre famille de marques de voyage comprend : Expedia®, Hotels.com®, Expedia® Partner Solutions, Egencia®, trivago®, HomeAway®, Orbitz®, Travelocity®, Wotif®, lastminute.com.au®, ebookers®, CheapTickets®, Hotwire®, Classic Vacations®, Expedia® Media Solutions, CarRentals.com™, Expedia Local Expert®, Expedia® CruiseShipCenters®, SilverRail Technologies, Inc., ALICE et Traveldoo®.
Expedia Group s'engage à proposer un environnement de travail ouvert à un personnel diversifié. Tous les candidats qualifiés seront pris en considération pour le poste à pourvoir, sans distinction aucune liée à la race, à la religion, au sexe, à l'orientation sexuelle, à l'origine ethnique, à un handicap ou à l'âge.

description:
Sidetrade, one of the leading European AI Software companies, is on an exciting journey. Together we are transforming the customer journey. We empower marketing, sales and finance teams to grow sales and accelerate cash. When you combine our powerful technology and massive data-sets with our creative and smart people, anything is possible.
Aimie, our intelligent technology, recognizes customer behavior patterns, makes immediately actionable recommendations and get results:
Accelerating Prospect, winning new customers, by quickly and accurately identifying future buyers
Developing business, by getting current customers to make additional purchases and preventing customer churn
Increasing performance, by reducing payment delay
Sidetrade is on an exciting mission to transform the customer journey through artificial intelligence.
We are actively looking for a Senior Site Reliability Engineer to join our great R&D team based in Paris. If you are looking to make an impact, Sidetrade is the place for you!
What you will be doing
Working within small multi-disciplined teams/squads with the overall responsibility for the availability and reliability of various platforms; relied upon by 150,000+ users worldwide.
Generally, this role will be 50% writing code to automate processes and 50% investigating issues and supporting their resolution. You will need to have a passion for using software development techniques and experience to diagnose & solve operational (application, architectural & infrastructure) problems.
Due to the nature of this role, you may sometimes be required to provide on-call cover to support any critical missions or incidents and work closely with our dedicated support teams and lead blameless retrospectives with the goal of discovering the best approach to prevent future occurrences of the same issue.
As per of our key performance indicators, we need to have the platform up and running at any time. Your role would be to measure, monitor availability, latency and overall system health, and understanding trends and capabilities of the service.
Who are we looking for?
3 years+ experience as Site Reliability Engineer
Experience with orchestration tools such as Ansible
Familiarity with Docker and Kubernetes concepts and associated tools such as Helm
Experience of global data management (DBA, monitoring, backup, etc.)
Solid sysadmin and networks capabilities (tcp, firewall, etc)
Exposure to incident response processes and scenarios
Engineering skills using one or more programming languages such as Java, Python, C#, etc.
Experience running mission-critical services in production is a major plus
Linux / UNIX system administration.
Use of modern CI/CD tools for delivery and automation
Familiarity with the latest compute, load balancing and scaling, storage, networking, security and virtualization technologies
Experience mentoring and working closely with more junior colleagues
Fluent in French with proficient English (as you will be collaborating with the team in Birmingham)
Experience administering and supporting PostgreSQL, Mongo & ElasticSearch will be a plus
Experience in and knowledge of developing and testing transactional websites, data-driven web publishing, content management systems.
Enable continuous improvement of security process and guidelines with Security team
Support implementation of secure design principles according to policies and standards of Information Security
Why would you join us?
Passionate and open team
Weekly team breakfasts
AfterWorks
Weekly free sport classes
We have a strict PSL in place and we will only accept applications from agencies that have been invited to work on this role through the Workable portal.
Candidate CV's not submitted through our Workable portal or submitted directly through to managers or HR will be considered unsolicited and no fee will be payable.
