Senior Solutions Architect - Public Sector France
AWS EMEA SARL (France Branch)38,552 avis - Courbevoie (92)
titre_poste: Senior Solutions Architect - Public Sector France
date_publication:
Amazon.com - il y a 30+ jours
- Continuer pour postuler
Signaler cette offre d'emploi
description:
The candidate will possess both technical and customer-facing skills that will allow them to be the technical “face” of Amazon within a solution provider's ecosystem/environment as well as directly to end customers. He or she will be able to drive discussions with senior personnel within an organisation, as well as the technical background that enables him or her to easily interact and give guidance to software developers, IT professionals, and architects in public sector markets. The ideal candidate will also have a demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges.

The right person will:
Be highly technical and analytical, possess significant experience of software development and/or IT and networking implementation/consulting experience, including some experience with public sector customers.
Have advisory/consulting experience (including some with public sector customers).
Have strong verbal and written communications skills, as well as the ability to work effectively across internal and external organisations and virtual teams.
Have executive speaking and presentation skills – including experience delivering formal presentations (to both large and small groups) and white-boarding sessions.

Are you passionate about helping public sector organisations in France innovate and transform using cloud technology? Do you have both broad and deep knowledge of networking, virtualisation, operating systems, application architectures, web applications, Line-of-Business systems, databases, and microservices applications designed for the cloud? Do you have a knack for helping customers to make their first steps in the cloud and progressively build a trajectory to success with new cloud computing projects ? Are you knowledgeable about security and compliance best practices for applications and their supporting servers, networks and storage?

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is looking for highly skilled and motivated Solution Architects to help accelerate our growing public sector business in France. Organisations in this sector face huge challenges to accomplish complex missions with limited resources and an incomplete knowledge of the potential of the cloud. You would be part of a dynamic, expanding team bringing the latest in disruptive, cutting-edge cloud computing technologies to public sector leaders who want to improve citizens digital experience and to help civil servants to focus more of their time and resources on their core service and innovation.

As a Public Sector Solution Architect, you will have the opportunity to shape and deliver on a strategy to build mind-share and broad usage of AWS' utility computing services within a large variety of public sector organisations (central government, public agencies, universities and schools, non profit organizations, state owned companies, ...) and the larger ecosystem that supports them. Your broad responsibilities will include: owning the technical engagement with those customers, removing technical account management hurdles, defining implementation and transition architectures, helping to respond to RFIs and RFPs, and achieving ultimate success around specific technical projects. To achieve those goals — and building on your broad background and technical breadth and depth in security, networking, operating systems, storage, and application architecture — you will develop expertise in all AWS technologies, and deep understanding of how customer applications and services are best built and operated on the AWS cloud computing platform.

The ideal candidate will :

Enjoy working with public sector customers and partners. You will have a passion for designing and building cloud computing systems for some of the world’s largest and most important organisations to accelerate and scale innovation, reduce costs and drive efficiency, and for educating and training the people who work in and with them to do the same.

Have a strong understanding of public sector mandates, security, standards, and compliance for designing large-scale cloud computing solutions. You will have a broad base of experience working as an architect and systems / software / network engineer. You will enjoy building and expanding your technical skills, to the point that you can not only contribute to, but lead deep architecture discussions around systems and applications in the cloud. You will regularly draw on these skills to take part in and lead deep-dive education and technology design exercises to create world-class systems for public sector organisations and the AWS partners who work with them, including systems integrators and ISVs. You will be happy to roll up your sleeves, get stuck into the detail of systems, possibly write demo / proof of concept code, and generally do what it takes to achieve technical success for customers on the AWS platform.

Roles & Responsibilities:
Serve as a key member of the account management and business development team in helping to ensure customer success in building and migrating applications, software and services on the AWS platform.
Engage systems integrators and support their technical implementation efforts in AWS.
Closely collaborate with broader AWS account management teams, and support and promote AWS Consulting and Technology Partners in order to deliver maximum value to customers.
Assist solution providers working with public sector organisations to define and implement technical and business strategies that will enable them to sell more of their offerings on the AWS platform.
Develop and deliver compelling presentations, product demos, sample solutions, and discussions to drive awareness and adoption of Amazon Web Services in French public sector organisations.
Gain recognition and credibility as a regular attendee, panelist and keynote speaker at AWS and third-party technology conferences, trade shows and press events.
Capture and share best practice knowledge with the worldwide AWS solution architect community, as well as your public sector SA team

The right person will preferably:
Have experience working within the software development or Internet industries (highly desired).
Understand application, server, and network security and government certifications (highly desirable).
Have a technical degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or Mathematics (highly desirable).
Have a working knowledge of modern software development practices and technologies such as agile methodologies and DevOps (highly desirable).
Be AWS-certified (e.g. AWS Solutions Architect Associate).

description:
Requisition ID: 225240
Work Area: Customer Service and Support
Expected Travel: 0 - 30%
Career Status: Professional
Employment Type: Regular Full Time
COMPANY DESCRIPTION
SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.
SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.

PURPOSE AND OBJECTIVES
SAP’s Digital Business Services (DBS), is driving innovative services for customers from an end-to-end perspective. The mission of DBS is to achieve customer’s success and retention for SAP by efficient and flawless implementation of all SAP solutions with a strong focus on the digitalization agenda of customers.
Business Transformation Services (BTS) is part of SAP services organization. It is a global organization consisting of central expertise teams and of local customer centric teams. The core mission of BTS is to drive the digitalization agenda of our customers through designing and implementing Innovation & Transformation Roadmaps. Management consulting, Business value generation, business & process model redesign and organizational change management are in BTS’s DNA.
To have a successful career in SAP BTS, candidates must possess the following qualities:
A genuine passion for driving client success and delivering business outcomes through technology.
The gravitas and demeanor to act as a trusted advisor at C-level both from a business and technology perspective.
A collaborative and influential style that will allow them to build a personal external and internal network and that will allow them to operate effectively within a complex matrix organization with multiple objectives.
The energy and tenacity to persevere in sometimes challenging and political client engagements.
Expertise in business process optimization, business case building, roadmap design and value measurement through defined KPIs.

EDUCATION AND QUALIFICATIONS / SKILLS AND COMPETENCIES
University degree (Master’s degree in business administration, economics, computer sciences, engineering, etc.)
Minimum of 6 years work experience in Management Consulting or other Advisory Services
Good knowledge of current and future trends in IT and in at least one other industry
Solid knowledge in SAP Solutions and Technology
Network in the French SAP related market
Excellent interpersonal skills, strong verbal and written communication skills as well solid presentation skills
Team player, proactive networking, results and execution focused and willingness to learn
Enthusiasm to support business development efforts
Fluent written and spoken French and English
Flexibility to travel in France and in Europe

DESIRED WORK EXPERIENCE
We are looking for a balance of the following:
Business process experience, in a SAP context, such as process re-engineering, process design or process audits
Broad experience of SAP portfolio and at least with depth for one line-of-business (e.g. procurement or marketing) or industry solutions. Preferred industry experience is in consumer products/ retail, discrete industry, utilities.
Development of Business Benefit cases for securing investment in major IT programs.
Advisory in a SAP transformation context. It may cover definition of landscape strategy, IT portfolio planning, COE organization, enterprise architecture governance, business value roadmap.
Proven experience in customer management and team coordination.
Experience with Cloud platforms, new technologies and/or projects with an innovative mindset approach would be a plus.
WHAT YOU GET FROM US
Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own. A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment – apply now.
SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT
To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.
SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team (Americas: Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com).
Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.
Additional Locations:

For our strong and well-positioned team in France we are looking for an experienced technical Pre-Sales Consultant who is specialized on IT Asset Management or IT Service Management and who will also take over responsibilities for other technical areas of our solutions, including asset lifecycle management, SW license management, client configuration and potentially more as the Ivanti portfolio is further developing.

Collaborate closely with account managers from the sales teams to identify and drive projects towards successful closing. The focus is on technical closure.
Single point of contact for involved technical and business stakeholders from customer/partner side with focus on service and asset management aspects.

Responsible for staying current on competitive analysis and understanding differentiators between Ivanti and its competitors

Experience in implementing complex IT solutions like Service Management within (Enterprise) customer scenarios

ANSYS84 avis - Paris (75)
date_publication:

description:
SUMMARY


The ANSYS Platform Deployment Specialist is a member of the EMEA Field Engineering organization. As a Deployment Specialist, you will work closely with our customers, leveraging internal technical and project management teams, and are responsible for software deployment & deployment support to ANSYS internal & external customers. These deployment environments can be on premise and/or in public cloud.

The deployment of these systems will include the elicitation, documentation and analysis of customers’ business/functional requirements, system design and solution configuration, onsite deployment and integration, user training and go‐live support.

RESPONSIBILITIES
Provide Customer care, Professional Services, Business support and BU Assistance as required.
Work with customers to understand how to integrate ANSYS services and applications into their Infrastructure Platform.
Work with customers to troubleshoot and resolve deployment & configuration related problems of ANSYS software products on various platforms on customer premises and in 3rd party cloud environments. Support ANSYS SaaS Products such as ANSYS Cloud from a Deployment and Integration perspective into the customer environment.
Work in an agile environment to develop the next-generation simulation platform for customizing ANSYS products according to the customer needs
Propose, design, implement, and maintain software components & deployment automation which meet project requirements
Actively participate in project planning, design brainstorm sessions and scrum meetings
Work with engineering teams to deploy easy-to-use tools
Think “outside the box”, prototype internally and let your ideas be known.
Be a team player who can collaborate effectively with all key ANSYS and customer stakeholders including sales, product development, project management, implementation engineers, and end users

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s degree in Applied Math, Computer Sciences, Engineering or related field
A minimum of 3 years of experience in an engineering or IT environment
Familiarity with concepts that impact software deployment, such as TCP/IP, DNS, Ethernet, Virtualization, Security and Network Administration, Firewalls, Authentication, Web and Database Services & Storage platforms.
A minimum of 1 years of experience with Linux-based computer systems
Experience with Windows-based computer systems
Proficiency with programming languages such as Python, Java, Javascript, .NET, C#, JSON, Powershell, Linux Shell
Demonstrated skills in writing and presenting in fluent English
Logical problem-solving approach and the ability to clearly communicate the situation and proposed solution to the customer

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Demonstrated use of relevant ANSYS software or knowledge of other commercial CAE, CAD, EDA software package
Experience in the following is a plus:
Integrating with, Deploying & Administering an HPC system using Cluster Job Management Systems such as Grid Engine, LSF or PBS
Cloud Based environments such as AWS, Google Cloud Platform or Windows Azure using tools relevant to those environments (such as CloudFormation, Chef or Puppet for AWS)
Deployment and Operations of Web Services and Databases.
Practical knowledge of agile project management
Must have passion and drive for personal technical excellence and high performance
Must have customer service aptitude and maintain customer focus
Ability to travel up to 25%

CULTURE AND VALUES

Culture and values are incredibly important to ANSYS. They inform us of who we are, of how we act. Values aren't posters hanging on a wall or about trite or glib slogans. They aren't about rules and regulations. They can't just be handed down the organization. They are shared beliefs – guideposts that we all follow when we're facing a challenge or a decision. Our values tell us how we live our lives; how we approach our jobs. Our values are crucial for fostering a culture of winning for our company:
Customer focus
Results and Accountability
Innovation
Transparency and Integrity
Mastery
Inclusiveness
Sense of urgency
Collaboration and Teamwork
ANSYS does not accept unsolicited referrals for vacancies, and any unsolicited referral will become the property of ANSYS. Upon hire, no fee will be owed to the agency, person, or entity.

description:
Passionate about tech? Interested in Energy? Come work for Kayrros, a fast-growing start-up using artificial intelligence to transform the world’s biggest industry.
Kayrros is headquartered in Paris, with offices in New York, Houston, London, and Singapore. By working for Kayrros, you will join an energetic team of 100 people, with diverse professional backgrounds—from data science and petroleum engineering to sales and marketing—and over 15 different nationalities and 10 spoken languages.
Our team of energy experts and tech wizards are working to bring transparency to the global energy market. We employ innovative technologies, like satellite imagery processing and artificial intelligence, to capture and analyse data across the energy sector. Combined with our expert analysis, we give our clients valuable information on global market movements to make better business decisions—whether that’s trading, investing or managing their operations.
In September 2018, Kayrros received €21M in Serie B funding to continue breaking the boundaries of the energy market.
Interested in operating at the intersection of energy and the data revolution? Get in touch!
We are currently recruiting for our Paris office,
a* Software Engineer M/F *(CDI)
At Kayrros the Signal team is in charge of maintaining the product made by the team and improve the product with new features. You will join a product team composed of 6 people (a Project Manager, a Data Engineer and Oil & Gas Analysts).
Task Overview
Ship a product from design to industrialization and be part of the product design, features specifications, choice of architecture & technologies…
Create data pipelines and reusable modules to be integrated within Kayrros platform.
Work with data scientists to conduct experiments, design solutions, and scale models on large amount of data.
Develop your own experience, share advice and benefit from that of the engineering team in Kayrros key domains (computer vision, remote sensing, machine learning at scale…).
Deploy fully automated CI/CD pipelines that both enable a quick time-to-market and a strong reliability in the production environment.
Implement quality assessment processes, practical coding standards and get involved into code reviews.
Technology stack
Languages: Python (notably pyspark), any other modern language appreciated
Tools: Linux, Git, Docker, Message brokers (Kafka/RabbitMQ)
Big Data: Hadoop (Yarn + HDFS), Spark, Elasticsearch
Profile
This is an ideal opportunity if you are looking for a new opportunity and you want to join a fast-growing start-up.
You have between 1 and 4 years of experience as Software Engineer, Back-End Engineer or Data Engineer
You must have an experience with Python development
You must have an experience with contributing to full-stack solutions and performance optimization
You must have an Interest in understanding and implementing data science algorithms
An experience with Agile development is highly appreciated
An experience with ElasticSearch and some Big Data technologies (Spark, HDFS, Kafka) is highly appreciated
You can communicate clearly in English, including with non-technical people
Why joining Kayrros?
We are a young, fast-growing tech company and are extremely passionate about what we do.
We are located in the WeWork building on Rue la Fayette, 75009 (free drinks, events and a vibrant atmosphere).
You will work with an international team and practice your English (or Chinese, German, Swedish, Portuguese...) on a day to day basis.
Recruitment process
Send your CV specifying the type of contract and your availability
A phone interview (HR or Team Member)
A physical interview (Team member + HR interview + Manager)
The whole process will last one month at the maximum.
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Language:
English (Preferred)

description:
Passionné(e) par les nouvelles technologies ? Intéressé(e) par le secteur de l’énergie ? Rejoignez Kayrros, la start-up qui révolutionne le monde de l’énergie.
Kayrros est une start-up créée en 2016 et spécialisée dans l’énergie et l’intelligence artificielle. Rejoindre Kayrros, c’est rejoindre une équipe dynamique de 100 personnes basée à Paris (HQ) et dans nos bureaux de New-York, Houston, Singapour et Londres. Notre équipe internationale est principalement composée de Data Scientists, Data Engineers et Energy Analysts, dont le but est d’apporter de la transparence au secteur de l’énergie.
Kayrros utilise des technologies innovantes, telles que le traitement d'images par satellite et l'intelligence artificielle, pour capturer et analyser des données dans le secteur de l'énergie. Ces données combinées à notre expertise nous permettent de fournir à nos clients (traders, fond d’investissement et grandes entreprises), des informations sur les mouvements du marché mondial, afin de les aider à prendre de meilleures décisions d’investissement.
En septembre 2018, Kayrros a réalisé une deuxième levée de fonds de 21 millions d’euros, nous permettant de continuer notre croissance.
Nous recherchons actuellement pour notre bureau de Paris
un Software Engineer H/F (CDI)
Au sein de Kayrros, l’équipe Signal est en charge de maintenir et optimiser le Produit existant. Vous travaillerez au sein d’une équipe composée de 6 personnes (un Product Manager, un Data Engineer et plusieurs Oil & Gas Analysts).

En tant que Software Engineer, vous devrez donc :
Participer au développement d’un produit, de sa conception à l'industrialisation et prendre part aux choix techniques (architecture, technologies utilisées…).
Créer des pipelines de données et des modules réutilisables qui s’intégreront dans la plateforme Kayrros.
Travailler avec des Data Scientists pour mener des expériences, concevoir des solutions et déployer des modèles sur un grand volume de données.
Développer votre propre expérience, partager des conseils et profiter de ceux de l’équipe Engineering dans les domaines clés de Kayrros (computer vision, remote sensing, machine learning at scale…).
Déployer des pipelines CI / CD entièrement automatisés qui permettent à la fois de réduire le time-to-market et une fiabilité élevée en production.
Garantir la qualité de la code base Kayrros en participant entre autres à des code reviews.
Notre technologie
Langages: Python (notamment pyspark), la maitrise d’autres langages est appreciée
Outils: Linux, Git, Docker, Message brokers (Kafka/RabbitMQ)
Big Data: Hadoop (Yarn + HDFS), Spark, Elasticsearch

Vous avez entre un et quatre ans d’expérience en tant que Software Engineer ou Back-End Engineer.

Vous avez déjà contribué à des projets full-stack et pris en compte l’optimisation des performances
Vous avez envie de comprendre et déployer des algorithmes de Data Science

Une expérience avec ElasticSearch et certaines technologies Big Data (Spark, HDFS, Kafka) est très appréciée
Vous pouvez communiquer clairement en anglais, y compris avec des personnes non techniques.
Vous êtes dynamique, curieux et désireux d’en apprendre davantage sur le secteur de l’énergie et l’intelligence économique
Pourquoi Kayrros ?
Nous sommes une jeune entreprise en croissance et nous sommes extrêmement passionnés par ce que nous faisons
Nous sommes situés dans l’espace de co-working WeWork, rue la Fayette, 75009 (boissons gratuites, événements et atmosphère animée)

description:
DYNAMIC SIMULATION ENGINEER

Company Summary
TechnipFMC is a global oil and gas leader, specialized in subsea, onshore, offshore, and surface technologies. Our mission: to enhance the performance of world’s energy industry. How we do it: by constantly challenging conventions and investing in our 37 000+ employees, across 48 countries. At TechnipFMC, we aim to offer an inspiring working experience: tackling some of the most complex technical and engineering challenges in the world in collaboration with a truly global team.

Introduction to the Job
Within the Expertise & Modeling department, you will be in charge of development of process dynamic simulation models on behalf of TECHNIP France. With the support of our experts, you will provide either assistance to TechnipFMC’s project or to direct client.

Job description
Perform dynamic simulation modeling for process units.
Contribute to integrated Subsea Topsides dynamic analysis.
Produce studies deliverables (Dynamic model validation report, Model Acceptance test procedure, …)
Participate to the management of interface for OTS development
Participate to the validation of the various versions of process simulation softwares.
Supervise junior dynamic simulation engineers on projects
You are meant for this job if

Graduated Engineer in Chemical Engineering or Process Engineering and you have significative experience (8 years minimum) of process dynamic modeling
Dynamic, proactive, rigorous, autonomous, you are an easy-going team mate in order to evolve and assert yourself in a multicultural environment. Your English is fluent. Business trips abroad are to be foreseen.

A good knowledge in process dynamic modeling is mandatory. Competencies in process control and ICSS architecture are an advantage

Your future at TechnipFMC
Potential career path, if possible
Global mobility opportunities if relevant
Training and development
Diverse and international team if relevant
Learn more about TechnipFMC

Learn more about us and find other open positions at our Career Page.

Follow us on LinkedIn for company updates.

````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````
INGENIEUR SIMULATION DYNAMIQUE
A propos de nous
TechnipFMC est un leader mondial du pétrole et du gaz, spécialisé dans les technologies sous-marines, onshore, offshore et de surface. Notre mission: améliorer les performances du secteur de l’énergie mondial. Comment nous le faisons: en défiant constamment les conventions et en investissant dans nos 37 000 employés et plus, dans 48 pays. Chez TechnipFMC, notre objectif est de proposer une expérience de travail inspirante: relever les défis techniques et d’ingénierie les plus complexes du monde en collaboration avec une véritable équipe à l'échelle mondiale.

A propos du poste
Au sein du département Expertise et Modélisation, vous serez en charge de développer des modèles de simulations dynamiques de procédés pour TECHNIP France. En s’appuyant sur le support de nos experts, vous serez amené(e) à remplir cette tâche soit pour les projets dont TECHNIPFMC a la charge, soit pour nos clients récurrents.

Description de poste
Développer des modèles d’unités procédés.
Contribuer aux analyses dynamiques sur modèle intégré Subsea Topsides.
Rédiger les documents de l’étude (Rapport de validation, Procédure d’acceptabilité, rapport de résultats)
Assurer l’interface avec différentes disciplines dans la réalisation des simulations dynamique pour OTS
Participer à la validation des logiciels de simulation de procéd
Superviser des ingénieurs simulation dynamique Junior sur projets
A propos de vous
Vous êtes ingénieur diplômé(e) d’une école de Génie des Procédés ou de Génie Chimique et êtes attiré(e) par les activités de modélisation dynamique de procédé, avec une expérience de 8 ans minimum.
Vous êtes dynamique, proactif(ve), rigoureux(se) et autonome et vous savez évoluer et vous affirmer dans un environnement de travail multiculturel.
Vous parlez un anglais opérationnel et êtes mobile pour des déplacements de courte durée en France et à l’étranger.
Une bonne maitrise des outils de modélisation dynamique de procédé est indispensable. Des compétences en contrôle de procédé et architecture ICSS sont souhaitées.
Votre avenir chez TechnipFMC
Cheminement de carrière potentiel, si possible
Opportunités de mobilité globale si pertinentes
La formation et le développement
Équipe diversifiée et internationale si pertinent
En savoir plus sur TechnipFMC

Account Executive - Enterprise Corporate Sales - FRANCE
"The secret to successful hiring is to look for people who want to change the world” - Marc Benioff, CEO & Founder of Salesforce

Sounds like you? Great, here’s what Salesforce, #1 Best Workplace in Europe 2018 can offer you to help you to thrive:
Not just a job, a Career: Our 30% YOY growth has positioned a culture of talent development where we constantly create opportunities for you to learn, grow and feel empowered to realise your full potential, whichever career path you choose.

International Opportunities: Salesforce offers you a multitude of growth opportunities throughout our Global Sales Hubs.
Role Description:
As part of our Enterprise Corporate Sales team you will be selling to our top enterprise accounts and working with Fortune 500 calibre clients across France. You will manage the complete end to end sales-cycles, often presenting to C-level executives. You will trailblaze the salesforce vision through product demonstration, in-market events, and account specific initiatives.
What we are looking for:
Proven experience of quota carrying software or technology sales and account management experience.
Successful history of net direct new business sales, with the ability to prove consistent delivery against revenue targets.

Experience managing and closing complex sales cycles and demonstrated ownership of all aspects of territory management.

Business Proficient in English and French
University Degree
Your Impact:
The Enterprise Corporate Sales (ECS) Account Executive is responsible for growing and managing subsets within the Enterprise Parent accounts. Your role includes partnering with our Strategic Account Managers to evangelise the Salesforce vision and account strategy. You will work closely with current and prospective customers as a trusted advisor to deeply understand their unique company challenges and goals. You will consult with customers on the Salesforce Platform to evangelise solutions that will help them reach their business goals and blaze new trails within their organisations.
Some of your main responsibilities and deliverables will include:
Manage the end to end sales process through engagement of appropriate resources such as Sales Engineers, Professional Services, Marketing, Partners etc.

Maintaining a long term perspective to maximise overall revenue generation while being able to generate short term results.

What's in it for you:
Clear and structured career path into Senior and Leadership positions within the company.
World - Class Training & Development in the areas of professional growth and product knowledge.
Constant learning and knowledge sharing with some of the best complex selling professionals in the industry.
Environment for an entrepreneurial minded person with a lot of energy, ideas and courage for their implementation.
Freedom to design the own go-to market strategy.
Responsibility for the entire sales cycle , from acquisition through to signing deals.
Planning and implementation of marketing events
Support from a professional team (marketing, sales program, solution engineering, business development)
Regular customer meetings face to face in country
Comprehensive training offering supplemented by individual coaching
Chance to work in a dynamic, fun and challenging environment where we will make sure you reach your full potential.
Extra Benefits: Gym subsidy, Travel Scheme, Education Subsidy, Pension, Bootcamp in San Francisco, 7 Volunteering Days a year and free snacks and drinks
Join our Ohana and be your best!
"ECS embraces and embodies the Salesforce Ohana values of transparency, integrity, commitment, linearity/velocity and giving back."
- Tyler Harnish, Area Vice President Enterprise Corporate Sales

As SeniorManager, Real Estate & Workplace – Southern Europe you will provide Facilities leadership across the Southern European region (France, Spain & Italy with potential expansion) and will report directly to the Sr Director, REW EMEA. This position will require good working knowledge of Office Health and Safety practices and would also need to undertake and project-manage facility projects such as relocations, fit outs and upgrades, as directed by the Snr Director of REW EMEA. This position is highly visible within EMEA offices and requires interfacing with members from all levels of Vmware.
Summary of Position
The Senior Manager is responsible for the efficient operation of the building, services and management of all site Facilities FTE and Contractor staff.
Thorough understanding of Facilities Operations including building maintenance (e.g. HVAC mechanical operations, General Power and RPS provision, Fire Suppression systems and the like), and specialist operational requirements to facilitate a high class and modern built environment for our people.
Management of facilities operations including, Management of vendors and contracts for facilities related services, such as building maintenance, janitorial, coffee/tea service, plant service, catering service, food/snack/beverage supplies, recycling/waste management, equipment maintenance, mail/post/shipping/receiving services, ergonomics contractors, health & safety, etc. as they apply to their site.

Negotiate new leases and renewals working closely with the Lease Administration team.
Manage local REW office staff, including receptionist, facilities assistants and shipping/receiving clerks, or any additional staff that are within our agreed supervision remit
Performs all review and development management activities for staff, including overseeing training, performance evaluation, will Initiate and implement goals and objectives for staff
Performs site Inspections quarterly to determine any corrective actions
Creates and inputs annual operational budgets. Monitors spending and provides budgetary reports monthly working closely with the Finance team
Meets periodically with vendors to review pricing/services

We strive to further improve our innovative service portfolio and our customer engagement programs, as well as increasing our delivery efficiency and to increase business outcome for customers, make them more efficient and accelerate time to value. This includes all SAP solutions across all cloud solutions.

Our customers demand from support more than just incident solving. With SAP Preferred Success, customers gain the services and assets for mission-critical assistance that are included in SAP Enterprise Support, plus more-specific service levels and access to expert SAP contacts to help resolve issues and stay flexible to accommodate future innovations.
RESPONSIBILITIES, EXPECTATIONS AND TASKS

This is a client-facing role, delivering ongoing support and guidance around business strategy and transformation topics after the sales cycle has completed. The role focuses on relationship-building and proactive support activities that in turn promote overall customer satisfaction, product adoption and retention & renewals. The role manages diverse, high profile and/or key accounts.

Key tasks of this role:
Develop a trusted relationship with key stakeholders and decision makers, understand and respond to customer needs bringing the customers value in the focus.
Understand key elements of the customer’s environment and Cloud strategy.

Facilitate access to product and functional expertise for certain topic areas e.g. via Empowerment Sessions.

Meet customer expectations by anticipating and orchestrating in the resolution of their top issues, act as an escalation point and collaborate with other departments as needed.

Proactively contribute to strategic customer programs launched by ES & Preferred Care management, e.g. SAP Enterprise Support Advisory Council.

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND COMPETENCIES

You enjoy interactions that lead to ultimate customer success and satisfaction. Customer orientation and focus on quality, as well as skills to interact/collaborate with customer IT and LOB decision makers.

Ability to deliver results under pressure, work independently, and take ownership of assigned tasks (pro-active driver, results-oriented, pragmatic).
Excellent communication, enthusiast, strong work ethic and a positive attitude.
Fluency in English (verbal and written) and fluency in French (written and verbal)

3-5+ years’ working experience with proven ability in a customer-facing role to work with dedicated customers on project and senior management level.
Proven record in managing issues, scope, and quality while bringing areas of responsibility and tasks to successful completion within the time requirements.
Experience in working in global / virtual teams is an advantage.
Experience in transferring knowledge to others (coaching & mentoring) is an advantage.

WHAT YOU GET FROM US
Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own. A career at SAP can open many doors for you. The Manager, Technical Consultants will be responsible for collaborating with the Enterprise Accounts sales teams, the in-region (geographic) sales resources, commercial and marketing teams to drive out technical resource and development needs of the TC team. This individual will develop and execute the organizational and procedural plans to align with the Enterprise Account Plan, EMEA business strategies and the relevant Focus Industry Strategies.

Interaction with customers staff and plant locations worldwide; interaction with the customers’ key supply chain partners ( EPCs, OEMs, Distributors, SI’s, etc.) worldwide; communication and coordination of Rockwell Automation sales, support, and business units worldwide.

An extensive background and knowledge of the RA portfolio, a variety of focus industries, specifically in at least one of these; Life Science, Food & Beverage, Auto & Tire, Consumer Products and Process industries is a prerequisite.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS
Manage a team of Technical Consultants (TC) capable of supporting the suite of Rockwell Automation control, software, motion, drives and component products in the target application segments.
Develop and manage the process and systems to track TC resource requests and project activity and how the requests are qualified and work scope defined.
Work with the Enterprise Accounts sales teams to identify new application solutions and determine strategies to expand in new customer segment areas to promote sales growth. Execute plans through the TC team.
Assure the TCs are aligned to support assigned Enterprise Accounts and are in synch with the Systems & Solutions team for engagement process execution and internal product requirement development activities.
Work with Enterprise Accounts and Industry sales teams as required to ensure customer engagements are successful through proper project definition and execution. Engage as necessary on customer / project escalations.
Work with senior management to understand the strategic direction for the Enterprise Accounts and Industry sales teams. Define and implement plans to meet the needs and effectively communicate to the TC team members.
Engage with the project management team as required to establish project team resources and develop a project plan for execution.
Work with the Business Unit teams to develop application solution specific tools for the TCs.
Work with the Global and Regional Enterprise Accounts Team members, as well as Industry Managers to drive customer requirements for application and product solutions into the Business Strategy Review (BSR) process and to ensure alignment between target applications and the TC team’s capabilities. Create development plans as required.
Provide performance management and development of the TCs including performance appraisals, career guidance and counselling, measurable goal setting, and development planning for each engineer in the group.
Ability to work and collaborate with individuals at various levels, including C-level, within an organization in a fast-paced team environment.
Qualifications
Basic Qualifications
Bachelor’s Degree


Preferred Qualifications
A minimum of 8 years related work experience in the automation industry (manufacturing and process) required. Typically requires a minimum of 2 year management experience. DCS process system experience is an advantage.
Technical expertise and strong application knowledge and demonstrated program management skills.
A minimum of 3 years of recognized leadership experience of a technical team. Must also have proven commercial awareness and acumen.
In-depth knowledge of Rockwell Automation’s Integrated Architecture, PlantPAx System, and Control Power Solutions (Drives, MCC’s, etc.).

Experience in low and medium voltage systems, including MCCs Medium Voltage and Low Voltage Drives and Control Products.
Software experience with historians, databases, network security and OPC.
Knowledge and experience with network and communication protocols: DNP 3.0 LAN/WAN, Modbus TCP, Modbus RTU, SEL Mirrored Bits, Goose Messaging, IEC 61850, TCP/IP, UDP.

Software Engineering Internship
Exciting new opportunity for a Software Engineer Intern in France !

Suresnes, France

Working at HID
HID Global is an innovative fast-paced organisation, with many possibilities to make a difference and add value. HID is recognised for the great care we take with clients and employees alike.

Mission Context
Inside the Software Engineering Department of the Identity and Access Management Business Unit (IAM BU), the Methods & Tools team manages the development infrastructure, and has designed a suite of tools to manage source code, binary packages, dependencies, vulnerabilities and automate builds for continuous integration.
The main mission of the internship (80%) is to improve the ActivBuilder tool to meet user requests and adapt it to the latest continuous integration and cloud technologies such as containerization. A secondary mission (20%) is to turn ActivBuilder into an open source project.

Mission Details
Update the tool’s regression test suite. This will allow the intern to become familiar with the overall software architecture and APIs.
Develop an ActivBuilder plugin to build Docker images and automatically deploy them to Amazon Elastic Container Registry (ECR).
Turn ActivBuilder into an open source project: cleanup and refactor the source code, make it available in a public repository and create build documentation.

Expected Skills
You are an engineering school 2nd or 3rd year student and your main passion is Computer Science and software development. You can code in Java and Python. You have a strong interest in development tools, software development methodology and the Open Source movement.
You are a thorough and reliable person, you are not afraid of technical complexity, you pay attention to details, and you like efficient code that also “looks beautiful”. You are proficient in English and French.

Computer Science Major, Post Graduate level student

We are looking for a high-performing and ambitious Solution Manager with a proven experience and a passion for selling technology solutions to senior executives.

As a customer-focused technical sales professional you will participate in the pre-sales efforts in EUROPE/MEA regions by creating opportunities and partnering with the Sales Manager (based in Paris) to build a customer-centric sales value proposition.
To be successful in this role you must be comfortable managing multiple campaigns, while serving as the central point of technical contact for the customers, as well as the first go-to technical referent for Intersec’s sales team.
Requirements
The goal is to establish a trusted relationship and strong understanding of the customer’s business, translating business needs into technical requirement and developing and presenting a technical vision, business case and physical solution specifically modeled for the customer.
You will own the technical customer relationship and leverages strong technical and interpersonal skills to lead technical discussions and apply advanced subject matter expertise, providing guidance on current market landscape, challenges and the telco industry trends.

Responsibilities
Partner with the Sales Manager to define the business account plan
Support opportunity prospecting by proactively generating leads through your deep understanding of product capabilities to address business issues and provide business value.
Develop deep understanding of the customer business, industry drivers, major transformational factors and resulting business requirements to align Intersec solutions to address the customer’s requirements.
Support and lead large scale enterprise transactions as a Sales Engineer by using industry knowledge and understanding to move deals forward.
Manage the technical response to the response to RFI/RFP/RFQ including products, solutions, software and services.
Take the lead on moving deals through the sales process by knowing how and when to engage the appropriate Intersec and partner resources, tools and programs to accelerate the sales process and reduce the time to technical close
Define solution options and articulate benefits and ROI, effectively highlighting technological advantages and disadvantages from the customer’s perspective
Build with the customer a compelling business-case based on Intersec use-cases portfolio, and present it to the C-Level Executives.
Lead, Manage and optionally run PoC (Proof of Concept), value-based workshops and presentations of Intersec solutions to customers, including white-boarding and presentation of technical material
Be the customer advocate and liaison for product management and development
Work with multiple stakeholders in different functions such as Product Manager, Solution Architects and Marketing to illustrate use cases where Intersec can add value. This requires strong account management capability as well as a passion and enthusiasm for introducing disruptive technology.
Communicate and commit to internal technology and solutions roadmaps and NDAs, to help spur conversations around innovation.
Understand ecosystem of solution providers and ISVs likely to positively influence customer decisions
Provide proactive support to customers and prospects to ensure their successful adoption of the technology
Participate as a speaker in key company events and other marketing related activity.


Who we’re looking for :
A seasoned sales professional able to open new accounts through outstanding pre-sales activities
Profound understanding of various licenses of business models (subscription, SaaS, term-licensed)
Experience in selling in Telco environment (Core Network equipment, CRM, VAS Platform)
Trusted advisor, selling on C level in B2C and B2B markets

Knowledge of Big data infrastructures, cloud solutions, virtualization technologies, IP routing and TCP
Business case focus : able to drive a business case, build a value proposition
Ability to sell a commercial proposal to both technical and non-technical teams
Strong skills on selling on value proposition and customer benefits
Knowledge of CRM software (Salesforce ideally) and Microsoft Office Suite
English is mandatory, local language is a plus
Strong leadership, communication, and technical skills
Persuasive presentation and public speaking skills. Must be able to command an audience while articulating a meaningful message
Self-motivated, self-starter and results oriented
Able to work in unstructured environments and situations, and prioritize effectively with minimal supervision
Availability to travel as needed

meta1:
Returnship Program - Software/Data Science
Criteo46 avis - Paris (75)
date_publication:
il y a 30+ jours
- Continuer pour postuler
Signaler cette offre d'emploi
description:
Who we are
At Criteo, we connect 1.5 billion active shoppers with the things they need and love. Our technology takes an algorithmic approach to predict what user we show an ad to, when, and for what products. Our dataset is about 50 petabytes in Hadoop (more than 120 TB extra per day) and we take less than 10ms to respond to an ad request. This is truly big data and machine learning without the buzzwords. If scale and complexity excite you, join us.

Did you take a voluntary break of two years or more and want to get your career back on track?
Criteo Returnship Program, at Criteo AI Lab Paris, is a professional, mid-level initiative for people who would like to re-join the technical workforce after a voluntary break in their career. The program runs for 6 months. Participants will have the opportunity to learn on-site about recent technologies, network, find mentors and leverage our internal community. You may be considered for a full-time position upon the completion of the program.


1 month training on coding
5 months of immersion in Criteo AI Lab team
Mentorship
Experience the Criteo life.
At the end of the Criteo Returnship Program, we hope you will have developped all the skills and confidence to get back on track.

Eligibility Requirements

You are a software or systems engineer, statistician or data scientist (experience in experiment design and analysis) or in closely related professions
You have been off the market for 2 years or more
You are eligible to work in France
You are proficient in English
You are available full-time for a 6 month-commitment

How to apply?

Please send in your up-to date resume detailing your previous experience and help us understand your motivation by providing a cover letter that explains the reasons why you want to participate and how the returnship fits your longer-term career trajectory.

Start date is October 1st, 2019.
At Criteo, we dare to be different. We believe that diversity fuels innovation and creates an energy that can be seen and felt all over Criteo. We champion different perspectives and are committed to creating a workplace where all Criteos are heard, feel a sense of belonging, and are treated with respect and dignity.

Criteo collects your personal data for the purposes of managing Criteo's recruitment related activities. Consequently, Criteo may use your personal data in relation to the evaluation and selection of applicants. Your information will be accessible to the different Criteo entities across the world. By clicking the "Apply" button you expressly give your consent.

Rakuten France - Paris (75)
date_publication:
il y a 30+ jours
Signaler cette offre d'emploi
description:
NTRODUCTION
This position is located at the Rakuten Blockchain Lab in Belfast city centre where currently have an engineering team of 12 who work in smallagile teams, collaborating with other Rakuten teams in Europe and Japanto deliver solutions for individual Rakuten companies as well as common platforms and services to be used across the organisation. The engineering team build secure, high availability enterprise platforms that allow the many Rakuten Business/Developers to create solutions that take advantage of the benefits of distributed ledger or blockchain technologies without having to be concerned about the complexities of implementation. The team are currently working on a number of very exciting Rakuten HQ projects to be delivered in 2019 and with plan to grow to 20 people in the next 12 months are actively looking for a passionate and motivated Security Architect with a developer mind set to work side by side with the platform engineers.
This is an opportunity to be the Security Architect in a team that is building modern, blockchain-based cloud platforms, delivering innovative solutions for a global leader in internet services with more than 1.2 billion members around the world.
MISSIONS
We are looking for a security architect who is interested in the « full stack” and is comfortable working on secure application design and development as well as cloud based infrastructure. We want you to be enthusiastic about “getting your hands dirty”, working as a security architect in the development team to ensure that « secure » solutions are being brought to market. You will have experience of being involved in projects from the beginning and striving to maximise the customer satisfaction by ensuring that security is built in to both the software and the development process.
You will have the opportunity to work on emerging blockchain frameworks and learn from the experienced blockchain engineers in the team. In addition to the work with the Rakuten Blockchain Lab, you will have the chance to directly influence multiple regional and global projects by working with various teams across Rakuten Europe.
Your responsibilities are :
*
Work side by side with Application and DevOps engineers to ensure security best practice is incorporated into design, development and testing of application and infrastructure code
Design, document and continuously improve the security related aspects of the Software Development Lifecycle
Evaluation, selection and implementation of the appropriate security tooling and frameworks
Contribute to the wider Rakuten group by promoting « Secure by default » development process
Directly influence multiple regional and global projects by working with various teams across Rakuten Europe
Encourage innovation, outside-of-the-box thinking and implementation of cutting-edge technologies
Technical stack:
In the Rakuten Blockchain Lab, we take full ownership of the end-to-end solution from inception through to production and beyond. Our platforms follow a microservice architecture where services are developed in Node.js and deployed as docker containers into a cloud based Kubernetes environment. There are integrations with relational databases, 3rd party APIs as well as specialised cryptographic services and of course blockchain networks
PROFILE
Essential:
*
5+ years of solid commercial development experience, working with Java or Node.js on Linux (experience with other object oriented or functional languages such as .NET, Python or Ruby will also be considered)
Full stack security architect familiar with how to build secure applications (secure coding best practices), securing the build and deployment process and securing the run time environment (OWASP Top 10)
Demonstrated experience of tools to detect potential issues or even better prevent issues from building these processes into the build asnd deployment pipeline
A basic understanding of blockchain fundamentals
Preferred:
*
Experience of application containers such as Docker and container orchestration technologies such as Docker Swarm or Google Kubernetes
Experience in delivering cloud based systems (i.e. deploying and running in AWS, Azure, OpenStack, Google Compute Environment, etc.)
Previous experience of working with blockchain frameworks such as Hyperledger Fabric or Multichain
Type d'emploi : Temps plein, CDI

About PayFit

With €14 Million raised in 2014 and €70 Million raised few weeks ago, PayFit digitizes and simplifies payroll management and HR processes for companies. Fast, intuitive and automated, the software-as-a-service solution allows employers to easily manage payroll on its own. Employees have access to a dedicated online space for payslips, leave requests, expense report entry and HR data.

Our mission is to support the digital transformation of business’s human resources through a reliable SaaS solution providing a unique experience to its users. We're starting our expansion beyond France into Spain, Germany, UK and Italy. This is a unique opportunity to build the simplest product possible with a massive reach across employees of thousands of European companies.

So far, 3000 companies trusted PayFit such as Big Mamma, Heetch, Gameloft, and Sellsy. Our offices are located in downtown Paris and we are now a team of 200 passionate PayFiters !

About the job

As a Design System Expert, you'll work directly in the Design System squad with 5 amazing engineers. You will own Midnight (Payfit Design System) from components design, to guidelines definitions. Your work will be key to make PayFit experience the best one, at scale.

Full-stack designer. You have a very strong level in UI design, you're in love with details and well finished interfaces, but you don't stop to the first look. You are also passionate about interaction design and components usability. You're obsess with both good UX and delightful UI.
Automation and consistency addict. You are convinced that automation, standardization and consistency are key to scale a product preserving the UX quality. You know how to build a design system and how to embed a design team in the process.
Design system advocate. You know how to define and standardize a design system, and how to establish best practices for software and design workflows. You are also a design system evangelist.
Team player. You love working in team, collaborating with engineers and building tools and documentation that will help designers to go further building the product. You can work hand in hand with both brand and product designers.
Leader. You own your projects, and embed people in the adventure. You are able to set process, documentation and communication to do so.

About you

Have already design and improve complex design systems
Experiences designing and shipping digital products and systems, not only websites
Ability to drive a project from conception to delivery
Organized and ambitious mindset to follow the development of the team
Product thinker, strong user advocate
Minimalism freak, and the taste for clean and simple products
Experience building a design system
Solid cross-functional collaboration and communication skills
Fluent in English

Bonus

Devsigner: you have knowledge and experience in front development languages
Any kind of coding skill, so that you can understand how engineers think their way around.

Why now ?

Key moment to join PayFit and help us shape a world-class design team: we just raised €70 Million and we are building a design dream team.
Competitive salary
Perks including free snacks and coffee, plus a sport room in our office
MacBooks are our standard, but we'll provide whatever equipment you need to help you get your job done

Do you see yourself in these words ?
Tell us more about you, what you’ve done and what you want to do.
We’ll be more than happy to meet you :)

AXA Group Solutions France - Paris (75)
date_publication:

Signaler cette offre d'emploi
description:
The headquarters of the AXA Group, based in Paris 8th and 17th, brings together the Group's corporate activities. It coordinates the various entities with the Group's strategy and is responsible for managing international projects. The headquarters has approximately 800 employees and is distinguished by its strong international culture (39 nationalities).
The position will report to Group head of Technology Innovation having locations in Paris 17th (France), on the EPFL campus in Lausanne (Switzerland) and in San Francisco (USA).
This new unit was created earlier in 2018 to contribute to a global strategic program of digital transformation and innovation to drive AXA towards becoming a tech-led company. It is not only an innovation unit but also, and above all, an engineering team helping AXA entities to “test and learn” their ideas leveraging emerging technologies and scale them across the group. We strongly believe in learning by doing and acknowledge we have the right to fail if we learn along the way. Our projects span from IT related topics, to computer vision, cognitive services, bots, drones and many other web/mobile initiatives. Our mission is to transform an idea into a first stage of execution. Once the feasibility and the value for users is confirmed, we scale it with the help of industrialization teams.
To reinforce our software engineering team , we are looking for a highly motivated software engineer, very aware of trends and groundbreaking startups. Years of experience is not what matters. We will value passion, openness, curiosity, respect, engagement, a “big picture vision” and for sure, someone who loves coding! We don’t intend to “play” with technology, we do really seek for impact.

MISSIONS
In a group of passionate software engineers, data scientists, actuaries and designers on a mission to invent the technologies, you will support the next generation of insurance products using Computational Law. We are responsible of the whole product development and we are looking for a passionate Software Engineer to reinforce our engineering team.
As an impact driven intrapreneur, you will help us develop prototypes and products to be deployed in production.
As a Software Engineer, you will have the following responsibilities:
Develop software prototypes and products that will be used in production
Constantly improve the team knowledge with technology watch, white papers, position papers, … and promote new ideas
Evangelize your peers within AXA about the solutions you develop and contribute to the Data and Technology Innovation Team reputation
Qualifications
PROFILE
The ideal candidate will have previous experience in a start-up or in a tech-driven company, with an entrepreneur mindset, meaning a wide understanding of technologies coupled with a sense of strategy and business impact.
We expect you to be autonomous and able to learn. The projects duration spans from 1 week to 6 months. Be ready to switch regularly: new field, new technology, new methodology, … and adapt to the new situation.

From 2 years of experience
Bachelor’s or graduate degrees in Computer Science or similar
Fluent in English, French or German a plus any other languages
SKILLS
• Excited about building software prototypes.
Excited about learning new technologies on short notice.
Expert in at least one of this domains:
- Natural Language Processing
Web development
System/Linux development
• Fluent in at least 1 programming language, C++ / node.js / python preferred
Git
Unit testing
Passionate about technology.
Visionary about new technology applications

Who you are:

• Excellent written and verbal English communication. You will do most of your writing in English. Speaking will be English (mandatory) or French.
Nice to have: fluent in Hindu or Mandarin or German.
Ability to challenge others and challenge him or herself
Ability to work in an international and cross functional team
Strong collaboration skills and team player
Comfortable in a fast-paced agile driven environment
Demonstrating openness and curiosity
Considering new challenges as an opportunity
See solutions before problems
Startup experience
In general, we are looking for someone with raw smarts who can easily learn the specific skills needed to do his/her job.

If you feel like you have the enthusiasm for this position, apply! During the interview, candidates will be asked about their vision of software engineering and their knowledge of the digital industry: be prepared! A warm-up in the cover letter will be highly appreciated.

A propos d'AXA
Aimeriez-vous vous lever chaque jour motivé(e) par une mission inspirante et travailler en équipe pour permettre de protéger les personnes et leurs proches?
Chez AXA nous avons l’ambition de mener la transformation de notre métier.
Nous cherchons des personnes talentueuses ayant une expérience diversifiée, qui pensent différemment, et qui veulent faire partie de cette transformation passionnante en challengeant le statu quo et faire d’AXA – marque globale leader et une des sociétés les plus innovantes dans notre secteur – une entreprise encore plus performante et responsable.
Dans un monde en perpétuelle évolution et avec une présence dans 64 pays, nos 165 000 salariés et distributeurs privilégiés anticipent le changement pour offrir des services et solutions adaptés aux besoins actuels et futurs de nos 107 millions de clients.
AXA IT – Application Products Department : partenaire du Groupe AXA
Avec plus de 700 collaborateurs dans le monde, AXA IT – Application Products Department a pour principale mission de proposer des solutions informatiques et digitales aux entités du Groupe AXA.
A ce titre, AXA IT – Application Products Department déploie les projets et solutions qui lui sont confiés pour accompagner le développement de ses clients, selon les ambitions informatiques et les lignes de métier des entités du Groupe.
Grâce à des équipes présentes en France, Allemagne, Espagne, Portugal, Suisse, UK, Asie et US, mais aussi un support au Maroc, Mexique, en Belgique et en Italie, AXA IT – Application Products Department est le partenaire informatique privilégié d’AXA.
Entreprise responsable, AXA IT – Application Products Department s’engage par des actions concrètes auprès de ses collaborateurs, clients, fournisseurs mais aussi envers la société et la protection de l’environnement.
Pourquoi nous rejoindre ?

description:
The headquarters of the AXA Group, based in Paris 8th and 17th, brings together the Group's corporate activities. It coordinates the various entities with the Group's strategy and is responsible for managing international projects. The headquarters has approximately 800 employees and is distinguished by its strong international culture (39 nationalities).
“Great ideas are worth nothing without execution”.
The position will report to Group head of Technology Innovation having locations in Paris 17th (France), on the EPFL campus in Lausanne (Switzerland) and in San Francisco (USA). This new unit was created earlier in 2018 to contribute to a global strategic program of digital transformation and innovation to drive AXA towards becoming a tech-led company.
It is not only an innovation unit but also, and above all, an engineering team helping AXA entities to “test and learn” their ideas leveraging emerging technologies and scale them across the group. We strongly believe in learning by doing and acknowledge we have the right to fail if we learn along the way.
Our projects span from IT related topics, to computer vision, cognitive services, bots, drones and many other web/mobile initiatives. Our mission is to transform an idea into a first stage of execution. Once the feasibility and the value for users is confirmed, we scale it with the help of industrialization teams.
DOMAINS OF RESPONSABILITY
We are the Tech Innovation team of AXA Group. We are a group of passionate software engineers, data scientists, actuaries and designers on a mission to identify or invent the technologies that will support the transformation of insurance.

As a Product owner , you'll work with AXA people from Engineering, Product, Actuaries, Distribution teams. Your role is to deliver innovation solutions that will redefine the way our industry is operating, leveraging the latest tech innovations.

MISSIONS
We are responsible for the delivery of some innovation solutions and we are looking for a passionate product owner to reinforce our team. The ideal candidate will have experience in innovation and understand how to mature an idea. Before becoming a product (group asset), most new initiatives are managed more likely as projects in the first few weeks/months before we are convinced it could become a product. We expect our future colleague to make this difference while making sure smooth transitions/evolutions are planned appropriately (methodologies, ….). As an impact driven intrapreneur, you will have the following responsibilities:
Initially :
Coordinate internal resources and third parties/vendors for the flawless execution of projects
Assist in the definition of project scope and objectives, involving all relevant stakeholders and ensuring technical feasibility
Ensure resource availability and allocation and execution.
Meet with clients (AXA entities in countries where the group is present) to identify which projects can scale and become group assets
Then :
Developing and adapting products vision.
Managing a portfolio of products, develop new products and enhance existing ones.
Managing the product backlog and define priorities
Evangelize your peers within AXA about the solutions you develop and contribute to the Data and Technology Innovation Team reputation
If you feel like you have the enthusiasm for this position, apply!
During the interview, candidates will be asked about their vision on managing a project and their knowledge of the digital industry: be prepared! A warm-up in the cover letter will be highly appreciated.

Qualifications
PROFIL

The ideal candidate will have previous experience in a start-up or in a tech-driven company, with an entrepreneur mindset, meaning a good understanding of technologies coupled with a strong sense of strategy and business impact.
We expect you to be autonomous and able to learn.

Master’s Degree in appropriate field of study or equivalent work experience
5-6 years of project management or related experience.
SKILLS
• Ability to explain complex concepts clearly to technical and non-technical audiences
Proven working experience in project/product management with a focus on software products and technologies. Experience in developing Innovative Insurance IT products is a plus.
Excellent client-facing and internal communication skills
Demonstrated ability to achieve strategic goals in an innovative and fast-paced environment, and to evolve product strategy based on research, data and industry trends; excellent problem-solving, organizational and analytical skills.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Solid organizational skills including attention to detail and multitasking skills
You have a bias toward action and can break down complex problems into steps that drive product development.
Passionate about technology and visionary about new technology applications
Excellent written and verbal English communication. You will do most of your writing in English. Speaking will be English (mandatory) or French. German, a plus.
Ability to work in an international and cross functional organization as a team player
Startup experience a plus
In general, we are looking for someone with raw smarts who can easily learn the specific skills needed to do his/her job.

A propos d'AXA
Aimeriez-vous vous lever chaque jour motivé(e) par une mission inspirante et travailler en équipe pour permettre de protéger les personnes et leurs proches?
Chez AXA nous avons l’ambition de mener la transformation de notre métier.
Nous cherchons des personnes talentueuses ayant une expérience diversifiée, qui pensent différemment, et qui veulent faire partie de cette transformation passionnante en challengeant le statu quo et faire d’AXA – marque globale leader et une des sociétés les plus innovantes dans notre secteur – une entreprise encore plus performante et responsable.
Dans un monde en perpétuelle évolution et avec une présence dans 64 pays, nos 165 000 salariés et distributeurs privilégiés anticipent le changement pour offrir des services et solutions adaptés aux besoins actuels et futurs de nos 107 millions de clients.
AXA IT – Application Products Department : partenaire du Groupe AXA
Avec plus de 700 collaborateurs dans le monde, AXA IT – Application Products Department a pour principale mission de proposer des solutions informatiques et digitales aux entités du Groupe AXA.
A ce titre, AXA IT – Application Products Department déploie les projets et solutions qui lui sont confiés pour accompagner le développement de ses clients, selon les ambitions informatiques et les lignes de métier des entités du Groupe.
Grâce à des équipes présentes en France, Allemagne, Espagne, Portugal, Suisse, UK, Asie et US, mais aussi un support au Maroc, Mexique, en Belgique et en Italie, AXA IT – Application Products Department est le partenaire informatique privilégié d’AXA.

description:
Structural Engineer Specialist Concrete and steel structure (M/F)

Company Summary
TechnipFMC is a global oil and gas leader, specialized in subsea, onshore, offshore, and surface technologies. Our mission: to enhance the performance of world’s energy industry. How we do it: by constantly challenging conventions and investing in our 37 000+ employees, across 48 countries. At TechnipFMC, we aim to offer an inspiring working experience: tackling some of the most complex technical and engineering challenges in the world in collaboration with a truly global team.

Introduction to the Job

At TechnipFMC, we deliver critical projects of a scale, scope and difficulty that you simply won’t find anywhere else. We are looking for a Structural Engineer Specialist Concrete and steel structure (M/F) who can join our multicultural team in Paris.

As a specialist in concrete and steel structural design, you will be in charge of the design and calculation of the works in the frame of a project. You will work in a design team and report to your business manager. Depending on the technical and budgetary requirements you will need to:
Write basic design data and specifications
Set and define the conceptual principles for the project
Collect and analyse data from plot team and other specialties and in particular the loads
Validate the modelling principles and in particular the action combinations and the loads factors
Make the pre-sizing calculation notes upstream of the design offices
Validate the drawings drawn up by the design office for the Detail Engineering subcontractors
Assist design centres, suppliers and construction companies for the structural design under their responsibilities
Check and validate the structural calculation notes issued by design centres, suppliers and construction companies
You are meant for this job if you have/ are:
Graduate of an engineering school or a university with speciality Civil Engineering/ Public works, you have a first experience in structural design office, preferably in the industrial field.
You practice the current calculation software (StaadPro, SACS,…) and you are aware of international Codes and standards.
Mobile for travel abroad
Fluent in English
Asset
Technical knowledge, ability to analyse, autonomy and relational capabilities
Your future at TechnipFMC
Potential career path, if possible
Global mobility opportunities if relevant
Training and development
Diverse and international team if relevant
Learn more about TechnipFMC

Learn more about us and find other open positions at our Career Page.

Follow us on LinkedIn for company updates.
