il y a 30+ jours
- Continuer pour postuler
Signaler cette offre d'emploi
description:
We are looking for an Engineering Manager to join our Product and Tech team in Paris. The team focuses on building our educational platform to make our students successful.

As a leader in this part of the organization, technical leadership and a background in software development are important to be able to challenge and grow our engineers. However, the role is at the same time people-first and technology first.
Your primary responsibility is to the people on your team: ensuring that your team members are growing, performing well, doing valuable work and generally having a great time at OpenClassrooms. You’ll work together with other leads to build strong teams, provide technical leadership, and ensure we have a world class engineering organization.
You’ll also have plenty of opportunity to work across the larger organization on different challenging projects.
REPORTING LINE

Reports to the CTO.

RESPONSIBILITIES

The overall responsibilities of the Engineering Manager, are:
Work with engineers to grow their technical, interpersonal, and leadership skills, and ensure they have the right challenges and necessary context to make use of them.
Build and manage a team of developers focused on addressing our educational vision and ambition.
Participate in discussions about software architecture.
Advocate and advance modern software development practices within the team (Clean Code, TDD, CI/CD, test automation etc)
Help develop and evangelize great engineering practices across all of OpenClassrooms
Work closely with teams, product owners, agile coaches and other stakeholders to ensure we deliver world-class promotional courses, programs and platforms
Work with the recruiting team to attract, hire, onboard and retain diverse top talent


You are experienced in leading, coaching and mentoring software developers.
You have excellent communication skills with which to build relationships, trust, and respect, and are able to leverage this to grow people and the organization.
You love developing and growing people.
You are knowledgeable and passionate about current development best practices.
You have demonstrated strong leadership skills while working with engineers.
You are excited about making culture choices that positively impact the team.
You have familiarity and experience operating in complex tech organizations that work with a product that handles users at scale, making use of agile methodologies and tools.

REQUIREMENT
The ideal candidate will have 6+ years of related professional experience
Bachelor degree
HIRING PROCESS
The journey starts with a phone interview and a meeting with Audrey, Recruitment Manager then a meeting Romain, CTO. Then we plan face to face meetings with a several people from the Tech team and 2 people from other teams (Education, Marketing,....). You will be asked to provide us with 5 professional references contact detail.

Feel free to get the gist of who we are : https://openclassrooms.com/courses/how-do-we-work-at-openclassrooms

WHAT WE OFFER
Pass Navigo paid by OpenClassrooms
Health insurance for free (“Mutuelle” monthly fee entirely paid by OpenClassrooms)
Meal vouchers (Employer contribution at the max authorized by law)
Access to gym for free (Gymlib paid by OpenClassrooms)
Unlimited days off and a 1.000€ premium once a year for 15+ days off taken
Access to remote working
A company MacBook
A work environment and a strong culture built on agility, openness, respect and high quality
OpenClassrooms is a French hyper-growth company eligible to the French Tech Visa program. That means, for foreign candidates, benefiting from the accelerated procedure to apply for a "Talent Passport" residence permit. There is also a simplified "accompanying family" procedure available for spouse and dependent minor children. More information here: https://visa.lafrenchtech.com/4/french-tech-visa-for-employees

We highly value a workplace free from discrimination and we strongly believe that diversity of experience, perspectives, and background will lead to a better environment for our employees and a better product for our students. This is something we value deeply and we encourage everyone to come be a part of revolutionizing Education.
Working at OpenClassrooms means joining a dynamic and stimulating team, take up challenges, meet awesome people every week, and change the world, a little bit, everyday!

meta1:
Proposal Engineer
Pall Danaher397 avis - Saint-Germain-en-Laye (78)
date_publication:
Danaher - il y a 30+ jours
- Continuer pour postuler
Signaler cette offre d'emploi
description:
About Us
Find what drives you on a team with a 70+ year history of being recognized for discovery, determination, and innovation. As a global leader in high-tech filtration, separation, and purification, Pall Corporation thrives on helping our customers protect people. Our portfolio is broad, so if your interests lie along the spectrum of Life Sciences to Industrial, you’ll find a rewarding role here. Our career opportunities are as diverse as our products and they are all focused on creating better lives and a better planet. At Pall, we believe that innovation is our legacy, our privilege, and our destiny. If that resonates with you, join us!
Description
We are currently seeking a Proposal Engineer to support our growing business.
Position Objective:
This exciting opportunity is to join our team in France as a Proposal Engineer and you will specifically look after Pall’s Fluid Technology & Asset Protection markets. You will be responsible for providing technical, commercial support and provide quotations to external sales, customers, Pall’s business partners for selected countries within the Western Europe North Africa area.
You will contribute to our double-digit growth in the region, working into a very dynamic environment to serve our multimillion of addressable market for the Industrial Manufacturing, Oil & Gas, Chemical, Refinery, Polymer, …
You will provide support, proposing equivalence, design & costing and prepare the offer, to FTAP Sales & channel partners for some WENA territories, As capital project workload allows, and when demand requires, to provide quotation and technical query support to the regional FTAP Sales team
Role and Duties:
Responsible for review and interpretation of customer’s technical specifications, datasheet, and discussion/development of those documents with the customer.
Provide design & costing support to Pall FTAP sales engineers, sales account managers & channel partners in the Western Europe North Africa , initially for made-to-order pressure vessel projects, based on client specifications and Pall applications experience, including preparing RFQ packs for Sourcing and evaluating quotations from potential vendors
Use information to find equivalence, select, design, size and cost appropriate Pall solution to offer customer quotations
Provide technical and commercial support to Pall Sales End User Team, to customer and business partners directly. You will act as the intermediary with Customer Services, Operations Dept.; Plants, Sales Administration, Sourcing and Contract and Legal Dpt.
Performs appropriate calculations to develop a process design and the right solution that will meet customer requirements. Selects technology and equipment that can support the process design.
Engage with Sales teams and clients to develop and present solutions in a timely fashion, and support sales in securing orders
Contract review of orders and ensures effective handover of “ready to go” projects to operations on receipt of order
Provide administrative and technical support to Customer Service using ANAND, EPMS, SAP
Provide technical and commercial support to customers, channel partners and field-based Sales Team for Pall Fluid Technology & Asset Protection markets
You will be required to communicate directly with some clients, and, on spot basis to travel supporting the sales, meeting our customers to present our solution and review customers’ clarification
Qualifications
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical or Chemical
Experience in a similar position is preferred (Technical inside sales or Sales Engineer developing technical competences)
Fluent in English and French, additional language is desirable (Spanish, Italian, Dutch)
Understanding of the design & function of Pall filter technologies used in FTAP markets, including an appreciation of the fundamental requirements for pressure vessel design & manufacture
Able to interpret detailed client technical specifications
Able to prepare simple General Assembly drawings and Process & Instrumentation Diagrams using CAD software (Autodesk Inventor, CATIA or similar) is a must
Able to communicate technical issues clearly and effectively to Pall teams, clients and potential vendors across the EMEA region
Understand the commercial implications of product selection & design decisions, including risk identification & mitigation
Identification of technical “red lines” during negotiations with clients and vendors
Good interpersonal skills
A positive attitude with the ability to embrace change within a busy sales office environment, and take ownership of issues until fully resolved
Able to work as part of a team while managing own work load to meet deadlines; good attention to detail; appreciation of the basics of project management
Knowledge of Microsoft Office programs, Outlook desirable, CRM, SAP
Interested? Join the PALL Team!
If you would like to explore this exciting opportunity further and find out more about our competitive salary package, please do not hesitate to contact us!

Diversity & Inclusion
At Danaher, we are dedicated to building and sustaining a truly diverse and inclusive culture. These are not just words on a page—Diversity and Inclusion is a top priority for the company, and it ties deeply to each of our core values. Danaher Corporation and all Danaher Companies are equal opportunity employers that evaluate applicants without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, age, marital status, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or other characteristics protected by law.


Danaher Corporation Overview
Danaher is a global science & technology innovator committed to helping our customers solve complex challenges and improve quality of life worldwide. Our world class brands are leaders in some of the most demanding and attractive industries, including life sciences, medical diagnostics, environmental and applied solutions. Our globally diverse team of 71,000 associates is united by a common culture and operating system, the Danaher Business System, which serves as our competitive advantage. We generated $19.9B in revenue last year. We are ranked #162 on the Fortune 500 and our stock has outperformed the S&P 500 by more than 5,200% over 25 years.
At Danaher, you can build a career in a way no other company can duplicate. Our brands allow us to offer dynamic careers across multiple industries. We're innovative, fast-paced, results-oriented, and we win. We need talented people to keep winning. Here you'll learn how DBS is used to shape strategy, focus execution, align our people, and create value for customers and shareholders. Come join our winning team.
Danaher is committed to competitive compensation that typically has key components including base salary, variable annual incentive compensation based on personal and company performance, and long-term incentive.
Organization
: Pall
Job Function
: Sales
Primary Location
: EMEA-Western Europe-France-Saint-Germain-en-Laye
Schedule
: Full-time

meta1:
Technical Writer
PayFit - Paris (75)
date_publication:
il y a 30+ jours
- Continuer pour postuler
Signaler cette offre d'emploi
description:
Who are we?

PayFit simplifies payroll management and HR processes for SMBs. We have built a fast, intuitive and automated SaaS solution to help business owners and HR professionals save time and money allowing them to refocus and what really matters: their employees. Through PayFit, employees have a dedicated access for their payslips and are able to manage efficiently their leave and expense requests. To build such a solution, we have created our own programming language: JetLang. Thanks to JetLang we were able to code Labour Code and collective agreements, and today we continue to add new features.

We have set ourselves a mission to support the digital transformation of HR management through our ever growing range of product features and services. We have a strong presence in France since 2015 and have been quickly growing in Germany, Spain and the UK. More than 3000 companies such as Big Mamma, MinuteBuzz or Sellsy to name a few already trust us. Over 300 PayFiters have already joined the adventure and we have raised 95M€ to keep growing.

Your missions

PayFit is looking for an experienced Technical Writer to produce high-quality documentation that enhances our internal developer experience and contributes to the overall success of our products. Most importantly, you should specialize in developer-focused documentation and other highly technical deliverables. You will closely collaborate closely with engineers, product managers, and product designer to create documentation and products that make developers more productive at PayFit. The ideal candidate has excellent communications skills and a passion for improving developer experiences through robust documentation.

Your mission will include:
drive documentation planning with engineering teams,
foster a documentation-minded culture among engineering teams and provide technical edits and direction to contributors,
work as part of a team to produce conceptual, how-to, and API reference documentation for PayFit products,
organize and audit the documentation library to keep information relevant over time,
help promote company-wide knowledge sharing practices,
identify gaps in documentation and work with engineering teams to resolve them!

This job has been tailored for you if...

you have experience as a technical writer or information developer,
experience with writing developer documentation,
experience with the software development life cycle and Agile processes,
good foundation in programming, API design, and software architecture,
experience with source control and bug-tracking systems,
experience using multiple documentation tools to write, format, manage, and publish high-quality content,
working knowledge of HTML and CSS,
ability to read and understand code samples in a variety of languages.

Bonus Points
degree in English, Technical Writing, Computer Science, or a related field highly desirable,
ability to write example code in JavaScript,
comfortable using the Mac Terminal,
UX writing and research experience,
experience working with static site generators like Jekyll.

We are meant to work together if...

you are a real team player who want to build a big success story with us,
you speak both french and english fluently and you want to work in an international and dynamic environment,
you have a strong interpersonal and communication skills,
you want to learn, improve and gain responsibility.

What we offer ❤️

an amazing working environment, designed for kindness and blossoming,
an attractive remuneration package,
an international and dynamic team with the opportunity to visit our different offices (Paris, Berlin, Barcelona, London),
remote friendly policy,
a gym inside the office and Gymlib subscription with preferential rate,
regular team and global events,
restaurant tickets,
4 weeks of paternity leave (fully covered) and 20 weeks of maternity leave (fully covered),
Alan insurance (60% covered by PayFit),
great coffee, fruits, snacks, foosball, MPG Teams or even team yoga classes,
MacBooks are our standard, but we'll provide whatever equipment you need to help you get your job done!
Hiring process ️

1️⃣ Initial call with the hiring manager
2️⃣ Technical call
3️⃣ On-site meetings with the direct team
4️⃣ BBQ test to share a drink with the entire PayFit team (no sausage, no test )

Want to know more about our epic team?

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=b0uqNUw2JIk
We are looking for passionate and innovative people who want to build the next big success story with us! Do you describe yourself with these words? Do you want to join an incredible adventure?
Tell us who you are, what you’ve done and what you want to do. We’ll be more than happy to meet you :)

meta1:
Life Insurance Consultant - RPC Consulting
Reynolds Porter Chamberlain - Paris (75)
date_publication:
il y a 30+ jours
- Continuer pour postuler
Signaler cette offre d'emploi
description:
Who we are looking for
Do you want to join the team that will transform life insurance actuarial modelling using our cutting edge software?
Do you want to address the modelling challenges faced by insurers?
Do you enjoy working on client facing projects as part of a team?
If so, and you have a Life insurance background we will be interested in speaking with you.
About the role
As a member of our growing Life team you will play a vital role in meeting the expectations of our clients, and will be involved in delivering high quality cutting-edge life insurance actuarial modelling solutions.
There will be great emphasis on helping clients re-engineer existing modelling estates to meet their pricing, valuation, reporting and capital modelling needs. You will be part of a team who are developing, implementing and testing models in either joint client-RPC collaborations or full RPC teams.
You will be responsible for the preparation of data and the technical delivery of model development and testing. You will use your knowledge and experience to provide input into decision making and by using out software platform, Tyche, you will advise clients about solutions and strategies for their business. You may use your understanding of the industry and the different market segments to provide support and advice to clients and to deliver commercial solutions that drive the business forward.
Candidate profile
Educated to degree level with a minimum of a 2:1 or equivalent qualification and ideally working towards an actuarial qualification with experience of:
Technical skills:
Modelling: gained at either another consulting firm or from within a modelling team at an Insurance company;
Knowledge of MoSes or Prophet Software or knowledge with other modelling tools such as C#, VBA, SQL, etc.
Some experience of Life insurance modelling;
Strong analytical skills with a logical and thorough approach to define and solve a problem;
Consulting skills:
Self-starter who is adaptable and can deal with ambiguity in order to make things happen;
Excellent organisational skills with the ability to work under pressure and effectively prioritise and execute tasks;
Enjoy working in a team orientated, collaborative environment;
Standard working hours are 09.30 to 5.30pm with additional hours required during times of increased activity. We are open to applications from candidates who require flexible working patterns.
Before you meet us, get to know us
Located in our prestigious offices in London and more recently Paris, RPC Consulting delivers modelling and software solutions combined with consultancy support to the insurance industry. We help those in insurance and related sectors do things better. We deploy our team of highly skilled actuaries, accountants, MBAs and PhDs - all of whom specialise in insurance - to help our clients get ahead.
We have developed our own proprietary modelling platform, Tyche, to solve this industry need. With Tyche we are able to tackle the most challenging of modelling problems and provide companies with solutions that can be implemented into their daily business discussions by leveraging affordable “commodity” hardware and ground breaking advances in parallel software design.
RPC Consulting has a fresh, dynamic work atmosphere, but you will benefit from its relationship with, and therefore the security of, a larger organisation, RPC. The firm now has over 80 people bringing deep insurance knowledge, actuarial science, data science and software development skills to a growing client base both in the UK, French and US markets.
Inclusion and Diversity
People are at the heart of everything we do. We want every member of our team to feel welcome, valued and confident they'll achieve their career objectives here. It's the minimum our employees should expect of us - and it's good for business, too.
We've put into place a number of initiatives and development programmes to ensure that our population is as reflective of society as possible, both internally with allies@RPC & RPC RAIN, and externally, we partner with the 30% Club, Business in the Community, Cityparents, Stonewall, InterLaw and University of Law.

meta1:
Lead Full stack developer (H/F)
AXA General Insurance2,274 avis - Paris (75)
date_publication:
il y a 30+ jours
- Continuer pour postuler
Signaler cette offre d'emploi
description:
Lead Full stack developer (H/F) (190007OL)
PRIMARY LOCATION : FRANCE-75-PARIS-PARIS
ORGANIZATION : Group IT
CONTRACT TYPE : Regular
SCHEDULE : Full-time
DESCRIPTION
AXA SERVICES
AXA Services is an IT solutions company delivering services to the AXA Group & to
its banking and insurance companies. We develop and operate transverse business
solutions at international scale.
Working for the different companies of the AXA group, AXA Services has a worldwide
action field with offices in 7 countries.
Our mission is to shape, build and maintain the shared solutions of AXA Group. The
aim of these services is to sustain business development, reduce time to market, &
generate savings.

CONTEXT
Test Platform solutions act as efficient accelerator for many projects within AXA Group, reducing time to market and helping better manage the quality along the software life cycle.
Test Platform solutions vary from on-the-shelf products hosted on premise or deployed on the cloud, to home-built platforms answering AXA specific needs.
In this context, we are looking for a Tech Lead engineer who will be the technical referent of Test Platform team and:
Guide test Platform developers in building features with the right DEV approach
Perform early investigations and coordinate remediation in case of incident on Test Platform Production environments
Contribute to some OPS activities
Act as level 3 support for test Platform solutions

MAIN TASKS AND RESPONSIBILITIES
The Tech Lead will perform the following activities:
Deliver DEV expertise and guide nearshore or offshore developers building solutions (based on Java, SQL Databases, Front-end & Back-end, OpenShift)
Review built code and perform regular retrospectives
Help developers build solutions in CI-CD context
Launch and coordinate investigations on production incidents
Perform some Ops actions at application level on production
Accompany test platforms end users as Level 3 support
On the shelf Tools in the scope : Microfocus ALM – UFT – Perf Center – SV, SeleniumBOX, Perfecto Mobile, Talend, PowerBI
QUALIFICATIONS
PROFESSIONAL AND
TECHNICAL SKILLS

Technical skills:
Must Have:
FullStack developer: Minimum of 4 years significant experience in development field (FrontEnd + BackEnd)
Proficiency with fundamental FrontEnd languages such as HTML, CSS and JavaScript
Familiarity with JavaScript frameworks such as Angular JS & React
Proficiency with server-side languages such as Java, PHP and .Net
Familiarity with database technology such as MySQL, PostreSQL & Oracle
Familiarity with test automation scripting : Selenium
Proficiency with WebServices (REST, SOAP)
Proficiency with Unix/Dos commands

Nice to Have:
Jenkins
Openshift, Amazon cloud
Azure cloud
Docker
Kibana
Microfocus HPe ALM/QC, UFT, PC, SV
SeleniumBOX
Perfecto
PowerBI
Jira / Xray

Non-Technical Skills:
Must Have:
Strong organizational skills
Good problem-solving skills
Coordination and communication
Good analytical skills
Ability to work in a multicultural context.
Experience of working alongside internal and external providers in an international context
Ability to work as a group
Ability to instill confidence
Rigor and ability to synthesize
Sense of commitment
Proactivity and results orientation

Language
English: Independent user (B1 in Common European Framework of Reference for Languages)

ABOUT AXA
Would you like to wake up every day driven and inspired by our noble mission and to work together as one global team to empower people to live a better life? Here at AXA we strive to lead the transformation of our industry. We are looking for talented individuals who come from varied backgrounds, think differently and want to be part of this exciting transformation by challenging the status quo so we can push AXA - a leading global brand and one of the most innovative companies in our industry - onto even greater things.
In a fast-evolving world and with a presence in 64 countries, our 166,000 employees and exclusive distributors anticipate change to offer services and solutions tailored to the current and future needs of our 103 million customers.

To support our business strategy and digital transformation, AXA is building a new Group Security Practice to ensure a coordinated response to the increasing cyber security threat, enable risk decisions to be made consistently across the organization and establish sustainable security capabilities that are integrated with the business.
Our vision for Information Security is to ‘protect our stakeholders by securing our information assets, managing our cyber risk and enabling business strategies in an efficient and effective way, fully supported by executive leadership and underpinned by all AXA employees’.

WHAT WE OFFER
At AXA, we lead a an HR policy that encourages diversity, maintains your professional and private life balance and accelerates the skills and career development : promotion of diversity, remuneration policy, training device, ... Discover everything that makes AXA an employer of choice.
Whatever your job is, we strive to offer you career opportunities. Our goal is to develop your skills to support the transformation of our changing business.

Au sein de la Direction Exécutive Réseau et Systèmes d'Information / Direction SI Connaissance Client et Corporate et plus précisément au sein de l’activité Data Publication, vous intégrez l'équipe dans le cadre de la gestion de projets de Data Engineering.
A ce titre, vos missions seront les suivantes :
Effectuer les pré-études des projets Data en vous assurant de l'exhaustivité des impacts et de la cohérence de la solution de bout en bout
Mettre en œuvre l'ensemble des techniques et procédés permettant de collecter, de nettoyer, d'organiser, de synthétiser et de modéliser efficacement les données provenant de diverses sources
Participer à la définition de la donnée et à la structuration de son cycle de vie dans le respect de la réglementation en vigueur (RGPD)
Etre garant(e) de l'accès qualitatif aux données.
Documenter (référencement, normes, qualification, dictionnaire de données...) afin de faciliter l'utilisation de la donnée par les équipes métiers et son exploitation (scripts, procédures de reprise,...) par les équipes de Run
Utiliser les outils pertinents au suivi et au maintien de la qualité des données de bout-en-bout de l'intégration jusqu'à la mise à disposition des utilisateurs (Recette, Dédoublonnage, Suivi de QoD...).
Enregistrer les incidents dans un journal afin d'identifier les correctifs à mettre en place.
Optimiser les performances en restant en veille sur les métriques de production.
Prendre des mesures préventives pour assurer des traitements stables et sécurisés en tenant compte des problématiques de gestion de capacité et de sécurité de l'information
Accompagner les utilisateurs dans leurs démarches d'exploration et d'analyse de données
En tant que Responsable Projets Data, vous :
Etes en contact direct avec les métiers pour comprendre, challenger leurs besoins et apporter des réponses techniques pertinentes
Etes garant(e) de la conduite des projets en application du process de projets Data, du suivi du planning et de l'intégralité des livrables (EB, actions, CR,...), de la livraison des productions selon le planning établi
Assurez la coordination et l'animation d'acteurs issus d'environnements différents
Animez la communication autour du projet et la restitution à la hiérarchie

Profil
Responsable de projet BI / Data Engineer Senior (>=5 ans) H/F De formation BAC+5, école d'Ingénieur ou équivalent avec une spécialisation systèmes d'information.
Vous justifiez d'une expérience significative de 5 à 10 ans en pilotage projets et appréciez travailler dans un milieu opérationnel et technique notamment grâce à votre aisance relationnelle et votre capacité d’adaptation.
Vous avez une bonne vision des solutions et usages de la Data.
Vous avez des capacités d'analyse, de synthèse et rédactionnelles, êtes orienté(e) solutions et résultats

Environnement technique :
Ecosystème Apache Hadoop : Spark, Hive, Kafka streaming, AirFlow
SGBD : Teradata, Oracle, MySQL, PostgreSQL, SQL Server
Langage script : SQL, Python, Shell Unix
ETL : informatica, Talend

description:
Who we are

Sqreen is the industry’s first provider of Application Security Management (ASM), unifying application security needs into one single platform, giving over 600 companies unprecedented visibility and protection in production. Sqreen enables developers, operations and security teams to scale their security without impacting engineering velocity.

The company was founded by security veterans who previously led the offensive security team at Apple. Sqreen is backed by Greylock Partners, Y Combinator, Alven and Point Nine.

For more information, please visit www.sqreen.com.

What we need your help with

As a key part of our product engineering team, you'll be in charge of the direct management of 6-8 software engineers. Reporting to Beth, our talented Director of Engineering, you'll work closely with our CTO and Head of Product to deliver our ambitious 2019 roadmap and ensure our product engineers have everything they need to succeed and grow.

This role will suit someone who defines success as enabling others to succeed, and who sees management as being at the service of a team, not the other way around.

Day to day you'll:

> Run 1:1 meetings with each member of your team
> Set goals aligned with company objectives
> Give feedback and act as a coach and mentor to your team
> Ensure team health, knowledge sharing and alignment across the broader Sqreen team
> Add value to technical discussions without acting as the decision-maker
> Enable your team to deliver timely product engineering solutions to meet user needs
> Actively contribute to building a healthy, collaborative modern engineering and organisational culture
> Stay close to our developer community and seek and contribute best practises via regular conferences and meetups

Who you are

At Sqreen, we understand that management is not engineering, so we'd love to hear from you if you have:

> Low ego and high emotional intelligence (EQ)
> Excellent communication skills, capable of adapting your style to different people and situations
> A love for growing and developing people and a track record of doing it
> Knowledge and passion for software development
> Fluent spoken and written English (our working language)
> Experience working in a high-growth early-stage startup (bonus)
> A product mindset and enjoy working with people outside your area of expertise - every Sqreener collaborates daily with Engineering, Sales, Support and other teams

Sqreeners come from all corners of the globe and all walks of life. Diversity is important to us, so if you're unsure, please apply!

Why work for Sqreen

> Be part of an incredibly talented team who are passionate about democratising security
> Join at a crucial stage of our development with a huge amount of runway for you to add value
> Contribute tangibly to our core product, bringing value to our customers each and every week
> Join a product-focused company, with a deep commitment to learning
> Ask for any book you like and enjoy a week per quarter to focus on a side project of your choice
> Attend great conferences all year round
> Enjoy premium health insurance, healthy snacks every day and coached Sqreenfit sessions every fortnight
> A relaxed working environment with regular social activities
> Beautiful 'Sqreenhouses' in central Paris (Sentier), and San Francisco (SoMa)
> An international, English speaking work environment with the opportunity to visit SF

Sqreen participates actively in the tech and security ecosystem in Paris and San Francisco so you'll have access to some of the most interesting and talented people from our network and beyond!

Dashlane - Paris (75)

description:
Dashlane is a password manager and online security app for everyone who lives, works, and plays on the internet. With a simple, intuitive design and patented security technology, Dashlane keeps passwords, personal data, and payment info at people's fingertips, so they can stop guessing passwords and wasting time filling out forms. Dashlane has helped over 11 million users in 180 countries manage and secure their digital identities and has enabled over $17 billion in e-commerce transactions. Our team in Paris, New York and Lisbon is united by our passion for password security and the belief that our success is built on the diverse backgrounds of every member.

You will be based in Paris, France.

The Role

Dashlane is looking for a Release Engineer in Paris to support our growth. The primary purpose of this role is to help us scale and industrialize our current multi-platform release pipeline that enables our product development teams to own and run their release processes.

You will support all phases of the software life-cycle - including multi-platform build systems, continuous integration, crash reporting, code coverage, analysis tools, and test environments, to allow our code and features to be released in a streamlined and automated way, from development to production.

In collaboration with the engineering teams and in an agile and cross-platform environment, you will design, implement, document, improve and maintain a solid release infrastructure that optimizes our development speed, accelerates our agile delivery cadence, while still providing a very high degree of stability and reliability for our customers.

At Dashlane you will:
Support and improve our tools for continuous integration (CI) and continuous delivery (CD), in a cross-platform environment (windows, mac, android, ios, web)
Improve and maintain our automated release pipelines that package, test and deploy code
Contribute to defining and documenting our code branching, merge strategies and release procedures
Improve and adapt our release processes based on business needs and a fast growing engineering team
Integrate and maintain a common set of tools that help automate and monitor everything as much as possible
Define and promote industry best practices across multiple teams
Apply best practices in CI/CD security (privilege separation, secret management, pipeline security testing, etc.)
Requirements:
4+ years in a Software Engineering, Release Engineering or a similar role
We're also looking for:
Proficient with version control, continuous integration, and multi-platform development environments
Expertise in automating release and build processes
Expertise in working with CI tools like Gitlab, Jenkins or Bamboo.
Experience in coding and scripting in one or more programming languages (Java, typescript, python, bash, etc).
Experience with Docker and/or Kubernetes
Experience with configuration management tools (ansible, terraform, puppet, packer)
Diversity at Dashlane:
A true international company, founded in Paris and currently split between Paris, New York, and Lisbon, we thrive off diverse perspectives. We recognize that diversity has different aspects: gender, sexual orientation, ability, ethnic origin, social background, age, lifestyle, and more. We're committed to hiring people that create a diverse community and foster a culture where everyone is heard and feels a sense of belonging.

Senior Corrosion Engineer (F/M)
Company Summary
TechnipFMC is a global oil and gas leader, specialized in subsea, onshore, offshore, and surface technologies. Our mission: to enhance the performance of world’s energy industry. How we do it: by constantly challenging conventions and investing in our 37 000+ employees, across 48 countries. At TechnipFMC, we aim to offer an inspiring working experience: tackling some of the most complex technical and engineering challenges in the world in collaboration with a truly global team.
Introduction to the Job
At TechnipFMC, we deliver critical projects of a scale, scope and difficulty that you simply won’t find anywhere else. We are looking for an Senior Corrosion Engineer who can join our multicultural team in Paris.
Job description
As part of the development of the Multidisciplinary Section "Materials and Welding", we are looking for a Beginner Corrosion Engineer (F/M). On behalf of the Engineering Division, during the execution phase of Onshore/Offshore Projects, the Candidate will perform studies related to corrosion and selection of materials applied to structures, equipment and pipes.
Analyse/assess the contractual, environmental and process conditions related to each project
Assess the risks of corrosion and/or degradation of materials for selection
Define the anti-corrosion philosophy and strategies according to the design life of the installations
Attend technical meetings with clients
Specify the overall anti-corrosion plan and write project specifications
Launch and follow orders for corrosion monitoring devices
Participate in activities related to integrity and inspection (e.g. RBI studies)
Provide assistance to the site during the construction phase
You will also participate to the Discipline Technical Referential improvement (Templates, Guidelines…)
The Candidate shall demonstrate his experience for:
Materials Selection and Corrosion risk assessment
Enabling understanding of Engineering documentation: PFDs, MSDs, PIDs, Datasheets, General Arrangement Drawings, ISO Drawings and Inspection Reports
Definition of Corrosion Monitoring requirements for material Requisitions and Technical Tabulations
Development of Corrosion Control Philosophies, Corrosion Management Programs and Material Selection Reports
Manage Corrosion Monitoring Requisition and Review Vendor documents taking into account schedule constraints
Corrosion Rate Prediction with Modeling Software (ECE…)
Would be a plus: Implementation of Risk Based Inspection (RBI) studies, and On-Stream Inspection (OSI) Programs

You are meant for this job if
Eight (8) years' minimum experience in the Petrochemical and/or Oil & Gas industries. Other relevant experience will be considered.
You have solid knowledge of engineering processes for all types of contracts and more specifically for Corrosion studies.
Qualified candidates must have as a minimum a BS degree in Materials/Metallurgy/Corrosion or related field.
Self-managing, dynamic and responsive, you have excellent communication skills and work efficiently in a multi-cultural environment.
You are a good listener and advisor, you can analyse and summarize, your decision-making and negotiation skills will ensure you successfully assume your responsibilities.
You speak fluent English and are available to complete short assignments abroad.
Your future at TechnipFMC
Potential career path, if possible
Global mobility opportunities if relevant
Training and development
Diverse and international team if relevant
Learn more about TechnipFMC
Learn more about us and find other open positions at our Career Page.
Follow us on LinkedIn for company updates.

description:
Who we are
At Criteo, we connect 1.5 billion active shoppers with the things they need and love. Our technology takes an algorithmic approach to predict what user we show an ad to, when, and for what products. Our dataset is about 50 petabytes in Hadoop (more than 120 TB extra per day) and we take less than 10ms to respond to an ad request. This is truly big data and machine learning without the buzzwords. If scale and complexity excite you, join us.

Most of all, we are creators. From designing ground-breaking products to solving technical challenges at an exceptional scale, our tech teams work with state of the art methodologies to shape the future of our datacenters

The SRE Webscale team builds the frameworks and SDKs that keeps our 15k+ servers functioning like clockwork. Their low-latency code is critical to support business in processing over 5M QPS (300B+ HTTP requests/day)

What you will do:

You will take the lead of an engineering team in the the Web Scalability group. The team owns part of our internal SDK, providing technical services & features to our Product Engineering teams.

The main challenges ahead are:
Ownership and convergence of our dimension-based configuration solutions, powering all A/B Tests in the company.
High performance and stability of our in-house C# Kafka, Memcache & Couchbase drivers.
Re-design our distributed caching solutions on top of relational databases for increased scalability.

You will:
Manage a small number of engineers in the team (4-5).
Effectively prioritize and make calls regarding team roadmap and deliverables.
Contribute code in the team among engineers (this is a very hands-on role).
Solve problems at a scale you never experienced previously.
Work with you fellow team leads and principal engineers in the group who will be able to support you.
Who you are
Solid development engineer experience with high-level object-oriented language such as C# (preferably) & Java.
Experience or deep interest in online, real-time distributed systems.
Experience with balancing a hands-on engineering role while managing teams of 3-5 engineers.
Good communication skills both written and spoken in English.
“can do” attitude and an ability to work around problems by thinking positively and in a collaborative manner.
Previous experience in web scalability, Kafka, Distributed caches & C# is a definitely plus
At Criteo, we dare to be different. We believe that diversity fuels innovation and creates an energy that can be seen and felt all over Criteo. We champion different perspectives and are committed to creating a workplace where all Criteos are heard, feel a sense of belonging, and are treated with respect and dignity.

description:
Expert Corrosion Engineer (F/M)
Company Summary
TechnipFMC is a global oil and gas leader, specialized in subsea, onshore, offshore, and surface technologies. Our mission: to enhance the performance of world’s energy industry. How we do it: by constantly challenging conventions and investing in our 37 000+ employees, across 48 countries. At TechnipFMC, we aim to offer an inspiring working experience: tackling some of the most complex technical and engineering challenges in the world in collaboration with a truly global team.

Introduction to the Job
At TechnipFMC, we deliver critical projects of a scale, scope and difficulty that you simply won’t find anywhere else. We are looking for an Expert Corrosion Engineer (F/M) who can join our multicultural team in Paris

Job description

Within the Engineering Division, during the execution phase of Onshore/Offshore Projects, you will perform studies related to corrosion and selection of materials applied to structures, equipment and pipes.

Your main duties will be the following:
Provide Discipline support in his expertise
As a document checker, ensure consistent interpretation of in-house Materials & Corrosion Standards and Discipline workflow
Capture lesson learned and best practices related to Materials & Corrosion technical aspects
Expert in anticipating the Materials & Corrosion business risks consequences and provide advices to achieve optimum balance of technical, safety, operations, and integrity aspects
Providing cost effective corrosion control and material selection of company engineering projects during design phase
Ensure that material selection and corrosion mitigation strategies will enable to maintain technical integrity during the life cycle of oil and gas facilities
Understanding of Engineering documentation: PFDs, MSDs, PIDs, Datasheets, General Arrangement Drawings, ISO Drawings and Inspection Reports
Definition of Corrosion Monitoring requirements for material Requisitions and Technical Tabulations
Development of Corrosion Control Philosophies, Corrosion Management Programs and Material Selection Reports
Management of Corrosion Monitoring Requisition and Review Vendor documents taking into account schedule constraints
Corrosion Rate Prediction with Modeling Software (ECE…)
Providing on the job training, coaching & support career development for junior staff
You are meant for this role if you have/ are:
Master’s degree in Materials/Metallurgy/Corrosion or related field.
15 years' minimum experience in the Petrochemical and/or Oil & Gas industries. Other relevant experience will be considered.
Solid knowledge of engineering processes for all types of contracts and more specifically for Corrosion studies.
Self-managing, dynamic and responsive, you have excellent communication skills and work efficiently in a multi-cultural environment.
Good and conversant in relevant technical networks, you possess excellent problem-solving skills in very challenging contexts.
Fluent in English and are available to complete short assignments abroad.
Your future at TechnipFMC
Potential career path, if possible
Global mobility opportunities if relevant
Training and development
Diverse and international team if relevant
Learn more about TechnipFMC

Learn more about us and find other open positions at our Career Page.

Follow us on LinkedIn for company updates.

description:
SUMMARY
ANSYS is seeking an Senior Application engineer who can leverage advanced engineering expertise to help customers realize the value of pervasive simulation. The Senior Application Engineer works closely with the sales team to deliver value and is a trusted expert for customers and colleagues.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Support sales engagements and demonstrate the value of ANSYS technology by presenting capabilities and demonstrating software use.
Support customers as they automate solutions around ANSYS technology.
Challenge assumptions and innovate while working closely with customers to realize the value of ANSYS technology.
Present solutions to customers, prospects and colleagues.
Contribute to the ANSYS community by documenting success and sharing ideas.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
MS degree in electrical engineering with emphasis on RF, electromagnetic fields, radar or wireless systems.
Industrial experience related to radar, antenna design, millimeter wave circuits or wireless systems.
A solid understanding of the basic principles of electromagnetic fields and RF circuit design such as filters, impedance matching networks, amplifiers and mixers.
Ability to describe complex technical concepts to a range of audiences.
Familiarity with one or more commercial simulation tools such as ANSYS HFSS, Feko, Keysight Momentum, CST Microwave studio, …
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Ph.D. in a relevant field.
Understanding of RF systems.
Experience with Matlab, Python, or another high-level programming language applied to solving problems in mathematics, engineering or physics.
Understanding of thermal and mechanical challenges for the design of wireless and radar systems.
Knowledge of Linux operating system.
Familiarity with high performance computing and schedulers.
CULTURE AND VALUES
Culture and values are incredibly important to ANSYS. They inform us of who we are, of how we act. Values aren't posters hanging on a wall or about trite or glib slogans. They aren't about rules and regulations. They can't just be handed down the organization. They are shared beliefs – guideposts that we all follow when we're facing a challenge or a decision. Our values tell us how we live our lives; how we approach our jobs. Our values are crucial for fostering a culture of winning for our company:
Customer focus
Results and Accountability
Innovation
Transparency and Integrity
Mastery
Inclusiveness
Sense of urgency
Collaboration and Teamwork
ANSYS does not accept unsolicited referrals for vacancies, and any unsolicited referral will become the property of ANSYS. Upon hire, no fee will be owed to the agency, person, or entity.

meta1:
Java Agent Engineer
Sqreen - Paris (75)
date_publication:
il y a 30+ jours
Signaler cette offre d'emploi
description:
Who we are

Sqreen is the industry’s first provider of Application Security Management (ASM), unifying application security needs into one single platform, giving over 600 companies unprecedented visibility and protection in production. Sqreen enables developers, operations and security teams to scale their security without impacting engineering velocity.

The company was founded by security veterans who previously led the offensive security team at Apple. Sqreen is backed by Greylock Partners, Y Combinator, Alven and Point Nine.

For more information, please visit www.sqreen.com.

What we need your help with

As part of the product engineering team you'll be in charge of designing and implementing the new features of the Sqreen Java agent.

Our technology protects web applications at run-time through dynamic instrumentation. You’ll work on server modules performing dynamic instrumentation, application security protection, and run-time monitoring to protect our Java customers' applications.

Your challenge? Make our customers' applications as safe as possible without compromising on performance.

We are a customer centric company. The Sqreen agents are protecting more than 500 customers, in production. As such, you will be in touch with our customers in order to get feedback on our features but also to get information about potential performance or stability improvement. Fixing bugs for our customers (so that no other customers will encounter them!) is a critical part of the job.

Day to day you'll:

> Own, build, test and release Sqreen's Java agent
> Design and implement key features, protocols and protections running within our customers' applications
> Use modern development methods and tools to put your code in production quickly
> Work with backend teams to enhance data flow, performance and reliability
> Produce technical blog posts and document the software you ship
> Attend conferences and meetups to share your work
> Forecast Java language and runtime evolutions to ensure the Sqreen agent has a first in class Java support
> Follow the Java ecosystem evolutions to stay close to application servers, frameworks, popular deployment mechanisms etc.

Who you are

We'd love to hear from you if you have:

> A strong interest in leading implementation of a mission critical piece of software
> The ability to design custom protocols, services and frameworks
> Significant experience with the Java ecosystem
> A high consideration of reliability, low-latency, redundancy, and security
> Excellent communication skills (we work in English)
> A product mindset and enjoy working with people outside your area of expertise - every engineer at Sqreen collaborates daily with Sales, Support and other teams

Sqreeners come from all corners of the globe and all walks of life. Diversity is important to us, so if you're unsure, please apply!
Why work for Sqreen

> Be part of an incredibly talented team who are passionate about democratising security
> Join at a crucial stage of our development with a huge amount of runway for you to add value
> Contribute tangibly to our core product, bringing value to our customers each and every week
> Join a product-focused company, with a deep commitment to learning
> Ask for any book you like and enjoy a week per quarter to focus on a side project of your choice
> Attend great conferences all year round
> Enjoy premium health insurance, healthy snacks every day and coached Sqreenfit sessions every fortnight
> A relaxed working environment with regular social activities
> Beautiful 'Sqreenhouses' in central Paris (Sentier), and San Francisco (SoMa)
> An international, English speaking work environment with the opportunity to visit SF

Sqreen participates actively in the tech and security ecosystem in Paris and San Francisco so you'll have access to some of the most interesting and talented people from our network and beyond!

Your challenge? Make our customers' applications as safe as possible without compromising on performance.

Day to day you'll:

> Own, build, test and release a Sqreen agent
> Design and implement key features, protocols and protections running within our customers' applications
> Use modern development methods and tools to put your code in production quickly
> Work with backend teams to enhance data flow, performance and reliability
> Produce technical blog posts and document the software you ship
> Attend conferences and meetups to share your work
> Forecast the language and runtime evolutions to ensure the Sqreen agent has a first in class support
> Follow the language ecosystem evolutions to stay close to new frameworks, popular deployment mechanisms etc.

Who you are

We'd love to hear from you if you have:

> A strong interest in leading implementation of a mission critical piece of software
> The ability to design custom protocols, services and frameworks
> Strong experience with C programming
> Experience with C++ and Python is a bonus!
> A high consideration of reliability, low-latency, redundancy, and security
> Excellent communication skills (we work in English)
> A product mindset and enjoy working with people outside your area of expertise - every engineer at Sqreen collaborates daily with Sales, Support and other teams

Sqreeners come from all corners of the globe and all walks of life. Diversity is important to us, so if you're unsure, please apply!
Why work for Sqreen

> Be part of an incredibly talented team who are passionate about democratising security
> Join at a crucial stage of our development with a huge amount of runway for you to add value
> Contribute tangibly to our core product, bringing value to our customers each and every week
> Join a product-focused company, with a deep commitment to learning
> Ask for any book you like and enjoy a week per quarter to focus on a side project of your choice
> Attend great conferences all year round
> Enjoy premium health insurance, healthy snacks every day and coached Sqreenfit sessions every fortnight
> A relaxed working environment with regular social activities
> Beautiful 'Sqreenhouses' in central Paris (Sentier), and San Francisco (SoMa)
> An international, English speaking work environment with the opportunity to visit SF

Sqreen participates actively in the tech and security ecosystem in Paris and San Francisco so you'll have access to some of the most interesting and talented people from our network and beyond!

description:
Ciena may well be the most important technology company you’ve never heard of. The innovations that wow us (driverless cars), and those we now take for granted (the ability to mobile-stream your favorite show) are the products of ingenuity from some brilliant and forward-thinking companies. But those companies rely on Ciena, another vanguard of innovation, to create and advance the underlying networks that bring their breakthroughs to our doorsteps. VR, AI, IOT, 5G … literally none of it would be possible without the mind-boggling technology that makes the internet itself work. For more than 25 years, Ciena has been the global leader in networking strategy, and our technology has been part of the critical infrastructure running within the most advanced companies in the world.
What will you do at Ciena?
This position is for recently graduated professionals in Computer Science, Telecommunication or Electrical/Electronic Engineering field, and willing to learn and progress their career on technical sales area on Telecom and IT industry.
We want people passionate about technology and solving complex problems. You must work well in a team oriented / open environment.
We are looking for people who have ‘agile’ in their DNA and get excited about having newly developed features getting released in a matter of days (even hours). You will get involved in a wide array of tasks ranging from setting up lab environments, prototyping new techniques and technologies to supporting proof of concept activities. You are expected to operate in a fluid DevOps environment and learn to write code for proof of concept applications in Carrier Class networking and Cloud based environments. You must be able to help the account team communicate solutions to customers and be comfortable having a technical relationship with the customer. Learning how Ciena built networks to support the Social media apps that we all use on a day to day basis, but looking forward how will ML and AI impact our 5G or IoT networks of the future

Support of customer demos and proof of concepts

General Activities

Technology / Products & Design Tools Training
Field System Engineering group to get a feel of the product.
Commercial, to understand the cost and commercial strategy of both hardware and services

Sales Engineer, put your skills into play, design, commercial, marketing
Sales, Develop skills on Account planning, forecast, deal qualification

A major part of the role will be to interact with fellow experienced Systems Engineers and looking at how they design the worlds leading networks, whether it be DWDM, OTN or IP.
Areas of impact
By being part of Ciena’s Systems Engineering team, you will have a crucial part on the success of our organization! You will contribute with the technical thinking behind the designs of the best networks Ciena can deploy to help customers be successful in supporting their critical applications.

LI-CN

A distinct way to work
Free thinking, free discussion, and collaboration are the norm. Expect more satisfying outcomes - both personal and professional.

Ciena is also committed to developing inclusive, barrier-free selection processes and work environments. meta1:
Apprenticeship - Configurable tool development
GE Renewable Energy56 avis - Massy (91)
date_publication:
General Electric - il y a 30+ jours
- Continuer pour postuler
Signaler cette offre d'emploi
description:
Role Summary:
Development of a configurable tool for the implementation of validation rules using existing APIs

Le/La titulaire de ce poste est chargé(e) du développement d'un outil configurable pour la mise en œuvre de règles de validation à l'aide des API existants.
Essential Responsibilities:
Within GE Renewable Energy, the Application Engineering team is in charge of delivering advanced software solutions for Energy Management in Transmission, Distribution and Market areas.

CIMNet is the Network analysis and validation module. It provides a collection of high-performance functionalities necessary to ensure fast and efficient Network Model verification in terms of consistency and network security, leveraging almost 40 years of experience in efficient and reliable network analysis algorithms by GE. CIMNet has been designed as a flexible multipurpose application. Its fast and high-quality CIM-based Network analysis modules can be used to quickly validate the Master models imported and/or modified in Source, as they can be used independently to load, merge and run Power Systems calculations from CGMES files. It is therefore the perfect solution to cover all model validation, Model merge and advanced network analysis business requirements of TSOs and RSCs

CIMNET was certified for full support of CGMES models including detailed HVDC data processing using the first version of ENTSOE conformity rules and these conformity rules are changing and expanding all over the years.

The purpose of this apprenticeship is to extend existing validation rules implemented in CIMNet with a complementary tool providing further possibilities to implement new rules from ENTSOE with high degree of configurability using CIMNet APIs.



The intern will be required to:
Understand the APIs or extension points available in CIMNET,
Understand the existing validation rules from ENTSOE with a support of Power Systems engineers from the team.
Design and develop this new configurable tool for the implementation of validation rules.
Provide all required documentations: detail User Guide, validation test book and online help.


Duration of the apprenticeship : 1-2 years

Principales responsabilités :

Au sein de GE Renewable Energy, l'équipe Ingénierie d'applications est chargée de développer des solutions logicielles avancées dédiées à la gestion de l'énergie dans les domaines de la transmission, de la distribution et du marché de réseaux électriques.



CIMNet est le module utilisé pour l'analyse et la validation de réseau. Il offre un ensemble de fonctionnalités ultra-performantes qui garantissent une vérification rapide et efficace du modèle de réseau en matière de cohérence et de sécurité, et qui s'appuient sur l'expérience de GE qui développe depuis 40 ans des algorithmes d'analyse de réseau à la fois fiables et efficaces. CIMNet a été conçu comme une application polyvalente et flexible. Ses modules d'analyse de réseau basés sur CIM sont rapides et de haute qualité, et peuvent être utilisés pour valider en un clin d'œil les modèles originaux importés et/ou modifiés dans Source. Ils peuvent également être utilisés indépendamment pour charger, combiner et exécuter les calculs Power Systems à partir de fichiers CGMES. Il s'agit donc de la solution parfaite pour couvrir toutes les exigences en matière de validation de modèle, de combinaison de modèles et d'analyse de réseau avancée des TSO et RSC



Le module CIMNET a été certifié pour la prise en charge des modèles CGMES, y compris pour le traitement des données HVDC détaillées, à l'aide de la première version des règles de conformité ENTSOE, règles de conformité qui évoluent et s'étoffent au fil des années.


L'objectif de cet apprentissage est d'étendre les règles de validation existantes et mises en œuvre au niveau du module CIMNet en créant un outil complémentaire offrant davantage de possibilités d'implémenter de nouvelles règles à partir des règles ENTSOE, avec de nombreuses options de configuration et en utilisant les API CIMNet.

Qualifications/Requirements:
Software development engineering studies – PhD or Master degree.
Good understanding of standard data sharing tools XML, RDFS
Good understanding of UML with at least a strong contribution in one project.
Strong programming skills in C++, Java and Python

Études d'ingénierie en développement logiciel – Doctorat ou BAC+4
Bonne compréhension des outils de partage de données standard (XML, RDFS)
Bonne compréhension d'UML avec au moins une contribution concrète au cours d'un projet
Solides compétences de programmation sous C++, Java et Python



Principales responsabilités :

L’apprenti(e) assumera les responsabilités suivantes :
Comprendre les API ou les points d'extension du module CIMNET
Comprendre les règles de validation ENTSOE existantes avec l'aide des ingénieurs Power Systems de l'équipe
Concevoir et développer ce nouvel outil configurable pour la mise en œuvre de règles de validation
Fournir toute la documentation requise, y compris le guide de l'utilisateur, le livret des essais de validation et l'aide en ligne


Durée du contrat d'apprentissage : 1 à 2 ans

About Us:
GE (NYSE:GE) drives the world forward by tackling its biggest challenges. By combining world-class engineering with software and analytics, GE helps the world work more efficiently, reliably, and safely. GE people are global, diverse and dedicated, operating with the highest integrity and passion to fulfill GE’s mission and deliver for our customers. www.ge.com
Additional Locations:
France;Massy;

About the job
When leading companies choose Google Cloud it's a huge win for spreading the power of cloud computing globally. Once educational institutions, government agencies, and other businesses sign on to use Google Cloud products, you come in to facilitate making their work more productive, mobile, and collaborative. You assist fellow sales Googlers by problem-solving key technical issues for our customers. You liaise with the product marketing management and engineering teams to stay on top of industry trends and devise enhancements to Google Cloud products.
The Google Cloud Platform team helps customers transform and evolve their business through the use of Google’s global network, web-scale data centers and software infrastructure. As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you will help shape the future of businesses of all sizes use technology to connect with customers, employees and partners. As a Sales Engineer, you will work hand-in-hand with technical Sales teams as an enterprise hybrid cloud subject matter expert to differentiate and paint the vision of Google Cloud to our customers. You will help prospective customers and partners understand the power of Google Cloud, explaining technical features, helping customers design architectures, engage in proof of concepts, and troubleshooting potential roadblocks.
Google Cloud helps millions of employees and organizations empower their employees, serve their customers, and build what’s next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. And our teams are dedicated to helping our customers and developers see the benefits of our technology come to life.
Responsibilities
Work with the team to identify and qualify business opportunities. Understand key customer technical objections and develop a strategy to resolve technical blockers.
Provide in-depth enterprise infrastructure/cloud modernization expertise to support the technical relationship with Google’s customers. Partner directly with product management to prioritize solutions impacting customer adoption to Google Cloud.
Guide customers through assessments of their existing legacy application environment(s). Provide recommendations on a prioritization roadmap for application modernization. Identify candidate applications for migration to hybrid-cloud computing models.
Structure and execute prototyping workshops to prove out proposed new architectures, developing best practices, and documenting key blocking requirements for prioritization with engineering.
Travel to customer sites, conferences, and other related events as required.

description:
Are you an expert designer obsessed with solving complex UX problems and creating intuitive, unified experiences? Are you passionate about how the user-centred design can humanize technology, address usability puzzles, achieve business goals, and help to bring to market innovative digital products that delight customers? Join Dashlane as a Senior Product Designer and take part in a mission to create intuitive and usable software with global impact.

Dashlane is a top-rated password manager and online security app, created for everyone who lives, works, and plays on the internet. With a simple, intuitive design and patented security technology, Dashlane keeps passwords, personal data, and payment info at users' fingertips, so they can stop guessing passwords and wasting time filling out forms. Dashlane has helped over 11 million users in 180 countries manage and secure their digital identities and has enabled over $17 billion in e-commerce transactions. Our teams in New York, Paris, and Lisbon are united by our passion for password security — and the belief that our success is built on the diverse backgrounds of every member.

As a Senior Product Designer you will be a key member of an international team committed to building the best online identity and security app — and be part of the culture in which design and user experience is the cornerstone of everything we do. You will work alongside a broad mix of stakeholders including product managers, engineers, marketers, copywriters, user researchers and fellow designers in a creative, highly collaborative environment. You will influence the direction our apps are taking in look and feel and in user experience, and champion the user perspective at every step. At Dashlane you will be relied upon to create exemplary prototypes, interfaces and experiences, whilst balancing user needs, constraints of technology, company brand values and KPIs. As we continue to push the boundaries of modern UX, we will be looking to you to integrate motion and interaction design into your usability solutions.

You will be based in Paris, France.

--------------------
At Dashlane you will
--------------------

Work on something important and meaningful. Our Desktop, Mobile and Web applications are already enhancing the web experience of millions of people worldwide, and are essential to making their online lives more secure.
Create cutting-edge user experience that takes our apps to the next level, and always strive to push them further.
Design and iterate layouts and assets that reflect the brand and enforce messaging.
Produce top-notch work that injects usability and beauty into the product and delight into the user experience.
Create and own high-quality UI and design, from concept to execution;
Work to briefs that may require shifting priorities. You will be expected to balance business needs and constraints of technology and will challenge the brief in order to drive innovation with the aim of improving user experience and usability of the product.
Own not only the features you design, but actively contribute to all sides of the Dashlane application, and participate in setting the design direction for the Product.
Stay up-to-date with the latest trends in UX design and influence our understanding of the Mac, Windows, web, iOS and Android environments, their unique differentiators and quirks.
Work closely with developers, Product Managers, and Copywriters on a daily basis to aid implementation of the designed interface and to ensure the UX success. The team will depend on your keen eye for details.
Work with our Analytics and User Testing teams to validate assumptions, test design solutions and fine-tune the messaging.
Be the team expert on all things pertaining to motion and animation in UX. Create exemplary prototypes, propose enhancements and be obsessed with fine-tuning the smallest of interactions.
Participate in UX workshops and lead Design Sprints in solving problems and building the best experience.
-------------------------
Minimum requirements
-------------------------

You are an expert in InVision, and Sketch or Adobe suite.
A relevant degree (BA or equivalent, or higher).
Experience with wireframes, storyboards, user flows, Personas and other UX methodologies such as Card Sorting, Eye Movement Tracking, various types of Usability Testing.
5 or more years working in app development environment.
Working experience within Agile cycles and ceremonies.
A track record of delivering UX solutions in more than one digital platform.
A portfolio in addition to resume. (Submissions without a portfolio will not be considered).
-------------------
The ideal candidate
-------------------

You have a practical grasp of animation and understand the importance of interaction design in the user experience.
A solid understanding of the interplay between typography, colour, and motion, and their roles in visual communication.
Motion graphics is your strongest side: you have proficiency and passion for motion, and have specific expertise in After Effects and equivalent software.
The ability to translate complex ideas into a simple language. Your fluency in English will be essential both when communicating in writing and verbally.
You are comfortable in putting the team first and sharing ownership in the company's success.
You are a self-starter and can manage your own time, juggling many projects with changing priorities, with the ability to work under pressure and tight deadlines.
You have a passion for consumer apps and follow new developments in the world of software development.
You have the illustration / digital art skills.
---------------------
Diversity at Dashlane
---------------------

A true international company, founded in Paris and currently split between Paris, New York, and Lisbon, we thrive off diverse perspectives. We recognize that diversity has different aspects: gender, sexual orientation, ability, ethnic origin, social background, age, lifestyle, and more. We're committed to hiring people that create a diverse community and foster a culture where everyone is heard and feels a sense of belonging.

About the job
When leading companies choose Google Cloud it's a huge win for spreading the power of cloud computing globally. Once educational institutions, government agencies, and other businesses sign on to use Google Cloud products, you come in to facilitate making their work more productive, mobile, and collaborative. You assist fellow sales Googlers by problem-solving key technical issues for our customers. You liaise with the product marketing management and engineering teams to stay on top of industry trends and devise enhancements to Google Cloud products.
The Google Cloud Platform team helps customers transform and evolve their business through the use of Google’s global network, web-scale data centers and software infrastructure. As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you will help shape the future of businesses of all sizes use technology to connect with customers, employees and partners. As a Sales Engineer, you will work hand-in-hand with the Sales team to introduce Google Cloud to our customers. You will help prospective, existing customers and partners understand the power of Google Cloud, develop creative cloud solutions and architectures to solve their business challenges, and problem-solve any potential technical roadblocks.
Google Cloud helps millions of employees and organizations empower their employees, serve their customers, and build what’s next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. And our teams are dedicated to helping our customers and developers see the benefits of our technology come to life.
Responsibilities
Challenge and inspire customers and peers to solve difficult problems with ambitious and novel solutions leveraging a sophisticated set of technical competences.
Work with the team to identify and qualify business opportunities, identify key customer technical objections and develop a strategy to resolve technical blockers.
Manage the technical relationship with Google’s customers, including managing product and solution briefings, proof-of-concept work, and the coordination of additional technical resources.
Work hands-on with customers to demonstrate and prototype Google Cloud product integrations in customer/partner environments.
Recommend migration strategies, enterprise architectures, migration tools and cloud infrastructure required to successfully implement a complete solution using best practices on Google Cloud.
