You will work closely with the Strategic Cons Team and become a subject matter expert in this area to help design a new, faster and more robust network infrastructure for fast transaction processing etc. Working in the Security Consulting Team, you will be involved in recommending & architecting for vulnerability scanning, vulnerability remediation, pen testing and security audit involvement etc. If you have expertise in compliance in financials such as PCI DSS, this would be ideal but if not, then there will be support for you from the Security team etc. As the Network & Security expert, you will need to have strong Enterprise skills for capacity planning to work with Network or Cloud software Team and advise on poss ACS, DNS, SSL, etc. with Network administration on LAN/WAN, VPN etc. A Cisco or similar qualification could be ideal and you will have a zest for technology and designing or working with a Secure Network Centre of excellence in line with governance etc. ISO 27001, ISO 27005.
The key responsibilities will be:
Design & development of the Infrastructure for monitoring in a 24/7 D/C environment with network management in a Cisco, poss F5 Enterprise environment, supporting IP Addressing, sub-netting, the OSI model, firewalls, routers, switches and systems
Performing ongoing infrastructure improvements and recommending Firewalls, and working with various network protocols such as: TCP/IP, IP, wireless, physical security audits with ISO etc.
Liaising with ISO, other Development Architects on Information Security, Issues and SIEM etc to make improvements.
Working to ensure robust transaction processing and highly scalable networks with Compliance and security audits, vulnerabilities etc.
Work to best practice and Change Management structure, with Incident Response processes and Management.
Identify New Network & Consulting Design, current weaknesses and recommend improvements etc.
Working in Security Consulting you may be involved in providing scanning, vulnerability remediation which may include some pen testing and security audit involvement etc.
Ideal Skills & Experience – Not Essential
A Network Security & Consulting Engineer with excellent Networking and ideally some F5 for load balancing and security etc as well as web traffic, capacity planning etc.
Strong experience as an security architect or network architect developing both HLD and LLD.
Recognised CISCO certifications, CCNP, CCDE etc.
IT Graduate in a relevant subject or CISSP would be useful.
5+ years experience in a Network Operations, Security Operation Centre SOC, etc. covering capacity planning, network enhancements and improvements for ICT, undertaking assessments with project and/or security delivery responsibility, IPS, Intrusion Protection System for implementation.
Experience working in the security operations you will be involved in vulnerability scanning, vulnerability remediation, pen testing and security audit involvement etc.
Significant experience of working within information systems or networking disciplines
Experience of audit methodologies and network security assessment tools
Experience with File Integrity Monitoring tools, IPSec, SPLUNK, etc.
Extensive experience of security appliances, such as firewalls.
Network experience with Security like: Qualys, Kerberos, Palo Alto, WAF or IAM etc.
Any experience using SNMP, Netflow, Syslog, Gemalto etc.
Experience evaluating the security infrastructure for e.g. retail, financial services or service providers, Telecoms etc.
Certifications such as CISSP, GIAC, GCIH, PCIP, CIEH would be desirable but not essential.
This is great opportunity and challenge to assist in the next generation of high availability secure network processing and a robust scalable infrastructure for mass Enterprise managed services – this will challenge the best.

Doctrine builds a legal research and analytics software for legal professionals, law firms, companies, and individuals to search through the law, handle their cases, and grow their business. At Doctrine we proudly aim for technical excellence in all our Engineering tracks - Frontend, Backend and Data Science. To excel in building and living by such high quality standards, our web engineers have been historically focusing on either Frontend development or Backend development. As we scale and become a more mature tech organization, we believe that there is an opportunity for having people strongly specializing in both, hence contributing to a global Javascript-based web engineering strategy while providing more flexibility in terms of skills to the organization.

We are therefore looking for Senior Fullstack Web Developers, meaning Web Developers with strong ambitions in both Frontend development and Backend development, willing to take advantage of our all-Javascript (React + NodeJS) web landscape. On the frontend side, you will work on providing the best experience together with our Product designers. On the backend side, reliability, security and performance will be some or your focus points. And like all our Engineering team, a passion for building the best products for our users is a must.
In this role, you will use our backend stack to:
Use NodeJS to write controllers for AJAX APIs using ExpressJS and program application logic
Work with Data Scientists to help them prepare data in PostgreSQL tables adapted to fast real-time querying in the application
Write optimized SQL queries in the NodeJS app to get the data
Write ElasticSearch queries in the NodeJS app to search the indexed data
Rely on AWS Lambdas and other cloud-based services
Work on building dashboards (Graphana, Kibana) and other monitoring tools

You will also use our frontend stack to:
Collaborate with Product Designers to iterate on the design and implementation of our product
Build reusable UI components with all the power of the React/Redux ecosystem
Consume internal APIs exposed specifically for the needs of our Frontend
Ensure the best experience, both for our users and in terms of SEO

We like to think that we are helping make the internet safer. We have raised $210M to date and are growing quickly. Our team is spread across more than 35 countries and we are proud to continually be recognized as a great place to work. Culture is critical to us, and we are transparent about our vision and principles.

Join us on this journey to make developers more productive while making the internet safer!

titre_poste: Power and Utilities Specialist Solutions Architect
date_publication:

Signaler cette offre d'emploi
description:
Proven experience in technical IT teams in an engineering, architecture, consulting, pre-sales, or similar function in the power and utilities sector
Hands-on experience in a technical environment such as software development, system administration, data and analytics platform, information security, service delivery and management
Ability to learn new concepts and technologies, and apply them to provide the best business outcomes for customers
Ability to formulate and communicate ideas clearly in a business environment, including presenting in front of varied internal and external audiences

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is looking for Solutions Architects for our Europe, Middle-East, and Africa customers. If you have experience in designing, developing, or maintaining platforms in the power and utilities sector, and are interested in helping customers embrace cloud technologies, come and talk to us. Specialist Solutions Architects work with AWS' partners and customers to accelerate their cloud transformation. They engage in a wide range of activities around their domain of expertise, providing technical advice to customers, helping the internal and external communities, presenting AWS publicly on their domain, and providing a preferred path between AWS service teams and customers

This is an opportunity to join Amazon’s technical teams, working with our engineers on the new services that power the cloud ecosystem, while developing your skills and furthering your career within what we believe to be one of the most innovative and progressive technology companies. This role will focus on helping our power and utilities customers and partners build innovative Solutions and Businesses that focus on leveraging the value of data.

As a Power & Utilities Specialist Solutions Architect (SA), you will help customers select the technologies that will support their business requirements. Part of the Specialist Solutions Architecture team, you will work closely with the other Specialist SAs on Big Data, Databases, Analytics, Artificial Intelligence, or Security, as well as the Business Development teams, to enable large-scale customer use cases and drive the adoption of AWS for their platforms. You will interact with other SAs, providing guidance on their customer engagements by developing white papers, blogs, reference implementations, and presentations to enable customers and 3rd parties to fully leverage the AWS platform. You will also create field enablement materials for the broader SA population, to help them understand how to integrate AWS solutions into customer architectures.

Candidates have a mix of communication and technical skills, and will have the ability to engage with customers at different levels in the organization, from executive to developer. Previous experience with AWS is desired but not required, provided you have experience building large scale solutions. You will get the opportunity to work directly with senior engineers at customers, partners and AWS service teams, influencing their roadmaps and driving innovation.

If you are someone who enjoys innovating, likes solving hard problems and working on the cutting edge of technology, we would love to have you on the team.

As the role will cover EMEA the ideal candidate can be located in other countries across Europe, ideally; United Kingdom, Germany, Sweden, Netherlands, Luxembourg, Spain, Italy, France.

Amazon's Culture

Our positive and supportive culture encourages our people to do their best work every day. We have 14 leadership principles that help guide us in our every-day decision making process. We believe they are a clearer articulation of those things that have always been a part of what makes Amazon great – things that we must consciously hold on to in fulfilling our mission to be Earth’s Most Customer Centric Company. We are continuously looking for new ways to maintain a culture where our people excel and lead healthy and happy lives. It is always Day One.

How You’ll Grow

At Amazon, our professional development plan focuses on helping people at every level of their career to identify and use their strengths to do their best work every day. From entry-level employees to senior leaders, we believe there’s always room to learn and develop your career. We offer opportunities to help sharpen your skills in addition to hands-on experience in the global, fast-changing business world. From on-the-job learning experiences to formal development programs, our professionals have a variety of opportunities to continue to grow throughout their career.

Roles and responsibilities
Customers' trusted advisor: collaborate with AWS account, training and support teams to help partners and customers learn and use AWS services and solutions related to their industry
Business partner: serve as a key member of the business development and account management team in helping to ensure customer success in building and migrating applications, software and services on the AWS platform.
Public engagement: provide thought leadership on Analytics solutions that benefit customers through the use of AWS Services. This takes the form of contribution to external publications such as the AWS Blogs, Whitepapers and Reference architectures, or public presentations at AWS Summits, AWS re:Invent, AWS User Groups or industry events
Community player: capture and share best-practices, participate, and contribute as a member of the worldwide AWS technical community of Solution Architects, Professional Services Consultants, Technical Account Managers, and AWS Trainers
Service team point of contact: act as a conduit between the AWS Service teams and the customers, providing detailed guidance for the broader field organization and the customers, and acting as an advocate for the customers towards the central teams

Amazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer – Minority / Women / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation.

Technical degree in computer science, math, or engineering such as a Master's degree
Experience working within software or Internet-related companies
Experience in application portfolio management, enterprise architecture and practices, and modernization
Track record of implementing AWS services in a variety of business environments such as large enterprises and start-ups. AWS Certifications, e.g. AWS Solutions Architect Associate/Professional

Junior Software engineer - Ecosystem
Dataiku - Paris (75)
date_publication:
il y a 5 mois
- Continuer pour postuler
Signaler cette offre d'emploi
description:
Dataiku’s mission is big: to enable all people throughout companies around the world to use data by removing friction surrounding data access, cleaning, modeling, deployment, and more. But it’s not just about technology and processes; at Dataiku, we also believe that people (including our people!) are a critical piece of the equation.

As a Software engineer specializing in ecosystem integrations, you’ll play a crucial role helping us integrate Dataiku DSS with various technologies including SaaS services, open data sources and data storage systems.
One of the most unique characteristics of our product, Dataiku DSS, is the breadth of its scope and the fact that it caters both to data analysts (with visual analytics) and data scientists (with deep integration in code and libraries, and a web-based IDE). Connecting to data sources, visualization tools and other systems is a critical part of our business and you will play a crucial role in that.

In this position, you will have to regularly learn and use new APIs and identify their limitations (security, performance, usability, etc.), in order to design the best possible integration with DSS.

You will be developing production-ready code using the best software engineering practices as well as writing the associated technical documentation and tutorials.

Existing ecosystem integrations include for example Twitter, Salesforce, cloud storages, cloud Spark services, cloud Kubernetes clusters ESRI (Geospatial data provider), Tableau Software and PowerBI.
You’re the ideal recruit if:
You are curious and autonomous.
You like digging into source code to see what is under the hood and how things are working.
You have some experience with a programming language and Web technologies
You love multitasking, doing multiple projects in parallel.
You have a first experience (either professional or personal) building a real product.
To fulfill its mission, Dataiku is growing fast (having just closed a $101 million Series C round in December 2018 and looking to double in 2019), but still maintains a startup spirit. Dataiku serves its global customer base from its headquarters in New York City as well as offices in Paris, London, Munich, Singapore, and Sydney. Each of our offices has a unique culture, but underpinning local nuances, we always value curiosity, collaboration, and can-do attitudes.

date_publication:

description:
Dataiku’s mission is big: to enable all people throughout companies around the world to use data by removing friction surrounding data access, cleaning, modeling, deployment, and more. But it’s not just about technology and processes; at Dataiku, we also believe that people (including our people!) are a critical piece of the equation.

We are looking for outstanding R&D software engineers to contribute to expand Dataiku DSS capabilities for advanced and/or specific use cases. Within the engineering team and in collaboration with Product Managers, and our advanced analytics lab, you will develop production-ready components and integrate them to Dataiku DSS.

One of the most unique characteristics of our product, Dataiku DSS, is the breadth of its scope and the fact that it caters to both data analysts (with visual analytics) and data scientists (with deep integration in code and libraries, and a web-based IDE).

You will work to explore further and deliver solutions for use cases that are not fully addressed by the core capabilities of DSS.

The use cases may include:

Computational mathematics topics: advanced machine learning, statistics, operations research, simulation, decision modeling, time series and signal processing, computer vision, natural language processing, etc.
Working with geographic information systems, financial data, medical images or other specific data types
Integration with new languages or platforms
And possibly lots of others...

Together with Product Managers and Data Scientists, you will be working in direct contact with clients to answer their needs and improve their experience of DSS. You will strive to provide building blocks and/or integration with third party libraries that will help address these needs and augment our product for future uses.

This is a software engineering position, you will be responsible for designing your components and developing production-ready code following the best software engineering standards.

We use mostly Python and Java but occasionally code using Scala, R or Julia. Integration with other languages or platforms can fall in the scope of this position.
You’re the ideal recruit if:
You are curious and pragmatic: you want to explore extensions to our product but are motivated by delivering production code for business use cases
You like to sometimes go out of the office/lab to see data science in the wild so that you implement things our users actually need, even (and especially) when they are actually very simple
You have experience in one or several of the above computational mathematics domains
You are autonomous and dedicated to push some boundaries but have a humble and friendly personality, you are not interested in looking smarter than your colleagues
You have a first experience building a real product (in academia or in a company)
To fulfill its mission, Dataiku is growing fast (having just closed a $101 million Series C round in December 2018 and looking to double in 2019), but still maintains a startup spirit. Dataiku serves its global customer base from its headquarters in New York City as well as offices in Paris, London, Munich, Singapore, and Sydney. Each of our offices has a unique culture, but underpinning local nuances, we always value curiosity, collaboration, and can-do attitudes.

Description
Gatan, Inc. is the world's leading manufacturer of instrumentation and software used to enhance and extend the operation and performance of electron microscopes. The Gatan name is recognized and respected throughout the worldwide scientific community and has been synonymous with high quality products and the industry's leading technology.
The Field Service System Engineer is responsible for on-site repair or services of Gatan specimen prep, imaging and analytical systems at the customer site. The ideal candidate will live in close proximity to Paris, France.

On-site customer installation, service support, limited telephone support, hardware and software configuration, troubleshooting, and maintenance support for Gatan products.
Ensure repaired systems meet operating specifications, documenting service performed.
Read and interpret schematics and electrical diagrams through to the component level.
Isolate the system fault at the component level for electronic, vacuum, and mechanical systems and repair.
Document work performed in a service report.
Complete billing or warranty documentation as needed.
Propose design enhancements and improvements.

Experience with current Personal Computer Windows Operation System (OS) software installation and configuration.

Ability to work on complex learning and development problems as well as teach highly technical information is essential.
Ability to interface with people at all levels.

Associate’s Degree in Electronics or equivalent experience
Bachelor's Degree, preferred
Good practice of French and English languages

description:
EMEA
Paris France (FR)
|
Data Innovation Engineer
Permanent
Information Technology
About SCOR
SCOR is the 5th largest Reinsurance Company worldwide, following a profit-driven underwriting policy and practising selectively across all branches of reinsurance. Our specialist teams operate in over 120 countries, developing value added and innovative products and services and making long-term commitments to their clients, namely insurers and large corporations.
SCOR's aim, as an independent global reinsurance company, is to develop its Life and P&C business lines, to provide its clients with a broad range of innovative reinsurance solutions and to pursue an underwriting policy founded on profitability, supported by effective risk management and a prudent investment policy, in order to offer its clients an optimum level of security, to create value for its shareholders, and to contribute to the welfare and resilience of Society by helping to protect insureds against the risks they face.
- Job Summary
The Innovation team is in charge of managing capability of innovation like Machine Learning and AI (Artificial intelligence), Big data, RPA (Robotic Process Automation), Blockchain… and providing ad hoc technical environment.
The Data Engineer Innovation is responsible for support Business on their needs on new technologies, challenge solutions, implement Proof of Concepts, provide, manage and promote Innovation services to business and functional IT, and train users for the best utilization. He could build quick prototype construction using business data to develop, test, elaborate and maintain analytics infrastructure to improve the data use capability, manage and support Machine Learning, RPA and AI implementation on POC or business projects.
This position is an opportunity to be in a transversal division, supporting innovation in both IT functional, IT technical and business.
- Key duties and responsibilities
Perform research and analysis as needed to understand, create and/or improve maintenance of sandboxes (data sciences, big data…) and give advices on architecture of big data, data transfer & dataflow to optimize performance results.
Manage RPA, machine learning and AI sandboxes, automate dataflow processes, data reconciliation issues.
Analyze deep impact of improvement by learning of robots/data sciences algorithms/IA on IT environment, processes and organization;
Keep up-to-date with latest technology trends in data analytics, machine learning and robot process automation, including installation method and managing infrastructure.
Support business & IT integration efforts by assisting in the development and understanding of business applications, rules, mapping and scoring, up to software engineering/code development.
Participate in the creation of rules, studies and systems designed to incorporate business value.
Foster and participate in a culture of continuous improvement.
Create and maintain process documentation as required.
Adhere to all Information Security policies and best practices, including security awareness training and other information protection initiatives.
Communicate on several subject, with right level of popularization/expertise, both formally and informally, in network with capability to animate communities, and provide large hall (& audience) presentation
Other duties as required for the position.
- Required experience & competencies
Experience:
3+ years in innovation area, implementing key technologies in IT environment.
Experienced in implementing & managing IT infrastructure evolution needs by new technologies: analytics infrastructure including profiling, reporting & data visualization, Hadoop installation…
Experienced in Software engineering (Java, Python, R) on several environments or frameworks (Spark, Jupyter, RStudio…) with capability on writing parallel execution code in Hadoop environment (Java, Python)
Experienced on Machine Learning and/or Artificial Intelligence implementation,
Experience on Robotic Process Automation & robotics developments greatly appreciated: rule based and automated systems implementation, including development and enhancement of rules, process, preferred.
Basic knowledge on mathematics, statistics and algorithms
Capability to support business statisticians & data scientists with software engineering appreciated
Experience in functional design creation, financial transactions, troubleshooting, dealing with (re)insurance issues appreciated
Personal Competencies:
Problem Solving – Identifies and analyses issues, proposes and rolls out relevant solutions after appropriate approvals.
Communication – Knows how and when to develop/sustain a message and/or an idea (speaking and writing), uses the right tools to present information. Ability to work within, cross functional & technical teams.
Resilience – Demonstrates an ability to step back when facing difficult situations and to bounce back after a failure. Learn on failure.
Decision Making – Makes decisions and/or rolls out the decisions taking into account all available information.
Accountability – Alerts, raises the critical points when needed, shoulders and corrects his/her decisions and shows responsibility regarding cost management in autonomy.
Commitment – Takes initiatives and makes effort to bring his/her skills and uses his/her expertise to contribute to the success of the Group.
Curiosity & Open-minded – Demonstrates an appetite for learning and developing his/her-self in his/her field of expertise, can develop new practices and methods in relation with his/her day-to-day work.
Creativity – Capacity to merge different ideas, to capture and integrate tendencies, and to capitalize to purpose new ways of works and functionalities.
Digital Competencies:
Ability to employ information: identify, recognize, record and store digital information to facilitate retrieval and use.
Ability to access information: locate, select and retrieve digital information.
Ability to determine data's quality, value, and relevance in different contexts.
Apply security measures in digital environments: protect hardware, software applications, data and personal information, data encryption.
Ability to create information: generate new digital content and knowledge by organizing, integrating, adapting and applying digital information.
Ability to identify and assess accurate sources of information, and understanding architecture. Required Education
Bachelor’s degree in mathematics, applied science, computer science or equivalent work experience.

description:
Role Summary:
L’équipe des services industriels externalisés de GE Digital possède un vaste éventail mondial de connaissances uniques en la matière, que nous utilisons, en partenariat avec nos clients, afin de générer jour après jour des résultats exceptionnels dans l’Internet industriel des objets (IIOT).

Essential Responsibilities:
En utilisant les tout derniers logiciels, les plateformes Cloud, l’apprentissage automatique et les technologies en sciences des données, nous œuvrons à l’échelle internationale à partir de 7 implantations et nous prenons en charge plus de 170 langues afin de rendre l’univers industriel mondial plus sécurisé, plus efficient et plus efficace.
L’équipe des services industriels externalisés de GE Digital travaille principalement et directement avec les clients afin d’appuyer et d’orienter les décisions opérationnelles de ces derniers en mettant à profit les résultats de multiples solutions de gestion d’actifs, de sciences des données et d'apprentissage automatique.

L’ingénieur(e) prestation senior participera activement au renforcement de la culture de confiance, de transparence et de responsabilité.

Le/la candidat(e) devra posséder de solides connaissances et une maîtrise des compétences spécifiques à l’industrie, et formera principalement les jeunes ingénieurs tout en mettant à profit l’expertise des ingénieurs plus chevronnés afin de combler leurs lacunes.

À ce poste, le/la candidat(e) doit assumer les responsabilités suivantes :
Mettre la satisfaction des clients au centre de ses préoccupations, en s’assurant que les clients sont plus que satisfaits de nos services de conseil continus qui sont fournis chaque jour, chaque semaine, chaque mois et chaque année
Travailler directement avec les clients afin de les aider à exploiter au mieux la toute dernière technologie logicielle, les sciences des données, l'apprentissage automatique et les bonnes pratiques de l’industrie pour transformer leurs procédés industriels
Mettre à profit la solide expertise du secteur de l’équipe afin de garantir une assistance opérationnelle aux clients, en les aidant à prendre des décisions fondées sur les résultats
Renforcer et prendre part à une culture d’équipe internationale favorisant l’amélioration continue, le partage des bonnes pratiques et la collaboration ouverte
Apprendre et se familiariser rapidement avec les procédés industriels, les méthodologies industrielles et les actifs relatifs aux segments verticaux du secteur
Se familiariser rapidement avec des logiciels et outils d'analyse prédictive sophistiqués, de gestion d'actifs et de sciences des données

Solide expérience professionnelle dans le domaine concerné

Expertise technique :
Capacité à prendre ou à recommander des décisions sur la base d’analyses approfondies, identifier les problèmes critiques à résoudre, identifier les sources de données requises pour exécuter des analyses, mettre à profit les conseils de son responsable pour sélectionner et utiliser des techniques d’analyse avancées
Capacité à identifier et à résoudre les problèmes de base ou modérément complexes ; capacité à analyser des scénarios modérément complexes pour définir des actions concrètes dans le cadre de ses fonctions ; capacité à agir en tant que représentant GE pour résoudre des problèmes sur des sites client
Capacité à mettre à jour régulièrement les connaissances des produits afin de comprendre les nouvelles fonctionnalités et contraintes ; comprendre les principaux concurrents et partenaires dans l’espace produit ; comprendre la stratégie de mise sur le marché et le positionnement des produits ; posséder une expérience du secteur pertinente pour comprendre les défis communs et les réalités auxquels sont confrontés les clients
Leadership :

Entretenir des relations positives avec l’ensemble des services, branches GE et clients concernés, afin de gérer efficacement les conflits et de créer un climat de transparence et de confiance mutuelle pour atteindre des objectifs communs ; montrer l’exemple d’une attitude collaborative afin d’encourager ces comportements au sein de l’équipe, favorisant ainsi un climat d’ouverture et de confiance mutuelle
Capacité avérée à définir des exigences et à collaborer sur des solutions, en s’appuyant sur ses propres connaissances techniques et sur un réseau d’experts ; adopter un style de communication qui encourage une interaction efficace avec le client et avec les équipes interfonctionnelles ; s’appuyer sur sa connaissance des fonctionnalités du produit pour limiter les risques et parvenir au résultat attendu
Assurer une perspective équilibrée sur les besoins du client/service par rapport aux objectifs commerciaux ; garantir une transparence en ce qui concerne l'approche et les options de résolution de problèmes ; démontrer une capacité à déterminer des résultats justes et raisonnables avec des compromis partagés ; faire preuve d'initiative en allant au-delà des limites et trouver des solutions en dehors du groupe
Qualités personnelles :
Faire face aux problèmes et aux questions liés aux produits de façon rigoureuse et disciplinée ; Définir les objectifs, les énoncés d’un problème et les ambiguïtés avant d’élaborer et d’évaluer des solutions évaluer systématiquement et de manière rationnelle les solutions possibles sur la base de critères explicités aux collaborateurs ; Identifier et décrire de façon formelle les différentes ambiguïtés et hypothèses avec les parties prenantes construire des arguments logiques à partir de faits et d’indicateurs
déterminer et articuler les facteurs clés de réussite nécessaires pour que le client puisse acquérir, mettre en œuvre et utiliser une solution ; assister le client dans l'identification des défauts, même si cela peut retarder une décision commerciale ; s'appuyer sur les experts de GE pour proposer des moyens innovants aux clients pour maîtriser les facteurs clés du succès

description:
What will be your role?
As our technology teams grow, we are looking for a Technical Program Manager to successfully help us deliver high-impact company-wide initiatives. You will drive cross-functional initiatives, leveraging strong leadership, planning, communication, and collaboration skills. You are technically strong with software engineering, systems engineering, and/or data science.

Does it sound like you?
You hold a Master’s Degree in Engineering or related fields.
You've got more than 5 years of experience as a software program manager or as an engineering or product leader.
You have successful experience leading cross-functional teams to deliver complex projects iteratively with multiple dependencies and constraints, in a highly dynamic and agile environment.
You show proven ability to operate effectively and autonomously across multiple teams in situations of extreme ambiguity, with only high-level direction.
You're experienced in building roadmaps, release plans, project plans with a thorough understanding of dependency management.
You've got excellent written and verbal communication skills: You're able to communicate highly technical problems and solutions at all levels from engineer to partners to executives.
You're able to influence, negotiate and inspire others in a complex organisation.
You've got excellent organization, planning skills, and attention to detail.
You have a true sense of urgency and a bias for action.
You are a framer and know how to clearly and concisely identify and frame problems.
You have good judgment: you know when to push when to escalate, when to get more information, and when to take someone aside and have a little private chat.
You have a great attitude: part of your job is to get over each and every one of the possible obstacles (not enough resources, not enough money, not enough time, not feasible, etc.), so at its core, you are a great problem solver. You don’t make excuses, You make it happen. You are tireless and unstoppable.

What will you do?
Lead iterative delivery of strategic cross-functional initiatives from concept to shipping, through focus, transparency, communication, visibility, and accountability: you'll interface with engineering managers and engineers to estimate work efforts, define milestones and manage resources. Track progress, resolve dependencies, evaluate risks and communicate status to upper management and project stakeholders. Engage and energize the project teams to achieve aggressive goals.
Leverage deep technical expertise with large-scale, distributed 24x7 production systems to build comprehensive plans, to identify risks, and to ensure smooth project launches with a goal of delighting our passengers and drivers
Partner with engineering, product, and business leadership to build highly collaborative teams and to enhance communication across teams and stakeholders
Proactively remove obstacles to drive momentum and progress. Identify communication gaps, manage issue escalations and provide support to teams balancing competing priorities. Drive results proactively.

What are going to be your main challenges?
From creating a Pooling offer to building a B2B platform, or enabling ops teams to open a new country in 2 clicks, we need to deliver multiple high-impact initiatives that will involve multiple teams. You are a problem solver who makes things happen around you by setting clear goals and inspiring teams to deliver. You will be both strategic and tactical and do what it takes to deliver key programs that have a material impact on the business.

What's next?
If your application is selected, the process will go as follows:
1. Interview with the CTO and the CPO (1h30)
2. Take home assignment (~5 days deadline)
3. Interview with some Product Managers (1h30) and some Engineering Managers (2h00)
4. Day on site (Paris) to meet your future stakeholders


Heetch embraces diversity and equal opportunity for everyone We provide a safe and inclusive work environment. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Because the more diverse we are, the better our work will be!

Heetch SAS is collecting your personal data (identity, contact details, academic background, professional experience and optionally a covering letter) for the processing of your application to our job offer, based on your consent.
Your personal data will only be accessible to our hiring team, our co-founders, and the manager of the position you are applying to. In addition, data are stored by our processor in order to use its applications tracking system. Your data may be stored outside of the EU/EEA but are protected by appropriated safeguards.
Your data are stored for a maximum duration of two years. If we do not reply to your application, you allow us to store your data during this term in order to potentially contact you for another position within our company or affiliates and subsidiaries.
You have a right to access to your data, to rectify them, under some conditions to erase them, and to limit the processing. Also, you have a right of portability on your data. In addition, you may revoke your consent and we shall stop processing your data. Eventually, you have a right to define directives about the fate of your data if your death should occur.
For more information about your rights, please see our privacy policy.

ERCOM développe une gamme complète de solutions simples et certifiées en réponse aux besoins croissants des entreprises en matière de communications sécurisées.
Nos 180 experts déploient des solutions en France et à l’Internationale auprès d’Institutions et d’Entreprises qui ont besoin de solutions fiables, simples et hautement sécurisées.

QUI ÊTES-VOUS ?
Formation supérieur (ingénieur ou équivalent)
Expérience opérationnelle dans l’ingénierie, l’exploitation, ou le déploiement des réseaux chez les opérateurs télécoms, ou pour des fournisseurs est indispensable.

Qualités rédactionnelles, en français comme en anglais

CE QUE NOUS POUVONS ACCOMPLIR ENSEMBLE :
Rattaché directement au Responsable de l’équipe Intégration et Customer Support au sein du Département Operations, vous intervenez principalement dans les phases de déploiement et demaintien en conditions opérationnelles du cycle de vie des projets clients et des produits / solutions SUNERIS. Pierre angulaire entre les services produit, validation, projets et avant-vente, vous êtes le point de contact technique privilégié des différents services.

Uniformiser les processus, la qualité et le savoir-faire technique et non-technique au sein du service

Participer à l’amélioration produit en tenant compte des remontées terrain

Aider le Chef de Projet Technique sur la mise en place des moyens d’opérer les systèmes dans les contextes clients
Augmentation de notre capacité à capitaliser notre savoir-faire et notre capacité à sous-traiter : prise en compte des améliorations proposées par les membres du service, prise de connaissance et diffusion des évolutions de nouvelles versions systèmes.
Uniformisation des livrables de chacune des affaires, avec le Chef de Projet Technique vers les clients internes et externes
Définition et participation à la mise en place d’outils et d’infrastructures internes et leur pérennité, notamment :
Infrastructures de communication avec les clients/sous-traitants
Plateformes de démonstration
Plateforme de pré-production
Vous êtes un des acteurs clé de la bonne exécution technique avec le Chef de Projet Technique, des livrables clients, et de l’excellence opérationnelle des projets de SUNERIS.
Vous pilotez la prise en compte et le respect de certaines contraintes : analyse du contexte et évaluation de la situation technique, rigueur, qualité, anticipation, synthèse et respect des délais.
Des déplacements sont à prévoir en Afrique et au Moyen Orient (max 25 % du temps de travail)
Possibilité d’astreintes ponctuelles en semaine et le week-end en heures ouvrées 9h00 - 18h00 à distance ou sur Vélizy

Innovation, passion, ambition : rejoignez Thales et créez le monde de demain, dès aujourd’hui.

Today's organizations are under pressure to digitally transform their business but are constrained by a diverse portfolio of applications, clouds and premises-based infrastructures. Docker unlocks the potential of every organization with a container platform that brings traditional applications and microservices built on Window, Linux and mainframe into an automated and secure supply chain, advancing dev to ops collaboration. Il/Elle travaille sous la direction du Responsable global Télémétrie et est intégré(e) à l'organisation en charge de l’ingénierie des systèmes de conception de solutions de télémétrie GICS hébergée à l’EME (Massy).
Le/La candidat(e) doit avoir une bonne connaissance du domaine de la télémétrie, notamment les technologies RTU, BCU, DCS, PMU, ainsi que les technologies de mesure et d’adaptation de télémétrie.
TECHNICAL ENGINEERING DESIGN
Prepare Telemetry Engineering documents including Architecture, SLD, Data List, RTU selection & sizing, Relays, Transducers and Adaptation Work.
Plan & Coordinate survey activities, analyse & broadcast survey results to project team.
Define or validate the tele information plan according to customer specifications and determine the database architecture and sizing for the Scada / EMS.
Define the tele signalling plan of RTU & DCS system.
Specify the Power supply system.
Define the Civil Work interfaces & coordinate.
Prepare the appropriate equipment purchase order request, follow up the purchase order & equipment delivery.
Dispatch the appropriate information & control the integration / installation drawings delivery.
Solve or/and escalate technical issues.
OFFSHORE ENGINEERING CONTROL
Responsible of follow up of Offshore Design Offices.
Prepare inputs data for offshore DO.
Support off-shore DO resources.
Control the drawings production in respect of quality, milestones and cost.
COMMISSIONING FOLLOW UP
Define during the work statement the site roll out strategy with the construction manager, Scada/EMS team and the Project manager.
Control the commissioning activities.
Participate to prepare installation & commissioning planning.
Give technical Support to the commissioning team.
Precipitate to recruiting of commissioning engineers

Scope of Work Management.
Prepare & participate to the technical transfer in-between Tender / Operation.
Participate with PM to the split of work, responsibility matrix, etc.
Define or validate the technical Specification & scope of work for Telemetry system.
Validate the project documentation structure.
Define technical offers for new extension & VO

Budget & Time control.
Define & control the technical milestones.
Identify & follow-up the technical risks/opportunities & define the associated action plan

Technical Coordination.
Be the technical interface with customer.
TECHNICAL REPORTING
Communicate to PM (milestones, technical risks, pending points, technical project progress).
Participate & contribute to the Project Reviews.
CONCEPTION TECHNIQUE
Préparer les documents techniques de télémétrie : architecture, SLD, liste de données, choix et dimensionnement d’unités RTU, relais, transducteurs et travaux d’adaptation.
Planifier et coordonner les activités d’enquête, analyser et diffuser les résultats d’enquête à l'équipe de projet.
Définir ou valider le plan de téléinformation selon les spécifications du client et déterminer l’architecture de base de données et le dimensionnement du système Scada/ EMS.
Définir le plan de télésignalisation de la RTU et du système DCS.

Qualifications/Requirements:
Spécifier le système d’alimentation.
Définir les interfaces de génie civil et assurer la coordination.
Préparer la demande de bon de commande d’équipement appropriée, assurer le suivi de la commande et la livraison de l’équipement.
Diffuser les bonnes informations et contrôler la livraison des schémas d'intégration/installation.
Résoudre et/ou remonter les problèmes techniques.
CONTRÔLE D’INGÉNIERIE OFFSHORE
Assurer le suivi des bureaux d’études offshore.
Préparer les données d’entrée pour les bureaux d’études offshore.
Soutenir les ressources des bureaux d’études offshore.
Contrôler la production des schémas en ce qui concerne la qualité, les étapes importantes et le coût.
SUIVI DE MISE EN SERVICE
Définir, lors de l’énoncé des travaux, la stratégie de déploiement sur site avec le directeur des travaux, l’équipe Scada/EMS et le/la chef de projet.
Contrôler les activités de mise en service.
Participer à la planification d’installation et de mise en service.
Apporter un soutien technique à l'équipe de mise en service.
Participer au recrutement des techniciens de mise en service et à la gestion du périmètre d’intervention.
Préparer et participer au transfert technique entre les équipes Appels d'offres et Opérations.
Participer avec le chef de projet à la répartition du travail, à l'élaboration de la matrice de responsabilité, etc.
Définir ou valider les spécifications techniques et le champ d'application du système de télémétrie.
Valider la structure de documentation de projet.
Définir les offres techniques pour une nouvelle extension et contrôler le budget VO et le temps.
Définir et contrôler les étapes techniques importantes.
Identifier et assurer le suivi des risques/opportunités techniques et définir la coordination technique du plan d’action associé.
Être l'interface technique avec le client.
REPORTING TECHNIQUE
Communiquer au/à la chef de projet les éléments suivants : étapes importantes, risques techniques, points en attente, état d’avancement du projet technique).
Participer et contribuer aux revues de projets.

Bachelor's Degree in Electrical Engineering from an accredited university or college or the same knowledge/experience.
Strong experience in Telemetry Domain.
Good understanding SCADA and Metering Technologies, in operation function (project delivery) background and system design.
Should have good knowledge of RTU (Remote Terminal Unit), Substation Automation System, Metering and PMU (Phasor Measurement Unit) Technologies.
Knowledge on energy management protocols including IEC101, 104, IEC 61850, MODBUS, DNP 3.0, RP570, DLMS etc…
Industry knowledge in the field of operation and multi sites project organizations.
Capacity to produce technical documentations (design and implementation documents,maintenance procedures, etc…).

Desired Characteristics:
Must have the experience of working in multi-domain projects and able to efficiently coordinate with all project stakeholders including Technical Manager and Project Manager.
Must be process and methodology oriented to ensure quality project deliveries.
Should have good knowledge of EHS and must be able to work individually at site.
Possess good understanding of project Budget and must be able to forecast in advance if there is a budget deviation.
Candidate must be innovative thinker and should be adaptive to new technologies.

BAC+3 en génie électrique dans une université ou un établissement d’enseignement supérieur agréé(e), ou expériences/connaissances équivalentes.
Solide expérience de la télémétrie.
Bonne compréhension des technologies SCADA et de mesure, expérience du service opérationnel (livraison de projets) et de la conception de systèmes.
Bonne connaissance des technologies RTU (terminaux distants), des systèmes d'automatisation de sous-station, ainsi que des technologies de mesure et PMU (unité de mesure de phaseur).
Connaissance des protocoles de gestion d'énergie, notamment IEC101, 104, IEC 61850, MODBUS, DNP 3.0, RP570, DLMS, etc.
Connaissance du secteur dans le domaine des opérations et des organisations de projets répartis sur plusieurs sites.
Capacité à produire de la documentation technique (documents de conception et de mise en œuvre, procédures de maintenance, etc.).
Expérience des projets multidomaines et capacité à coordonner efficacement avec toutes les parties prenantes du projet, notamment le responsable technique et le/la chef de projet.
Attentif(ve) aux processus et aux méthodologies pour assurer des livraisons de projets de qualité.
Bonne connaissance EHS et capacité à travailler avec autonomie sur site.
Bonne compréhension de la budgétisation de projet et capacité à prévoir à l'avance les écarts de budget.
Esprit d’innovation et capacité à s’adapter aux nouvelles technologies.

Significant experience as an electrical control designer for a utility or engineering firm.
Should have experience of working in EHV, HV and MV Substation.
Prior experience with field installation and commissioning will be highly desirable.
Some experience on SCADA / EMS / DMS Technologies will be desirable.
Knowledge on PMU & Metering Technologies is desirable.
Knowledge of Networking and Telecom domain will be desirable.
Fluent in French (desirable) and English language including oral, reading and writing skills.
Should be flexible to carry out several missions at global sites (commissioning activity).

Expérience significative en tant que concepteur de commandes électriques pour une entreprise de services publics ou d'ingénierie.
Expérience des sous-stations EHV, HV et MV.
Expérience préalable de l'installation et de la mise en service sur site fortement appréciée.
Expérience des technologies SCADA/EMS/DMS souhaitable.
Connaissance des technologies PMU et de mesure souhaitable.
Connaissance du domaine des réseaux et des télécommunications souhaitable.
Français (souhaitable) et anglais courants (lu, parlé et écrit).
Flexible pour effectuer plusieurs missions sur des sites mondiaux (activités de mise en service).

About Us:
GE (NYSE:GE) drives the world forward by tackling its biggest challenges. By combining world-class engineering with software and analytics, GE helps the world work more efficiently, reliably, and safely. GE people are global, diverse and dedicated, operating with the highest integrity and passion to fulfill GE’s mission and deliver for our customers. www.ge.com
Additional Locations:
France;Massy;

description:
At Algolia, we are passionate about helping developers & product teams connect their users with what matters most in milliseconds!

We want to make the implementation of Algolia as smooth and easy as possible for Shopify users. We're looking for a Software Engineer to help us fundamentally change the way developers are implementing search. Your main goal is to design, architecture & implement enhancements to our Shopify Integration. We want you to help us build a state of the art service used by millions of customers using our search engine. You'll join an existing team of 4 people who value quality, interdependence and ownership.

At Algolia, we spell Culture with a capital ‘C’. That’s why as a candidate you should value & practice transparency, take ownership, have the humility to acknowledge your weaknesses and continuously strive to grow both professionally and personally.

If you're problem solver, able to think outside the box and eager to work on a project with a strong a product focus, then this is your challenge!
YOUR ROLE WILL CONSIST OF:
Design, architecture & implement features for our customers using our Shopify Integration
Help our users in customizing our service to fit their needs
Partner with the other teams to provide a unique on-boarding and support experience
Build clean, reusable and scalable code or libraries
Help design the JavaScript-based search UI/UX
YOU MIGHT BE A FIT IF YOU HAVE:
3+ years of web development experience in Ruby on Rails and Javascript
Rigor in high code quality, automated testing, and other engineering best practices
Great oral and written communication in English
Will to share ownership of the project and its code with all members
Experience with Git
NICE TO HAVE:
Experience with developing for Shopify
Experience with working in a very fast-paced and continuously changing environment
Experience with working in an open-source environment
Experience of AWS or another cloud service provider
Experience of working on architecture with thousands of customers
Experience with regular customer interaction
WE'RE LOOKING FOR SOMEONE WHO CAN LIVE OUR VALUES:
GRIT - Problem-solving and perseverance capability in an ever-changing and growing environment
TRUST - Willingness to trust our co-workers and to take ownership
CANDOR - Ability to receive and give constructive feedback
CARE - Genuine care about other team members, our clients and the decisions we make in the company
HUMILITY- Aptitude for learning from others, putting ego aside.
BENEFITS:
Private Medical Insurance
Life and Disability Insurance
Business Travel Insurance
Relocation support
Company Canteen (high standard)
Flexible work hours and time off
PERKS:
Competitive pay and equity
Your choice of computer, phone, keyboard, you name it. Everything you need to be efficient
Coaching and sponsorship to participate and speak at leading industry conferences
Ongoing professional education opportunities through internal & external workshops, including public speaking, language learning (English/French)
Fun: we spend time together — team building, socializing and making tools that encourage getting to know teammates across offices and continents.
Charitable contribution matching
Unique referral rewards program: refer a candidate, and we’ll donate to your charity of choice
Corporate flats available for the first months of relocation and when you travel to different offices
Fully stocked kitchens
Team workouts
Regular meals & happy hours

Guarantee support and capitalization.

French, Fluent Level

description:
At Keysight, we're in business to help scientists and engineers address their toughest challenges with precision and confidence. We offer the most precise electronic measurement tools in the industry, along with advanced software to match.
In this role you will be part of the KeysightCare Customer Support Organization, delivering post-sales customer support directly to key customers and strategic partners.
We are looking for an experienced engineer who can demonstrate a broad knowledge of instrumentation, applications and technologies; who can coach and share their technical expertise to raise the technical capability across the EMEAI team. As an RF or digital application/product specialist, you will be seen as the ‘go to’ knowledge expert within KeysightCare and will engage with customer and partners across EMEAI to deliver post-sales customer support.

You will work with the local KeysightCare team to structure and manage day to day operations, with the expectation the successful candidate will develop into a team leadership role, with people management responsibility. You will be a key contributor to the KeysightCare EMEAI regional strategy and will work across the KeysightCare to lead projects requiring coordination with other functions, customers, third parties.

The successful candidate must demonstrate a real passion for customer success and enjoy taking on complex technical challenges working in a customer facing deep technical environment.
Responsibilities include:
Coach and share technical expertise across the EMEAI team.
Be the knowledge expert within KeysightCare and engage with customers and partners across EMEAI to deliver post-sales customer support, solving technical questions of varied scope and complexity.
Manage day to day operations and workload expectations, with expectation to develop into team leadership role with people management responsibility.
You will drive the implementation of KeysightCare post sales-support strategy in France.
Key contributor to the KeysightCare regional strategy. Together with expert engineers across EMEAI, define a structured training model to address soft skills and technical competence across EMEAI team.
Close cooperation with the Keysight product and software divisions. The technical support application engineer is the technical interface between the customers and the Keysight Worldwide support team.
Take proactive actions while interacting with customers in terms of solving current questions or addressing potential future needs.
PLEASE SUBMIT YOUR RESUME IN ENGLISH.
Job Qualifications
Bachelor and/or Master’s degree in Electrical Engineering or science discipline.
Typically, 8+ years relevant experience working in a Digital/RF technologies or related business.
Requires in-depth technical knowledge and experience in job and ability to work independently.
Solid understanding of the generation, demodulation and analysis of digital communication signals.
Solid understanding of RF/MW fundamentals with practical experience using RF/MW test equipment.
Advanced Scripting Programming skills using languages such as C++,C#, VEE, LabView, Python, MATLAB ® or VB, an advantage.
Strong organisational skills, ability to multi-task, prioritise and work well under pressure.
Local language written and oral communication essential. A strong level of English language required.
Understands the local market, customer needs and dynamics, strong communicator who can positively interact with customers.
Full driving license.

Keysight is an equal opportunity employer.
Job Function
Support / Service

Business:
Keysight Global Services Organization

Employment Program:
Regular

Duration (temp position only):
Not Applicable

Relocation Benefits:
No

Shift:
Day Job

Schedule:
Full Time (F)

Travel Required:
< 25%

Candidates can be considered to work from the following locations: Les Ulis, Paris / France

meta1:
Professional Services Analyst (Paris)
Medallia, Inc. - Paris (75)
date_publication:
il y a 5 mois
- Continuer pour postuler
Signaler cette offre d'emploi
description:
Medallia’s mission is to help companies win through customer experience. The world’s best-loved brands trust Medallia’s Experience Cloud™, which embeds the pulse of the customer in an organization and empowers employees with the real-time customer data, insights, and tools they need to make every experience great. Named a leader in the most recent Forrester Wave and ranked in the 2018 Forbes Cloud 100 list, Medallia is growing quickly, with a global footprint that spans Silicon Valley, Austin, New York, Washington DC, London, Paris, Sydney, Buenos Aires, and Tel Aviv. Here, we value people for each of the aspects that make them whole. We believe that people should not be defined only by a job title—nobody is "just an engineer" or "just a salesperson." We are each partners, parents, children, siblings, friends, and former classmates. We have different backgrounds and we celebrate different cultures. And, just like our product, we honor each of the experiences that build our people.

At Medallia we hire the whole person, not just a part of them.

Medallia is the global leader in Customer Experience Management. Our mission is to create a world where companies are loved by their customers; where organizations see you as a person and not just their next sale. We do this by building a bridge between hundreds of companies and billions of customers, around the world, enabling access to your eyes, ears, and hearts, so they may design and deliver extraordinary experiences, every single day.

THE FUNCTION:
The Professional Services team deploys and manages the Medallia feedback platform for leading global companies across retail, financial services, hospitality, high tech, and other industries. As a member of the team, you will partner with senior decision makers at admired brands on a mission critical task—helping companies improve in the eyes of their ultimate judges: customers. You work with cutting-edge technology and tackle real business problems. You gain exposure to a wide range of industries and work with great colleagues. Most importantly, you get to build: build a great company, build awesome relationships and programs with our customers, build lifelong friendships, and build a new industry.

THE ROLE:
As an Analyst you will be assigned to multiple projects and accounts depending on our need and your interests and expertise. The assignments vary from designing and implementing our software for new customers to enhancing and managing live customer accounts.

Product Implementation:
Work with senior team members to carry out customer implementations and program enhancements
Participate in the implementation design, setup, and review processes
Identify improvements to our feedback products and processes
Utilize Medallia software knowledge to configure surveys and reports
Client Management:
Build long-standing customer relationships by improving customer feedback programs
Provide support to client meetings by leveraging in-depth Medallia system capabilities
Work with client teams in resolving technical/system related inquiries
Provide quality assurance support when providing features to clients
Provide client support when analyzing large sets of data
Other Responsibilities:
Engage in new product launches and other cross-functional initiatives with Engineering and Marketing
Develop a thorough understanding of product features that are relevant to each client program

You gain exposure to a wide range of industries and work with great colleagues. You will develop a customer-first mindset, learn about how to position compelling product features to customers, and manage our product to deliver to customer needs. Most importantly, you get to build: build a great company, build awesome relationships and programs with our customers, build lifelong friendships, and build a new industry.
Minimum Qualifications:
Experience successfully managing and retaining clients while leveraging software
Education: BA/BS, with evidence of technical experience or equivalent relevant experience.
Preferred Qualifications:
Lightning-fast learner and great problem-solver
Experience working in one of the following industries: Software, Hospitality, Financial Services, Automotive, B2B, and/or Retail.
Advanced degree is a plus
Top candidates:
Aspire to make our world-class clients (Four Seasons, Sephora, Mercedes, etc.) as customer-centric as your local coffee joint
Get energized by working with a team to creatively build on each other’s expertise
Love technical problem-solving and are passionate about learning and stretching yourself, from picking up JavaScript and XML to honing your client-facing skills
Can't wait to become an expert on our industry-leading product and leverage this knowledge to maximize Medallia's value for clients
Have fantastic attention to detail, and excellent analytical and communication skills
Note: This role is not eligible for immigration/visa sponsorship.

At Medallia, we don’t just accept difference - we celebrate it and recognize the value it brings to our customers and employees. Medallia is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. Equal opportunity and consideration are afforded to all qualified applicants and employees. We won't unlawfully discriminate on the basis of gender identity or expression, race, ethnicity, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, physical or mental disability, Veteran status, sexual orientation, and any other category protected by law.

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is looking for Data Warehousing and Analytics Solutions Architects for our French customers. If you have experience in designing architecture of data ingestion, storage, processing and visualization, leveraging tools such as Teradata, Pentaho, Qlik, Tableau or Elasticsearch and are interested in helping customers embrace cloud technologies, come and talk to us. Specialist Solutions Architects work with AWS' partners and customers to accelerate their cloud transformation. They engage in a wide range of activities around their domain of expertise, providing technical advice to customers, helping the internal and external communities, presenting AWS publicly on their domain, and providing a preferred path between AWS service teams and customers.

This is an opportunity to join Amazon’s technical teams, working with our engineers on the new services that power the cloud ecosystem, while developing your skills and furthering your career within what we believe to be one of the most innovative and progressive technology companies. These engagements will focus on Data warehousing, Business Intelligence, and Machine Learning. This role will specifically focus on AWS Services for Analytics, and on helping our customers and partners build innovative Solutions and Businesses that focus on leveraging the value of data.

As a Data Warehousing and Analytics Specialist Solutions Architect (SA), you will help customers select the technologies that will support their business requirements. Part of the Specialist Solutions Architecture team, you will work closely with the other Specialist SAs on Big Data, Databases, Analytics, Artificial Intelligence, or Security, as well as the Business Development teams, to enable large-scale customer use cases and drive the adoption of AWS for their data processing platforms. You will interact with other SAs, providing guidance on their customer engagements by developing white papers, blogs, reference implementations, and presentations to enable customers and 3rd parties to fully leverage the AWS platform. You will also create field enablement materials for the broader SA population, to help them understand how to integrate AWS solutions into customer architectures.

Candidates have a mix of communication and technical skills, and will have the ability to engage with customers at different levels in the organization, from executive to developer. Previous experience with AWS is desired but not required, provided you have experience building large scale solutions. You will get the opportunity to work directly with senior engineers at customers, partners and AWS service teams, influencing their roadmaps and driving innovation.

If you are someone who enjoys innovating, likes solving hard problems and working on the cutting edge of technology, we would love to have you on the team.
Amazon's Culture Our positive and supportive culture encourages our people to do their best work every day. We have 14 leadership principles that help guide us in our every-day decision making process. We believe they are a clearer articulation of those things that have always been a part of what makes Amazon great – things that we must consciously hold on to in fulfilling our mission to be Earth’s Most Customer Centric Company. We are continuously looking for new ways to maintain a culture where our people excel and lead healthy and happy lives. Learn more about life at Amazon. It is always Day One.

How You’ll Grow At Amazon, our professional development plan focuses on helping people at every level of their career to identify and use their strengths to do their best work every day. From entry-level employees to senior leaders, we believe there’s always room to learn and develop your career. We offer opportunities to help sharpen your skills in addition to hands-on experience in the global, fast-changing business world. From on-the-job learning experiences to formal development programs, our professionals have a variety of opportunities to continue to grow throughout their career.

Roles and responsibilities
Customers' trusted advisor: collaborate with AWS account, training and support teams to help partners and customers learn and use AWS services such as Amazon Redshift, Kinesis, SageMaker, Glue, S3, DynamoDB, and the Relational Database Service (RDS)
Business partner: serve as a key member of the business development and account management team in helping to ensure customer success in building and migrating applications, software and services on the AWS platform.
Public engagement: provide thought leadership on Analytics solutions that benefit customers through the use of AWS Services. This takes the form of contribution to external publications such as the AWS Blogs, Whitepapers and Reference architectures, or public presentations at AWS Summits, AWS re:Invent, AWS User Groups or industry events
Community player: capture and share best-practices, participate, and contribute as a member of the worldwide AWS technical community of Solution Architects, Professional Services Consultants, Technical Account Managers, and AWS Trainers
Service team point of contact: act as a conduit between the AWS Service teams and the customers, providing detailed guidance for the broader field organization and the customers, and acting as an advocate for the customers towards the central teams

We're backed by $320 million in venture funding and in early 2019 were valued at $1.25 billion. Our mission is to power the world's catering, and we'll make it happen – even more surely if you come help us.

We have been growing 2X per year. Even faster in Europe. But 10X growth is out there, and we want it. Our people are terrifically talented straight-shooters who love what they do. And everyone is generous and kind, too—we have a strict no jerk policy. Ready to join us?

description:
Une entreprise qui transforme le monde qui nous entoure

Chez Palantir, nous concevons des logiciels qui offrent des solutions aux problèmes les plus importants au monde. Nous établissons des partenariats avec les plus puissantes institutions afin de transformer l'utilisation de leurs données. Nos logiciels sont utilisés pour empêcher des attaques terroristes, découvrir de nouveaux médicaments, déjouer des fraudes bancaires, et bien plus encore.

Les missons proposées

En tant que Site Reliability Operations Analyst vous travaillez au cœur des déploiements clients de Palantir. Vous êtes responsable de la conception, de l’implémentation et de l’exécution des process pour rationaliser les workflows et réduire les points de friction. Vous suivez et stabilisez les projets, vous faites disparaître les points bloquants et anticipez les besoins du client pour permettre aux ingénieurs de concentrer leur temps et attention sur les problèmes techniques qu'ils sont les plus à même de résoudre.
Ce poste exige des compétences de gestion de projet, d'optimisation des processus et de capacité d’exécution. Vous êtes une personne qui aime régler les problèmes et qui adopte la meilleure idée, même lorsqu'elle ne vient pas de vous.

Vos principales responsabilités

Vous travaillez sur un grand nombre de problèmes et défis. Vous pouvez aider un déploiement chez une client un jour, et le suivant rejoindre un nouveau pilote de l'autre côté de la planète.
Vous êtes la personne de référence en cas de problème. Même si ce problème ne fait pas partie de votre domaine d'expertise, vous vous proposez pour le régler et demandez de l'aide seulement si vous avez épuisé toutes les autres possibilités.
Vous concevez et mettez en place des processus réduisant les points de friction et permettant à tous les membres de votre équipe de se vouer à ce qu'ils font le mieux.
Vous êtes créatifs, travailler avec l’esprit d’équipe et faire tout ce qui est possible pour réaliser vos tâches.

Le profil recherché

Une grande capacité de jugement et de sang froid dans les situations stressantes.
Une approche créative dans la gestion de projet afin de permettre de rapides itérations et des méthodes peu coûteuses pour communiquer notre avancement à nos clients.
Un relationnel client exceptionnel.
Une passion pour le développement de partenariats forts avec nos clients.
Une attention méticuleuse aux détails, ce qui inclus maintenir des dossiers à jour et traquer les métriques-clés du projet.
Un enthousiasme pour aller travailler chez et avec le client et/ou aider des projets internes, en apportant ordre et efficacité dans les initiatives internes.
Un excellent niveau d’anglais
25 à 75 % de déplacements professionnels. Cela peut varier en fonction du lieu et de l'équipe.

Si vous avez besoin d’aide ou d’ajustements lors de vos entretiens en raison d’un handicap, vous pouvez nous contacter sur accommodations@palantir.com.

A World-Changing Company

At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.

The Role

As a Site Reliability Operations Analyst you are the engine behind Palantir deployments. You are responsible for crafting, implementing and executing processes to streamline workflows and reduce friction. You track and stabilize projects, remove roadblocks, and anticipate customer needs to free up our engineers to focus their time and attention on the technical problems they are best equipped to solve.
This position requires a combination of project management, process optimization, and execution skills. You are a person who loves fixing problems and always embraces the best idea, even when it is not your own.

Core Responsibilities

Work on many different types of problems and challenges. You might be supporting a deployment at a large, global customer one day, and jetting off across the world to help out with a new pilot project the next.
Be the first responders when things go wrong. Even if a problem is outside your area of expertise, you make the first move to fix it, and only ask for help when we’ve exhausted all that we can possibly do.
Craft and implement process to reduce friction and enable all team members to spend their time on what they do best.
Think creatively, work collaboratively, and do whatever it takes to get the job done.

What We Value

Extraordinary judgment and composure in high-pressure situations.
A creative approach to project management centered around lightweight frameworks that enable rapid iteration and low-overhead methods of keeping our customers informed.
Excellent customer service skills.
A real passion for developing strong partnerships with customers.
Meticulous attention to detail, including maintaining accurate records and diligently tracking key project metrics.
Enthusiasm for working on site with customers and/or supporting internal projects and senior leadership, bringing order and efficiency to critical internal initiatives.
Ability to travel 25 – 75% required. Varies by location and team.

If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at accommodations@palantir.com.

About Us

Marketing and digital experience teams at thousands of the world's most admired companies ( https://www.airship.com/customers/ )rely on Airship's Customer Engagement Platform to create deeper connections with customers by delivering incredibly relevant, orchestrated messages on any channel.

Founded in 2009 as a pioneer in push notifications, Airship now gives brands the user-level data, engagement channels, AI orchestration and services they need to deliver push notifications, emails, SMS, in-app messages, mobile wallet cards and more to exactly the right person in exactly the right moment — building trust, boosting engagement, driving action and growing value.

Learn more about our Customer Engagement Platform ( https://www.airship.com/platform/ )or read our blog ( https://www.airship.com/blog/ ).

About You

You possess strong software engineering and Java development fundamentals. You value delivering products that delight and you are unafraid to dig into unknown codebases to unravel unexpected behaviors. You value reliability, testability, and maintainability. You're proud of the code you write, but you're also pragmatic and believe in iteration. You know when it is time to refactor, and when it's time to ship.

About the Position

The job of a Backend Java /Node.js engineer at Airship is to focused on distributed system design, development, and support. We provide low latency services that process a stream of events from both apps/web/mobile wallet/email/sms and internal services.

Our backend infrastructure is built on the Google Cloud Platform and AWS.
Our platform uses microservices that talk to NoSQL databases and handle immense load.
You'll be involved in schema design, ownership of data semantics, and a lot of squinting at server metrics trying to puzzle out why database write latency spiked in the 99th percentile and moved the emphasis in "near-real-time" from "real" to "near."
Our API are both developed on Java and Node.js and we are dealing with billions of API per days
You'll be in charge of:
Maintaining and improving our API developed in Node.js
Attached to the Backend Java Team, work on projects such as segmentation, API, backend structure...
Experience and Skills:
Relevant experience of 3 to 5+ years with software engineering best practices: unit testing, code reviews, documentation, and version control.
Relevant experience working on Java and Node.js
Experience with distributed systems
Willingness to work as part of a team to achieve shared commitments
Calmly work in a fast-paced environment to ensure continuous delivery
Provide mentorship and guidance for less experienced engineers
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Bonus points for:
Solid fundamentals with Linux
Experience with the Google Cloud Platform or AWS
Practiced Git workflows
Experience with distributed NoSQL systems or key-value stores
