DESCRIPTION
POSITION MISSION & MAIN ACTIVITIES
Job Purpose

The manager of the Head of Cloud Distributed and Integration team works within the Technical Technology Office and he/she is accountable to define the vision and the path to transform AXA infrastructures into a level similar to Tech-Led Companies. Creation of this vision and transformation path are done in close collaboration with product teams. This will include the definition and management of technology strategy, technical choices and high level architectures of Cloud, Distriubted and Integration technical products.
His/her domain of exercise is:
Public and private cloud as a key AXA strategic element of tech led strategy,
Distributed which includes compute, software, storage, Mainframe and Database
Integration (in construction) which includes EIP, ESG, global API, Orchestration, Scheduling and overall Management & Monitoring services.
First and foremost, in a collaborative approach leveraging sponsors, stakeholders and communities (product, chapters, entities, security, developers, market providers …), head of CDI owns the overall and per component vision. In this role, he/she will contribute significantly during the first phase of AXA gating process (Gate 0: idea till Gate 1: vision & strategy).
Secondly, the head of CDI leads the lifecycle of technology choice and is a key decision maker on architecture using and animating governance to move from vision to implementation. For this phase, he/she will be in strong support of the Product / Program manager that will deliver the Gate 2 (commitment on solution, timing and budget). And later on in the lyfecycle will coordinate and engage his/her team in all architectural steps required from Gate 2 to Gate 4 and subsequent refresh/decommissioning activity.
He/she will lead and the team have a key role in participating in key the initiatives of the domain to guarantee transversal coordination: feasibility studies, opportunity studies, business case, major contract negotiation or position papers; should it be for Group Operations products but also for OpCo questions. They finally provide architecture support and consultancy where needed by products.
The head of CDI is one of the key actors in necessary to communicate the vision, evangelize stakeholders and represent Technology Office. This needs to be done through clear leadership, vision and communication. This includes represents AXA IT with our key vendors, partners and internal collegues.

Main Activities. Provides infrastructure technology vision, leadership and standardization and this in close relation with product head cloud, distributed and Integration:
o Formalizes and writes the vision: executive notes, evangelization deck, strategy document …
o Defines Cloud, distributed and integration Product Technology Strategy in support of Group IT strategy
o Owns and defines the cloud, distributed and integration content of the Group Target Archtiecture
o Approves and contributes to end-to-end solution design in collaboration with Product Engineering to provide the overall product architecture, and ensure that its design is consistent with Group Operations standards and good practices
o Facilitates collaboration and knowledge sharing between technical experts within AXA Service

Defines design patterns:
o Determines Technical Infrastructure designs/evolutions required jointly with Product Engineering teams. This includes the delivery of product blueprints, High-Level Designs and contribution to Low-Level Designs
o Minimizes technical complexity and identifies convergence opportunities

Manages and contributes to Product Governance & Architecture Community
o Contributes to product governance bodies for architecture related matters
o Ensures the coordination between product governance bodies and Architecture dedicated governance bodies
o Organizes, governs and animates Architecture gevernance bodies and architecture communities (with special focus on cloud architect community)
o Supports Cloud Product Technology governance for Architecture related matters
o Attends product and community meetings and events
o Provides feedback on community structure, tools and content to aid in continuous improvement

Watches market and maintain strategic vendors relationship
o Leads relationship with strategic vendors for architecture related matters in relationship with Procurement, Product Engineering teams and Operations
o Ensures follow-up for architecture matters with strategic vendors
o Provides a key presence within the broader industry through close strategic vendor relationships and industry standards setting bodies.

QUALIFICATIONS
PROFILE, SKILLS & COMPETENCIES
Attitude
The person will have to manage the complexity of a global organization operating in a decentralized organisation. Goals can only be achieved through:
Openness to different opinions and creation of consensus
Agility to constantly address new topics and new stakeholders
Embracing of the new AXA values and new ways of working with courage to promote them against tradition
Willingness to serve the overall objective of enterprise-wide consistency above any tactical goal
Tenacity and endurance for dealing with ambiguity between management, OpCos and Operational teams
Acting as a leader in collaboration and generating attractive and effective ways of working

Experience
University degree (engineer profile) with > 15 years experience (IT, large global programs, International landscape), including management of a Technical Services organization or equivalent
Must exhibit a strong understanding of today’s computing challenges and trends, mostly at Infrastructure and Technical levels. Application and Information Architecture knowledge in AXA’s businesses would be a plus.
Must have experience in driving large architecture, standardization & transformation initiatives
Established and demonstrably productive technical relationships with major IT vendors
Proven ability to thrive in a matrixed, multi-cultural and global environment
Strategic thinking
Articulates a multi-dimensional (cultures, languages, geographical locations, business contexts) thinking in order to develop a vision and a strategy
Has a deep understanding of organizational structures, in order to be in a position to better identify improvement points
Has Analytical, logical and interpretive ability at a management level to interpret scenarios, express concepts or models with several dimensions: architecture, Business Cases, procurement, program approach …
Recommends strategic scenarios relevant to complexity, scope, risk and magnitude of the solving problem
Delivers a strategic vision for the product evolution and foster vision buy-in.
Drives Cloud Product Technology Strategy in support of AXA Service strategy.
Ensures Product’s architecture remains consistent with AXA Service standards and good practices.
Determines Technical Infrastructure designs/evolutions required jointly with Product Engineering teams. This includes the delivery of product blueprints, High-Level Designs and contribution to Low-Level Designs.
Ensures the execution of the architecture deliverables within the governance of strategic programs/Products.
IS accountable for his/her domain’s governance and contributes to product governance bodies & architecture community.
Leads relationship with strategic vendors for architecture related matters in relationship with Procurement, Product Engineering teams and Operations.
Acts as a reference for oversight on cloud market dynamics and future Cloud market trends, this includes also the product technical components.
Deals with very high level of complexity as he/she will address all technology domains and ensure the right balance between long term and short term goals/benefits. All this while looking at the global dimension of AXA and Group IT and working successfully with executives at Group IT, OpCo and Group levels.
Managerial
Management: To achieve his main responsibilities, the head of Cloud Distributed and integration relies on a core team of 5 to 8 architects and some external expertise . He or she also relies on the technical expert teams in AXA Services (especially products) and OpCo IT teams to contribute to the Global deliverables.
Creates a working environment for testing and developing new ways of working and collaboration spirit, as a role model for other teams
Empowers team by providing sufficient guidance, by delegating and trusting them on their accountabilities but by still remaining available for advice and help
Builds and hires the relevant team to take those challenges
Recognizes potential leaders and provides them with challenging assignments/stretch goals
Can effectively mentor others to acquire this competency
Add project, program management, gating principles and standards to the initiatives

Transversal skills:
Ability to work in a matrix environment & with senior executives
Strong multi-cultural understanding and application
Ability to build collaborative relationships with both internal customers and program/project stakeholders
Facilitation, negotiation and influencing skills to achieve results in a matrix management environment
Problem solving, strong analytical skills
Excellent writing and oral communication skills for senior executices, large community and operational teams
Sense of urgency and efforts redirection if necessary to maintain sound time-management of initiatives
Decision making and ability to work independently in a complex environment
High degree of work ethics and professionalism; leads by example
Fluent in English

Infrastructure & cloud practices:
Strong expertise in Cloud design patterns and infrastructure good practices
Requires deep understanding of the cloud technology and market practices with very good/established level of expertise.

Architecture & Strategy:
Good expertise in the practice of Architecture: frameworks (TOGAF, Archimate, …) to deliver a holistic view
Understanding of the current AXA Service Product business model as an Cloud product provider and ability to communicate at all levels regarding the key components of the model.
Program & Project management :
Strong/proven ability to deliver global programs relying on resources in multiple countries
Strong ability to balance risk and investment when designing technical architectures
Able to provide leadership and to establish credibility both internally, with our customer and within the marketplace. Able to develop and promote new concepts versus following existing processes. Ability to foresee the future technology trends and their impact on AXA & AXA Service while remaining realistic. Ability to influence & negotiate with partners, customers, and internally.
Communication skills (both oral and written) to develop and deliver the key AXA Service messages for our customer, partners and internally
Action / results oriented, energetic and positive to “sell” the strategic directions and drive AXA Service’s evolution to adopt them.
Taking into account the multi-cultural environment, a fluent English knowledge in speaking and writing is mandatory.
ABOUT AXA
Would you like to wake up every day driven and inspired by our noble mission and to work together as one global team to empower people to live a better life? Here at AXA we strive to lead the transformation of our industry. We are looking for talented individuals who come from varied backgrounds, think differently and want to be part of this exciting transformation by challenging the status quo so we can push AXA - a leading global brand and one of the most innovative companies in our industry - onto even greater things.
In a fast-evolving world and with a presence in 64 countries, our 166,000 employees and exclusive distributors anticipate change to offer services and solutions tailored to the current and future needs of our 103 million customers.


WHAT WE OFFER
At AXA, we lead an HR policy that encourages diversity, maintains your professional and private life balance and accelerates the skills and career development : promotion of diversity, remuneration policy, training device, ... Discover everything that makes AXA an employer of choice.
Whatever your job is, we strive to offer you career opportunities. Our goal is to develop your skills to support the transformation of our changing business.

description:
Dataiku’s mission is big: to enable all people throughout companies around the world to use data by removing friction surrounding data access, cleaning, modeling, deployment, and more. But it’s not just about technology and processes; at Dataiku, we also believe that people (including our people!) are a critical piece of the equation.

We are looking for an outstanding software test engineer.

Our R&D team creates Dataiku DSS, a cutting-edge product that allows data analysts to discover hidden insights. As a software engineer in test, your mission will be to ensure that we only deliver highest-quality products to our customers. You will play a crucial role in our success by helping our users have the best possible experience.

DSS is built on modern Web technologies (single page webapp with Angular/AngularJS) and integrates with a very large ecosystem of big data technologies (Spark, Hadoop, MPP databases, Cloud services, ...) . Our software testing stack includes developer-led unit tests, automated backend integration testing, automated browser-side testing and some manual frontend testing.

At Dataiku, developers are involved in writing part of the automated integration tests together with the QA team.
As a software engineer in test, your responsibilities will include:
Working on advanced automated test suites to exercice our applications at all levels
Helping build and expand our test infrastructure and frameworks (virtual machines, containers, auto-provisioning, UI testing, ...)
Ensuring that lessons are learnt from bugs in production
Defining manual testing plans
Working with the developers to ensure that they deliver testable code
You are the ideal recruit if:
You have a passion for quality and a good attention to details
You are not scared about technical challenges and technologies diversity
You have a prior experience working on automated testing of an end-to-end application
You know that Selenium is not only the name of the 34th element
Experience with testing single-page web applications is a big plus, as is experience with big data technologies
To fulfill its mission, Dataiku is growing fast (having just closed a $101 million Series C round in December 2018 and looking to double in 2019), but still maintains a startup spirit. Dataiku serves its global customer base from its headquarters in New York City as well as offices in Paris, London, Munich, Singapore, and Sydney. Each of our offices has a unique culture, but underpinning local nuances, we always value curiosity, collaboration, and can-do attitudes.

Job Title: Support Engineer – L1

Reporting Line: Director Technical Support Servcies- Tintri Team

The Tintri Technology has enjoyed a level of customer satisfaction that is unparalleled to many other Technologies, this will have been partly due to the amazing team that supports the product We have recently moved the Technical support function to our Paris office and are looking to build a New team of Technical support Engineers.
They are all excited about the agility of public cloud—AWS, Azure, etc.—and Tintri puts all that agility right inside their data centers. That’s no small feat. To deliver on that promise, we had to build an all-flash architecture that is completely distinct from legacy solutions—using a building block approach akin to public cloud. And it’s just one signal that at Tintri, employees get to work on projects that are well … unconventional, challenging and high impact.

The desire to stand apart has also helped Tintri get noticed. CDW is the biggest reseller in the business—we were just named their Partner of the Year. In both Gartner Magic Quadrants covering our space we’re recognized as a Visionary. And we’re growing: more than 1,000 organizations—including 20% of the Fortune 100—trust Tintri. Please consider trusting the next stage of your career to Tintri, too.

As a Technical Support Engineer, you will provide first-level support to customers, support personnel, and field support staff, focused on troubleshooting, repairing and debugging Tintri products. Support incidents can range from hardware and/or software issues with Tintri storage systems and solutions, to interoperability issues. Always take care of the customer. Customer Satisfaction is job #1.

Validate technical information and issues early warnings and disseminates information as needed.

Exceptional command of the English language

Ability to work in a 24X7X365 organization, including weekends and holidays if required

TCP/IP based networking and troubleshooting skills
Experience with Network File System (NFS), the UNIX remote file sharing protocol

About Emerson
At Emerson, we are innovators and problem-solvers, focused on a common purpose: leaving our world in a better place than we found it. Each and every day, our foundational values—integrity, safety and quality, supporting our people, customer focus, continuous improvement, collaboration and innovation—inform every decision we make and empower our employees to keep reaching higher.

As a global technology and engineering leader, we provide groundbreaking solutions for customers in industrial, commercial, and residential markets.

Our Commercial & Residential Solutions business helps ensure human comfort and health, protect food quality and safety, advance energy efficiency and create sustainable infrastructure.

description:
We are looking for an Engineering Manager to join our Product and Tech team in Paris. The team focuses on building our educational platform to make our students successful.

As a leader in this part of the organization, technical leadership and a background in software development are important to be able to challenge and grow our engineers. However, the role is at the same time people-first and technology first.
Your primary responsibility is to the people on your team: ensuring that your team members are growing, performing well, doing valuable work and generally having a great time at OpenClassrooms. You’ll work together with other leads to build strong teams, provide technical leadership, and ensure we have a world class engineering organization.
You’ll also have plenty of opportunity to work across the larger organization on different challenging projects.
REPORTING LINE

Reports to the CTO.

RESPONSIBILITIES

The overall responsibilities of the Engineering Manager, are:
Work with engineers to grow their technical, interpersonal, and leadership skills, and ensure they have the right challenges and necessary context to make use of them.
Build and manage a team of developers focused on addressing our educational vision and ambition.
Participate in discussions about software architecture.
Advocate and advance modern software development practices within the team (Clean Code, TDD, CI/CD, test automation etc)
Help develop and evangelize great engineering practices across all of OpenClassrooms
Work closely with teams, product owners, agile coaches and other stakeholders to ensure we deliver world-class promotional courses, programs and platforms
Work with the recruiting team to attract, hire, onboard and retain diverse top talent
Requirements
You are experienced in leading, coaching and mentoring software developers.
You have excellent communication skills with which to build relationships, trust, and respect, and are able to leverage this to grow people and the organization.
You love developing and growing people.
You are knowledgeable and passionate about current development best practices.
You have demonstrated strong leadership skills while working with engineers.
You are excited about making culture choices that positively impact the team.
You have familiarity and experience operating in complex tech organizations that work with a product that handles users at scale, making use of agile methodologies and tools.

REQUIREMENT
The ideal candidate will have 6+ years of related professional experience
Bachelor degree
HIRING PROCESS
The journey starts with a phone interview and a meeting with Audrey, Recruitment Manager then a meeting Romain, CTO. Then we plan face to face meetings with a several people from the Tech team and 2 people from other teams (Education, Marketing,....). You will be asked to provide us with 5 professional references contact detail.

Feel free to get the gist of who we are : https://openclassrooms.com/courses/how-do-we-work-at-openclassrooms

WHAT WE OFFER
Pass Navigo paid by OpenClassrooms
Health insurance for free (“Mutuelle” monthly fee entirely paid by OpenClassrooms)
Meal vouchers (Employer contribution at the max authorized by law)
Access to gym for free (Gymlib paid by OpenClassrooms)
Unlimited days off and a 1.000€ premium once a year for 15+ days off taken
Access to remote working
A company MacBook
A work environment and a strong culture built on agility, openness, respect and high quality
OpenClassrooms is a French hyper-growth company eligible to the French Tech Visa program. That means, for foreign candidates, benefiting from the accelerated procedure to apply for a "Talent Passport" residence permit. There is also a simplified "accompanying family" procedure available for spouse and dependent minor children. More information here: https://visa.lafrenchtech.com/4/french-tech-visa-for-employees

We highly value a workplace free from discrimination and we strongly believe that diversity of experience, perspectives, and background will lead to a better environment for our employees and a better product for our students. This is something we value deeply and we encourage everyone to come be a part of revolutionizing Education.
Working at OpenClassrooms means joining a dynamic and stimulating team, take up challenges, meet awesome people every week, and change the world, a little bit, everyday!

API Technical Writer/Developer
Dataiku - Paris (75)

Signaler cette offre d'emploi
description:
Dataiku’s mission is big: to enable all people throughout companies around the world to use data by removing friction surrounding data access, cleaning, modeling, deployment, and more. But it’s not just about technology and processes; at Dataiku, we also believe that people (including our people!) are a critical piece of the equation.

As a API Technical Writer/Developer in the Dataiku Engineering team, you’ll play a crucial role helping us have a real impact on the daily life of data scientists and analysts with development skills. You’ll be working alongside Software engineers, Product managers and UX designers. You will be responsible for API clients and content targeted at developers working with Dataiku DSS.

DSS is a machine-learning platform that connects together all big data technologies. We work with all major cloud services, SQL databases, NoSQL databases, Hadoop, Spark, MLLib, scikit-learn, Shiny, … and many more. Basically, our technological stack includes most of the Big Data and Machine Learning landscape.

One of the most unique characteristics of DSS is the breadth of its scope and the fact that it caters both to data analysts (with visual analytics) and data scientists (with deep integration in code and libraries, and a web-based IDE).

You will work primarily with Python, R, Javascript and Java, but also possibly with C#, Julia and many more programming languages.

This is a full-time position, primarily based in Paris, France.
You will
Develop and maintain the Python and SDK wrapping the DSS REST API, so that all new features are easily available to external developers
Build SDKs for additional programming languages (starting with Javascript)
Extend these SDKs with additional helpers and tools to improve the lives of developers working with our platform, based on their feedback.
Ensure that our API documentation are accurate, easy to understand, and are truly helping developers
Own and develop the various code samples available in DSS and its documentation (ranging from HelloWorld to Deep Learning models), focusing on solving real problems and bringing immediate value to developers
Be the go-to expert for anything related to developing in or for DSS
To fulfill its mission, Dataiku is growing fast (having just closed a $101 million Series C round in December 2018 and looking to double in 2019), but still maintains a startup spirit. Dataiku serves its global customer base from its headquarters in New York City as well as offices in Paris, London, Munich, Singapore, and Sydney. Each of our offices has a unique culture, but underpinning local nuances, we always value curiosity, collaboration, and can-do attitudes.

description:
Entreprise en pleine croissance qui aide les scientifiques à construire le futur de la médecine.
Technologies spécialisées en biologie moléculaire et analyse génétique grâce à un outil développé en interne : un PCR numérique qui permet aux scientifiques de détecter et quantifier les mutations ADN avec une précision inégalée sur le marché.
Grâce à cette technologie, des chercheurs du monde entier développent une nouvelle génération de tests génétiques de haute précision, dans divers domaines d'application comme par exemple : des tests de diagnostics de cancer (biopsie liquide), des tests pré-nataux ou encore la détection d'OGM.

Vous intégrerez le département R&D logiciel de cette entreprise de 35 personnes ayant pour objectif de doubler ses effectifs d'ici la fin de l'année.

Avantages : Stock Options ou BSPCE, Mutuelle, Parking, TR, CE, RTT...
LE POSTE / LES MISSIONS
Au sein du département R&D Logiciel, vous intervenez en collaboration dans une équipe de 3 personnes : 1 Directeur R&D Logiciel et 2 développeurs :

=> Développement d'applications desktop uniquement

Vos missions de Software QA Engineer seront :

1.Maintenir les tests logiciels en place et en écrire de nouveaux (unit tests, integration tests, user tests, risk mitigation tests)
Travailler en collaboration avec les développeurs
Comprendre les besoins utilisateurs
Maintenir et améliorer la couverture de test existante
2. Fournir de la documentation logicielle à jour (software architecture design, technical specifications, test plans and test reports)
3. Mettre les mains dans le code et proposer des corrections ou améliorations pertinentes
4. Participer à l'élaboration et l'amélioration du plus stable et plus simple logiciel de Life Science
5. Proposer des solutions innovantes (=> force de proposition et veille techno)
PROFIL RECHERCHÉ
Profil :

Vous justifiez d'une expérience d'au moins 2 -3 ans
Bonnes connaissances d’un langage de script permettant d’automatiser les tests sous Linux
Expérience en automatisation de test en environnement normé (ex : industrie, automobile, médical ...)
Maitrise de langages de développement (C++, ou Python, ou JavaScript, ou Java) = but étant d'être à l'aise pour interagir avec les dévs
Expérience en environnement Qt / Squish environment avec basic Visual Studio et C++
Expérience en Intégration continue ( en utilisant ces outils ou d'autres équivalent : Git, Redmine, Jenkins)
Environnement Linux
Méthodologie Agile
Anglais technique obligatoire

=> l'outil Squish pour automatiser les tests d'interface graphique en Qt :
https://www.froglogic.com/fr/squish/editions/qt-gui-test-automation/

Des plus pour votre candidature :

Expérience en test logiciel dans un environnement normé médical (IEC 62304, IEC 62366 ou CFR 21 Part 11)
Ouvert d'esprit et aimer travailler dans un environnement multidisciplinaire aux côtés d'experts en développement logiciel mais aussi en microfluidique, biologie moléculaire, en micromécanique, en marketing & business development, etc.)
Vous ne savez peut-être pas ce qu'un PCR est, mais vous êtes curieux de le découvrir !
Vous êtes motivé par des objectifs ambitieux et prêt à apporter des changements importants à la science et la médecine !

description:
Passionné par le développement, vous êtes résolument orienté Front End ?
Winamax recrute des Front End Software Engineers (H/F)!
Winamax est une société basée à Paris, dédiée au poker et aux paris sportifs en ligne.
Avec 56 % de parts de marché (données janvier 2019), Winamax est le premier site de poker en France. Depuis 2014, nous proposons également des paris sportifs, et avons su faire la différence sur un secteur très compétitif, grâce notamment à un ton humoristique décalé et en proposant les meilleures cotes.
Depuis juillet 2018, la société s’est lancée sur le marché espagnol des jeux en ligne, où elle croît de jour en jour.

ENVIRONNEMENT TECHNIQUE @WINAMAX
Techniquement, Winamax c’est :
Un moteur de jeu puissant et innovant : adaptation dynamique de l'offre de jeu, parties de poker hautement configurables, détection de fraude, ...
Une architecture distribuée et scalable conçue pour traiter en temps réel les flux de la plateforme
Une plateforme modulaire soumise à des contraintes de haute disponibilité et de sécurisation des données, capable de gérer de fortes audiences
Quelques chiffres :
10G+ mains de poker jouées
150K+ joueurs actifs par jour
100K+ tournois de poker par jour
40K+ paris sportifs proposés en permanence
300K+ coupons de paris sportifs placés chaque jour
50K+ messages échangés par seconde
10To+ de données en base
Notre stack :
Backend : Node.js, Python, C++, PHP
Frontend : JavaScript, ES6, Flow, React.js, Redux.js, React Native
Ops : AWS Cloud Services, Jenkins, Gitlab, Continuous Delivery, Terraform, Ansible, PuppetLabs
Databases : SQL (MySQL), NoSQL (AWS DynamoDB), Data warehouse (AWS RedShift)
Cache : Redis, Memcached
Data & Event processing : Apache Kafka, Apache Spark
Service & API Management : AWS ECS, Consul, Docker, Kong
DESCRIPTION DU POSTE
Au sein de notre équipe Tech, vous prendrez une part active au développement de la prochaine génération des applications Winamax (desktop et mobile), et à l’amélioration de notre moteur cross platform.
En tant que Front End Software Engineer, vous serez notamment en charge de :
Développer des fonctionnalités innovantes qui seront appréciées par des milliers de joueurs
Produire un code robuste pour des applications temps réel de jeux d'argent (poker, paris sportifs)
Participer à des projets stratégiques et transverses impliquant des équipes pluridisciplinaires
Selon votre profil, votre expérience et votre appétence, vous pourriez également accompagner la montée en compétence des membres juniors de l’équipe.
PROFILS RECHERCHÉS
Les compétences nécessaires pour réussir à ce poste chez Winamax :
2 ans d’expérience en développement informatique orienté Front End
Maîtrise du langage Javascript (ES 6)
Maîtrise d’une ou plusieurs technos UI : React, Vue, …
Première expérience réussie dans le développement d’applications (desktop, mobile)
Maitrise d’une suite de tests unitaires, tests End-to-End
Les plus:
Connaissance d’une ou plusieurs des technos suivantes : Electron, Redux, Flow, NodeJS, AS3
Sensibilité pour le développement d’interfaces et l’ergonomie
Expérience ou compétence full-stack
Intérêt pour le domaine du jeu en ligne, du Poker ou du Pari Sportif
La rigueur et la capacité à travailler en équipe font partie des qualités que l’on vous reconnaît unanimement dans les équipes avec lesquelles vous avez collaboré.
Vos principaux atouts :
Ouverture d’esprit
Curiosité pour explorer de nouvelles pistes, maintenir ses connaissances à jour
Relationnel : communiquer de façon claire et non équivoque avec les membres de l’équipe Tech mais également avec les autres équipes dans l’entreprise
POURQUOI NOUS REJOINDRE ?
Si le poker ou les paris sportifs ne sont pas des arguments suffisants pour attirer votre attention, nous en avons d’autres !
Un esprit startup, et des équipes jeunes et dynamiques
Un cadre de travail unique et convivial, en plein cœur de Paris (salle de sport, salle de jeux vidéo, terrain de pétanque, barbecue, boissons offertes…)
Le choix de son ordinateur (Mac ou PC) pour travailler efficacement
Un salaire compétitif
Un intéressement et une participation attractifs
Une excellente mutuelle
6 semaines de congés
Restaurant d’entreprise
Participation à des conférences techniques
Du fun : soirées organisées régulièrement par notre CE (poker, gaming, jeux de plateau, soirée raclette…)
COMMENT POSTULER ?
Nous vous remercions de nous faire parvenir votre CV et pourquoi pas un message d’accompagnement pour nous en dire plus sur vos qualités et compétences en lien avec Winamax, le poste proposé et le profil recherché. Il nous sera ainsi plus aisé d’entamer un échange efficace en sachant qui vous êtes et ce que vous recherchez pour votre prochain challenge professionnel !
Que se passe-t-il après le commit de votre candidature ?
Entretien téléphonique RH ( ~30min )
Entretien avec un Lead Tech (~ 1h)
Test technique à faire en remote
Débrief du test par téléphone (~10min)
Et plus si affinités !

50K+ messages échangés par seconde
10To+ de données en base
Notre stack :
Backend : Node.js, Python, C++, PHP
Frontend : JavaScript, ES6, Flow, React.js, Redux.js, React Native
Ops : AWS Cloud Services, Jenkins, Gitlab, Continuous Delivery, Terraform, Ansible, PuppetLabs
Databases : SQL (MySQL), NoSQL (AWS DynamoDB), Data warehouse (AWS RedShift)
Cache : Redis, Memcached
Data & Event processing : Apache Kafka, Apache Spark
Service & API Management : AWS ECS, Consul, Docker, Kong
DESCRIPTION DU POSTE
Au sein de notre équipe Tech, vous prendrez une part active à la conception et au développement des fonctionnalités et de l’architecture de la plateforme de jeu de Winamax (poker, paris sportifs).
En tant que Back End Software Engineer, vous serez notamment en charge de :
Développer des applications hautement disponibles et supportant des montées en charge
Contribuer à l’amélioration constante de l’architecture logicielle de la plateforme
Assurer une qualité de service optimale des services déployés
Participer à des projets stratégiques et transverses impliquant des équipes pluridisciplinaires
Selon votre profil, votre expérience et votre appétence, vous pourriez également accompagner la montée en compétence des membres juniors de l’équipe.
PROFILS RECHERCHÉS
Afin de renforcer nos équipes Back End, nous recherchons des profils dotés d’un très bon niveau d’abstraction et prêts à résoudre des problématiques complexes.
Les compétences nécessaires pour réussir à ce poste chez Winamax :
2 à 3 ans d’expérience en développement informatique orienté Back End
Maîtrise de l’un des langages suivants : Node.JS, Python, C++, PHP
Maîtrise de l’environnement Linux/Unix
Bonnes connaissances des architectures microservices, Event-Driven, API First
Maitrise d’une suite de tests unitaires, tests End-to-End
Les plus:
Connaissance et utilisation de Docker, Kafka, Redis, bases SQL et NoSQL
Connaissance et expérience d’une solution de Cloud Computing : AWS, GCP ou Azure
Expérience des processus CI/CD
Intérêt pour le domaine du jeu en ligne, du Poker ou du Pari Sportif
La rigueur et la capacité à travailler en équipe font partie des qualités que l’on vous reconnaît unanimement dans les équipes avec lesquelles vous avez collaboré.
Vos principaux atouts :
Ouverture d’esprit
Curiosité pour explorer de nouvelles pistes, maintenir ses connaissances à jour
Relationnel : communiquer de façon claire et non équivoque avec les membres de l’équipe Tech mais également avec les autres équipes dans l’entreprise
POURQUOI NOUS REJOINDRE ?
Si le poker ou les paris sportifs ne sont pas des arguments suffisants pour attirer votre attention, nous en avons d’autres !
Un esprit startup, et des équipes jeunes et dynamiques
Un cadre de travail unique et convivial, en plein cœur de Paris (salle de sport, salle de jeux vidéo, terrain de pétanque, barbecue, boissons offertes…)
Le choix de son ordinateur (Mac ou PC) pour travailler efficacement
Un salaire compétitif
Un intéressement et une participation attractifs
Une excellente mutuelle
6 semaines de congés
Restaurant d’entreprise
Participation à des conférences techniques
Du fun : soirées organisées régulièrement par notre CE (poker, gaming, jeux de plateau, soirée raclette…)
COMMENT POSTULER ?
Nous vous remercions de nous faire parvenir votre CV et pourquoi pas un message d’accompagnement pour nous en dire plus sur vos qualités et compétences en lien avec Winamax, le poste proposé et le profil recherché. Il nous sera ainsi plus aisé d’entamer un échange efficace en sachant qui vous êtes et ce que vous recherchez pour votre prochain challenge professionnel !
Que se passe-t-il après le commit de votre candidature ?
Entretien téléphonique RH ( ~30min )
Entretien avec un Lead Tech (~ 1h)
Test technique (~1h)
Débrief du test par le Lead Tech (~15min)
Et plus si affinités !

Vous contribuez à la gestion des environnements,
Vous effectuez la revue de codes,
Vous êtes force de proposition en ce qui concerne les normes et les procédures,
Vous êtes responsable du respect des normes et procédures en vigueur (architecture, sécurité, qualité, documentation …) et de la maintenabilité des développements,
Vous êtes responsable de la production des dossiers d’exploitation (coordination, rédaction, packaging),
Vous préparez, contribuez, et contrôlez les tests d’intégration,
Si nécessaire, vous réalisez des tests de performance,
Vous assurez une veille selon les besoins fonctionnels, conseillez sur le choix de solutions progicielles, et faites le lien avec l’éditeur,
Vous contribuez au support de 2nd niveau (surveillance de la production, analyse de bug, participation aux astreintes liées à la production),
Vous assurez une veille technologique sur des points spécifiques et élaborez les propositions de solutions techniques sous la responsabilité du chef de projet,
Vous participez à la réalisation du benchmark (informer et développer) de la solution technique actuelle,
Vous êtes référent sur une ou plusieurs technologies et/ou un domaine applicatif,
Vous coachez les Spécialistes Etudes-Développements SI débutants (management opérationnel).
Tous nos postes sont ouverts aux personnes en situation de handicap.

VIDEO - Vis mon Job de Développeur
Découvrez en vidéo les métiers de développeur front-end et back-end : concevoir et développer des outils digitaux et garantir la meilleure expérience utilisateur.
Profil
De formation bac +5, vous êtes de préférence diplômé d’une école d'ingénieur ou avez suivi
un cursus universitaire à dominante informatique.
Vous avez une expérience professionnelle de minimum 5 ans en développement (Java full stack, NodeJS, Angular/React, Python, shell, etc.).
Vous maîtrisez les bases de données relationnelles (Oracle/PLSql) et vous avez des bonnes notions et une première expérience en NoSQL (MongoDB, HBase, E/S, etc.).
Vous avez de l'expérience sur le multithreading, la synchronisation et la gestion de la mémoire.
Vous connaissez les architectures distribuées et vous avez une bonne culture APIs/micro services. Vous avez des bases Big data/Data lake (Hadoop, HDFS, Spark, etc.)
Vous parlez anglais couramment.
Evolution
3600 ITECiens répartis aux quatre coins du monde, en Asie, Amérique et Europe dont les challenges sont :
de co-construire la transformation de nos métiers,
de livrer régulièrement et rapidement les solutions qui repoussent sans cesse les limites de la technologie… … dans un environnement où le travail en équipe est notre quotidien et où le partage fait partie de notre culture
Le futur de la finance sera hi-tech , créons le ensemble au sein d’ITEC en s’appuyant sur nos trois piliers : l'excellence technique, la co-création de valeur et l'esprit d’équipe.

Pour la 4ème année consécutive, Société Générale a reçu le label « Top Employer France » pour sa politique de Ressources Humaines et sa capacité à développer les talents à tous les niveaux de l'organisation.
Environnement
Vous rejoignez la Direction des Fonctions Support de la Banque de Grande Clientèle et Solutions Investisseurs (GBIS). Cette dernière a pour responsabilité, au niveau mondial, de fournir des services aux lignes métiers de GBIS & à leurs clients, et d’accélérer leur transformation digitale et opérationnelle. Vous intégrez la Communauté IT de GBIS et la Filière IT du Groupe.

Android Software Engineer – Growth Engineering
Netatmo4 avis - Paris (75)

description:
At Netatmo, we are all about the Smart Home! Our mission is to design products that make your home safer, more comfortable and ultimately more eco-friendly. Since November 2018, Netatmo has become a part of the Legrand group – a global leader in electrical and digital infrastructure for buildings, with millions of users all over the world.
We continue to develop our brand and products autonomously. Manage your heating and energy savings thanks to our Smart Thermostat, detect the presence of intruders using our cameras, which combine artificial intelligence and image processing software, … We also collaborate with strategic partners including the Muller Group, Velux and Legrand to create a range of products that will revolutionise your home.
With an international team of 250 motivated and passionated individuals with over 20 nationalities represented amongst our teams primarily located in the Paris region, Netatmo is always on the lookout for new talent to promote its development.
Job Description
The new Growth & Data Engineering team was created to support Netatmo’s growth by generating exceptional tech ideas and innovative solutions to problems that affect the Smart Home market. These issues may hinder sales growth and influence the prestige of Netatmo’s brand.
As a member of the team, you will effectively manage the design, execution and analysis of various initiatives driven by the team.
Naturally autonomous, you are able to drive projects from initiation to closure by making the best use of Netatmo’s resources – skilled personnel and technology - at your disposal.
Your main tasks will include:
Technical design and implementation of solutions by maximising the Android technology at your disposal,
Building on already developed technological bricks to promote continuous improvement and growth as the OS and applications of Netatmo’s products evolve
Focusing on the User Experience of the various projects you handle,
Creating reliable technological bricks which can be integrated into Netatmo’s products’ applications,
Going beyond the Android field to provide tech solutions to ensure the progress of a project
The Netatmo culture will inspire you to:
Create code that will be used by thousands of enthusiastic clients,
Be conversant with state-of-the-art technological innovations in your field,
Own the code you create and offer pertinent ideas by being resourceful.
Qualifications
Required :
Degree in Engineering or equivalent,
About 2-3 years experience,
Strong passion for Software development,
Relevant knowledge of one or more Object-oriented programming languages including
(Java/Kotlin/C++)
You have already piloted one or more App development projects from start to finish,
Good knowledge of Android SDK,
Excellent attention to detail and a taste for user interface software development,
Autonomy.

Extra :
Desire to learn and/or share experience in other development areas (web, backend, iOS),
Taste for experimenting with a variety of unconventional methods, i.e. Growth Hacking.
Additional Information
Why Joining us
Beyond our attractive package, as an employee at Netatmo you can receive a free sample of each Netatmo product. You'll also be incentived to participate in Meetups and Tech or Business conferences, become Net@fit by joining our sports classes (Pilates, Yoga, Boxing, Crossfit, …) Football, Running or Ping-pong teams and healthier with our free fruit basket, show your music skills during our music sessions with Net@sound, participate in our afterwork events, birthday breakfasts, BBQ with the Boss, International Lunches, Christmas parties and a range of other events.
Videos To Watch
I'm interested
Privacy Policy

meta1:
Ingénieur Intégration Assistant vocal (H/F) / Voice Assistant Integration Engineer (M/F)
Parrot Faurecia Automotive - Paris 10e (75)
titre_poste: Ingénieur Intégration Assistant vocal (H/F) / Voice Assistant Integration Engineer (M/F)
date_publication:
il y a 6 mois
- Continuer pour postuler
Signaler cette offre d'emploi
description:
Vous souhaitez intégrer une entreprise française, innovante et agile ?

Rejoignez Faurecia Clarion Electronics, alliant un esprit start-up à un équipementier automobile de 1er rang, pour développer le cockpit du futur !

L’activité automobile de Parrot a été racheté à 100% par Faurecia en 2018 et a donné naissance à Faurecia Clarion Electronics Europe : 4ème Business Group de Faurecia.

Au cœur de Paris, nos équipes conçoivent des technologies innovantes en développant des interfaces homme-machine sous Android auto pour offrir au client final une expérience connectique intuitive.
Nos solutions électroniques embarquées sont dotées de processeurs graphiques multi-cœur puissants afin de répondre plus rapidement à diverses instructions simultanées.

Relevez avec nous l'un des plus grands challenges de l'industrie automobile !

Nous recherchons un Ingénieur Intégration Assistant vocal (H/F)

CONTEXTE

Au sein du département software de la société Parrot Faurecia Automotive située à Paris, vous serez en charge de piloter les sujets d’expertise liés aux Virtual Personal Assistants et de gérer les développements spécifiques pour les démonstrations et prototypages.

MISSIONS

Rattaché(e) au manager des activités transverses de l’entreprise (reconnaissance vocale, navigation, traductions, App Market), vos missions seront les suivantes :

Prototyper et maquetter les différentes plateformes de dialogues

Rédiger les spécifications techniques de ces IHM

Étudier, analyser et répondre aux appels d’offre en lien avec le sujet

Participer aux workshops clients et fournisseurs

Développer et implémenter la partie reconnaissance vocale et Natural Language Understanding (NLU) pour les maquettages et prototypages

Identifier et documenter les innovations technologiques de reconnaissance vocale pour en extraire une valeur ajoutée pour l’entreprise

Étudier, analyser et caractériser les solutions de reconnaissance vocale et NLU des fournisseurs et des concurrents

Collaborer au sein d’une équipe dynamique et motivée

PROFIL

Vous êtes diplômé(e) d’une Ecole d’Ingénieurs ou d’une Thèse, idéalement en informatique avec une spécialisation en traitement de la parole.

Vous disposez d’au moins 2 années d’expérience dans le domaine de la reconnaissance vocale.

Vous maîtrisez le langage C++, le développement Java sous Android et vous avez de solides connaissances des assistants Google et Alexa.
.
Dans l’idéal, vous êtes familier avec :

La compréhension du langage naturel

Le traitement de la parole

Le traitement du signal

Les technologies Nuance

Le langage Python

Des déplacements occasionnels sont à prévoir.

Votre niveau d’anglais vous permet d’échanger à l’écrit et à l’oral, vous maitrisez notamment le vocabulaire technique.

La maîtrise du Chinois serait un plus.

EN - Would you like to be part of a French company known for its innovation and agility?

Join Faurecia Clarion Electronics, combining a start-up spirit with a first-class automotive equipment manufacturer, to develop the cockpit of the future!
Parrot's automotive business was acquired 100% by Faurecia in 2018 and gave rise to Faurecia Clarion Electronics Europe, Faurecia's 4th Business Group.

In the heart of Paris, our teams design innovative technologies by developing man-machine interfaces under Android auto to offer the end customer an intuitive connectivity experience.
Our embedded electronics solutions are equipped with powerful multi-core graphics processors to respond more quickly to various simultaneous instructions.

Take up with us one of the greatest challenges in the automotive industry!

We are looking for a Voice Assistant Integration Engineer (M/F)

CONTEXT

Within the software department of Parrot Faurecia Automotive in Paris, you will be in charge of managing the expertise subjects related to Virtual Personal Assistants and managing specific developments for demonstrations and prototypes.

MISSIONS

Reporting to the manager of the company's transversal activities (voice recognition, navigation, translations, App Market), your missions will be as follows:

Prototype and model the different dialogue platforms

Write the technical specifications of these HMIs

Study, analyze and respond to calls for tenders related to the subject

Participate in customer and supplier workshops

Develop and implement the speech recognition and Natural Language Understanding (NLU) part for modeling and prototyping

Identify and document speech recognition technological innovations to extract added value for the company

Study, analyze and characterize speech and NLU recognition solutions from suppliers and competitors

Collaborate within a dynamic and motivated team

PROFILE

You are a graduate of an engineering school or thesis, ideally in computer science with a specialization in speech processing.

You have at least 2 years of experience in the field of speech recognition.

You are proficient in C++ language, Java development under Android and you have a solid knowledge of Google and Alexa assistants.

Ideally, you are familiar with:

Understanding natural language

Speech processing

Signal processing

Nuance Technologies

The Python language

Occasional travel is expected.

Your level of English allows you to exchange in writing and orally, you master the technical vocabulary in particular.

Skills in Chinese would be a plus.

Au sein du département software de la société Parrot Faurecia Automotive située à Paris, vous serez en charge de mener à bien l’intégration des livrables de reconnaissance vocale, d’établir les plans de validation, de piloter les campagnes de test et de gérer les intervenants externes (locuteurs natifs, traducteurs).

MISSIONS

Rattaché(e) au manager des activités transverses de l’entreprise (reconnaissance vocale, navigation, traductions, App Market), vos missions seront les suivantes :

Définir, spécifier et mettre en œuvre les plans de test des livrables de la reconnaissance vocale

Mettre en place et suivre l’intégration de la reconnaissance vocale pour chaque projet ou démonstrateur

Encadrer les intervenants lors des campagnes de test

Étudier et mettre en place des outils permettant d’analyser et caractériser les performances de reconnaissance vocale de notre plateforme, des solutions de fournisseurs et des concurrents

Mettre en place des outils et un environnement d'intégration continue

Collaborer au sein d’une équipe dynamique et motivée

Vous êtes diplômé(e) d’une Ecole d’Ingénieurs ou d’une Thèse, idéalement en informatique avec une spécialisation en traitement de la parole.

Vous disposez d’au moins 2 années d’expérience dans le domaine de la reconnaissance vocale.

Une bonne maîtrise de GIT et Jenkins ainsi que des langages C++, Python, est indispensable.

La compréhension du langage naturel

Le traitement du signal

Le traitement de la parole

Les technologies Nuance

Google Assistant

Alexa

Le développement Java sous Android

Take up with us one of the greatest challenges in the automotive industry!

We are looking for a C++ integration and test engineer (M/F)

CONTEXT

Within the software department of Parrot Faurecia Automotive in Paris, you will be in charge of successfully integrating speech recognition deliverables, drawing up validation plans, managing test campaigns and managing external stakeholders (native speakers, translators).

MISSIONS

Reporting to the manager of the company's transversal activities (voice recognition, navigation, translations, App Market), your missions will be as follows:

Define, specify and implement test plans for speech recognition deliverables

Set up and monitor the integration of voice recognition for each project or demonstrator

Supervise the interveners during the test campaigns

Study and implement tools to analyze and characterize the speech recognition performance of our platform, supplier solutions and competitors

Implement tools and a continuous integration environment

Collaborate within a dynamic and motivated team

meta1:
Database Solutions Architect
AWS EMEA SARL (France Branch)38,552 avis - Courbevoie (92)
date_publication:
Amazon.com - il y a 6 mois
- Continuer pour postuler
Signaler cette offre d'emploi
description:
Proven experience on commercial or open source database technologies (Microsoft SQL Server, Oracle Databases, IBM DB2, MySQL, PostgreSQL, or Amazon Databases), and on different stages of the lifecycle (Schema Design, Query Tuning and Optimization, Data Migration and Integration, operational management or troubleshooting)
Ability to learn new concepts and technologies, and apply them to provide the best business outcomes for customers
Ability to formulate and communicate ideas clearly in a business environment, including presenting in front of varied internal and external audiences
Business fluent French is required for customer interactions, alongside business English for internal communication and collaboration with the worldwide teams

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is looking for Database Solutions Architects for our French customers. If you have experience in designing database platforms, leveraging platforms such as Oracle, Microsoft SQL Server, MySQL, PostgreSQL or other database engines, and are interested in helping customers embrace cloud technologies, come and talk to us. Specialist Solutions Architects work with AWS' partners and customers to accelerate their cloud transformation. They engage in a wide range of activities around their domain of expertise, providing technical advice to customers, helping the internal and external communities, presenting AWS publicly on their domain, and providing a preferred path between AWS service teams and customers.

This is an opportunity to join Amazon’s technical teams, working with our engineers on the new services that power the cloud ecosystem, while developing your skills and furthering your career within what we believe to be one of the most innovative and progressive technology companies. These engagements will focus on database and data warehousing. This role will specifically focus on AWS Services for Databases, and on helping our customers and partners build innovative Solutions and Businesses that focus on leveraging the value of data.

As a Database Specialist Solutions Architect (SA), you will help customers select the technologies that will support their business requirements. Part of the Specialist Solutions Architecture team, you will work closely with the other Specialist SAs on Big Data, Databases, Analytics, Artificial Intelligence, or Security, as well as the Business Development teams, to enable large-scale customer use cases and drive the adoption of AWS for their database platforms. You will interact with other SAs, providing guidance on their customer engagements by developing white papers, blogs, reference implementations, and presentations to enable customers and 3rd parties to fully leverage the AWS platform. You will also create field enablement materials for the broader SA population, to help them understand how to integrate AWS solutions into customer architectures.

Candidates have a mix of communication and technical skills, and will have the ability to engage with customers at different levels in the organization, from executive to developer. Previous experience with AWS is desired but not required, provided you have experience building or operating mission critical database platforms. You will get the opportunity to work directly with senior engineers at customers, partners and AWS service teams, influencing their roadmaps and driving innovation.

If you are someone who enjoys innovating, likes solving hard problems and working on the cutting edge of technology, we would love to have you on the team.

Amazon's Culture

Our positive and supportive culture encourages our people to do their best work every day. We have 14 leadership principles that help guide us in our every-day decision making process. We believe they are a clearer articulation of those things that have always been a part of what makes Amazon great – things that we must consciously hold on to in fulfilling our mission to be Earth’s Most Customer Centric Company. We are continuously looking for new ways to maintain a culture where our people excel and lead healthy and happy lives. Learn more about life at Amazon. It is always Day One.

How You’ll Grow

At Amazon, our professional development plan focuses on helping people at every level of their career to identify and use their strengths to do their best work every day. From entry-level employees to senior leaders, we believe there’s always room to learn and develop your career. We offer opportunities to help sharpen your skills in addition to hands-on experience in the global, fast-changing business world. From on-the-job learning experiences to formal development programs, our professionals have a variety of opportunities to continue to grow throughout their career.

Roles and responsibilities
Customers' trusted advisor: collaborate with AWS account, training and support teams to help partners and customers learn and use AWS services such as Amazon Relational Database Service (RDS), Redshift, DynamoDB, DocumentDB, Neptune, or Database Migratio Service
Business partner: serve as a key member of the business development and account management team in helping to ensure customer success in building and migrating applications, software and services on the AWS platform.
Public engagement: provide thought leadership on Analytics solutions that benefit customers through the use of AWS Services. This takes the form of contribution to external publications such as the AWS Blogs, Whitepapers and Reference architectures, or public presentations at AWS Summits, AWS re:Invent, AWS User Groups or industry events
Community player: capture and share best-practices, participate, and contribute as a member of the worldwide AWS technical community of Solution Architects, Professional Services Consultants, Technical Account Managers, and AWS Trainers
Service team point of contact: act as a conduit between the AWS Service teams and the customers, providing detailed guidance for the broader field organization and the customers, and acting as an advocate for the customers towards the central teams

Amazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer – Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation.

Technical degree in computer science, math, or engineering such as a Master's degree
Hands on experience leading large-scale database projects, such as projects in the software development or Internet industries
Hands on experience as a database or data warehouse developer. Scripting/programming experience in database related fields
Experience with NoSQL databases such as MongoDB or Apache Cassandra
Understanding of application, server, and network security
Deep understanding of the technical and use case differences between OLTP, OLAP, in-memory, columnar, and MPP data stores and their impact on application design and performance
Understanding of security practices related to data ingestion, storage, analysis and visualization
Track record of implementing AWS services in a variety of business environments such as large enterprises and start-ups. AWS Certifications, e.g. AWS Solutions Architect Associate/Professional

COMPANY DESCRIPTION
SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.
SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.
EXPECTATIONS AND TASKS
Be a Trusted Adviser and "Talk Business"
Deal with LOB, Executive Level
Establish powerful relationships
Be a strong contributor to the Virtual Account Team
Strategic Selling (Leverage the portfolio)
To Achieve Our Vision (Innovation)
Implement business strategies to ensure customer success driving revenue targets for software and software related services.
Participate in a team-selling environment working with one or more Account Executives (AEs) and/or Services Account Manager (SAMs), GAD’s on assigned accounts.

WORK EXPERIENCE
Functional Experience
7 plus years direct quota carrying selling experience in the enterprise software and services industry. Ideally, a combination of both direct enterprise software sales and direct services sales. This can be variable by region.
Background and experience in high ticket complex sales cycles. Value selling and solution selling experience and training. Intimate knowledge of enterprise software projects and the overall lifecycle management of enterprise applications.
Knowledge of SAPs Partners, Competitors and the regional IT Industry
Drive -The approach that brings intensity, pace, sharpness to the working life. The mindset to keep active & makes things happen.
Treating customers and colleagues with respect, fairness and consideration
Ethics
Setting Personal Objectives
Self Awareness (knowing yourself – your strengths & your weaknesses)

Managerial Experience
None, solid experience in leading virtual teams
English: Fluent

EDUCATION AND QUALIFICATION / SKILLS AND COMPETENCIES
Bachelor or Master’s Degree

WHAT YOU GET FROM US
Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own. A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment – apply now.
SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT
To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.
SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team (Americas: Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com).

Algolia - Paris (75)
date_publication:

description:
At Algolia, we are passionate about helping developers & product teams connect their users with what matters most in milliseconds!

Product Managers are in charge of discovering and building great products to help us achieve Algolia’s vision. We are responsible for the whole process end-to-end, from strategy to execution. We take part in every step of the product development process alongside Designers, Engineers and User Researchers, and we partner closely with cross-functional teams to ensure the products we deliver align closely with the company’s objectives, including sales, customer success, solutions engineering, support, and the marketing team.

We’re looking for an experienced Product Manager to join the team and help us improve our practice. You’ll be responsible for establishing a roadmap for your team, creating short and long-term goals, and delivering on them. You have the basics of PMing down and you can take on ambiguous projects and autonomously execute on them. You thrive in cross-functional environments and are excited to collaborate with engineering, design, sales, product leadership, and our founders.
YOUR ROLE WILL CONSIST OF:
Talk to customers and prospects to deeply understand their pains, challenges and needs
Work closely with Engineers and Designers to create solutions that address real customer pains and bring joy to our users
Create a strategy and roadmap for your scope. Advocate for it internally and externally and ensure staffing and prioritization of the most leveraged initiatives
Contribute to the company’s product strategy based on customer insights, competitive analysis, and data from the market
Build strong relationships with internal and external stakeholders to gather feedback and ensure alignment on your plans
Drive product launches alongside product marketing, and ensure success of your features in the market
Help the PM team grow and improve, by engaging in knowledge sharing, mentorship, recruiting activities, and creating new processes to help us adapt as we scale
YOU MIGHT BE A FIT IF YOU HAVE:
Experience managing software products from inception to launch and iteration
Excellent written and spoken English communication skills
Strong empathy: you can deeply empathize with people who are different from you, and understand what drives their feelings and emotions, their pains and their joys
Good business sense: you are focused on outcomes rather than projects, you prioritize projects that help the company’s objectives and always think about how you will measure success
Strategic: you can reason about the impact of product tradeoffs on the business. You think about the whole ecosystem - partners, competition, trends - and know how it impacts your prioritization. You know not to re-invent the wheel, drive with hypotheses, and favor the iterative approach
Ownership: you always feel accountable to deliver value to customers end-to-end. You are a force of proposition and know to sweat the details when it makes a difference
Structured and clear communication: you are able to communicate complex ideas in simple terms. You can adapt your message to the audience and are always clear about your decision-making frameworks
Collaboration: you are an impactful team player and leader. You have strong listening skills and always course correct based on feedback. You know how to motivate and energize your team to make it more engaged in the pursuit of its goals. You make decisions quickly and remove ambiguity for your team to help them move faster
NICE TO HAVE:
Experience working with search or search engines
Experience as a developer or data analyst, or a technical background
Experience building a product for an audience of developers
Experience as a PM in a fast-growing B2B SaaS company
WE'RE LOOKING FOR SOME WHO CAN LIVE OUR VALUES:
GRIT - Problem-solving and perseverance capability in an ever-changing and growing environment
TRUST - Willingness to trust our co-workers and to take ownership
CANDOR - Ability to receive and give constructive feedback
CARE - Genuine care about other team members, our clients and the decisions we make in the company
HUMILITY- Aptitude for learning from others, putting ego aside.

description:
Job openings - MICROWAVE VISION



PHOTO HERE








Job positions to be filled
MICROWAVE VISION
1
MVG is preparing for the world of tomorrow…
Our world is witnessing the emergence of means of communication with unmatched performance.
In the very near future, humans and machines will be instantly connected using applications that will combine
connectivity, speed, and reliability.
The rollout of 5G for everybody will pave the way for the connected car, the configurable factory, medical
applications, or drone taxis, to name but a few. It will mean the emergence of a world, whether urban or rural, united
by means of communication that will completely change our current way of life.
Geopolitical tensions will also increase the need to keep a closer eye on our planet, be it via drones, observation
satellites, radar, or state-of-the-art technology, to ensure our safety.
All the major players in the civil telecommunications sector, as well as aerospace and defense, already trust our
Group to bring them the fast, precise instrumentation they need to develop their products.
Driven by the rollout of 5G in civil telecommunications and the new challenges tied to aerospace and defense, our
Group will continue the growth trajectory that it has sustained since 1996, and strengthen its leading position.
MVG, a fully French-owned Group with over 36 nationalities and 350 employees, a third of whom are in the United
States, is approaching the future with confidence and recruiting more than 50 engineers in 2019 across all its
subsidiaries.
MVG has locations in Philadelphia, Atlanta, San Diego, Hong Kong, Shenzhen, Tokyo, Tel Aviv, Rome, Paris, Brest,
Munich, Manchester, and Gothenburg. All the Group’s subsidiaries work together on a daily basis to satisfy their
customers. In fact, managing one program typically requires contributions from five subsidiaries!
Ever since the company was first created, MVG has placed particular importance on promoting an atmosphere that
is conducive to professional growth. Just some of the things we offer are top-tier health insurance and an ideal
working environment, which includes discussion and break rooms.
The Group believes that the variety of its employees' skills, cultures, training backgrounds, and talents is an asset,
and contributes to the innovative nature and success of its projects. MVG offers a development model that is deeply
rooted in cultivating talent and a desire to work on and develop new products.
If you are an engineer (whether newly graduated or experienced) and draw satisfaction from travel, teamwork and
international environments, and if you are practical and committed to understanding the ins and outs of your job,
then you are welcome at our Group.
Whatever your nationality, take a look through our openings and find the one that will give you a chance to grow!
San Diego site – US Citizens or Permanent Residents due to ITAR Regulations
Located in Otay Mesa, San Diego County, we are close to downtown San Diego’s many tourist attractions, shops
and restaurants. Excellent benefits. Bilingual in Spanish or Tagalog helpful.
2
Copyright © 2018 Microwave Vision SA – MVG. All rights reserved.
Manufacturing/Process Engineer – 5-10 years of experience. Industrial engineering background in a manufacturing
environment.
R&D Product Engineer – 3-5 years of experience. Electrical Engineering degree with RF/microwave experience
with anechoic chamber absorber.
RF Technician – 1-3 years of experience. Associates degree in Electrical Engineering Technology.
Philadelphia site – US Citizens or Permanent Residents due to ITAR Regulations
Located in Warminster, Bucks County, we are close to downtown Philadelphia, and numerous historic sites and
outdoor activities, restaurants and shopping throughout the region. 1.5 hours to New York City, and 3 hours to
Washington, DC. Excellent benefits.
Financial Analyst – 3-5 years of experience in project cost accounting/analysis, budgeting, cash flow, forecasting in
manufacturing environment. BS degree in Finance/Accounting.
Program Manager – 5-10 years of experience in program management working in engineering industry. BS in
electrical or mechanical engineering. Understanding of RF and/or antenna measurement systems desirable.
Program Manager – 3-5 years of experience in program management working in engineering industry. BS in
electrical or mechanical engineering. Understanding of RF and/or antenna measurement systems desirable.
Systems Engineer – 1-5 years of experience in RF/Microwave industry. BS or MS Electrical Engineering degree.
Strong analytical skills. MATLAB, RF Systems experience a must. RCS and/or antenna measurement systems
experience desirable.
Field Service Technician – 1-3 years of experience with RF systems/test equipment. Associates degree in Electrical
Engineering Technology. Troubleshoot, repair, install RF systems using standard test and measurement equipment
(network analyzers, spectrum analyzers, oscilloscopes and multimeters).
Atlanta site
MVG, Inc. is based in Marietta, GA, just 20 minutes Northwest of downtown Atlanta, and conveniently located
adjacent to Suntrust Park, the Atlanta United Soccer Fields, and the Marietta Square. MVG, Inc. offers candidates
a superior benefits package including Health, Dental, Vision, Life, and Disability insurance, as well as generous
PTO and 401k plans.
Field Service technician/engineer – 1-3+ years of experience with electronics, RF, schematics, troubleshooting,
repair and field service work. AS/BS degrees preferred. Good computer and mechanical skills are essential.
Understanding of antennas/antenna measurements, and foreign language abilities are a plus. This job would
include installation, service, and support of MVG’s antenna measurement. Candidate needs to be willing to travel
extensively, work independently, be self-motivated, respect deadlines, and possess good customer service skills.
Antenna Measurement Services Technologist – 1-3+ years of experience with antenna characterization and/or
design useful. Experience/understanding of near-field antenna measurements highly valued, as are basic data

analysis, manipulation, and presentation abilities (mainly utilizing Excel). IT/Programming exposure & experience
considered a plus, while the ability to work with customers and help them meet their testing objectives is critical.
AS/EET/BSEE degrees preferred.
Project Manager – 3-5+ years of experience in RF/antenna design & characterization, as well as demonstrated
project management skills in an engineering industry. The candidate should ideally possess an understanding of

Located in Haar, in the eastern outskirts of Munich, at only 20 mins from the city center. The office overlooking a

English and German (desirable).

Reading mechanical drawings – 3D CAD models (Solid Works), 2D drawings
Basic software skills required.
Electrical /RF technician – 3-5 years of experience with low-voltage electrical systems and/or RF systems.
Associates degree in Electrical Engineering.
Install motion control systems and RF systems, field service, maintenance.
Software skills required.
Technical Project Manager – 3-5 years of experience in technical project management working in engineering
industry. BS in telecommunication or electrical engineering. Understanding of RF and/or antenna measurement

Development Engineer – 1-3 years of experience with software development. BS in Software Engineering.
Understanding of RF and/or antenna measurement systems desirable.
4
Copyright © 2018 Microwave Vision SA – MVG. All rights reserved.

The Israeli site is located in Emek Hefer Industrial Park, only 40 minutes from Tel Aviv.
For our expansion we need the best!

forecasting in manufacturing environment. Degree in Finance/Accounting/Economics. Willing to travel a lot.

Research and Development Engineer - At least 10 years experienced RF engineer with electronical degree and RF

Rome site
Mechanical designer: the ideal candidate will be based in the MVI offices in Pomezia, Italy. He/She will work in the

R&D Antenna Engineer: after an extensive training period, the ideal candidate will become a member of the R&D

Paris site
RF Systems Engineer: 1-3 years of experience, good knowledge of RF modules involved in transmission and

RF & Antennas engineer: 1-3 years of experience, good knowledge in analog mission/reception RF architectures

Brest site

date_publication:
