description:
Vous souhaitez intégrer une entreprise française, innovante et agile ?

Rejoignez Faurecia Clarion Electronics, alliant un esprit start-up à un équipementier automobile de 1er rang, pour développer le cockpit du futur !

L’activité automobile de Parrot a été racheté à 100% par Faurecia en 2018 et a donné naissance à Faurecia Clarion Electronics Europe : 4ème Business Group de Faurecia.

Au cœur de Paris, nos équipes conçoivent des technologies innovantes en développant des interfaces homme-machine sous Android auto pour offrir au client final une expérience connectique intuitive.
Nos solutions électroniques embarquées sont dotées de processeurs graphiques multi-cœur puissants afin de répondre plus rapidement à diverses instructions simultanées.

Relevez avec nous l'un des plus grands challenges de l'industrie automobile !

Nous recherchons un Ingénieur Sénior en traitement de la parole (H/F)

CONTEXTE

Au sein du département software de la société Parrot Faurecia Automotive située à Paris, vous serez en charge d’élaborer l’architecture de la reconnaissance vocale sur notre nouvelle plateforme, de piloter les sujets d’expertise liés aux Virtual Personal Assistants et de gérer les développements spécifiques pour les démonstrations et prototypages.

MISSIONS

Rattaché(e) au manager des activités transverses de l’entreprise (reconnaissance vocale, navigation, traductions, App Market), vos missions seront les suivantes :

Définir, spécifier et mettre en œuvre l’architecture de la reconnaissance vocale en tenant compte des limites et intérêts des deux modes (embarqué/déporté)

Prototyper et maquetter les différentes plateformes de dialogue

Rédiger les spécifications techniques de ces IHM

Étudier, analyser et répondre aux appels d’offre en lien avec le sujet

Participer aux workshops clients et fournisseurs

Développer et implémenter la partie reconnaissance vocale et Natural Language Understanding (NLU) pour les maquettages et prototypages

Identifier et documenter les innovations technologiques de reconnaissance vocale pour en extraire une valeur ajoutée pour l’entreprise

Étudier, analyser et caractériser les solutions de reconnaissance vocale et NLU des fournisseurs et des concurrents

Collaborer au sein d’une équipe dynamique et motivée

Garantir le bon fonctionnement de la reconnaissance vocale sur la nouvelle plateforme

Réaliser des plateformes de dialogue en alliant souplesse d’utilisation, robustesse et performances

Apporter de l’expertise et du support sur la thématique « Traitement de la Parole » : conseils, méthodes, outils

PROFIL

Vous êtes diplômé(e) d’une Ecole d’Ingénieurs ou d’une Thèse, idéalement en informatique avec une spécialisation en traitement de la parole.

Vous disposez d’au moins 5 années d’expérience dans le domaine de la reconnaissance vocale.
Une bonne maîtrise des langages C++ et Python ainsi que de solides connaissances dans le domaine du traitement de la parole sont indispensables.

Dans l’idéal, vous êtes familier avec :

La compréhension du langage naturel

Le traitement du signal

Les technologies Nuance

Google Assistant

Alexa

Le développement Java sous Android

Des déplacements occasionnels sont à prévoir.

Votre niveau d’anglais vous permet d’échanger à l’écrit et à l’oral, vous maîtrisez notamment le vocabulaire technique.

La maîtrise du Chinois serait un plus.

EN - Would you like to be part of a French company known for its innovation and agility?

Join Faurecia Clarion Electronics, combining a start-up spirit with a first-class automotive equipment manufacturer, to develop the cockpit of the future!
Parrot's automotive business was acquired 100% by Faurecia in 2018 and gave rise to Faurecia Clarion Electronics Europe, Faurecia's 4th Business Group.

In the heart of Paris, our teams design innovative technologies by developing man-machine interfaces under Android auto to offer the end customer an intuitive connectivity experience.
Our embedded electronics solutions are equipped with powerful multi-core graphics processors to respond more quickly to various simultaneous instructions.

Take up with us one of the greatest challenges in the automotive industry!

We are looking for a Senior Speech Processing Engineer (M/F)

CONTEXT

Within the software department of Parrot Faurecia Automotive in Paris, you will be in charge of developing the speech recognition architecture on our new platform, managing the expertise topics related to Virtual Personal Assistants and managing specific developments for demonstrations and prototypes.

MISSIONS

Reporting to the manager of the company's transversal activities (voice recognition, navigation, translations, App Market), your missions will be as follows:

Define, specify and implement the speech recognition architecture taking into account the limits and interests of both modes (embedded/deported)

Prototype and model the different dialogue platforms

Write the technical specifications of these HMIs

Study, analyze and respond to calls for tenders related to the subject

Participate in customer and supplier workshops

Develop and implement the speech recognition and Natural Language Understanding (NLU) part for modeling and prototyping

Identify and document speech recognition technological innovations to extract added value for the company

Study, analyze and characterize speech and NLU recognition solutions from suppliers and competitors

Collaborate within a dynamic and motivated team

Ensure that speech recognition works properly on the new platform

Create dialogue platforms that combine flexibility of use, robustness and performance

Provide expertise and support on the theme "Speech Processing": advice, methods, tools

PROFILE

You are a graduate of an engineering school or thesis, ideally in computer science with a specialization in speech processing.

You have at least 5 years of experience in the field of speech recognition.

A good command of C++ and Python languages and a solid knowledge of speech processing are essential.

Ideally, you are familiar with:

Understanding natural language

Signal processing

Nuance Technologies

Google Assistant

Alexa

Java development under Android

Occasional travel is expected.

Your level of English allows you to exchange in writing and orally, you master the technical vocabulary in particular.

Skills of Chinese would be a plus.

description:
Business Solution Strategist – Accelerate Advisory Services
VMware Accelerate Advisory Services is a Global program investing in our strategic account base to create transformation strategy in strong alignment to their business goals that is actionable, fundable, and measurable. The Business Solution Strategist is a senior level consultative sales lead who is part of the Accelerate Advisory Services and works closely with strategic account teams and sales leadership to drive adoption of VMware solutions into the strategic accounts segment of VMware’s Business. The Business Solution Strategist routinely engages with Director, VP and C-level executives, both internally and externally, providing perspective and guidance on long-term business/technology strategy, investments and innovation drawing upon their depth and breadth of technical and business management knowledge. The Business Solution Strategist is a strategic role which combines the competencies of strategy consulting, deal structuring and project management. The Business Solution Strategist leads cross-functional project teams on high-profile engagements, facilitates executive workshops, represents VMware at executive forums, and educates VMware account teams on strategy best practices and industry trends.
Responsibilities:
Build effective business relationships with customer architects, VPs, and C-level executives
Establish solid working relationships with VMware strategic account teams, sales leadership, professional services, product management, and executive staff
Facilitate executive workshops designed to consult on IT transformation and influence business and IT strategy
Conduct strategic account planning with VMware account teams
Conduct executive presentations
Coach and Develop VMware account teams on value selling
Assist in ROI and TCO analysis as well as developing high quality business cases
Advise customers on Risk Management procedures, Implementation Timelines, Change Management Implications, and Current capacity analysis
Develop Transformational strategies
Assist with Operational Readiness Assessment
Regularly benchmark VMware customers for best practices and value achieved
Conduct thorough industry/account research and analysis
Spread best practices among accounts/account teams and elevate strategic mindshare with those accounts
Requirements:
Bachelors degree required; Masters of Business Administration a plus
Solid industry expertise within a high-tech or consulting environment
Record of building strong customer relationships
Deep understanding of the financial and technical challenges faced with running modern day IT operations at large corporations
Pre-Sales or Consulting background
Consultative Selling (question based selling, positioning services)
Experience developing and growing C Level relationships
Ability to communicate complex topics to an audience with a variety of functional knowledge
Technical and Business writing skills (white papers, proposals, competitive responses)
Business skills (financial accounting, ROI, TCO, budget planning, organizational design)
Presentation skills including Public speaking, Meeting Facilitation and white boarding
Project Management
Strong understanding of VMware Strategy and Technology, alternative solutions, and the benefits that can be realized through the application of VMware solutions to customer environments

VMware Company Overview: VMware, we believe that software has the power to unlock new opportunities for people and our planet. We look beyond the barriers of compromise to engineer new ways to make technologies work together seamlessly. Our cloud, mobility, and security software form a flexible, consistent digital foundation for securely delivering the apps, services and experiences that are transforming business innovation around the globe. At the core of what we do are our people who deeply value execution, passion, integrity, customers, and community. Shape what’s possible today at http://careers.vmware.com.

Equal Employment Opportunity Statement: VMware is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any Kind: VMware is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. VMware will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. VMware encourages applicants of all ages. description:
SlimPay is the European leader in recurring payments for subscriptions. Our solution enables merchants to facilitate acquisition, increase the consumer lifetime value and maximize revenue through card and direct debit payments. With flagship offices in Paris, Madrid and Milan, we are rapidly growing our international footprint — one subscription payment at a time.
SlimPay’s mission is to reinvent the subscription payment journey, creating a frictionless experience for both consumers and merchants. We’re looking for someone who can live our values, alongside a team of 70 people at SlimPay:
Test. Learn. Iterate.
Be Driven. Be Decisive.
Share More. Know More.
Better Together.
Why join us?
This role is a unique opportunity to be part of a hyper-growth tech scale-up, working in an innovative environment from a technical and product perspective.
You will have the opportunity:
To disrupt the payment industry and impact millions of users
To be challenged and grow outside your comfort zone
To test and push the boundaries of technology
To work with advanced technologies
You will join a talented team of engineers, leveraging the most advanced technologies (cloud native on AWS, micro services, containerization, serverless, etc.) to build products that will impact the consumer payment journey.
As a back-end engineer, you will work in agile mode on diverse and innovative projects such as direct debit payments, card payments, open banking and data services.
The engineering team works with a “test, learn and iterate” mindset. This means that you will have the opportunity to continuously improve the engineering practice and raise the bar at SlimPay. After all, the startup spirit is embedded into our work!
Requirements
What do you need to be successful?
Previous successful experience as a back-end engineer ideally in a SaaS environment
Extensive knowledge of Java, Spring, SQL
Experience with AWS or desire to develop expertise on “Cloud Native”
Strong desire to contribute to the software architecture of the solutions
Eagerness to try new technologies/development languages (Go, Kotlin, Scala, etc.) as well as openness to challenge existing ones
Demonstrated ability to quickly learn and adapt to new processes and procedures
Excellent communication skills: experience in communicating with tech and non-tech teams
Fluent in English (written and oral)
High level of autonomy and proactivity in an agile environment
Strong ability to solve functional issues as well as technical issues
Ship quality code, performant and tested
Benefits
What are the perks of working at SlimPay?
Friday Breakfasts
Flex office
Ticket restaurant
Choice of Macbook or Dell XPS 13 Developer Edition
Monthly afterwork drinks with the team
Team-building events like yoga or escape game
Monthly All Hands (#sharemoreknowmore)
Weekly Tech Demos
And much more!

Minimum qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Engineering or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in software engineering and software framework design.

Experience programming in Rust and C++, or similar high-level programming languages.
Experience in development, integrating cellular modems on a modern operating system.
Development experience with wireless technologies such as CDMA, E-HRPD, GSM, UMTS, TDS-CDMA, LTE-FDD/LTE-TDD, and 5G.
Experience in Voice (including WFC, VoLTE, ViLTE) and data call performance, system selection, power and performance optimizations, MIPS optimization, and hardware accelerators.

In this role, you will work on defining, developing, integrating and customizing cellular connectivity features in Fuchsia with the aim of revolutionizing how future users will interact with and use devices.

Design and develop cellular connectivity features.
Debug, triage, and fix modem functional and performance issues from field customers.
Develop a power and performance optimized connectivity solution.
Support RFI/RFQ and carrier compliance.
Contribute beyond connectivity to make Fuchsia a better operating system.

description:
Organisation de l'équipe R&D

Dans l'équipe R&D, nous sommes complètement autonomes. Nous avons une liberté complète sur la façon d'organiser notre travail, nos horaires, nos formations, le recrutement du futur de l'équipe et bien entendu sur les solutions techniques. Enfin nous nous organisons en squads avec des PM et UX/UI designers pour construire le futur de l'EdTech.

Missions

Devenir un membre à part entière de l'équipe de dev de 360Learning,
Développer avec des technos modernes: Node.js (ES6), MongoDB, Vue.js et progresser dessus tous les jours grâce à notre process de peer review décentralisé.
Réaliser de vrais projets, qui seront déployés sur notre plateforme pour nos clients comme tous les autres devs (et cela dès ta première semaine !)
Devenir un expert d'une partie du code, autonome pour l'optimiser et/ou y implémenter

Architecture du code

La manière de concevoir le code, les bonnes pratiques, l’élégance et les astuces utilisées déterminent par des effets de long terme la vitesse de production de l’équipe. Étant une startup en forte croissance, la vitesse est l’un des enjeux majeurs pour nous. Nous sommes donc très attentifs à la qualité de ce que chacun produit. Nous relisons le code les uns des autres, nous échangeons sur ce sujet, et les plus confirmés aident les débutants à monter en compétences.

L’algorithmique est quelque chose d’important chez nous. Il n’est pas donné à tout le monde d’envisager le code, pris dans sa globalité, comme un algorithme qui se "manage". Nous recherchons de vrais passionnés d’informatique et d’algorithmique autant que de belles interfaces interactives.

Process de recrutement

1. Call avec Vladimir, notre Tech Recruiter.
2. Test technique
3. Entretiens avec la team R&D
Perks & recreation
Un CDI en fin de stage :-)
Horaires flexibles / télétravail ponctuel
Autonomie complète sur votre scope
Consoles en libre-service, nombreuses activités (yoga, coaching sportif, foot...)

Anglais courant (niveau B2 ou équivalent)

Vous aimez créer des interfaces de qualité : intuitives, performantes, belles...
Process de recrutement
Call avec Vladimir, notre Tech Recruiter.
Test technique sur HackeRank
Entretiens avec la team R&D
360Learning, scale-up ed-tech fondée en 2013, accompagne les entreprises dans leur transformation en organisation apprenante. Pour SNCF, Air Canada, Kingfisher, comme pour nos 1200 autres clients à travers le monde, apprendre au quotidien devient une évidence. Et pour soutenir une croissance annuelle de plus de 100%, 2019 verra nos équipes doubler de taille (de 110 à 230 employés) et s’internationaliser de Paris à New York, en passant par Londres, toujours plus près de nos clients. En pleine hypercroissance, 360Learning a besoin de recruter des top performers : motivés, ambitieux et compétitifs, et à la fois bienveillants, calmes, rationnels et analytiques. Les parcours “fast track” sont courants chez nous !

Notre modèle d'organisation

Pour soutenir cette croissance, nous avons mis en place un modèle d'organisation nommé Convexity, qui vise à maximiser l’autonomie, la capacité d’initiative et la responsabilisation de chacun, des plus jeunes aux plus expérimentés.

Pour cela, Convexity met l’accent sur la définition de la mission et du périmètre de chacun, et produit ce que l’on appelle un “low authority environment” : chez 360Learning, une fois l’onboarding passé, vous êtes entièrement owner de votre périmètre et de vos décisions à l’intérieur de celui-ci ! Vous êtes seul responsable de vos choix, et de vos résultats.

La transparence est également de mise, l’information business étant la propriété de tous, elle est loguée et partagée dans Trello : à vous aussi de respecter ces règles et de créer la transparence sur votre activité aussi !Le modèle Convexity est particulièrement adapté si vous êtes très autonome, plutôt introverti, rigoureux, analytique et calme, vous avez une grande capacité d’exécution, et si la bienveillance n’est pas juste un mot pour vous, mais un objectif concret dans vos actions quotidiennes. Vous vous reconnaissez ? Alors vous avez probablement un brillant avenir chez 360Learning !

meta1:
Senior Software Engineer - APIs
Criteo46 avis - Paris (75)
date_publication:
il y a 6 mois
- Continuer pour postuler
Signaler cette offre d'emploi
description:
Who we are
At Criteo, we connect 1.5 billion active shoppers with the things they need and love. Our technology takes an algorithmic approach to predict what user we show an ad to, when, and for what products. Our dataset is about 50 petabytes in Hadoop (more than 120 TB extra per day) and we take less than 10ms to respond to an ad request. This is truly big data and machine learning without the buzzwords. If scale and complexity excite you, join us.

Most of all, we are creators. From designing ground-breaking products to finding unique ways to solve technical challenges at an exceptional scale, our tech teams work with state of the art methodologies to shape the future of advertising.

The Software Engineering team builds the products that make Criteo tick: from developing industry leading machine learning techniques, to building high scale/low latency real-time applications (over 5M qps, handling over 300 Bn HTTP requests daily), to delivering first class client interfaces, both API and UI, with forward-thinking UX at their core, all using state of the art technology.

What you'll do

All new Criteo products are built in a self-service first perspective, which help us collect clients' feedback as quickly as possible to make them autonomous.
The Budget & Webapps Engineering team holds a central position and provides technical solutions for UI/APIs used by both advertisers and publishers’ platforms. More specifically, we provide both product (Budget configuration APIs & external APIs) and technical (Analytics) pipelines. In partnership with Product and R&D teams, you will be working on the whole Criteo data flow: from Kafka streams (Flink), designing jobs running on the HDFS on our Hadoop cluster, building both internal & external REST services to access this data. Other topics we cover include: authentication,
analytics using Elasticsearch, emailing solutions etc. The biggest challenge is that we need to work across the whole Criteo stack. This requires a general knowledge on how to build APIs and know your way around both streaming and batch processing.

As a software engineer, you are able to:
Understand the functional needs from Product & R&D
Write technical specs, design and implement systems to match those
expectations
Test with unitary, integration and end to end tests and provide quality
monitoring
Review code of team members to ensure we commit only high-quality
code
Continuously deploy the applications

This is only part of the job. Using the information collected through meetups and conferences, you strengthen our system by building a state-of-the-art application, whether in terms of framework or library, or in terms of best practices (testing, continuous integration/deployment strategies).
Our current stack is built around .NET CORE, running in marathon containers on Mesos, Java/Scala written jobs running on the cluster, Python, Flink library, Elasticsearch.

Who you are
You are knowledgeable about REST APIs and data pipelines
You are curious about new technologies, eventually leading personal subjects on the matter
You have experience with developing and extending large and complex systems
You have worked in Agile environments and are passionate about shipping high quality code!
You understand the notion of a design system and have already worked on it

Bonus points
You have experience with Flink
Competitive compensation package
35+ annual holidays days
Health insurance
Discounted transport and sports activities
Personalized relocation package if moving from abroad
Catered lunch and breakfast
Private nursery
Maternity and paternity leave
Annual cross teams hackathon
2 conferences per year of your choice
Internal mobility programs
Tailored educational resources
Want to know more?
What does it feel like to be part of something big? Get a snapshot
Get the story directly from our R&D engineers, check our Medium R&D blog
Interested in discovering your Criteo community first? Let’s meet

#LI-TZ1

At Criteo, we dare to be different. We believe that diversity fuels innovation and creates an energy that can be seen and felt all over Criteo. We champion different perspectives and are committed to creating a workplace where all Criteos are heard, feel a sense of belonging, and are treated with respect and dignity.

Criteo collects your personal data for the purposes of managing Criteo's recruitment related activities. Consequently, Criteo may use your personal data in relation to the evaluation and selection of applicants. Your information will be accessible to the different Criteo entities across the world. By clicking the "Apply" button you expressly give your consent.

meta1:
Senior Quality Assurance Engineer in Test (H/F) – CDI
HILTI738 avis - Boulogne-Billancourt (92)
titre_poste: Senior Quality Assurance Engineer in Test (H/F) – CDI
date_publication:
il y a 6 mois
- Continuer pour postuler
Signaler cette offre d'emploi
description:
It’s an incredibly exciting time to join the Hilti Digital Platforms team! We are redesigning the future of digital at Hilti and are looking for new team members to play an integral part in our transformation journey. As a Senior Quality Assurance Software Engineer in Test, you will work in a global, multicultural, collaborative, fun, and agile work environment. You will develop and execute exploratory and automated tests to ensure product quality.
Who is Hilti?
If you’re new to the industry, you might not have heard of us. We provide leading-edge tools, technologies, software and services for the global construction sector. We have a proud heritage, built over 75 years, and a worldwide reputation for pioneering products and exceptional service. With 28,000 people in more than 120 countries we operate with a unique direct sales model and generate around 250,000 customer interactions every day.
What does the role involve?
As a QA Engineer in Test, you design and implement tests, debug and define corrective actions, review system requirements and track quality assurance metrics (e.g. defect densities and open defect counts). You work closely with the developers and product owner to find gaps in the business logic, and ensure that the software is creating value for the customer. You create detailed, comprehensive and well-structured test plans and test cases, develop manual test cases to increase regression coverage as well as new functionality testing, and execute manual and automated test cases including ad-hoc and exploratory testing as needed. Ultimately, you monitor all stages of software development to identify and resolve system malfunctions to meet quality standards.
The Digital Platform team, at our two locations in Boulogne-Billancourt, France and Texas, USA, consists of 130+ team members in 11+ scrum teams working with the newest technologies to create a unique user experience for Hilti’s extraordinary products and services.
What do we offer?
To further accelerate in digital marketing, we are building our Global Digital Hub in Paris. You will experience the agile mentality of a start-up, combining the stability of a sound business model and the working environment of an award-winning culture. You can make an impact from day one in an international and diverse team by shaping the future of digital at Hilti and revolutionize customer interactions.
Why should you apply?
We’re investing more than ever in our digital transformation. As a company whose lifeblood is innovation, we give our customers the next level of digital offerings on an impressive global scale! For you, it means unrivalled opportunities to work in a ‘start-up within’ environment, develop an international career and really have an impact on the shape of things to come.
What you need is:
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related field, required
Minimum 3 to 5 years’ experience in software quality assurance
Strong knowledge of software QA methodologies, tools and processes
Experience with BDD test design and writing test cases with Gherkin syntax
SAP and Hybris knowledge a plus
Experience with Atlassian development tools, i.e. Bitbucket, Jira, Confluence, Bamboo
Excellent communication skills in English (verbal & written)
During your interviews, you will meet several members of the digital team including leadership. This way you get to know more about us, and we get to know more about you.
Tempted to apply? Click “apply now” and send us your resume today!
Do you want to know more? Go to https://careers.hilti.com/en/digital-marketing
Join us and #TransformDigital

We are not just invested in games; we are also invested in people. We know that our overall success is a combined effort, and we therefore strive to provide opportunities for our employees to learn, grow and thrive. Organized extracurricular activities and social outings bring our international team even closer together, making our work environment casual, inviting and inspiring.

Ensure very high availability and integrity of analytics services by monitoring and maintaining data flows
Build and put into production machine learning models that predict player behaviors, detect fraud events, etc..

description:
Innovation Software Engineer (H/F) - Paris (190003WO)
PRIMARY LOCATION : FRANCE-75-PARIS-PARIS
ORGANIZATION : AXA REV
CONTRACT TYPE : Regular
SCHEDULE : Full-time
DESCRIPTION
The headquarters of the AXA Group, based in Paris 8th and 17th, brings together the Group's corporate activities. It coordinates the various entities with the Group's strategy and is responsible for managing international projects. The headquarters has approximately 800 employees and is distinguished by its strong international culture (39 nationalities).

The position will report to Group head of Technology Innovation having locations in Paris 17th (France), on the EPFL campus in Lausanne (Switzerland) and in San Francisco (USA). This new unit was created earlier in 2018 to contribute to a global strategic program of digital transformation and innovation to drive AXA towards becoming a tech-led company.
It is not only an innovation unit but also, and above all, an engineering team helping AXA entities to “test and learn” their ideas leveraging emerging technologies and scale them across the group. We strongly believe in learning by doing and acknowledge we have the right to fail if we learn along the way.

Our projects span from IT related topics, to computer vision, cognitive services, bots, drones and many other web/mobile initiatives. Our mission is to transform an idea into a first stage of execution. Once the feasibility and the value for users is confirmed, we scale it with the help of industrialization teams.

To reinforce our software engineering team, we are looking for a highly motivated software engineer, very aware of trends and groundbreaking startups. Years of experience is not what matters. We will value passion, openness, curiosity, respect, engagement, a “big picture vision” and for sure, someone who loves coding! We don’t intend to “play” with technology, we do really seek for impact.

MISSIONS

Transform technology performance into business value.

Among responsibilities:

Perform technology surveys on emerging technology trends.
Develop prototypes to demonstrate new technologies.
Implement selected projects and coordinate with external stakeholders, especially when projects are deployed within the operational perimeter (inside AXA IT).
Constantly improve the team knowledge with technology watch, white papers, position papers. Grow our stakeholders' knowledge and understanding of emerging trends and technologies.
Submit new projects ideas to the team
Develop a good team spirit and strongly contribute to our reputation
Develop a good network within the AXA community
QUALIFICATIONS
Minimum 1 year of experience, internships can also be evaluated
Bachelor’s or graduate degrees in Computer Science or similar
Fluent in English, French is a plus
Nice to have: fluent in German, Spanish, Italian …

The ideal candidate will have previous experience in a start-up or in a tech-driven company, with an entrepreneur mindset, meaning a wide understanding of technologies coupled with a sense of strategy and business impact.
We expect you to be autonomous and able to learn.
The projects duration spans from 1 week to 6 months. Be ready to switch regularly: new field, new technology, new methodology, … and adapt to the new situation.

SKILLS

Excited about building software prototypes.
Excited about learning new technologies on short notice.
Expert in at least one of this domains:
Machine Learning, deep learning applied to imaging, NLP
Web development (front and back)
System development and continuous integration
Fluent in at least 1 programming language, NodeJs preferred
Passionate about technology.
Visionary about new technology applications
Nice to have: experience with computer vision, blockchain, bots, drones, robots, IoT, security, crypto, VR or AR

SOFT SKILLS

Excellent written and verbal English communication. You will do most of your writing in English. Speaking will be English (mandatory) or French.
Ability to challenge others and challenge him or herself
Ability to work in an international and cross functional team
Strong collaboration skills and team player
Will to contribute to the team culture
Comfortable in a fast-paced agile driven environment
Demonstrating openness and curiosity
Considering new challenges as an opportunity
See solutions before problems
Startup experience

In general, we are looking for someone with raw smarts who can easily learn the specific skills needed to do his/her job.

If you feel like you have the enthusiasm for this position, apply!
During the interview, candidates will be asked about their vision of software engineering and their knowledge of the digital industry: be prepared! A warm-up in the cover letter will be highly appreciated
ABOUT AXA
Would you like to wake up every day driven and inspired by our noble mission and to work together as one global team to empower people to live a better life? Here at AXA we strive to lead the transformation of our industry. We are looking for talented individuals who come from varied backgrounds, think differently and want to be part of this exciting transformation by challenging the status quo so we can push AXA - a leading global brand and one of the most innovative companies in our industry - onto even greater things.
In a fast-evolving world and with a presence in 64 countries, our 165,000 employees and exclusive distributors anticipate change to offer services and solutions tailored to the current and future needs of our 107 million customers.

AXA Services - unique fournisseur de services IT de l’ensemble du Groupe AXA. Créée le 1er janvier 2002, AXA Services (ex AXA Tech) est une filiale à 100 % du Groupe AXA ayant pour vocation de fournir des services d’infrastructure informatique aux entités AXA dans le monde entier. AXA services est aujourd’hui présente dans 15 pays et emploie plus de 3300 personnes. Elle gère environ 1 milliard d’euros de dépenses informatiques annuelles pour le compte du Groupe AXA.
WHAT WE OFFER
Chez AXA, nous menons une politique RH engagée qui favorise la diversité, préserve l’équilibre vie privée-vie professionnelle et accélère le développement des compétences et des carrières : promotion de la mixité, politique de rémunération, dispositif de formation,… Quel que soit votre métier, nous veillons à vous offrir des perspectives d’évolution et des opportunités de carrières. Notre objectif est de développer vos talents et vos compétences pour accompagner les transformations de notre entreprise en pleine mutation.

software solutions to manage their environmental and social performance, manage risks and improve
profitability. Enablon offers the most comprehensive platform in the industry, and is consistently
recognized as a global leader and visionary.
Software Product Owner H/F
Integrated Development Environment/Application Builder
Responsibilities
We are currently looking for a Senior Software Engineer / Technical Referent who as a product owner
will own the technology roadmap for our Application Builder Agile Team / Integrated Development
Environment. The Enablon Application Builder technology is the full web integrated development
environment (IDE) used by Enablon to build its industry-leading suite of applications.
You will need to intelligently balance the needs of Enablon developers who create solutions
using the Application Builder, the needs of implementation consultants who configure client
solutions and end-users who use the end-result ;
You will need great technical acumen to be credible managing the backlog for a tool whose
primary end-users are software developers ;
You will also need highly developed user experience skills to design interfaces which
efficiently guide developers and implementation consultants towards best practices
You will need to build relationships with stakeholders across Enablon and within our partner
community in order to understand their underlying needs ;
You will need to be able to translate between the languages of business priorities on one
hand and technical possibilities on the other to ensure the team works on what will have the
greatest impact.

Your main goals will be to provide to first-in-class tools to manage & improve the client upgrade
experience, improve the user experience of the deployment tools and to build out the automated
testing toolset.

Overview of responsibilities :
Define and convey the product technological vision and goals for every release and sprint ;
Provide ongoing support to the development team, understanding the product
functionalities and how they work ;
Document user stories, accurately meeting the business needs for specific products ;
Suggest creative functional compromises which solve implementation and maintenance
challenges, ensuring that business needs are always met ;

Pa
Manage and prioritize the sprint and release backlogs for a team of developers and QA
engineers ;
Lead product backlog refinement meetings ;
Manage stakeholder product requests ;
Ensure that project implementation consultants understand how to get the most out of the
product via direct communication and accurate documentation ;
Conducts demos with relevant content for targeted internal audience ;
Sign-off development based on the communicated definition of ‘Done’ ;
Communicate team progress to release management.
Qualifications & skills

We are looking for a pro-active and organised individual, who thrives in a fast-paced and dynamic
environment. Here at Enablon we value winning and celebrating successes together, but you will also
need to take ownership, set priorities and work with minimal guidance to be able to drive the entire
product process and maximize business value. We are also looking for a skilled communicator, with
the ability to adapt your communication style to the appropriate audience, whether they are non-
technical or technical and who is willing to get increasingly involved in customer visits for identifying
their needs early on.

You should have an appetite for digging deep into technical details in order to understand complex
platform requirements and you are able to read, write and interpret technical documentation. A
keen knowledge and interest in relational databases and software design is essential. You have
experience with product management for development tools and / or enterprise software products

meta1:
Innovation Software Engineer (H/F)
AXA REV - Paris (75)
date_publication:
AXA - il y a 6 mois
- Continuer pour postuler
Signaler cette offre d'emploi
description:
The headquarters of the AXA Group, based in Paris 8th and 17th, brings together the Group's corporate activities. It coordinates the various entities with the Group's strategy and is responsible for managing international projects. The headquarters has approximately 800 employees and is distinguished by its strong international culture (39 nationalities).

The position will report to Group head of Technology Innovation having locations in Paris 17th (France), on the EPFL campus in Lausanne (Switzerland) and in San Francisco (USA). This new unit was created earlier in 2018 to contribute to a global strategic program of digital transformation and innovation to drive AXA towards becoming a tech-led company.
It is not only an innovation unit but also, and above all, an engineering team helping AXA entities to “test and learn” their ideas leveraging emerging technologies and scale them across the group. We strongly believe in learning by doing and acknowledge we have the right to fail if we learn along the way.



Our projects span from IT related topics, to computer vision, cognitive services, bots, drones and many other web/mobile initiatives. Our mission is to transform an idea into a first stage of execution. Once the feasibility and the value for users is confirmed, we scale it with the help of industrialization teams.

To reinforce our software engineering team, we are looking for a highly motivated software engineer, very aware of trends and groundbreaking startups. Years of experience is not what matters. We will value passion, openness, curiosity, respect, engagement, a “big picture vision” and for sure, someone who loves coding! We don’t intend to “play” with technology, we do really seek for impact.



MISSIONS

Transform technology performance into business value.

Among responsibilities:

Perform technology surveys on emerging technology trends.
Develop prototypes to demonstrate new technologies.
Implement selected projects and coordinate with external stakeholders, especially when projects are deployed within the operational perimeter (inside AXA IT).
Constantly improve the team knowledge with technology watch, white papers, position papers. Grow our stakeholders' knowledge and understanding of emerging trends and technologies.
Submit new projects ideas to the team
Develop a good team spirit and strongly contribute to our reputation
Develop a good network within the AXA community
Qualifications
• Minimum 1 year of experience, internships can also be evaluated
Bachelor’s or graduate degrees in Computer Science or similar
Fluent in English, French is a plus
Nice to have: fluent in German, Spanish, Italian …

The ideal candidate will have previous experience in a start-up or in a tech-driven company, with an entrepreneur mindset, meaning a wide understanding of technologies coupled with a sense of strategy and business impact.
We expect you to be autonomous and able to learn.
The projects duration spans from 1 week to 6 months. Be ready to switch regularly: new field, new technology, new methodology, … and adapt to the new situation.



SKILLS

Excited about building software prototypes.
Excited about learning new technologies on short notice.
Expert in at least one of this domains:
Machine Learning, deep learning applied to imaging, NLP
Web development (front and back)
System development and continuous integration
Fluent in at least 1 programming language, NodeJs preferred
Passionate about technology.
Visionary about new technology applications
Nice to have: experience with computer vision, blockchain, bots, drones, robots, IoT, security, crypto, VR or AR

SOFT SKILLS

Excellent written and verbal English communication. You will do most of your writing in English. Speaking will be English (mandatory) or French.
Ability to challenge others and challenge him or herself
Ability to work in an international and cross functional team
Strong collaboration skills and team player
Will to contribute to the team culture
Comfortable in a fast-paced agile driven environment
Demonstrating openness and curiosity
Considering new challenges as an opportunity
See solutions before problems
Startup experience

In general, we are looking for someone with raw smarts who can easily learn the specific skills needed to do his/her job.

If you feel like you have the enthusiasm for this position, apply!
During the interview, candidates will be asked about their vision of software engineering and their knowledge of the digital industry: be prepared! A warm-up in the cover letter will be highly appreciated
About AXA
Would you like to wake up every day driven and inspired by our noble mission and to work together as one global team to empower people to live a better life? Here at AXA we strive to lead the transformation of our industry. We are looking for talented individuals who come from varied backgrounds, think differently and want to be part of this exciting transformation by challenging the status quo so we can push AXA - a leading global brand and one of the most innovative companies in our industry - onto even greater things.
In a fast-evolving world and with a presence in 64 countries, our 165,000 employees and exclusive distributors anticipate change to offer services and solutions tailored to the current and future needs of our 107 million customers.
AXA Services - unique fournisseur de services IT de l’ensemble du Groupe AXA. Créée le 1er janvier 2002, AXA Services (ex AXA Tech) est une filiale à 100 % du Groupe AXA ayant pour vocation de fournir des services d’infrastructure informatique aux entités AXA dans le monde entier. AXA services est aujourd’hui présente dans 15 pays et emploie plus de 3300 personnes. Elle gère environ 1 milliard d’euros de dépenses informatiques annuelles pour le compte du Groupe AXA.
What We Offer Chez AXA, nous menons une politique RH engagée qui favorise la diversité, préserve l’équilibre vie privée-vie professionnelle et accélère le développement des compétences et des carrières : promotion de la mixité, politique de rémunération, dispositif de formation,… Quel que soit votre métier, nous veillons à vous offrir des perspectives d’évolution et des opportunités de carrières. Notre objectif est de développer vos talents et vos compétences pour accompagner les transformations de notre entreprise en pleine mutation.

Requisition ID: 178235

Employment Type: Limited Full Time
COMPANY DESCRIPTION
SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.
SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.
S/4 HANA Cloud
SAP S/4HANA Cloud is the next generation cloud ERP business suite. It integrates every business process, helps turn real-time data into actions, and increases employee productivity, with the security you expect from SAP, enabling you to innovate, transform and run ahead.
S/4HANA Central Invoicing
S/4HANA Central Invoicing will extend the S/4HANA Central Procurement solution by adding centralized access, transparency, approval and management capabilities for Supplier Invoices across several connected S/4HANA and/or ERP systems.
S/4HANA Central Invoicing will be the sole entry point for Accounts Payables / Shared Service Center Employees to access relevant invoice documents. They will benefit from an amazing user experience and will be supported by intelligent algorithms to solve their daily tasks.
Companies will benefit from centralizing the invoice related tasks by streamlining their processes and reducing cycle times, which leads to real cost savings by meeting the payment target incl. corresponding discounts.
YOUR MISSION
The goal of this internship is to join a scrum team to contribute to the quality of Central Invoicing by developing automated tests.
As a member of this professional scrum team you will help us build these applications and develop end-to-end features using JavaScript on front and backends.
You will discover professional development at a world-class software vendor.
YOUR TEAM
You will join a professional development team, working in an agile/scrum mode.
You will work closely with Developers, Quality Engineers, UX Designers, Architects and Product experts.
You will be connected to an international development community working on the same project and goals.

HTML5 / JavaScript / Java / Rest Api / NodeJs / GitHub / Selenium
Commitment and taste for quality
Team player / Technical English is required in order to fit with company’s international context.
Duration
Dates will be defined with the student depending on his school calendar. Near six-month duration is expected.
Location
Internship will take place at SAP France 35, rue d’Alsace 92309 Levallois-Perret.
WHAT YOU GET FROM US
Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own. A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment – apply now.
SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT
To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.
SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team (Americas: Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com).
Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.

Do your curiosity and desire to learn drive you?

A deep passion for technology and software development
A strong knowledge of Linux system/processor performance, and network communication
An understanding of hardware and its influence on latency
An ability to look at code, figure out how it works, and how to make it better
A self-motivation and proactivity, a strong organization and a willingness to admit mistakes
A capacity to manage multiple projects and coordinate work with various teams and vendors in addition todaily production support activities
And enjoy tinkering with technology in your spare time.
What’s fun ?
Designing, evaluating and building new hardware and software technologies or solutions (server & storage)
Being a major player in developing long-term infrastructure strategies.
Actively monitoring the health of our entire infrastructure
We focus on automation, Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery so we can deploy everything–hardware, software – rapidly and repeatedly.
As Systems Engineers we work with development, trading, and other technology teams to implementsolutions to a huge variety of technical problems.
We operate at the bleeding edge of technology. If something new can potentially bring an advantage we willactively invest in developing and utilizing the solution.
The right balance of speed and quality is crucial. We value good engineering practices and scalablesolutions.
We encourage everybody to gain understanding of both trading strategy and how exchanges work from atechnological point of view.


Skillset requirements

Proficiency within one of the following:
Strong skills in Linux administration (CentOS) and Virtualization (Vmware)
Familiar with large-scale storage architecture (EMC VMAX / HP 3PAR / …)
Experience with kernel tuning and performance troubleshooting
Having practiced HPC architecture design and administration (Slurm, Lustre) before
Strong understanding of various protocols and Linux standard services
Familiar with configuration management tools like Puppet or Ansible
Python enthusiast
Eager to learn and apply new skills quickly


The Company

Founded in 1991, Capital Fund Management (CFM) is a successful alternative asset manager and a pioneer in the field of quantitative trading applied to capital markets across the globe. Our methodology relies on statistically robust analysis of terabytes of financial data to inform and enable our asset allocation, trading decisions and automated order execution.

CFM offers a challenging and rewarding career for highly-talented and passionate PhD’s, IT engineers and experts from around the world. Our people can draw on 28 years of research and analysis into financial market data as well as investment into our cutting edge technology platforms. These fundamentals allow us to create and execute state-of-the-art trading strategies for our clients and offer exciting career opportunities for our employees.

Our people’s diversity and dedication contribute to CFM’s unique culture of research, innovation and achievement. We are a Great Place to Work company and we offer a collaborative and informal work environment, attractive offices and facilities and highly competitive compensation packages including a profit-based bonus system.

The company is regulated by AMF, the SEC and the CFTC, with assets under management of $10 billion.

description:
Who we are
At Criteo, we connect 1.5 billion active shoppers with the things they need and love. Our technology takes an algorithmic approach to predict what user we show an ad to, when, and for what products. Our dataset is about 50 petabytes in Hadoop (more than 120 TB extra per day) and we take less than 10ms to respond to an ad request. This is truly big data and machine learning without the buzzwords. If scale and complexity excite you, join us.

Most of all, we are creators. From designing ground-breaking products to finding unique ways to tackle technical challenges at an extraordinary scale, our tech teams work with state of the art methodologies to shape the future of advertising.

Our Infrastructure teams are designing and operating the overall capacity and connectivity supporting the Criteo platform. They are in charge of designing, planning, scaling and operating hardware, system, network and datacenter layers.

Data center infrastructure team is looking for a motivated and skilled candidate to sustain Criteo's infrastructure growth. The candidate must be able to work with internal engineers and external groups including manufacturers, vendors, and contractors in an environment where clear guidelines may not exist. Travel will occasionally be necessary but shouldn’t be more than 10% of your time.

You will be :
In charge of the procurement part at the R&D
Forecast definition and follow-up with vendors and integrators
Participate in Datacenters RFP and Server RFQ always in broad collaboration with R&D, Procurement, and Legal Teams
Participate in WAN & IP Transit RFP and the delivery of network links up to the network router
Provide design of all layer one infrastructure within data center white space
Optimize physical arrangement of computing, storage, and networking within racks, rooms, and buildings
Manage Datacenter closing and assets decommissions
Set standards for racks, cabling systems, power distribution, cable management, and airflow management
Optimize hardware, power, and cabling layout in each rack design for scale
Evaluate, select, and help to build tools used to automate data center management
Drive innovation in the data center at CRITEO as well as across the industry
Provide data for CSR report

Who you are
BS in Computer Science or related field
3+ years of experience in the datacenter field
Power - three-phase, conditioning, and distribution from utility to chip
Cooling - theory, methods, efficiency
Cabling - standards, fibers, transceivers
Networking - basics of OSI layers, carriers, support
Software - monitoring, asset management, DCIM, analytics, reporting, UNIX, network CLI
Strong oral and written communication, organization, and project management skills
Ability to self-serve, investigate, and execute with minimal instruction
Taste for automation and standardization
Finance & Procurement awareness
Agile methods basis
Competitive compensation package
35+ annual holidays days
Health insurance
Discounted transport and sports activities
Personalized relocation package if moving from abroad
Catered lunch and breakfast
Private nursery
Maternity and paternity leave
Annual cross teams hackathon
2 conferences per year of your choice
Internal mobility programs
Tailored educational resources

What does it feel like to be part of something big? Get a snapshot
Get the story directly from our R&D engineers, check our Medium R&D blog

Liferay, Inc. is a leading provider of enterprise open source portal and collaboration software products and recognized leader by analyst firm Gartner. The company is growing at a fast pace to keep up with strong market demand for innovative solutions for digital transformation, customer experience, personal and social web experiences and enterprise applications.
Liferay offers many opportunities for individuals looking for a dynamic environment and accelerated career growth. Talented individuals will find it possible to increase their responsibilities and gain valuable business experience in a short amount of time with the company. With over 850 employees in offices across Europe, the Americas, and Asia Pacific, Liferay offers a chance to work with people from many different cultural backgrounds.
Liferay believes in making a bigger impact in the world through business and we dedicate part of our time and profits toward non-profit organizations and social initiatives.
Liferay’s French office is looking for a consultant to join its team.
As a Consultant at Liferay, you will work very close to customers, primary point of contact for all technical questions and inquiries, designing and developing solutions being involved in full cycles projects. Working closely with Account Executives, Account Managers and other members of the Liferay team, you will act as a trusted advisor for the customer on the Liferay solution, competitors, and alternative solutions.
We’re looking for people who love open source, enjoy wearing multiple hats, and want to grow with a company that’s bursting at the seams.

Core Responsibilities and duties
Reporting to the Head of Operations France, you will be responsible for:
Provide Liferay products consulting to our partners and customers
Provide technical information and supervision to our partners and customers
Respond to documents like RFP´s in close cooperation with the sales team
Demonstrate our software solution in front of prospects, existing clients and partners
Identify needs and requirements of customers and prospects so that demonstrations are customized to the customer’s specific interests
Provide product presentations, architecture reviews, application discussions and prototype development as needed
Provide technical leadership to project team(s) to perform design to deployment related activities, provide guidance, perform reviews, prevent and resolve technical issues
Designs and leads implementation of scalable, secure JAVA-based applications.
Providing input into regarding new technologies and techniques, as well as participate in the development of proof of concepts and best practices.
Deliver training for customers and partners to guarantee consistent know-how transfer.
Note: As in any fast-paced, agile environment, the list above is just some of the challenging opportunities you will tackle. You'll excel if you are able to enthusiastically overcome hurdles, quickly adjust to changing priorities, and have a blast working with a crazy fun team.

Required Qualifications
Engineer school or University degree (bac +4/5), preferably in Computer Science or software engineering, and/or systems engineering
Experience in technical consulting in internet web site development, portal, web content management and/or social collaboration industry in general
Experience with multiple databases (Oracle, SQL Server, MySQL, etc.) and application servers (Tomcat, JBoss, WebLogic or WebSphere)
Exposure to Java frameworks such as Spring and Hibernate
Exposure to front-end technologies such as CSS, HTML5, YUI (and/or Alloy UI), jQuery
Strong Web development experience - proficient in Java and Java EE
Prior experience with Liferay or other portal solutions a plus
Excellent interpersonal skills, both written and verbal
Demonstrated exceptional engineering, consulting, and / or software sales skills from previous employment
Works well with distributed team
Flexible
Fluent in English
We are offering
Salary package according to qualification and experience
Opportunities to take responsibility and grow professionally
Ability to work in an international context
A positive and pleasant work environment
Working at a successful company with strong growth
Equal Opportunities Employer - Statement
Liferay is committed to the equal treatment of all candidates, customers and employees and to fostering a culture of dignity at work. Our operating procedure provides for equal opportunities in recruitment and employment with the aim to eliminate discrimination against any job applicant or employee on the basis of race, age, sexual orientation, gender or gender reassignment, religion or beliefs, marital or civil partnerships status, family or dependency status, disability, pregnancy and maternity or membership of a travelling community.

description:
PeopleDoc by Ultimate Software s'est donné pour mission de révolutionner la façon dont chaque fonction RH fournit des services à ses employés.

La plate-forme PeopleDoc HR Service Delivery aide les équipes des ressources humaines à répondre plus facilement aux demandes des employés à la demande et à automatiser les processus des employés sur plusieurs sites.

PeopleDoc sert plus de 1000 clients avec des employés dans 180 pays et dans 12 langues. PeopleDoc fait maintenant partie d'Ultimate Software. Ultimate Software est un leader pour les applications Cloud HCM.

Plus d'informations sont disponibles à l'adressewww.people-doc.com. ( http://www.people-doc.com./ )

Description du poste / Résumé du poste:
Nous recherchons deux CyberSecurity Engineer pour renforcer nos capacités de détection, d'intervention et d'enquête pour nos environnements applicatifs. Le tout afin d'assurer la sécurité continue de notre solution Saas Cloud, composé de milliers de serveurs, destinés à des millions d'utilisateurs dans le monde entier.

En collaboration avec l'équipe SOC et DevSec, vous surveillez les tentatives d'infiltrations, analysez les logs à la recherche de patterns pour vous assurer que les tentatives d'infiltration sont identifiées et traitées rapidement.

Si vous aimez mettre en pratique vos connaissances techniques afin d'identifier et dénichez les meilleurs manières de défendre notre système, aimez être en apprentissage continu et évoluer dans un environnement international et stimulant alors ce poste est fait pour vous !

Principales responsabilités:
Surveiller en permanence les systèmes d'Ultimate Software et Peopledoc et répondre aux menaces inactives et actives
Maintenir des enquêtes actives sur les événements de sécurité transmis au SOC
Développer et gérer les outils de detection afin d'identifier les activités néfastes au sein de l'entreprise et modéliser les menaces
Construire des métriques sur l'efficacité, l'efficience et la couverture, et démontrer une preuve de valeur
Restez au courant des technologies de sécurité et faites des recommandations d'utilisation en fonction de la valeur métier
Qualifications requises:
Solides compétences en matière de sécurité, ou professionnel ayant au moins 5 ans d'expérience pertinente dans le domaine de la sécurité
Expérience dans le développement de programmes en Python.
Compréhension du traitement des incidents de sécurité et de l'applicabilité des vulnérabilités logicielles
Capacité à communiquer efficacement en anglais
Le poste est ouvert à Paris et disponible immédiatement.

Sewan (https://sewan.jobs/la-societe), opérateur et hébergeur cloud nouvelle génération, c’est 832% de croissance sur les 4 dernières années, 85 millions de C.A. sur l’année 2018 et un C.A. prévisionnel de 100 millions en 2019 !
Quelques chiffres importants :
550 000 utilisateurs
155 000 Go de données
110 M de valorisation temps réel par mois
1/3 des effectifs à la Technologie (120 personnes)

Sophia est une plate-forme Cloud développée et hébergée par Sewan permettant l’accès à tous les services de notre catalogue. Ses fonctionnalités sont disponibles via son interface ou ses nombreuses API et offrent un accès temps réel complètement automatisé aux offres Sewan.

Aujourd’hui Sophia c’est :
Un code base multi-technologies : 1 M de lignes de code (Python, NodeJS, PHP, React…)
Une API ultra-complète : 100 web services, 1000 endpoints
Une équipe Agile : plus de 30 mises en production par semaine
100% de disponibilité

Avec l’incroyable croissance de Sewan, nous développons actuellement un projet ambitieux : la refonte technique, technologique et UX de Sophia afin d’offrir à nos clients un outil toujours plus fonctionnel.
Nos équipes agiles ont besoin de vous pour participer à ce challenge qui met en œuvre les technologies et architectures les plus modernes et participer à la construction du Sewan de demain :
Micro-services
Containerisation (Docker + Kubernetes)
API Gateway
Linux, nginx, Apache, Ansible, Salt, Fabric, VMWare
Python, React, PHP, Node, GraphQL
MongoDB, MySQL, ProxySQL, Redis, RabbitMQ, Suite ELK
JIRA/Confluence, Gitlab, Gitlab CI, Jenkins, SonarQube
Intégration et déploiement continus (nous livrons en production tous les jours)
Missions
Vous rejoindrez une équipe talentueuse, créative et motivée pour travailler à des projets de grande envergure avec de vrais défis professionnels à relever dans une ambiance détendue entre passionnés.
Votre mission consistera à :
Développer une Plateform as A Service pour les équipes de développement
Mettre en œuvre des best practices de Devops au sein de l’équipe Software Engineering
Moderniser les architectures legacy dans une perspective de scalabilité
Accompagner les projets de développement d'une expertise technique Dev et Ops
Dynamiser et challenger l’équipe.
Profil et Compétences
Votre profil idéal :
Maîtrise des outils et workflow de CI/CD: Gtilab, Jenkins et Sonarqube
Solides compétences sur Docker, Docker-compose et Kubernetes
Connaissances approfondies de SaltStack et Ansible
Force de proposition sur l'architecture et l’outillage
Bonnes compétences de scripting/développement Bash, Python, Go
Travail en équipe (Agile Scrum, Peer Review, Guidelines & Best Practices)

// AVANTAGES
Choix de l’OS et des outils de développement
Événements festifs internes réguliers (https://sewan.jobs/la-vie-chez-sewan/)
Labellisé Happy at Work ! (https://sewan.jobs/sewan-labellise-happyatwork/)
Des possibilités d’évolution, mobilité interne
Tickets restaurants, RTT et mutuelle

description:
Who we are
At Criteo, we connect 1.5 billion active shoppers with the things they need and love. Our technology takes an algorithmic approach to predict what user we show an ad to, when, and for what products. Our dataset is about 50 petabytes in Hadoop (more than 120 TB extra per day) and we take less than 10ms to respond to an ad request. This is truly big data and machine learning without the buzzwords. If scale and complexity excite you, join us.

Most of all, we are creators. From designing ground-breaking products to finding unique ways to tackle technical challenges at an extraordinary scale, our tech teams work with state of the art methodologies to shape the future of advertising.

Our Infrastructure teams are designing and operating the overall capacity and connectivity supporting the Criteo platform. They are in charge of designing, planning, scaling and operating hardware, system, network and datacenter layers.

What you'll do
Data center infrastructure team is looking for a motivated and skilled candidate to sustain Criteo's infrastructure growth. The candidate must be able to work with internal engineers and external groups including manufacturers, vendors, and contractors in an environment where clear guidelines may not exist. Travel will occasionally be necessary but shouldn’t be more than 10% of your time.

You will be :
In charge of the procurement part at the R&D
Forecast definition and follow-up with vendors and integrators
Participate in Datacenters RFP and Server RFQ always in broad collaboration with R&D, Procurement, and Legal Teams
Participate in WAN & IP Transit RFP and the delivery of network links up to the network router
Provide design of all layer one infrastructure within data center white space
Optimize physical arrangement of computing, storage, and networking within racks, rooms, and buildings
Manage Datacenter closing and assets decommissions
Set standards for racks, cabling systems, power distribution, cable management, and airflow management
Optimize hardware, power, and cabling layout in each rack design for scale
Evaluate, select, and help to build tools used to automate data center management
Drive innovation in the data center at CRITEO as well as across the industry
Provide data for CSR report

Who you are
BS in Computer Science or related field
3+ years of experience in the datacenter field
Power - three-phase, conditioning, and distribution from utility to chip
Cooling - theory, methods, efficiency
Cabling - standards, fibers, transceivers
Networking - basics of OSI layers, carriers, support
Software - monitoring, asset management, DCIM, analytics, reporting, UNIX, network CLI
Strong oral and written communication, organization, and project management skills
Ability to self-serve, investigate, and execute with minimal instruction
Taste for automation and standardization
Finance & Procurement awareness
Agile methods basis

description:
As a VMware Senior Consultant within the global PSO Organization, you will provide customers technical leadership in the installation, configuration, and implementation of VMware products and technologies. You will be responsible for executing projects independently and implementing technical solutions based on VMware products.
The PSO team is a phenomenal, dynamic and fun team, always thrilled to welcome new colleagues. We work with our peers from in France, in Europe and in the global organization in an excellent atmosphere to foster people development and value creation for our customers.
What can you expect in this role?
As a technology specialist, empowered to independently conduct small to medium engagements with customers, you will take part of large projects with major customer, within Cloud projects. Some of your future assignments:
Independently conduct small to medium engagements with customers
Maintain current knowledge of the entire VMware product line
You conduct pre-packaged VMware consulting solutions in a timely and effective manner
Work in a diverse team of consultants to implement sophisticated SDDC solutions comprising VMware product stack
Assist in the development of standard and reusable VMware "productized" consulting service offerings and improvements to our methodology, including definition of tasks, expectations and standard estimates
You help to document best practices in developing and deploying VMware solutions, and feed them into our knowledge base for reuse by customers and partners
You build and maintain confidence of colleagues and customers
You actively participate in PSO team meeting by presenting technical project or new product
Lead consultant tasks and priorities in cloud project
Keep up-to-date on VMware technologies (self-trainings and corporate boot-camps)
Become a trusted advisor for your customers and your colleagues
Contribute in recruiting and mentoring new consultant
Assist in scoping engagement during services presales process
You may travel up to 50 percent of the time, including international; the role, responsibilities and geographical focus will change and develop over time along with the company’s rapid growth
What are the critical skills required to succeed?
3+ years of experience in customer-facing positions as a consultant, administrator or engineer, preferably within a system integrator, consulting organization or IT provider
Solid experience with modern IT infrastructure and hosting operation (Disaster recovery, SLA, Backup, Multi Site, Monitoring, AD & DNS…)
Proven expertise on VMware Virtual Infrastructure Deployment, Management & Administration: vSphere/vCenter is a strict minimum, vCenter Operations Manager, SRM, vCloud Automation Center, vCenter Orchestrator, vCloud
Cross Operating System knowledge, getting at least administrator experience in both Linux and Windows world
Strong application software development for one or more of the Linux, Unix (e.g. Solaris), Windows NT, and Windows 2000 operating systems. Systems programming or OS internal level skills would be an advantage
Understanding of modern IT production data centre and Internet (ISP/ASP) hosting operations
A good practical understanding of Web- based application development, including cgi-bin, and Apache or IIS server platforms
Aptitude to contribute, grow and evolve with the team
B.S./B.A./M.S. degree or equivalent technical training
VMware VCP is required
Excellent communications and interpersonal skills
Fluent in English and French is required
Anything else that may be valuable?
Experience with VMware vRealize Operations Manager, vRealize Log Insight is a strength
Experience with 3rd party datacenter product and solution, such as backup or storage solutions
Equal Opportunity Statement
We truly believe in the Power of Human Difference. At VMware, we celebrate our people from a wide variety of dynamic backgrounds, experiences and perspectives. Account Executive
Hull - Paris (75)

il y a 6 mois

Signaler cette offre d'emploi
description:
Hull is ranked by G2 as a high performer in the fast growing MarTech customer data management space. Are you looking for a role that challenges your sales, process, and management skills as well as your analytical abilities?
We’re looking for talented Account Executives in Paris to join the dots between our track and engaged accounts to reach out, build rapport, and spot new business opportunities. This is first and foremost a hunter role that requires you to generate new business opportunities and to run the full sales cycle to close.
Most sales team still work cold list noisy "one-size-fit-all-account" cadences to “hit” and reach new accounts. Painful, isn’t it? Reaching people who don’t know you or aren’t looking to buy can be tedious and painful. At Hull, we practice what we teach (which we learn from our customers using our platform). Business development is about engaging people who are already in the market, show intent and are considered best-fit.
When people indicate they’re interested in meeting to discuss how Hull can help integrate their tools, teams & data, you’ll be owning and leading sales cycles from chat conversations, demo requests qualification, social outreach, and email responses — to running Hull product demos. You will own the account from initial intent to closed won.
To understand a little more where our heads are at on "next-level" of sales development:
Read our blog post on sales enablement: https://www.hull.io/blog/sales-enablement/
Watch our presentation on rules-based growth: https://www.turingfest.com/2018/speakers/ed-fry
Read our chapter in the Clearbit Data-Driven Sales book: https://clearbit.com/books/data-driven-sales/sales-triggers
Watch the Dogpatch Advisors presentation on “Relevance at Scale”: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3NmKfvxxADc
You’ll be joining a technical team (80% engineers) to solve the big marketing problem of our time — stop us if you’ve seen this graphic before: https://chiefmartec.com/2018/04/marketing-technology-landscape-supergraphic-2018/
Nowhere is this more painful than in scaling B2B SaaS companies. Hull should be the single source of truth for all these companies. And you can own a key role in driving business to step up and help us join the dots.
If you “get it” too, we’d love to hear from you.

RESPONSIBILITIES
This is first and foremost a hunter role. You’ll be actively prospecting new business opportunities, as well as developing and up-selling current clients.
Responsible for the overall business development, and sales lifecycle of the Hull platform
Conduct in-depth research to identify lead opportunities and present sales strategies to Hull sales leadership
Document and track all potential and existing client interactions and lead follow-through using Hull, Salesforce, Intercom, and Outreach
Execute detailed product presentations and web demonstrations of our software capabilities to technical marketers i.e. growth marketers, growth engineers, marketing operations
Identify and utilize internal resources to qualify, assist in sales cycles, and close deals


Requirements
Native French speaker, English (fluent)
1.5 years+ experience as a SaaS SDR/BDR (you killed it in business development and want to take the next challenge and actually carry a real quota)
Work ethic misunderstood by the normal employee - you look to be superhuman in the tasks you take on and speed at which you complete them
You have to be data-driven to succeed. It’s part of the hiring qualification process.
Superb listening skills. You must understand objections and defeat them by turning skeptics into exciting new customers
Entrepreneurial mindset - You have the opportunity to help shape our sales process
High level of empathy. It’s important for our AEs to be a good person to peers and prospects
Proven ability to make strong connections and overcome rejection to achieve results
Consistent overachievement of quota
Great to have, but not required:
Bachelor's Degree
Experience hunting in greenfield environments
Experience using prospecting tools such as SalesLoft or Outreach
Benefits
Culture that emphasizes personal and professional growth
Competitive salary and great benefits
Uncapped commission structure
ROWE (Results Only Work Environment)
Casual dress all-day, everyday
Unlimited snacks and drinks
