description:
Group Operational Risk Manager - (F/H) (190003WA)
PRIMARY LOCATION : FRANCE-75-PARIS-PARIS
ORGANIZATION : GIE AXA
CONTRACT TYPE : Regular
SHIFT : Day Job
SCHEDULE : Full-time
DESCRIPTION
Primary purpose of this position:
Members of the Group Operational Risk Management (4 people) main duties are:
Animate and coordinate operational risk network, ensure harmonization of practices and implementation of Group guidelines, promote best practices exchange.
Ensure the qualitative and quantitative assessment of the major operational risk amongst the AXA entities and compute the Group Operational risk STEC quantification
Optimize the capital charge within the AXA Group and monitor the implementation of actions plans against the main operational risks.
Ensure and promote the operational risk losses and incident data collection
In this context, the objectives of the Group Operational Risk Managers are the following:

Principles and methodologies:
Define and spread the Group’s quantitative and qualitative principles and requirements.
Support and challenge the operational risk scenarios identified and assessed by the AXA Entities on both quantitative and qualitative aspects.
Ensure follow-up and effectiveness of the Group losses and incidents database.
Challenge, share and follow-up the action plans on major risks.
Modelling:
Ensure entities are in line with internal operational risk modelling approach and contribute to the related justification vis à vis regulators
Be the priviledged point of contact on operational risk modelling topics
Capital Charge validation/Production:
Compute the annual production of the Group Operational risk capital charge
Apply validation requirements at Group level and ensure entities are in line with local requirements.
Participate to the evolution and maintenance of Group operational risks software.
Prepare reports on the Group operational risk profile to the Group Executive Management, the regulator….
Local Coordination :
Be a privileged contact point with the local Operational Risks Managers (from 7 to 10 countries/areas).
Define methodological principles with regards to identification, measurement and reduction of operational risk
Ensure the roll out of these methodologies within the Operational risk community
Monitor the losses and incidents’ data collection.
Follow-up on action plans.
Ensure that local specificities are well reflected in the local operational risk profile.
Ensure consistency of local practices with Group requirements.

QUALIFICATIONS
Candidate Profile:

Technical and professional skills (technical expertise)
Experience in control function (audit, operational risk…) in insurance or financial environment.
Knowledge of internal and external requirements (regulators, rating agencies) with regards to the risk management and assessment within the frame of Solvency II.
General knowledge of insurance industry.
Quantitative background : engineer/actuary degree
Relational skills
Ability to manage local and international correspondent’s network with enthusiasm and commitment.
Strong communications skills to liaise with a wide range of correspondents at various level of management.
Rigor and reliability especially in the production and validation of Group Operational risk capital charge.
Ability to produce synthetic reporting to Executive Management.
Fluent in English.
Experience
7 to 10 years, ideally in risk management in insurance or bank industry.
ABOUT AXA
Would you like to wake up every day driven and inspired by our noble mission and to work together as one global team to empower people to live a better life? Here at AXA we strive to lead the transformation of our industry. We are looking for talented individuals who come from varied backgrounds, think differently and want to be part of this exciting transformation by challenging the status quo so we can push AXA - a leading global brand and one of the most innovative companies in our industry - onto even greater things.
In a fast-evolving world and with a presence in 64 countries, our 165,000 employees and exclusive distributors anticipate change to offer services and solutions tailored to the current and future needs of our 107 million customers.

The headquarters of the AXA Group, based in Paris 8th, brings together the Group's corporate activities. It coordinates the various entities with the Group's strategy, and is responsible for managing international projects. The headquarters has approximately 800 employees and is distinguished by its strong international culture (39 nationalities).
WHAT WE OFFER
We provide you regular career opportunities in international teams. If you want to join us, don’t hesitate to apply !

Information provided by applicants will be processed in strict confidentiality and may be used exclusively for recruitment processes.

AWS EMEA SARL (France Branch)38,552 avis - Courbevoie (92)
date_publication:

description:
10+ years of experience architecting and implementing enterprise-scale networks
5+ years experience with network virtualization and/or software defined networks
5+ years of highly technical and analytical IT experience
Deep knowledge of IPv4 and IPv6 protocols and standards
Deep knowledge of layer 2 technologies, including MPLS and Ethernet
Demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges
Experience speaking publicly in front of large audiences
Strong verbal and written communications skills are a must, as well as the ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations and virtual teams.

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is looking for a Solutions Architect with network technology skills to provide deep knowledge and innovative leadership to our customers. This position is for a highly technical Subject Matter Expert that can dive deep, work with customers, and work with internal teams to design next generation cloud and hybrid IT architectures. Do you have a unique combination of deep technical knowledge, business acumen and strong interpersonal skills? Do you enjoy innovating? Do you want to influence industry? Do you find it rewarding to educate colleagues and customers? Do you want to learn the very latest in cloud technologies and apply them to some of the most interesting computing workloads in the world? If so, AWS is looking for you!

Amazon aims to be the most customer centric company on earth. Amazon Web Services (AWS) provides a highly reliable, scalable, low-cost infrastructure platform in the cloud that powers critical applications for hundreds of thousands of businesses in 190 countries around the world. At AWS, customer obsession is in our DNA. The successful candidate will get the opportunity to work with a wide array of AWS solution architects and specialists, as well as being brought in as the solutions expert to meet with customers and partners.

Candidates should be knowledgeable in traditional local- and wide-area network technologies, network overlay/virtualization technologies, and software defined network design patterns. Experience working with customers is required to demonstrate and explain solutions. Customer meetings may include customer roles across developers, IT professionals, managers, and executives. Previous AWS experience is preferred but not required. The ideal candidate is as comfortable white-boarding complex network architectures as implementing complex network configuration.

Amazon's Culture

Our positive and supportive culture encourages our people to do their best work every day. We have 14 leadership principles that help guide us in our every-day decision making process. We believe they are a clearer articulation of those things that have always been a part of what makes Amazon great – things that we must consciously hold on to in fulfilling our mission to be Earth’s Most Customer Centric Company. We are continuously looking for new ways to maintain a culture where our people excel and lead healthy and happy lives. Learn more about life at Amazon. It is always Day One.

Here are some other qualities we are looking for:

Be great fun to work with. At AWS, we have a credo of “Work hard. Have fun. Make history”. In this role, you will love what you do, and instinctively know how to make work fun, while maintaining a work-life balance. We look for leaders who are creative and who are willing to take on any challenge and make a big impact for their team, for our customers and for the company.

Enjoy developing technical talent to achieve great things. You will have a passion for educating, training, and enabling cloud computing experts for a diverse and challenging set of Enterprise customers.

Have a strong understanding of solutions innovation. The ideal candidate will have past experience working as a Solutions Architect, technical pre-sales, or a similar role and experience managing a team of a Solutions Architects. You will have an ability to grow your leadership skills as well as diving deep into various hands-on solutions while developing new skills, so you can make strong contributions in architecture transformation discussions.

How You’ll Grow At Amazon, our professional development plan focuses on helping people at every level of their career to identify and use their strengths to do their best work every day. From entry-level employees to senior leaders, we believe there’s always room to learn and develop your career. We offer opportunities to help sharpen your skills in addition to hands-on experience in the global, fast-changing business world. From on-the-job learning experiences to formal development programs, our professionals have a variety of opportunities to continue to grow throughout their career.

An advanced degree in computer science, MIS, engineering or related discipline
Practical experience with computer network security
Experience with large-scale, distributed applications
Experience in a customer-facing, sales-aligned role such as consultant, solutions engineer or solutions architect
Track record of implementing AWS services in a variety of business environments such as large enterprises and start-ups.
AWS Certification, eg. AWS Solutions Architect Associate
Understanding of application, server, and network security is highly desired.

As a Pre sales Solution Architect, you will partner with customers, BlueData Sales and several other teams to craft highly scalable, flexible and resilient Big Data / AI / ML architectures that address customer business problems and accelerate the adoption of BlueData services. In collaboration with sales, you will drive revenue growth across a broad set of customers. As a trusted customer advocate, the solutions architect will help organizations understand best practices around advanced big data / AI / ML solutions, and how to accelerate business outcomes either on-prem or in the cloud. You will have the opportunity to help shape and execute a strategy to build mindshare within enterprise customers. You must be self-motivated with a proven track record in software/technology sales or consulting. The ability to connect technology with measurable business value is critical to a solutions architect. You should also have a demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, products, and technical challenges.
You will ideally:
Have a passion for educating, training, designing, and building technical solutions for a diverse and challenging set of enterprise customers.

Author / contribute to technical community / customer-facing publications such as whitepapers, blogs, webinars, etc…
Build deep relationships with senior technical individuals within customers to become the leading trusted advisor in the analytics space
Act as a technical liaison between customers, service engineering teams and support

COMPANY DESCRIPTION
SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.
SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.
JOB DESCRIPTION OVERVIEW
The SAP Ariba Center of Excellence (COE) sets sales, customers and partners up for success. In that regard it drives Business Development, Solution Go to Market and Network Value Engineering (NVE) for all SAP Ariba solutions across the EMEA and MEE region. Since both SAP S/4HANA and SAP Ariba show an outstanding performance there is a huge demand to grow our Network Value Engineering team.
The Network Value Engineering teams provide strategic advisory in procurement and supply chain to support customer co-innovation, business transformation, and business process performance improvement programs. They lead client engagements to assess strategic goals, innovation scenarios, key opportunities for improvement, and other sources of additional economic value in the area of digital procurement, supply chain and performance management. They conduct strategic account planning sessions with clients, facilitate client workshops, and lead value-based engagements. They partner with field sales teams to identify revenue opportunities, create account strategies, and execute on sales leads. They develop strategies and develop scaled-up initiatives to increase SAP's leadership position in digital procurement.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES AND TASKS
The NVE Associate works with and for the Network Value Engineering team at SAP [Market Unit], helping them to engage with SAP Ariba Sales teams and customers. He / she will receive specific assignments from Network Value Engineers who will guide the Associate and supervise the work. The duties of the Associate include (but are not limited to) the assistance of workshops, preparing customer presentations, helps to create a value-based strategy for technology sale and deployment, tracking sales performance, assisting with the development of industry analysis and benchmarking reports, the development of NVE content for sales teams and research work for a SAP business subject or prospect / client.
PREFERRED COMPETENCIES AND SKILLS
Currently studying at Engineering or Business School, the candidate will follow an internship of 6 months;
Excellent presentation and communication skills;
Proficiency in English and at least one other European language (French, Dutch);
Analytics Capabilities/ Analysis of corporate reports (Strategy, balance sheet, P / L account);
Good understanding of digital transformation and innovation;
Experience working in a transformational business environment;
Innovative Thinking;
Team work & Collaboration experience, an open mind, result-oriented, integrity and humor;
Knowledge of IT processes, software and IT architecture (ERP, CRM, SCM, Analytics & Reporting);
Knowledge or experience of SAP products / services is a plus (but not necessary).
WHAT YOU GET FROM US
Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own. A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment – apply now.
SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT
To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.
SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team (Americas: Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com).
Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.

Stage - Chargé d'intégration de nouvelles sources de données-(H/F)
Société Générale2,262 avis - Fontenay-sous-Bois (94)

description:
Mission
Dans le cadre d’une volonté de promouvoir l’utilisation du BigData au sein de l’entité RESG/GTS/DWS, vous aurez pour mission de collaborer, au sein d’une équipe de 5 personnes, à l’intégration de nouvelles sources de données techniques dans le datalake du groupe SG, de transformer cette donnée en PySpark, en vue d’analyses croisées permettant l’amélioration de nos services.

Sous la responsabilité de votre maître de stage ou de votre tuteur, vous participerez aux missions suivantes :
Les données concernées pourront être des données de type « informations de tickets ouverts par les supports informatiques », « log d’infrastructures », « données de référentiels techniques » …
Elaborer, en lien avec les Data Engineer, les outils nécessaires à la collecte des données (récupération de l’historique des données ainsi que des données « fraîches », travail sur l’exhaustivité, la fréquence et la qualité des données, réflexion sur la modélisation)
Transformer les données avec le langage de programmation PySpark
Réaliser des analyses croisées avec plusieurs sources de données
Synthétiser les résultats des analyses de données pertinentes (extraire une connaissance décisionnelle facilement interprétable, en s’appuyant sur des techniques et des expertises de visualisation : nous utilisons Tableau Software), et les communiquer aux clients
Prenez votre place dans LA banque relationnelle, engagée pour ses clients et ses collaborateurs !
Tous nos postes sont ouverts aux personnes en situation de handicap.
Profil
Vous souhaitez effectuer un stage au sein de la Société Générale et vous êtes un étudiant de niveau Bac+5 en Université, Ecole de commerce, Ecole d’ingénieur, avec une spécialisation en développement, voir Data Science / Machine Learning.
Vous maîtrisez le pack-office et avez un niveau d’anglais courant.

Des connaissances en langages de programmation (PySpark, Python ou R en option) et surtout une maîtrise du langage SQL sont aussi requises.

Une connaissance de l’outil Tableau Software est un plus.

D’autres connaissances en technologies Big Data (Hadoop et/ou Spark) peuvent également être appréciées.

Et si c'était vous ?
Postulez dès maintenant !
Si votre candidature est sélectionnée, vous serez directement contacté par un opérationnel pour un entretien de motivation.
Durée du stage : 6 mois
Stage basé à : Fontenay sous bois
Gratification selon grilles SG.
Environnement
L’infrastructure informatique constitue un enjeu majeur pour la Banque et l’utilisation de la donnée est au cœur de la stratégie du Groupe Société Générale.
RESG/GTS est l’un des plus grands centres de service partagés pour les infrastructures informatiques dans le secteur financier en Europe. Il supporte aujourd’hui plus de 85% des infrastructures informatiques du Groupe en France et à l’international. Ces infrastructures informatiques regroupent les postes de travail (ordinateurs, téléphones, messageries...), les centres de calcul hébergeant les serveurs du Groupe et les réseaux informatiques et télécom.
Le stage se situe au sein du département RESG/GTS/DWS (Digital Workplace Services) qui a pour responsabilité d'assurer le bon fonctionnement des outils destinés aux collaborateurs du groupe (postes de travail, imprimantes, téléphones, pc portables, smartphones, tablettes, accès distants, etc.) et de tous les services techniques associés (messagerie, annuaires techniques, services de fichiers, bureautique, internet, sécurité, etc.).
Référence: 1900060T
Entité: Fonctions centrales groupes
Date de début: Immédiat
Date de publication: 03/10/2019

description:
Local Unit & Position Description
DNV GL Energy in France has been advising developers, owners, operators and financiers of renewable energy projects, specifically in onshore and offshore wind, solar, storage and electricity networks, to enhance our customers' projects, technology and operations.
DNV GL is now recruiting four (4) Renewable Energy Engineers with some prior knowledge in renewable electricity generation, transport, storage or use, specifically related to wind and solar systems.

The roles are based in Paris (75013) and focus on French and francophone markets. The successful applicants will work with the local team and colleagues around the globe to provide energy consulting services.

If you enjoy the diversity of an international team, a flat company hierarchy and independent working in a French/English environment, this role may be for you!


Team members provide technical advice to customers throughout the energy value chain. The responsibilities will be aligned with the applicant’s prior experience and work preferences and may include:

Follow market trends and define service offerings for customers in the energy domain, drawing from DNV GL's service portfolio
Analyse resource and performance data of wind and solar farms and gradually move these services onto digital platforms
Carry out conceptual engineering for energy projects such as storage and hybrid applications
Identify potential transactions, prepare offers and contribute to due diligence projects
Manage risks of projects and assets, e.g. in offshore wind developments or electricity networks
Position Qualifications
Bachelor or Master degree in an engineering field (Grandes Écoles or equivalent)
Experience of 1 to 3 years in renewable energy applications, preferably with some knowledge in wind energy
Fluent in French and English with an ability to write concise reports in both languages
Good team-working, presentation and customer relation skills
Company & Business Area Description
DNV GL is a global quality assurance and risk management company. Driven by our purpose of safeguarding life, property and the environment, we enable our customers to advance the safety and sustainability of their business.

We provide classification, technical assurance, software and independent expert advisory services to the maritime, oil & gas, power and renewables industries. We also provide certification, supply chain and data management services to customers across a wide range of industries.

Combining technical, digital and operational expertise, risk methodology and in-depth industry knowledge, we empower our customers’ decisions and actions with trust and confidence. We continuously invest in research and collaborative innovation to provide customers and society with operational and technological foresight.

With origins stretching back to 1864 and operations in more than 100 countries, our experts are dedicated to helping customers make the world safer, smarter and greener.

DNV GL delivers world-renowned testing and advisory services to the energy value chain including renewables and energy efficiency. Our expertise spans onshore and offshore wind power, solar, conventional generation, transmission and distribution, smart grids, and sustainable energy use, as well as energy markets and regulations. Our experts support customers around the globe in delivering a safe, reliable, efficient, and sustainable energy supply.
Equal Opportunity Statement
DNV GL is an Equal Opportunity Employer and gives consideration for employment to qualified applicants without regard to gender, religion, race, national or ethnic origin, cultural background, social group, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, age or political opinion. Diversity is fundamental to our culture and we invite you to be part of this diversity!

titre_poste: Specialist Solution Architect: Big Data & Data Warehousing
date_publication:

description:
The candidate will possess both technical and customer-facing skills that will allow them to be the technical support “face” of Amazon within a solution providers’ ecosystem/environment as well as directly to end customers. He or she will be able to facilitate relationships with senior personnel, as well as the technical background that enables him or her to easily interact and give guidance to software developers, IT pros, and system architects. The ideal candidate will also have a demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges
The right person will be highly technical and analytical, possess significant experience of software development and/or IT and networking implementation/consulting experience
Strong verbal and written communications skills are a must, as well as the ability to work effectively across internal and external organisations and virtual teams
Executive speaking and presentation skills – Formal presentations, white-boarding, large and small group presentations
Possessing 5 or more years of data management expertise, spanning ETL processes, master data management or data management platforms experience, and integration in complex environments
Highly technical and analytical, possessing 10 or more years of analytics platform implementation or operations experience
Knowledge of the underlying infrastructure requirements such as networking, storage, and hardware optimisation
Implementation and tuning experience of data warehousing platforms, including knowledge of data warehouse schema design, query tuning and optimisation, and data migration and integration. Experience of requirements for the analytics presentation layer including dashboards, reporting, and OLAP
BS level technical degree required; computer science or maths background preferred

Are you a data lake and data warehousing specialist? Do you have experience of data ingestion, storage, processing and visualization? Do you like to solve the most complex and large-scale data challenges in the world today? Do you want to have an impact in the development and use of new data analytics technologies? Would you like a career that gives you opportunities to help customers and partners use cloud computing to build new solutions, faster, and at lower cost? Do you like to gain the deepest customer and partner insights using cloud computing technologies? Come join us!

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is looking for highly talented hands-on technical experts to collaborate with our customers and partners on key engagements in the data and analytics space. This is an excellent opportunity to join Amazon’s world class technical teams, working with some of the best and brightest engineers while also developing your skills and furthering your career within one of the most innovative and progressive technology companies. These engagements will focus on AWS Services for analytics in regard to data lake solutions on the AWS cloud, and on helping our customers and partners build innovative solutions and businesses that focus on leveraging the value of data. You will work on the complete set of technologies used in a data lake lifecycle: data integration, data storage, metadata management, data lineage and tiering, entitlements, master data management, data movement, data processing, and data visualization.

As a Data Lake Specialist Solutions Architect (SA), you will be the Subject Matter Expert (SME) for helping customers select the technologies that will support their business requirements, and successfully deploy analytics platforms on the AWS cloud. As part of the Data and Analytics Specialist Solutions Architecture team, you will work closely with the other Specialist SAs on Big Data, Databases, Analytics and Artificial Intelligence, as well as the Business Development teams, to enable large-scale customer use cases and drive the adoption of AWS for their data processing platforms. You will interact with other SAs in the field, providing guidance on their customer engagements, and developing white papers, blogs, reference implementations, and presentations to enable customers and 3rd parties to fully leverage the AWS platform. You will also create field enablement materials for the broader SA population, to help them understand how to integrate AWS solutions into customer architectures.

Candidates must have great communication skills and be very technical, with the ability to impress AWS customers at any level, from executive to developer. Previous experience with AWS is desired but not required, provided you have experience building large-scale solutions. You will get the opportunity to work directly with senior engineers at customers, partners and AWS service teams, influencing their roadmaps and driving innovation.

If you are someone who enjoys innovating, likes solving hard problems and working on the cutting edge of technology, we would love to have you on the team.
Roles and responsibilities
Design Customer Solutions: Collaborate with AWS field account teams, training and support teams to help partners and customers learn and use AWS services such as Elastic Map Reduce (EMR), Redshift, Kinesis, Amazon Machine Learning, AWS Lambda, Data Pipeline, S3, DynamoDB, and the Relational Database Service (RDS)
Devise Strategy: Engage with solution architects, account managers, professional services and partners to define an analytics engagement strategy for AWS operational territories and key accounts.
Thought Leadership: Provide global thought leadership on analytics solutions that benefit customers through the use of AWS Services. This takes the form of contribution to external publications such as the AWS Big Data Blog, whitepapers and reference architectures, as well as internal training of solution architects, professional services consultants, technical account managers, and AWS trainers
Serve as a key member of the business development and account management team in helping to ensure customer success in building and migrating applications, software and services on the AWS platform.
Assist solution providers with the definition and implementation of technical and business strategies.
Capture and share best-practice knowledge amongst the worldwide AWS solution architect community.
Understand AWS market segments, and industry verticals.
Understand and exploit the use of internal business support systems.

Understanding of application, server, and network security is highly desired
Experience working within the software development or internet industries is highly desired
Master's degree in computer science or engineering or similar field
Hands on experience leading large-scale global data warehousing and analytics projects.
Demonstrated industry leadership in the fields of database, data warehousing or data sciences
Real time streaming technologies and time series with tools such as Spark, Flink, Samza etc.
Hadoop big Ddata knowledge – Hive metastore; storage partitioning schemes on S3 and HDFS
ETL – understanding and custom coding
NoSQL understanding and use case application – Cassandra, HBase, DynamoDB
Understanding and use cases application of columnar data stores
Caching and queueing technologies – Kafka/Kinesis, Rabbitmq/SQS, Redis/Memcache etc.
RDBMS skills – SQL, optimization techniques, etc.
Scripting/Programming skills – Python, Java, Scala, Go
Excellent understanding of operating systems including troubleshooting
Data warehousing knowledge
Security at rest and in transit

description:
We are looking for Software Engineers to work on our Advertising Platform, reaching 1,4b users per month.

Our engineering team brings together 120+ talented individuals on 3 main locations (Paris, Montpellier and Bucharest). We are organized in agile and autonomous features team and we also share technical knowledge within several community of practices.

Our main engineering challenges:
We work in a very high traffic environment with low latencies constraints
Web and mobile complexity, we are trying to offer a similar user experience on a wide range of contexts (device, OS, browser, etc.)
An infinite source of Machine Learning use cases, ranging from ad performance prediction to ad delivery pacing and forecasting
Large datasets that we need to compute in near real time (auction resolution) and even greater volumes for analytics use cases
We operate globally and constantly think about new products to build the future of the media
Check our Engineering blog ( https://medium.com/teads-engineering ) and our Technical Stack ( https://stackshare.io/teads/teads )

As a Software Engineer, your missions will be:
Collaborate with a variety of teams to develop services from design to production.
Make sure the software is in good hands by writing, running and automating tests (unit, functional, load ...)
Implements end-to-end features and components created in response to user stories.
Stay up-to-date on new technologies and architectures, and share it with the team. Eventually you will propose ways to implement them into our current software engineering process.
Your skills and experiences:
Good programming abilities. Testing your development is a second nature to you, and you are very mindful about your application architecture, performance and maintainability and its overall quality.
An appetite for backend development
Strong problem solving skills
Working collaboratively with the team, able to explain your decision and share your knowledge
Bonus points:
Large-scale distributed systems, service oriented architecture
Experience in caching system (in memory, distributed)
Knowledge of the JVM (GC, Concurrency...)
Experience in high performance and/or low latency system
Messaging middleware (Kafka, RabbitMQ...)
MySQL and NoSQL datastores
If you want to learn Scala at scale and solve high scalability problems, join us!

We provide competitive benefits and in house training.

About Teads

Teads is The Global Media Platform. We have united and empowered the best publishers in the world and distribute ads to over 1.5 billion people every month within professionally-produced content.

Through its end-to-end platform, Teads provides demand-side, sell-side and creative technology to deliver better media effectiveness for brands, better monetisation solutions for publishers, and better experiences for consumers.

Teads partners with the leading marketers, agencies and publishers through a team of 800+ people in 26 countries

We're committed to creating a dynamic work environment that values diversity and inclusion, and represents employees across a variety of skill sets. We embrace contributions from all ages, sexes, races, ethnicities, religions, sexual orientations and gender identities.

#LI-MB1

description:
Based in Paris, as part of the support team and in close collaboration with the engineering team, you ensure the support levels 1,2,3 on the Tibco EBX software by offering answers to the customers and partners requests and questions.
Your role encompasses the whole software lifecycle, from the analysis of the customers’ requests/issues, to the reproduction and implementation of the corrective fixes and new features.
What You'll Do
The job holder will be expected to perform the following:-
Reporting defects: You need to identify and to reproduce defects, evaluate their criticality, then ensure that a correction is implemented in a timeframe that matches the customers SLAs.
Requesting new product enhancements: you evaluate the enhancement request, its relevance and priority regarding the product Tibco EBX and the customer’s satisfaction.
Then you communicate with the engineering team in order to plan the delivery of a new version including the new feature.

You will be working with customers from all over the world, so your working language will be English.

Java JEE, Java Servlet containers
Good proficiency in English (oral and written)

meta1:
Ingénieur intégration logicielle (H/F)
Parrot Faurecia Automotive - Paris (75)
date_publication:
il y a 7 mois
- Continuer pour postuler
Signaler cette offre d'emploi
description:
Vous souhaitez intégrer une entreprise française, innovante et agile ?

Rejoignez Faurecia Clarion Electronics, alliant un esprit start-up à un équipementier automobile de 1er rang, pour développer le cockpit du futur !

L’activité automobile de Parrot a été racheté à 100% par Faurecia en 2018 et a donné naissance à Faurecia Clarion Electronics Europe : 4ème Business Group de Faurecia.

Au cœur de Paris, nos équipes conçoivent des technologies innovantes en développant des interfaces homme-machine sous Android auto pour offrir au client final une expérience connectique intuitive.
Nos solutions électroniques embarquées sont dotées de processeurs graphiques multi-cœur puissants afin de répondre plus rapidement à diverses instructions simultanées.

Relevez avec nous l'un des plus grands challenges de l'industrie automobile !

Nous recherchons un Ingénieur intégration logicielle (H/F)

CONTEXTE

Au sein de l'équipe projet et en collaboration avec le responsable intégration, vous serez en charge de l'intégration logicielle.
Le poste couvre l'intégration d'une plateforme Android (Java, C/C++) et de composants logiciels en C/C++.
En mode Agile, vous serez en relation quotidienne avec les équipes responsables de ces composants afin de suivre les développements et anticiper les changements.

MISSIONS

Vous serez responsable du suivi et de l'intégration des évolutions des différents composants logiciels dans le contexte du développement d'un programme client :
Plateforme Android
Equipe OS
Bus vehicule (gateway CAN, LIN, ethernet)
Tuner
Développements de l'équipe client (applications Android, VHAL, cluster)

Vous serez en charge des tests d'intégration via l'automatisation de tests et de la génération des versions logicielles et des rapports associés.

Vos missions seront les suivantes :
Intégrer et configurer des composants logiciels issus des équipes plateformes
Suivre le développement plateforme et anticiper l'intégration (e.g., nightly build, tests en amont, …)
Préparer les changements au niveau projet, nécessaires pour l'intégration
Spécifier et développer des tests d'intégration
Automatiser l'exécution des tests
Générer des versions logicielles incluant les rapports de tests

PROFIL

Vous êtes diplômé d'une école d'ingénieur ou d'un cycle universitaire et disposez de 2 ans d'expérience minimum en intégration logicielle.

Vous avez les compétences techniques suivantes :
GIT et GERRIT,
repo,
Java,
C/C++,
Linux,
Scripting (python, bash),
Jenkins,
Docker

Dans l'idéal vous avez des connaissances en ASpice, Groovy.

Vous êtes autonome, rigoureux et êtes à l'aise avec le reporting.

Vous avez un bon niveau d'anglais, notamment technique.

EN - Would you like to be part of a French company known for its innovation and agility?

Join Faurecia Clarion Electronics, combining a start-up spirit with a first-class automotive equipment manufacturer, to develop the cockpit of the future!
Parrot's automotive business was acquired 100% by Faurecia in 2018 and gave rise to Faurecia Clarion Electronics Europe, Faurecia's 4th Business Group.

In the heart of Paris, our teams design innovative technologies by developing man-machine interfaces under Android auto to offer the end customer an intuitive connectivity experience.
Our embedded electronics solutions are equipped with powerful multi-core graphics processors to respond more quickly to various simultaneous instructions.

Take up with us one of the greatest challenges in the automotive industry!

We are looking for a Software Integration Engineer (M/F)

CONTEXT

Within the project team and in collaboration with the integration manager, you will be in charge of software integration.
The position covers the integration of an Android platform (Java, C/C++) and software components in C/C++.
In Agile mode, you will be in daily contact with the teams responsible for these components in order to monitor developments and anticipate changes.

MISSIONS

You will be responsible for monitoring and integrating the evolutions of the various software components in the context of the development of a customer program:

Android platform
OS Team
Vehicle bus (CAN, LIN, Ethernet gateway)
Tuner
Developments of the customer team (Android, VHAL, cluster applications)

You will be in charge of integration testing through test automation and the generation of software versions and associated reports.

Your missions will be as follows:

Integrate and configure software components from platform teams
Monitor platform development and anticipate integration (e.g., nightly build, upstream tests, etc.)
Prepare the changes at the project level necessary for integration
Specify and develop integration tests
Automate test execution
Generate software versions including test reports

PROFILE

You are a graduate of an engineering school or university and have a minimum of 2 years of experience in software integration.

You have the following technical skills:
GIT and GERRIT,
repo,
Java,
C/C+++,
Linux,
Scripting (python, bash),
Jenkins,
Docker

Ideally you have knowledge of ASpice, Groovy.

You are autonomous, rigorous and comfortable with reporting.

You have a good level of English, especially technical English.

description:
Vous souhaitez intégrer une entreprise française, innovante et agile ?

Rejoignez Faurecia Clarion Electronics, alliant un esprit start-up à un équipementier automobile de 1er rang, pour développer le cockpit du futur !

L’activité automobile de Parrot a été racheté à 100% par Faurecia en 2018 et a donné naissance à Faurecia Clarion Electronics Europe : 4ème Business Group de Faurecia.

Au cœur de Paris, nos équipes conçoivent des technologies innovantes en développant des interfaces homme-machine sous Android auto pour offrir au client final une expérience connectique intuitive.
Nos solutions électroniques embarquées sont dotées de processeurs graphiques multi-cœur puissants afin de répondre plus rapidement à diverses instructions simultanées.

Relevez avec nous l'un des plus grands challenges de l'industrie automobile !

Nous recherchons un Ingénieur Safety (H/F)

CONTEXTE

Vous intégrerez une équipe projet qui a pour objectif de développer un système embarqué de type Infotainment, pour un client constructeur automobile international.

MISSIONS

Vous contriburez à l'élaboration des exigences safety et à leur allocation (incluant leur traçabilité) et participerez à la définition de l'architecture system et formaliser les safety concept.

Vous réaliserez les analyses safety system (FMEA, FTA, analyses d'impact, calcul de Fiabilité) et participerez au développement de façon proactive en accompagnant les différents métiers (électronique, logiciel, système, qualité…) pour la mise en place des activités Safety conformément à la norme ISO26262 et au processus de développement produit.

Vous participerez à l'élaboration des documents Safety de conception au niveau Système et composants (Functional Safety Concept, Technical Safety Concept) et gérerez les aspects Safety avec les clients externes.

Vous coordonnerez la réalisation des documentations conformément à la norme ISO26262, ainsi que les revues Safety, validation des exigences fonctionnelles et audits.Vous participerez à l'amélioration des référentiels et processus de développement conformément à la norme ISO26262.

PROFIL

Vous êtes titulaire d'un diplôme d'Ingénieur ou d'une formation universitaire équivalente (BAC+5) et justifiez d'une expérience de 3 ans dans le domaine de la Sureté de fonctionnement SDF idéalement dans le secteur de l'industrie automobile.

Vous avez une très bonne connaissance de la Méthode Sureté de fonctionnement SDF selon la norme ISO26262 : arbres de défaillances, analyses de risque, AMDEC.

Vous êtes force de proposition, autonome et faites preuve de rigueur. Vous appréciez le travail en équipe et vous avez un bon relationnel et une capacité d'analyse et de synthèse éprouvées.

Un anglais courant pour ce poste est nécessaire.

EN - Would you like to be part of a French company known for its innovation and agility?

Join Faurecia Clarion Electronics, combining a start-up spirit with a first-class automotive equipment manufacturer, to develop the cockpit of the future!
Parrot's automotive business was acquired 100% by Faurecia in 2018 and gave rise to Faurecia Clarion Electronics Europe, Faurecia's 4th Business Group.

In the heart of Paris, our teams design innovative technologies by developing man-machine interfaces under Android auto to offer the end customer an intuitive connectivity experience.
Our embedded electronics solutions are equipped with powerful multi-core graphics processors to respond more quickly to various simultaneous instructions.

Take up with us one of the greatest challenges in the automotive industry!

We are looking for a Safety Engineer (M/F)

CONTEXT

You will join a project team whose objective is to develop an embedded Infotainment system for an international automotive manufacturer customer.

MISSIONS

You will contribute to the development of safety requirements and their allocation (including their traceability) and will participate in the definition of the architecture system and formalize the safety concept.

You will carry out safety system analyses (FMEA, FTA, impact analyses, reliability calculation) and participate in the development in a proactive way by supporting the various business lines (electronics, software, system, quality...) for the implementation of Safety activities in accordance with the ISO26262 standard and the product development process.

You will develop design Safety documents at System and component level (Functional Safety Concept, Technical Safety Concept) and manage Safety aspects with external customers.

You will coordinate the production of documentation in accordance with ISO2626262, as well as Safety reviews, validation of functional requirements and audits, and participate in the improvement of standards and development processes in accordance with ISO26262.

PROFILE

You have an engineering degree or equivalent university education (BAC+5) and 5 years' experience in the field of SDF operational safety, ideally in the automotive industry.

You have a very good knowledge of the SDF Operating Safety Method according to ISO26262, the practice of Operating Safety tools such as fault trees, risk analyses, FMECA and technical skills in electronic development (System, hardware and software).

Knowledge in Development Quality Method (APQP, Quality chain and cascade of critical characteristics, traceability,...), practice of Design for 6 Sigma tools, Design to Quality for robustness in design, technical skills in mechanical development would be desirable.

You are a force of proposal, autonomous and rigorous. You appreciate teamwork and have a good interpersonal skills and a proven ability to analyse and synthesise.

A fluent English for this position is required.

Research Scientist - Safety of Programs and Software Systems - Uber Elevate, Paris
Uber1,763 avis - Paris 3e (75)
titre_poste: Research Scientist - Safety of Programs and Software Systems - Uber Elevate, Paris
date_publication:
il y a 7 mois
- Continuer pour postuler
Signaler cette offre d'emploi
description:
About Uber Elevate

Uber Elevate is working toward transforming the world through aerial ridesharing at scale:
on-demand aviation has the potential to radically improve urban mobility, giving people back time lost in their daily commutes. Just as skyscrapers allowed cities to use limited land more efficiently, urban air transportation will use three-dimensional airspace to alleviate transportation congestion on the ground. A network of small, electric aircraft that take off and land vertically (called VTOL aircraft for Vertical Take-off and Landing, and pronounced vee-tol), will enable rapid, reliable transportation between suburbs and cities and, ultimately, within cities. Planned for 2023, UberAir will allow riders to tap a button and get a flight in three partner cities including Dallas and Los Angeles.

About the Role

Uber Elevate's Advanced Technologies Center (ATCP) is focused on advancing the state of knowledge in digital sciences, and developing advanced technologies that can help make cities smarter, better, and more efficient places to live and work. Based in Paris, France, The center brings together scientists and engineers working on many exciting topics that impact Elevate's vision of future air transport, including artificial intelligence (e.g. machine learning and optimization), airspace management, sensing & perception, autonomous control, energy management and communication networks.

ATCP scientists and engineers have the opportunity to directly impact the development of innovative transportation in cities, with a huge positive effect on people's lives. Research is conducted in an open environment, with results published in scientific journals and conferences, open-source software platforms, and collaborations with the best universities and researchers worldwide. The center started in 2019 and the team is growing fast, allowing each member to participate in shaping this exciting adventure.
We are looking for experienced researchers who are willing to both advance the state of the art in their scientific domain of expertise, and assist in the development of advanced technologies to build transportation systems of the future. Research scientists are expected to conduct frontier research, collaborate with the best research partners worldwide, advise junior researchers and students. They draw inspiration from the practical issues of urban air transportation and autonomous aircraft systems, and advise on the related technology developments.
What you'll do

Perform state-of-the-art research: Design and establish the viability of new concepts for the validation of both embedded and large, distributed software systems
In collaboration with the engineering support team at ATCP, supervise the implementation of test cases using real-life data and propose appropriate designs for verified software systems in the field of urban aviation.
Establish the ATCP team on safety and verification as a key player by developing collaborations, hiring and advising researchers and students.
Collaborate cross-functionally with research and engineering teams at Uber and communicate your work to colleagues and management
Submit publications or patents, to top software systems and verification journals and conferences

What You’ll Need

Minimum 6 years of experience with research in the safety of programs and software systems, and/or software verification.

Please provide the following information in your application
Your CV
A short research statement describing the problems you would like to address, and how you envision your research being applicable to Uber Elevate and the future of urban aviation
A full list of your scientific publications
A list of references that we may contact freely to learn about your research

Competencies (tbc)

Coding (REQUIRED) : The candidate will develop proof-of-concept and prototype code to establish the relevance and performance of their ideas. Support from ATCP engineers will allow this code to leverage research platforms and data access mechanisms so that the candidate can focus on their particular algorithms.
Collaboration (REQUIRED) : Important competence since research is performed in a network: externally, in order to develop and maintain an up to date knowledge of the field; internally to ATCP in order to pursue group projects, and advise early-stage researchers; and with the Elevate teams in California to discuss future technological roadmaps.
Execution and Results (REQUIRED) : regular publication of research results is expected.

Data Engineer
Dashlane - Paris (75)
date_publication:
il y a 7 mois

Signaler cette offre d'emploi
description:
Dashlane is a password manager and online security app for everyone who lives, works, and plays on the internet. With a simple, intuitive design and patented security technology, Dashlane keeps passwords, personal data, and payment info at users' fingertips, so they can stop guessing passwords and wasting time filling out forms. Dashlane has helped over 11 million users in 180 countries manage and secure their digital identities and has enabled over $17 billion in e-commerce transactions. Our team in New York and Paris is united by our passion for password security and the belief that our success is built on the diverse backgrounds of every member.

You will be based in Paris.

Dashlane is looking for a highly talented data engineer to join the Data team. Optimizing our data pipelines and data warehouses will be an essential part to helping our company scale in the coming years. You have several years of experience and a proven track record in building, deploying and keeping such applications up 24x7. You will work on a daily basis with your teammates in New York City.

At Dashlane you will:
Work on the development and maintenance of messaging services, BI tools, data warehouses
Implement custom ETL/ELT processes in distributed computing environments
Work on improving in-house tracking systems for all of our applications
Design and implement data pipelines capable of modeling data from many sources and store it in such a way that users can self-serve
Work on server applications and APIs that are used by our Data Team
Handle the challenges that come with managing terabytes of data
Develop automated reporting for API and system health (process, memory, response time)
We're looking for:
Having experience in architecting, implementing and testing data processing pipelines (e.g. Spark, Beam, ...) and data mining / data science algorithms either on-premise or on a cloud environment
Being used to developing and maintaining data ingestion processes, to keep applications in sync with partners
Having experience in administrating and ingesting data into standard data warehouses (e.g. Amazon Redshift, Microsoft SQL Server, Google BigQuery or Snowflake)
Being used to designing SQL tables, choosing indexes, tuning queries and understanding the intricacies required to optimize a table in different environments
Having strong experience in improving performance of queries, data jobs and scaling systems for exponential growth in data
Having experience with data lakes and expertise with designing and maintaining a BI solution
Have several years experience in software development
Being able to communicate and understand complex technical issues in English
Nice-To-Haves:
Have prior knowledge of Python and Node.js
Enjoy writing clean code that is easy to maintain and understand
Have a security background
Diversity at Dashlane:
A true international company, founded in Paris and currently split between Paris, New York, and Lisbon, we thrive off diverse perspectives. We recognize that diversity has different aspects: gender, sexual orientation, ability, ethnic origin, social background, age, lifestyle, and more. We're committed to hiring people that create a diverse community and foster a culture where everyone is heard and feels a sense of belonging.

description:
Senior Data Software Data Engineer (F/H) (19000313)
PRIMARY LOCATION : FRANCE-75-PARIS-PARIS
ORGANIZATION : AXA Global Re
CONTRACT TYPE : Regular
SHIFT : Day Job
SCHEDULE : Full-time
DESCRIPTION
Mission
AXA Global Parametrics is looking for a senior data software engineer who will lead the data developments in the team to achieve business requirements for the next couple of years. Those business requirements include index-based insurance products standardization as well as building the new vision of AXA Global Parametrics in terms of loss-based insurance, including image-based loss assessment and new services.

Main roles and responsibilities
In collaboration with the rest of the team, and particularly the engineering manager, the product owners, and the head of tech & data, the senior data software engineer will:
1. Contribute actively to the definition of AGP “Tech & Data” Strategy
Participate to business products discussion and bring vision, particularly according to data topics
Choice of technological stacks (mainly cloud but not only)
Architecture design
Participate to recruitment phases (whether internal or external workforce)
Give feedback about product/features prioritization and staffing

2. Build high quality products
Following an agile working methodology (frameworks, sprints, rituals, roles, …)
Following engineering good practices (clean code, pair coding, code reviews, test first, continuous integration and continuous delivery, tres amigos, …)
Ensuring products compliance with group security and regulatory guidelines
Helping colleagues and external workforce follow those same quality requirements

3. Ensure BAU & maintenance while products are live
Participate to platform upgrades
Switch into corrective and evolutionary maintenance when needed
Help Build components monitoring for an effective quality of service
In terms of components, the senior data software engineering will have to cover all the value chain, for both index-based and loss-based parametric insurance covers:
Data sourcing
Data storage, preparation and lineage
Data transformation pipelines and pricing tools (mainly R, Python)
Back-end (SQL and NoSQL databases, application exposure through data service layers toward external and internal world)
Front-ends (for AGP team, brokers, customers, …)
Other Internal IT solutions (customers, contracts, claims, policy management, …)

QUALIFICATIONS
Education:
Computer Science (engineering school, master, PhD) with excellent programming skills and a good understanding of data science and statistics + image analysis

Language:
Conversational level in English required
Fluency in French desired

Required skills:
Strong experience as a data software engineer
An experience as a computer vision engineer is a +
An experience in a Big Data Environment is a +
Good knowledge of main cloud providers (AWS, MS, …)
Good knowledge of main data, back, and front-end frameworks : JS, Java/C#, NodeJs, Python/Dash, R/Shiny, Tensorflow, PyTorch, SQL and NoSQL DB, numpy, scikit-learn, gensim, nltk, …
Good knowledge and usage of CI/CD and Docker technologies
Strong autonomy and ability to work in a fast-changing world
Rigorous in the delivery
Team spirit

ABOUT AXA
Would you like to wake up every day driven and inspired by our noble mission and to work together as one global team to empower people to live a better life? Here at AXA we strive to lead the transformation of our industry. We are looking for talented individuals who come from varied backgrounds, think differently and want to be part of this exciting transformation by challenging the status quo so we can push AXA - a leading global brand and one of the most innovative companies in our industry - onto even greater things.
In a fast-evolving world and with a presence in 64 countries, our 165,000 employees and exclusive distributors anticipate change to offer services and solutions tailored to the current and future needs of our 107 million customers

AXA, as one of the world leaders in financial protection, supports and advises its customers in three major business lines: Property & Casualty Insurance, Life & Savings, and Asset Management. Since 2014, AXA’s parametric insurance team has developed market-leading products to insure against climate risks. Clients range from individuals and corporations to governments and public institutions; they come from various weather-sensitive sectors across the world including agriculture, renewable energy, construction, transportation, leisure, and textiles.

Data scientists, meteorologists, business developers, underwriters and IT make up the parametric insurance team. Working closely together, they create innovative insurance products that meet clients’ needs.
WHAT WE OFFER
If you want to join a dynamic and challenging environment, do not hesitate to apply !

meta1:
Implementation Manager - France
Dataiku - Paris (75)
date_publication:
il y a 7 mois

Signaler cette offre d'emploi
description:
Dataiku’s mission is big: to enable all people throughout companies around the world to use data by removing friction surrounding data access, cleaning, modeling, deployment, and more. But it’s not just about technology and processes; at Dataiku, we also believe that people (including our people!) are a critical piece of the equation.

Dataiku is looking for an Implementation Manager to join the team. The ideal candidate is an energetic individual who is passionate about deploying big data technologies and using data science to solve business problems, and who will efficiently help customers drive their projects to get the most out of Dataiku DSS.

As a part of the Data Science team, the Implementation Manager is responsible for driving smooth client implementations of our product.

As an Implementation Manager, you:
Effectively project-manage the delivery to our clients of Dataiku’s suite of professional services: such services include assisted software installation, customer training/coaching, and co-development of data science projects with our customers
Maintain consistent and concise internal communication across multiple teams
Build and maintain relationships with key partners, both within Dataiku and among our customers
Ensure customer satisfaction throughout the implementation process
Contribute to the standardization of our implementation processes while Dataiku continues our rapid growth The goal is to set up our customers for success using Dataiku DSS from day one. Your skilled coordination of their deployment, training, and adoption of best practices will position them to derive the maximum value from the software, contributing to their data-driven operational success.

REQUIREMENTS
2 years + of experience in advanced analytics or data science projects
Demonstrated implementation management skills including: leadership, communication, customer management
Experience providing customer training is a plus
An interest in staying up to date on the latest techniques (Python, R, Scala, Hadoop, Spark, H2O, SQL…)
Experience in enterprise data projects and familiarity with advanced analytics technologies is a plus
Ability to explain data science concepts.
You must be technically-minded, but you don’t have to be an engineer to do well here
Organized, process-oriented, and resourceful
Bachelor’s degree required
PMP certification or similar training is a plus
BENEFITS
Opportunity to join Dataiku early on and help scale the company
Competitive compensation package, equity, health benefits, and paid vacation
Opportunity to work with a smart, passionate and driven team
Dataiku has a strong culture based on key values: Ownership, Passion, Autonomy and Friendliness

Dataiku processes your data for recruitment purposes only. We store these data in our Applicant Tracking System, Workable which is fully compliant with EU data protection laws, and we will not share it with anyone else. You will find information about our compliance with GDPR on our website.


To fulfill its mission, Dataiku is growing fast (having just closed a $101 million Series C round in December 2018 and looking to double in 2019), but still maintains a startup spirit. Dataiku serves its global customer base from its headquarters in New York City as well as offices in Paris, London, Munich, Singapore, and Sydney. Each of our offices has a unique culture, but underpinning local nuances, we always value curiosity, collaboration, and can-do attitudes.

Nous recherchons un(e) Ingénieur(e) en développement logiciel embarqué (H/F) pour rejoindre l'équipe Digital Tuner qui est en charge du développement des solutions de réception de télévision numérique et de radio de Parrot Faurecia Automotive.

MISSIONS

Vos missions seront de :
Développer et maintenir le logiciel embarqué de décodage canal pour les différentes normes de réception de radio et de télévision numérique de Parrot Faurecia Automotive
Assurer le support auprès de l'équipe driver pour l'implémentation de ces normes
Participer à l'élaboration de scénarios de tests fonctionnels en relation avec l'équipe validation

Vous aurez pour responsabilités :
Le respect des normes de transmission par le récepteur Parrot Faurecia Automotive
Le reporting au responsable et aux développeurs de l'équipe Digital Tuner

PROFIL

Vous êtes titulaire d'un diplôme d'Ingénieur ou d'un Master à dominante logicielle et justifiez d'une expérience professionnelle d'au moins 2 ans.

Vous maîtrisez le langage C, avez une bonne expérience en développement sur systèmes embarqués et connaissez les normes de réception radio et/ou TV.

Vous faites preuve de rigueur, d'autonomie et d'esprit d'analyse.
Vous communiquez facilement et aimez le travail en équipe.
Vous parlez anglais couramment.

EN - Would you like to be part of a French company known for its innovation and agility?

Join Faurecia Clarion Electronics, combining a start-up spirit with a first-class automotive equipment manufacturer, to develop the cockpit of the future!
Parrot's automotive business was acquired 100% by Faurecia in 2018 and gave rise to Faurecia Clarion Electronics Europe, Faurecia's 4th Business Group.

In the heart of Paris, our teams design innovative technologies by developing man-machine interfaces under Android auto to offer the end customer an intuitive connectivity experience.
Our embedded electronics solutions are equipped with powerful multi-core graphics processors to respond more quickly to various simultaneous instructions.

Take up with us one of the greatest challenges in the automotive industry!

We are looking for an Embedded software engineer (M/F)

CONTEXT

We are looking for an Embedded Software Development Engineer (M/F) to join the Digital Tuner team, which is in charge of the development of Parrot Faurecia Automotive's digital television and radio reception solutions.

MISSIONS

Your missions will be:
Develop and maintain the on-board decoding software for Parrot Faurecia Automotive's various radio and digital television reception standards
Provide support to the driver team for the implementation of these standards
Participate in the development of functional test scenarios related to the validation team

You will have responsibilities:
Compliance with transmission standards by the Parrot Faurecia Automotive receiver
Reporting to the manager and developers of the Digital Tuner team

PROFILE

You have a degree in Engineering or a Master in software and justify a professional experience of at least 2 years.

You are fluent in C language, have a good experience in development on embedded systems and know the standards of radio reception and / or TV.

You demonstrate rigor, autonomy and analytical skills.
You communicate easily and enjoy teamwork.
You speak English fluently.

Nous recherchons un Technicien Mesures essais et prototypage (H/F)

CONTEXTE

Le Service d'ingénierie mécanique recherche un technicien de laboratoire afin de réaliser les mesures, essais et prototypages des produits en cours de développement. Sous la responsabilité d'un ingénieur, il réalise des tests, des mesures, et des analyses pour valider les exigences produits dans le respect du programme d'essais et des procédures internes.

MISSIONS

Vous serez responsable des équipements du laboratoire, de leur maintenance, et de leur étalonnage/calibration périodique.
L'objectif est de dérouler les plans de test dans le respect des délais impartis et selon les protocoles établis et de consigner les résultats dans les outils internes et rédiger les rapports d'essai.

Vos missions seront les suivantes :

Contrôle dimensionnel des échantillons (scanner 3D GOM)
Préparation des échantillons à tester (instrumentation)
Réalisation des essais mécaniques, optiques, acoustiques, thermiques, afin de vérifier la satisfaction des exigences client et la robustesse du produit
Rédaction en anglais des rapports d'essai
Analyse des non-conformités et recherche de solutions d'améliorations
Analyse des causes de défaillance des produits en retour client
Assemblage de prototypes et moyens d'essais
Aide à la conception de bancs, supports, et moyens d'essai sur logiciel CAO (Solidworks)
Réalisation de divers travaux manuels de correction des problèmes sur les prototypes (perçage, usinage, peinture, etc…)

Vous serez responsable de l'organisation, de la propreté, et du rangement du laboratoire mécanique.

PROFIL

Vous avez une formation Bac Pro Microtechnique ou BAC STI2D.
Une première expérience dans ce secteur est appréciée mais pas indispensable.

Vous êtes adroit et avez des compétences en métrologie et en CAO.
Vous êtes rigoureux, précis, autonome, méthodique et avez un esprit d'analyse.

EN - Would you like to be part of a French company known for its innovation and agility?

Join Faurecia Clarion Electronics, combining a start-up spirit with a first-class automotive equipment manufacturer, to develop the cockpit of the future!

In the heart of Paris, our teams design innovative technologies by developing man-machine interfaces under Android auto to offer the end customer an intuitive connectivity experience.

We are looking for a Test measurement and prototyping technician (M/F)

CONTEXT

The Mechanical Engineering Department is looking for a laboratory technician to carry out measurements, tests and prototyping of products under development. Under the responsibility of an engineer, he performs tests, measurements and analyses to validate product requirements in compliance with the test program and internal procedures.

MISSIONS

You will be responsible for the laboratory equipment, its maintenance, and its periodic calibration/calibration.
The objective is to conduct the test plans on time and according to established protocols and to record the results in internal tools and write test reports.

Your missions will be as follows:

Dimensional inspection of samples (3D GOM scanner)
Preparation of the samples to be tested (instrumentation)
Carrying out mechanical, optical, acoustic, thermal and acoustic tests to verify the satisfaction of customer requirements and the robustness of the product
Writing test reports in English
Analysis of non-conformities and search for improvement solutions
Analysis of the causes of product failure in customer feedback
Assembly of prototypes and test means
Assistance in the design of benches, supports, and test equipment on CAD software (Solidworks)
Performing various manual tasks to correct problems on prototypes (drilling, machining, painting, etc...)

You will be responsible for the organization, cleanliness, and storage of the mechanical laboratory.

PROFILE

You have a DUT degree in Physical Measurements or equivalent.
A first experience in this sector is appreciated but not essential.

You are skilled and have skills in metrology and CAD.
You are rigorous, precise, autonomous, methodical and analytical.
