Au cœur de Paris, nos équipes conçoivent des technologies innovantes en développant des interfaces homme-machine sous Android auto pour offrir au client final une expérience connectique intuitive.
Nos solutions électroniques embarquées sont dotées de processeurs graphiques multi-cœur puissants afin de répondre plus rapidement à diverses instructions simultanées.

Relevez avec nous l'un des plus grands challenges de l'industrie automobile !

Nous recherchons un Ingénieur reconnaissance vocale - développement logiciel C et C++ - (H/F)

CONTEXTE

Vous devrez spécifier, développer, intégrer et tester les nouvelles fonctionnalités de la reconnaissance vocale et s'assurer de leurs bons fonctionnements (maintenance technique et tests).

En charge du développement et de la maintenance de la librairie logicielle pilotant les moteurs de reconnaissance vocale et de synthèse vocale, vous devrez faire preuve de rigueur et de réactivité.
Vous devrez aussi répondre à des exigences de méthodologie en étant capable de spécifier les fonctions supportées et d'apporter le support technique et conseils.

MISSIONS

Vous ferez partie d'une équipe diversifiée (navigation, traductions, reco vocale) au sein de laquelle différents sujets d'expertise et d'innovation sont évalués, intégrés et optimisés.

Rattaché(e) au manager des activités transverses de l'Auto (reconnaissance vocale, navigation, traductions), vous devrez remplir les tâches suivantes :

Spécifier les nouveaux développements répondant aux demandes clients Internes/Externes
Développer la librairie logicielle communiquant avec les moteurs de synthèse et reconnaissance vocale
Intégrer/Tester les nouveaux développements effectués et définir les tests associés
Gérer la résolution des problèmes en interface avec notamment :
les différentes équipes internes développant les autres fonctionnalités
le service validation
les fournisseurs
Apporter le support technique sur l'utilisation de la reconnaissance vocale
Evaluer les nouvelles fonctionnalités et technologies (ASR/TTS)

Vous devrez faire preuve de réactivité et d'implication sur un domaine en perpétuel évolution. Vous devrez vous tenir informé(e) des nouvelles technologies liées au monde Android et aux différentes innovations liées à la reconnaissance vocale.

A ce titre, vous aurez pour responsabilités :
Garantir le bon fonctionnement de la librairie logicielle en charge de la reconnaissance/synthèse vocale pour l'ensemble des projets
Participer à l'élaboration et la mise en place de la nouvelle plateforme de reconnaissance vocale
Apporter du support sur la thématique « Reco Vocale » : conseils, méthodes, outils

PROFIL

Vous êtes titulaire d'un diplôme d'ingénieur, d'un master, ou d'un PhD (idéalement traitement de la parole) (BAC+5) et justifiez d'une expérience de 2 à 5 ans dans les secteurs de la reconnaissance vocale ou de l'automobile.

Vous avez de solides compétences en développement informatique (C, C++, Python, …) et une bonne compréhension des technologies liées à la reconnaissance vocale.
Vous maîtrisez le C embarqué et les outils GNU.
Vous possédez aussi des connaissances ou des expériences en développement Java.
Vous avez des capacités à traiter des données structurées ou non structurées, de types variés (SQL, HTML, XML).
Une connaissance des outils GIT, Atlassian (JIRA, Confluence), dans les domaines du Traitement de la parole, d'Android, et des outils Nuance seraient également appréciées.
Vous montrez un fort intérêt et une bonne connaissance de l'écosystème Android.

Vous faites preuve de rigueur, d'une grande curiosité et d'une forte capacité d'initiative.
Vous êtes soucieux(se) du détail, et avez d'excellentes compétences analytiques.
Vous parlez couramment l'anglais.

Des déplacements à l'étranger sont à prévoir.

EN - Would you like to be part of a French company known for its innovation and agility?

Join Faurecia Clarion Electronics, combining a start-up spirit with a first-class automotive equipment manufacturer, to develop the cockpit of the future!
Parrot's automotive business was acquired 100% by Faurecia in 2018 and gave rise to Faurecia Clarion Electronics Europe, Faurecia's 4th Business Group.

In the heart of Paris, our teams design innovative technologies by developing man-machine interfaces under Android auto to offer the end customer an intuitive connectivity experience.
Our embedded electronics solutions are equipped with powerful multi-core graphics processors to respond more quickly to various simultaneous instructions.

Take up with us one of the greatest challenges in the automotive industry!

We are looking for a C/C++ Software development Engineer - Vocal Recognition (M/F)

CONTEXT

You will have to specify, develop, integrate and test the new voice recognition functionalities and ensure that they work properly (technical maintenance and tests).
In charge of developing and maintaining the software library that drives the speech recognition and speech synthesis engines, you will have to be rigorous and responsive.
You will also have to meet methodological requirements by being able to specify the supported functions and to provide technical support and advice.

MISSIONS

You will be part of a diversified team (navigation, translations, voice reception) in which different subjects of expertise and innovation are evaluated, integrated and optimized.

Reporting to the manager of the transversal activities of the Auto (voice recognition, navigation, translations), you will have to perform the following tasks:
Specify new developments in response to internal/external customer requests
Develop the software library communicating with text-to-speech and speech recognition engines
Integrate/Test new developments and define associated tests
Manage the resolution of problems interfacing with, in particular:
the various internal teams developing the other functionalities
the validation service
the suppliers
Provide technical support on the use of voice recognition
Evaluate new features and technologies (ASR/TTS)

You will have to be responsive and involved in a constantly evolving field. You will need to stay informed about new technologies related to the Android world and the various innovations related to speech recognition.

As such, you will be responsible for:
Ensure the proper functioning of the software library in charge of speech recognition/synthesis for all projects
Participate in the development and implementation of the new speech recognition platform
Provide support on the theme "Reco Vocale": advice, methods, tools

PROFILE

You have an engineering degree, a master's degree, or a PhD (ideally speech processing) (BAC+5) and have 2 to 5 years' experience in the voice recognition or automotive sectors.

You have strong computer development skills (C, C++, Python,...) and a good understanding of speech recognition technologies.
You are familiar with embedded C and GNU tools.
You also have knowledge or experience in Java development.
You have the ability to process structured or unstructured data of various types (SQL, HTML, XML).
Knowledge of GIT, Atlassian (JIRA, Confluence), speech processing, Android, and Nuance tools would also be appreciated.
You show a strong interest and knowledge of the Android ecosystem.

You are rigorous, curious and have a strong capacity for initiative.
You are detail-oriented and have excellent analytical skills.
You are fluent in English.

Travel abroad is to be expected.

description:
Vous souhaitez intégrer une entreprise française, innovante et agile ?

Rejoignez Faurecia Clarion Electronics, alliant un esprit start-up à un équipementier automobile de 1er rang, pour développer le cockpit du futur !

L’activité automobile de Parrot a été racheté à 100% par Faurecia en 2018 et a donné naissance à Faurecia Clarion Electronics Europe : 4ème Business Group de Faurecia.

Au cœur de Paris, nos équipes conçoivent des technologies innovantes en développant des interfaces homme-machine sous Android auto pour offrir au client final une expérience connectique intuitive.
Nos solutions électroniques embarquées sont dotées de processeurs graphiques multi-cœur puissants afin de répondre plus rapidement à diverses instructions simultanées.

Relevez avec nous l'un des plus grands challenges de l'industrie automobile !

Nous recherchons un Ingénieur Safety (H/F)

CONTEXTE

Vous intégrerez une équipe projet qui a pour objectif de développer un système embarqué de type Infotainment, pour un client constructeur automobile international.

MISSIONS

Vous contriburez à l'élaboration des exigences safety et à leur allocation (incluant leur traçabilité) et participerez à la définition de l'architecture system et formaliser les safety concept.

Vous réaliserez les analyses safety system (FMEA, FTA, analyses d'impact, calcul de Fiabilité) et participerez au développement de façon proactive en accompagnant les différents métiers (électronique, logiciel, système, qualité…) pour la mise en place des activités Safety conformément à la norme ISO26262 et au processus de développement produit.

Vous participerez à l'élaboration des documents Safety de conception au niveau Système et composants (Functional Safety Concept, Technical Safety Concept) et gérerez les aspects Safety avec les clients externes.

Vous coordonnerez la réalisation des documentations conformément à la norme ISO26262, ainsi que les revues Safety, validation des exigences fonctionnelles et audits.Vous participerez à l'amélioration des référentiels et processus de développement conformément à la norme ISO26262.

PROFIL

Vous êtes titulaire d'un diplôme d'Ingénieur ou d'une formation universitaire équivalente (BAC+5) et justifiez d'une expérience de 3 ans dans le domaine de la Sureté de fonctionnement SDF idéalement dans le secteur de l'industrie automobile.

Vous avez une très bonne connaissance de la Méthode Sureté de fonctionnement SDF selon la norme ISO26262 : arbres de défaillances, analyses de risque, AMDEC.

Vous êtes force de proposition, autonome et faites preuve de rigueur. Vous appréciez le travail en équipe et vous avez un bon relationnel et une capacité d'analyse et de synthèse éprouvées.

Un anglais courant pour ce poste est nécessaire.

EN - Would you like to be part of a French company known for its innovation and agility?

Join Faurecia Clarion Electronics, combining a start-up spirit with a first-class automotive equipment manufacturer, to develop the cockpit of the future!
Parrot's automotive business was acquired 100% by Faurecia in 2018 and gave rise to Faurecia Clarion Electronics Europe, Faurecia's 4th Business Group.

In the heart of Paris, our teams design innovative technologies by developing man-machine interfaces under Android auto to offer the end customer an intuitive connectivity experience.
Our embedded electronics solutions are equipped with powerful multi-core graphics processors to respond more quickly to various simultaneous instructions.

Take up with us one of the greatest challenges in the automotive industry!

We are looking for a Safety Engineer (M/F)

CONTEXT

You will join a project team whose objective is to develop an embedded Infotainment system for an international automotive manufacturer customer.

MISSIONS

You will contribute to the development of safety requirements and their allocation (including their traceability) and will participate in the definition of the architecture system and formalize the safety concept.

You will carry out safety system analyses (FMEA, FTA, impact analyses, reliability calculation) and participate in the development in a proactive way by supporting the various business lines (electronics, software, system, quality...) for the implementation of Safety activities in accordance with the ISO26262 standard and the product development process.

You will develop design Safety documents at System and component level (Functional Safety Concept, Technical Safety Concept) and manage Safety aspects with external customers.

You will coordinate the production of documentation in accordance with ISO2626262, as well as Safety reviews, validation of functional requirements and audits, and participate in the improvement of standards and development processes in accordance with ISO26262.

PROFILE

You have an engineering degree or equivalent university education (BAC+5) and 5 years' experience in the field of SDF operational safety, ideally in the automotive industry.

You have a very good knowledge of the SDF Operating Safety Method according to ISO26262, the practice of Operating Safety tools such as fault trees, risk analyses, FMECA and technical skills in electronic development (System, hardware and software).

Knowledge in Development Quality Method (APQP, Quality chain and cascade of critical characteristics, traceability,...), practice of Design for 6 Sigma tools, Design to Quality for robustness in design, technical skills in mechanical development would be desirable.

You are a force of proposal, autonomous and rigorous. You appreciate teamwork and have a good interpersonal skills and a proven ability to analyse and synthesise.

A fluent English for this position is required.

Relevez avec nous l'un des plus grands challenges de l'industrie automobile !

Nous recherchons un Technicien Mesures essais et prototypage (H/F)

CONTEXTE

Le Service d'ingénierie mécanique recherche un technicien de laboratoire afin de réaliser les mesures, essais et prototypages des produits en cours de développement. Sous la responsabilité d'un ingénieur, il réalise des tests, des mesures, et des analyses pour valider les exigences produits dans le respect du programme d'essais et des procédures internes.

MISSIONS

Vous serez responsable des équipements du laboratoire, de leur maintenance, et de leur étalonnage/calibration périodique.
L'objectif est de dérouler les plans de test dans le respect des délais impartis et selon les protocoles établis et de consigner les résultats dans les outils internes et rédiger les rapports d'essai.

Vos missions seront les suivantes :

Contrôle dimensionnel des échantillons (scanner 3D GOM)
Préparation des échantillons à tester (instrumentation)
Réalisation des essais mécaniques, optiques, acoustiques, thermiques, afin de vérifier la satisfaction des exigences client et la robustesse du produit
Rédaction en anglais des rapports d'essai
Analyse des non-conformités et recherche de solutions d'améliorations
Analyse des causes de défaillance des produits en retour client
Assemblage de prototypes et moyens d'essais
Aide à la conception de bancs, supports, et moyens d'essai sur logiciel CAO (Solidworks)
Réalisation de divers travaux manuels de correction des problèmes sur les prototypes (perçage, usinage, peinture, etc…)

Vous serez responsable de l'organisation, de la propreté, et du rangement du laboratoire mécanique.

PROFIL

Vous avez une formation Bac Pro Microtechnique ou BAC STI2D.
Une première expérience dans ce secteur est appréciée mais pas indispensable.

Vous êtes adroit et avez des compétences en métrologie et en CAO.
Vous êtes rigoureux, précis, autonome, méthodique et avez un esprit d'analyse.

EN - Would you like to be part of a French company known for its innovation and agility?

Join Faurecia Clarion Electronics, combining a start-up spirit with a first-class automotive equipment manufacturer, to develop the cockpit of the future!

We are looking for a Test measurement and prototyping technician (M/F)

CONTEXT

The Mechanical Engineering Department is looking for a laboratory technician to carry out measurements, tests and prototyping of products under development. Under the responsibility of an engineer, he performs tests, measurements and analyses to validate product requirements in compliance with the test program and internal procedures.

MISSIONS

You will be responsible for the laboratory equipment, its maintenance, and its periodic calibration/calibration.
The objective is to conduct the test plans on time and according to established protocols and to record the results in internal tools and write test reports.

Your missions will be as follows:

Dimensional inspection of samples (3D GOM scanner)
Preparation of the samples to be tested (instrumentation)
Carrying out mechanical, optical, acoustic, thermal and acoustic tests to verify the satisfaction of customer requirements and the robustness of the product
Writing test reports in English
Analysis of non-conformities and search for improvement solutions
Analysis of the causes of product failure in customer feedback
Assembly of prototypes and test means
Assistance in the design of benches, supports, and test equipment on CAD software (Solidworks)
Performing various manual tasks to correct problems on prototypes (drilling, machining, painting, etc...)

You will be responsible for the organization, cleanliness, and storage of the mechanical laboratory.

PROFILE

You have a DUT degree in Physical Measurements or equivalent.
A first experience in this sector is appreciated but not essential.

You are skilled and have skills in metrology and CAD.
You are rigorous, precise, autonomous, methodical and analytical.

En mode Agile, vous serez en relation quotidienne avec les équipes responsables de ces composants afin de suivre les développements et anticiper les changements.

MISSIONS

Vous serez responsable du suivi et de l'intégration des évolutions des différents composants logiciels dans le contexte du développement d'un programme client :
Plateforme Android
Equipe OS
Bus vehicule (gateway CAN, LIN, ethernet)
Tuner
Développements de l'équipe client (applications Android, VHAL, cluster)

Vous serez en charge des tests d'intégration via l'automatisation de tests et de la génération des versions logicielles et des rapports associés.

Intégrer et configurer des composants logiciels issus des équipes plateformes
Suivre le développement plateforme et anticiper l'intégration (e.g., nightly build, tests en amont, …)
Préparer les changements au niveau projet, nécessaires pour l'intégration
Spécifier et développer des tests d'intégration
Automatiser l'exécution des tests
Générer des versions logicielles incluant les rapports de tests

PROFIL

Vous êtes diplômé d'une école d'ingénieur ou d'un cycle universitaire et disposez de 2 ans d'expérience minimum en intégration logicielle.

GIT et GERRIT,
repo,
Java,
C/C++,
Linux,
Scripting (python, bash),
Jenkins,
Docker

Dans l'idéal vous avez des connaissances en ASpice, Groovy.

Vous êtes autonome, rigoureux et êtes à l'aise avec le reporting.

We are looking for a Software Integration Engineer (M/F)

CONTEXT

Within the project team and in collaboration with the integration manager, you will be in charge of software integration.
The position covers the integration of an Android platform (Java, C/C++) and software components in C/C++.
In Agile mode, you will be in daily contact with the teams responsible for these components in order to monitor developments and anticipate changes.

MISSIONS

You will be responsible for monitoring and integrating the evolutions of the various software components in the context of the development of a customer program:

Android platform
OS Team
Vehicle bus (CAN, LIN, Ethernet gateway)
Tuner
Developments of the customer team (Android, VHAL, cluster applications)

You will be in charge of integration testing through test automation and the generation of software versions and associated reports.

Your missions will be as follows:

Integrate and configure software components from platform teams
Monitor platform development and anticipate integration (e.g., nightly build, upstream tests, etc.)
Prepare the changes at the project level necessary for integration
Specify and develop integration tests
Automate test execution
Generate software versions including test reports

PROFILE

You are a graduate of an engineering school or university and have a minimum of 2 years of experience in software integration.

You have the following technical skills:
GIT and GERRIT,
repo,
Java,
C/C+++,
Linux,
Scripting (python, bash),
Jenkins,
Docker

Ideally you have knowledge of ASpice, Groovy.

You are autonomous, rigorous and comfortable with reporting.

You have a good level of English, especially technical English.

Vos missions seront : développer, concevoir et qualifier tout ou partie de l'électronique d'un système d'Infotainment Android. Vous travaillerez avec une équipe projet multi-compétences Mécanique, Logiciel, Validation, Achat et Commerce au déploiement de notre gamme de produit d'Infotainment chez les constructeurs automobiles.

MISSIONS

Vos missions seront les suivantes :
Participer à la rédaction du cahier des charges et des spécifications Hardware
Assurer la conception électronique en respectant les procédures internes
Suivre la sous-traitance (appels d'offre, support technique, spécifications techniques, respect des délais)
Elaborer le plan de test du produit en respectant les procédures internes
Qualifier les prototypes selon le plan de test
Transmettre et maintenir le dossier d'industrialisation (spécification du banc de test, BOM et GERBER) au service Industrialisation via l'outil SAP-PLM
Capitaliser le savoir-faire

Vous serez responsable de la conception hardware de tout ou partie d'un produit.
Vous travaillerez en étroite collaboration avec l'équipe projet (logiciel, mécanique, validation, …)
Vous devrez respecter les délais de conception imposés par la gestion projet et/ou la direction.

PROFIL

Compétences techniques :

Vous êtes titulaire d'un diplôme d'ingénieur à dominante électronique, jeune diplômé ou jusqu'à à 5 ans d'expérience au sein du secteur automobile, aéronautique ou des télécommunications.

Vous disposez des compétences techniques indispensables en conception électronique selon le cycle en V. Vous maîtrisez les différentes structures d'alimentation à découpage ou linéaire, l'intégrité des signaux et vous avez de bonnes notions de CEM.

Dans l'idéal, vous avez des connaissances en Orcad et SPICE et la capacité à évaluer le comportement thermique d'un produit / interpréter le résultat de simulation thermique.

Savoir -être :

Vous êtes capable de vous adapter facilement, vous aimez travailler en équipe.

We are looking for an Electronics Design Engineer (M/F)

CONTEXT

In order to strengthen our teams, we are recruiting a hardware design engineer. Your missions will be to develop, design and qualify all or part of the electronics of an Android Infotainment system. You will work with a multi-skilled project team Mechanics, Software, Validation, Purchasing and Trade to deploy our Infotainment product range to automotive manufacturers.

MISSIONS

Your missions will be as follows:

Participate in the drafting of specifications and hardware specifications
Ensure electronic design by respecting internal procedures
Monitor subcontracting (calls for tenders, technical support, technical specifications, meeting deadlines)
Develop the product test plan in accordance with internal procedures
Qualify prototypes according to the test plan
Transmit and maintain the industrialization file (test bench specification, BOM and GERBER) to the Industrialization department via the SAP-PLM tool
Capitalizing on know-how

You will be responsible for the hardware design of all or part of a product.

You will work in close collaboration with the project team (software, mechanics, validation,...)

You will have to respect the design deadlines imposed by the project management and/or the management.

PROFILE

Technical skills :

You have an engineering degree in electronics, a recent degree or up to 5 years' experience in the automotive, aeronautics or telecommunications sectors.

You have the necessary technical skills in electronic design according to the V-cycle. You are familiar with the different switching or linear power supply structures, signal integrity and you have a good knowledge of EMC.

Ideally, you have knowledge of Orcad and SPICE and the ability to evaluate the thermal behaviour of a product / interpret the result of thermal simulation.

To know - to be:

You are able to adapt easily, you like to work in a team.
You are rigorous, dynamic and autonomous.

You speak fluent English.

description:
Region: France
Division: Customer Operations / Project Engineering Team Office
Office Location: Paris
Position: Project Engineer
Required Starting Date: Immediately
Contract: Permanent

Working at Qosmos in the Project Management Team
You have a proven ability to work in Customer Operations and R&D departments, to recognize and extract essential information from all traffic types, to ensure optimum performance levels whatever the protocol analyzed and to ensure Carrier Grade stability levels.

Position Summary
The Project Engineer collects customer requirements driving the development of Qosmos products, assists the customer in integrating Qosmos products into its solutions and supports this integration throughout the customer project lifecycle.
The Project Engineer may occasionally be required to work on the customer’s premises to assist with product integration, the resolution of support issues, and the delivery of new versions of Qosmos products.

Main Responsibilities
Participate in customer’s projects using Qosmos DPI/IP Classification technology in heterogeneous environments (hardware as well as software)
Customer relationship management:
Be the Qosmos technical contact for customers, with support from the R&D architects, development and test experts.
Collect customer requirements and write specifications (new feature requests) with the full support of Qosmos R&D and ensure the successful delivery of our products.
Follow-up on customer issues:
Collect relevant information to help the support team
Start analysis/reproduction and propose workaround or a patch
Validate the fix and manage the hotfix delivery
Create Qosmos support tracking tickets and link them to the customer tracking tool when required
Represent the excellence and partnership spirit of our company.
Assist the customer during the product integration phase:

Guide our customer during the integration phase by recommending implementation choices.
Develop sample application code to respond to customer needs.
Propose product optimizations to be integrated in existing Qosmos products (following a customer request, R&D request, or as an individual initiative).
Q&A and Performance Monitoring/Optimization:
Ensure that the integration of our technology meets customer requirements in terms of quality and performance.
Run performance tests in customer environment
Follow performance trends and optimization
Profile our software to isolate bottlenecks in the customer architecture and report results to : Customer, Product Management and R&D
Develop, test and validate automated test applications to follow/improve our software quality.
Benchmarking:
Knowledge of software profiling usages
Ability to identify bottleneck code and propose corrections
Ability to clearly report issues and benchmarking results for both support and management teams
Potentially develop new features for Qosmos products while on the customer’s premises when necessary for confidentiality, restricted access to the validation environment or timeline reasons:
Protocol reverse engineering and plugin development.
ixEngine framework enhancements.
Analyze parameter and code software components within the scope of standards and procedures, and according to the evolution guidelines set out for existing components.
Ensure that technical goals and deadlines are met.
Follow the resolution of customer issues and monitor KPI:
Participate in elaborating test plans.
Create test sets.
Carry out tests.
Identify and fix bugs.
Report on a regular basis to management on project progress, identified risks and associated solutions or workarounds.
Capability to work on several projects in parallel.
Capability to drive customer requirements based on the Qosmos portfolio and strategy.

Desired Skills and Experience
Prerequisite:
Master’s degree in Computer Science with a specialization in Information Systems / Networks
Minimum of 2 years’ experience in software development over Linux
Fluent English
Knowledge of Linux system/kernel
Knowledge in Multi-Threading development
Development knowledge on Intel CPU architecture and possibly on other Multi Core CPU architectures (Cavium, NetLogic, Tilera, etc.)
Debugging techniques
In-depth knowledge of network architectures
Additional Skills:
Good interpersonal skills to interact with customers’ team members
Knowledge of algorithms
Customer-oriented
Knowledge of load balancing
Knowledge of telco architecture standards (HA, redundancy, alarms, etc.)
Availability for travel and to spend short periods on customer site – up to 15% of time
Experience of test automation

Key Facts About Qosmos, the DPI Business Unit of Enea
Only supplier focusing 100% on OEM IP Classification and DPI technology
Dominant supplier with 75% market share
Leading standardization of DPI & Network Intelligence in SDN and NFV networks
More than 100 customers worldwide (3x nearest competitor)
Double-digit revenue growth each year
A division of Enea
Main office in Paris, 70+ employees, regional offices in Silicon Valley and Singapore

description:
Who we are
At Criteo, we connect 1.5 billion active shoppers with the things they need and love. Our technology takes an algorithmic approach to predict what user we show an ad to, when, and for what products. Our dataset is about 50 petabytes in Hadoop (more than 120 TB extra per day) and we take less than 10ms to respond to an ad request. This is truly big data and machine learning without the buzzwords. If scale and complexity excite you, join us.

Most of all, we are creators. From designing ground-breaking products to finding unique ways to solve technical challenges at an exceptional scale, our tech teams work with state of the art methodologies to shape the future of advertising.

The Site Reliability teams keep one of the largest computing platforms in the AdTech world functioning like clockwork. They are processing, storing and monitoring through large scale data compute & storage services (Hadoop, SQL & NoSQL), streaming (Kafka), platform as a service (Chef, Mesos), identity management (Kerberos) and analytics (Hive, Druid, Vertica).

What you'll do

The team provides authentication and authorization services for both application and humans. Our mission is to support developers in implementing robust authentication/authorization components.

The provided service should be highly available, salable, secure and low latency. We currently provide authentication and authorization for more than 35K Servers( including Windows, Linux).
In this role, you will be in charge of designing, building and improving parts of our infrastructure to address scaling needs, performances and resiliency. You will also Develop tools and services to ease the work of developers with the perfect trade between ownership and good practices consistency. You will have to Design and build systems to automate away problems and investigate and fixie service issues

Some of the current projects are identifying new solution to better answer our client's needs. We're in a moment at Criteo where a self-service solution is missing and requested. In order to abstract complexity of Authentication systems, we need to build and provide an API on top of them, to get self-managed solution and to speed up the service access. We are also designing and implementing next Role-Based Access Control system to contribute to reach new R&D Challenges. More than that, Criteo is open minded and you’re free to contribute to other projects of other teams which generally help more than one team in the departement.

Who you are
Experienced with Java, Scala, C# or Python
Significant experience working on heterogeneous production platforms (Windows, Linux, Hadoop)
Developer background, able to quickly adapt to several scripting and development languages
Basic knowledge on principles and best practices regarding authentication, authorization and cryptography
Ability to work with international teams
Experienced with large scale deployments in Cloud or Hybrid environments
Experienced with automation frameworks like Puppet, Chef or Ansible
Experienced with monitoring tools like Prometheus
Good communication skills to provide guidance to the rest of the R&D on best practices
Proficiency with incident management
Experience with SSO, concept, services, JWT

35+ annual holidays days
Health insurance
Discounted transport and sports activities
Personalized relocation package if moving from abroad
Catered lunch and breakfast
Private nursery
Maternity and paternity leave
Annual cross teams hackathon
2 conferences per year of your choice
Internal mobility programs
Tailored educational resources

Want to know more?
What does it feel like to be part of something big? Get a snapshot
Get the story directly from our R&D engineers, check our Medium R&D blog
Interested in discovering your Criteo community first? Let’s meet

At Criteo, we dare to be different. We believe that diversity fuels innovation and creates an energy that can be seen and felt all over Criteo. We champion different perspectives and are committed to creating a workplace where all Criteos are heard, feel a sense of belonging, and are treated with respect and dignity.

Dans le cadre du développement et de la conception de plateforme multimédia pour l'automobile, vous intégrerez une équipe dont le but est de développer les spécificités produits sur une plateforme OEM générique sous Android pour de multiples constructeurs automobiles.

Build continuous integration, test-driven development and production deployment frameworks. Drive collaborative reviews of design, code, test plans and dataset implementation performed by data engineers in support of maintaining data engineering standards. Resolve roadblocks and give guidance to team members. Enjoy high freedom to act. Open excellent international and cross-functional career prospects in a dynamic environment.

Master’s degree in Computer Science or Information systems with 5+ years’ experience with advanced data management platform (e.g., Hadoop, AWS Redshift, Google cloud platform)

description:
Our mission
We want to be the source of truth and reference system in an industry where there hasn’t historically been one.
We want to address the core challenges with managing real-time data at scale: data collection, integration, control, and hygiene, organizing that data through identity resolution, orchestration of data flows. In short, we’re improving the data that’s available to all the other tools in your stack.
Our mission is to help companies better take advantage of their most precious asset, their data.

Who we are
We use technology to help our customers have better relationships with their customers.
Hull is the first product that helps SaaS companies manage, segment, transform and synchronize customer data across all their services in realtime.
We're a small team, where everyone has huge impact. We have offices in France and the US.

Your Role
As the Lead Platform Backend engineer, you will work closely with the CTO, Product Managers, Solution Engineers and :
Design, develop, release core components of the Hull platform, primarily working on core data pipelines and monitoring APIs.
Lead the engineering team into industrializing fast, reliable and continuous delivery of the product.
Be aware of the newest and greatest technologies available, and champion those which can enable engineering and infrastructure wins.
Help the team Design and implement the next major evolution of our data processing pipeline.
Work with our connectors/integrations and solutions engineering team to gain a strong understanding of our client’s use cases and data flows.
Requirements
6+ years of proven experience building and delivering production software in data intensive environments, in teams of 3 or more.
Fluent communication in English
Hands-on technical experience combined with strong management skills.
Solid knowledge in distributed storage and computing frameworks (ElasticSearch, Kafka, Avro, GraphQL)
Strong skills with the JVM, (Bonus: experience with Clojure or is excited to learn), Ruby & Rails, Node.js, Docker
Background with the Amazon cloud stack (EC2, S3, ECS etc...), Mesos & DC/OS, Timeseries Databases.
Experience in API design and data modelization


Bonus
Knowledge of Immutable databases (We use Datomic) Graph theory, Dataflow and Lambda Architectures, Complex event processing
Qualities we look for
Strong communication and collaboration skills
Strong drive to deliver on time and eagerness to see the result of your work used by customers.
Demonstrable track record of excellent problem-solving skills
Passion of learning and discovering new, better ways of doing things
Benefits
IT @ HULL
Join a core team of highly skilled engineers, and work on hard problems to help high-growth companies solve theirs.
A work environment tailored for deep, meaningful work.
Great location, in the center of Paris
Our Values

Velocity
Learn Fast, Fail Fast, Fix fast
Embrace doubt, and consider mistakes a part of the learning experience.
Velocity is what makes us different from more established companies and our competitors. It is what makes us beat the competition, keep customers happy, and iterate until we have found the right way to move forward.
We are a Learning Organization above all, and we can't learn without making mistakes.
Iterate and Learn
Start with the smallest solution that works and build it end to end.
When in doubt, err towards the simplest, fastest way to move forward. The right way to build things isn't to build them piece by piece, it's to build smaller versions of them and iterate. Consider the User experience the one piece that must be delivered, and work backwards from there.
Unity
All working together towards the same goal
We believe in our team, and in their expertise. We built a team of incredibly smart individuals and we rely on each other for success.
Empathy
Think how your actions impact others
The ability to put ourselves in the place of our customers and other team members is what helps us drive the right decisions at every instant. **
Ownership & Accountability
Nothing wrong with making mistakes
We believe empowering people brings positive change. We each own our decisions and actions, and we are responsible for creating value that derives from those actions.
Clarity & Transparency
Say what you do, do what you say
We believe in a culture of Transparency. We do things in the open. We're also responsible for making sure others are aware of what we're working on, and the help we need to make it happen.
Balance
Work/life balance
Work/life balance is critical. No good things from breaking it. Enjoy your family and your life so you can bring your best self to work.

description:
As a senior data scientist, you will be responsible for building models/tools that improve marketing efforts of Hilti globally. You will collaborate with business to provide technical guidance to a team of data scientists on advanced analytics models.
Who is Hilti?
If you’re new to the industry, you might not have heard of us. We provide leading-edge tools, technologies, software and services for the global construction sector. We have a proud heritage, built over 75 years, and a worldwide reputation for pioneering products and exceptional service. With 28,000 people in more than 120 countries we operate with a unique direct sales model and generate around 250,000 customer interactions every day.
What does the role involve?
You will apply your strong expertise of advanced analytics techniques (e.g., machine-learning) to design, prototype, and build solutions. You will ensure frequent communication with other stakeholders to drive use case solution with business focus and manage expectations on possibilities and lead times. You will develop best practices for analytics (models, standards, tools) and share learnings with peers.
Hilti is heavily investing in France: Our French office will be moving to Boulogne in 2019 and hosting our global Digital Marketing team.
What do we offer?
To further accelerate in digital marketing, we are building our Global Digital Hub in Paris. You will experience the agile mentality of a start-up, combining the stability of a sound business model and the working environment of an award-winning culture. You can make an impact from day one in an international and diverse team by shaping the future of digital at Hilti and revolutionize customer interactions.
Why should you apply?
Participate in starting up a new Digital Marketing organization, with global impact. Work together with a team of data scientists, data engineers; Run analysis using different tools and methodologies and provide outputs needed to solve business problem. Apply strong expertise in advanced analytics techniques (e.g., machine-learning) to design, prototype, and build solutions. Enjoy high freedom to act. Open excellent international and cross-functional career prospects in a dynamic environment.
What you need is:
Master’s degree or PhD in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics or Mathematics with 5+ years experience in a statistical and/or data science role; Hands on experience working as Data Scientist with cross functional teams.
Expertise in advanced analytical techniques such as descriptive statistics, machine learning, optimization, pattern recognition, cluster analysis, segmentation analysis, etc.
Experience of statistical analysis tools and languages, e.g., Python, R, Matlab, SAS, experience working with large data sets & distributed computing tools (e.g., Hadoop, Hive, Spark); Fluency in a scripting or computing language.
Fluency in English
During your interviews, you will meet several members of the digital team including leadership. This way you get to know more about us, and we get to know more about you.
Tempted to apply? Click “apply now” and send us your resume today!
Do you want to know more? Go to https://careers.hilti.com/en/digital-marketing
Join us and #TransformDigital

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is seeking a solutions architect (m/f) with proven experience in influencing far-reaching architectural and strategic technology decisions. COMPANY DESCRIPTION
SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.
SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.
PURPOSE AND OBJECTIVES
At SAP you will work at the most popular employer in Germany!
Team work is not just a buzz word for us. At SAP we live true team work. Especially in SAP Consulting we have to team up. Our team of SAP Retail Consultants is taking care of Retail customers worldwide focusing on all aspects of Retail.
To ensure the success of our customers and our SAP Consulting Projects, we have established and live a close collaboration to Development, Support and Sales to help each other and to ensure a permanent knowledge transfer.
As a SAP Retail Consultant you will be in the first row gaining impressive insights of SAP´s newest innovative products.
In order to strengthen our team of experts we are looking for a SAP Senior Consultant to transform customer requirements into an optimal SAP solution architecture, develop roadmaps for implementations, highlight the additional value of SAP solutions and to model and discuss End to End processes.
EXPECTATIONS AND TASKS
SAP Retail experience – expert in at least one of the areas below:
SAP Master Data
SAP Materials Management
SAP Sales and Distribution
SAP Store Operations
SAP Customer Activity Repository (CAR)
Design and Implementation
Analysis of Retail processes, information flows, functional requirements
Design end to end processes and IT architecture
Implementation of business processes including customizing and custom development
Support strategic customers and act as Trusted Advisor
SKILLS AND COMPETENCIES
Proven SAP Retail functional and architecting experience
Implementation experience in a number of different projects
Ability and willingness to undertake global travel and assignments
EDUCATION AND QUALIFICATIONS
University degree or equivalent
Fluent in French and in English is required, additional language is a plus
WORK EXPERIENCE
3+ years working experience as Consultant or Solution Architect for SAP solutions in Retail Industry or Fashion Industry
WHAT YOU GET FROM US
Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own. A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment – apply now.
SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT
To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.
SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. description:
Who we are
At Criteo, we connect 1.5 billion active shoppers with the things they need and love. Our technology takes an algorithmic approach to predict what user we show an ad to, when, and for what products. Our dataset is about 50 petabytes in Hadoop (more than 120 TB extra per day) and we take less than 10ms to respond to an ad request. This is truly big data and machine learning without the buzzwords. If scale and complexity excite you, join us.

What is it like to work in our R&D ?

Most of all, we are creators. From designing ground-breaking products to finding unique ways to solve technical challenges at an exceptional scale, our tech teams work with state of the art methodologies to shape the future of advertising.

The Criteo AI Lab brings together researchers, machine learning engineers, software engineers and data scientists. Our mission is to develop advertising solutions that provide value to Internet users around the world. We do so by pushing state-of-the-art ML methodologies into our products to drive better performance, and act as center of Machine Learning research and engineering excellence.
What You'll Do
You will join our team of machine learning researchers and software engineers to develop and design build scalable big-data distributed data processing systems that will be used to power experimentation and production ML applications at Criteo.
Your responsibilities will include building libraries, services and datasets that will be used by ML researchers and practitioners across Criteo.
You will then contribute directly to the development of Criteo’s infrastructure for experimentation / productionizing of ML applications.
Who you are
MS / PHD in Computer Science or relevant experience.
You have at least 3 years of programming experience in a OOP language such as C#, Python, Java or Scala (or equivalent) and a rock-solid foundation in Computer Science (data structures, algorithms) as well as the basics of machine learning.
Ideally, you have already dealt with large scale big-data processing in the Hadoop ecosystem, using industry standard services like Hadoop MapReduce / Apache Spark / Presto / Hive in languages like Java and Scala.
You have strong hands-on skills in sourcing, cleaning, manipulating and analyzing large volumes of data.
You are fluent in english (written and spoken) and also a team player who can work efficiently with others, with strong sense of ownership and taking pride in your work.
What we offer
Competitive compensation package
35 annual holidays days (25 + 10 RTT)
Health insurance
Personalized relocation package if moving from abroad
Catered lunch and breakfast
Private nursery
Discounted transport and sports activities
Maternity and paternity leave
2 conferences per year of your choice (1 International + 1 national)
Internal mobility programs
Tailored educational resources (Courseras, MOOC, Internal trainings ...)
Annual cross teams hackathon
